review.positiveRemarks: Convenient with a free shuttle twice hourly to the airport.

It is just those little things that are important for travellers who pay to use this service. After that - things were OK. The IHOP attached to the place was great and the free shuttle to airportwas a great service

Bugs in my room, very low water pressure in bathroom, in need of minor repairs (ceiling shows water damage (mold???), shower floor is peeling), no extra blankets in room, had to call front desk twice to get extra blankets & it took over an hour to get them, bed too close to heater/AC unit, only one thin blanket on bed (no bed spread).

review.positiveRemarks: close to where I was working

review.title: Not worth the price
review.reviewText:
We booked this room as a last minute stay and arrived at 11pm. The one female staff member was friendly but not the other she did not think us or smile during the whole time at the check-in desk. We arrive to our room to find a guy standing outside from next door smoking weed. We went into the hotel room turn on the TV but there were no available channels so I went to call the front desk but the phone did not work. I then used my cell phone and contacted the front desk, I told her that the TV and the in-room phone was not working.  She repeated what I said and told me that she would send someone to check it out. One hour later and no one still has shown up. I called back and she sais again the she would send somebody. It's now  close to 1:30am and still a no-show. Went to sleep. Upon checkout we explain what happened the night before and the lady at the front desk was very apologetic and said she would inform her manager to contact us. It is now 3 days later and still no call from the manager. 
Our hotel room was clean, but very old

Slide door to bathroom did not work well.
Found a cockroach crawl around
Room was just very rundown.
Price was only advantage of Hotel

review.title: Deceiving looks.
review.reviewText: I made my reservation online. Pictures online from hotel seemed decent. Upon my arival (Late in the evening). Receptionist was rude, I attempted to get information and basically ignored me. Inside hotel room furniture was old,  curtains had holes, door lock was damaged and the room reeked of smoke. There were "No smoking" signs posted everywhere and people were smoking right outside and all over hotel location. Thete even was guest sitting outside their room door drinking alcohol right outside! It was too late for me to go find another hotel specially when you have two minor children with you.  I will never stay at this particular location ever again! I hope no one ever does.

review.title: Very, very RUDE and incompetent front desk staff.
review.reviewText:
When I made my reservation I noted I needed to check in no later than 1 pm. On my 3 hour drive to get there I tried calling over and over again to confirm that I could get into a room by 1 pm but no one ever answered the phone. 
I arrived at 12:30 and let them know I was there and was told no check in until 3 pm. I politely explained all I needed was to get into my room to shower and change in time to make a very important meeting by 2 pm. I gave him a $20 tip and said please do what you can. He didn't say thank you or I'll do what I can or anything he just took the money. Several times I saw cleaning staff come in and hand him list of cleaned rooms. At 1:30 I approached him again and told him I still could make my meeting if I could get checked in. He just became angry and held up a list of check outs and said I half to complete checkout first. "you go away! 
At this time the lobby was full of angry people wanting to check in and he was rude to all of them. But the worst was an elderly couple who were visiting this country from France. They were having a hard time understanding his poor English.
He also told them "go away" which made them very confused. This is no way to treat visitors to our country, I was embarrassed to say the least.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, rooms are what one would expect at this price level, clean, comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks:
Management, and front desk staff  need to be replaced! 
Earlier more reasonable check in time.

review.title: Ihop open 24hrs at least

review.positiveRemarks: the 4 small hard pillows to sleep on.

review.title: Like it because it was near the airport
review.reviewText: It was ok.. the neighborhood in where the hotel was seemed ok.. I really was impressed that they take you to the airport..

review.title: Don't live there

review.title: Cheap and functional near San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: This Travelodge was fine to be close for an early morning flight.  Shuttle service to airport starts running at 4a.m. which is very nice.  Very noisy with people talking, slamming doors, car locks beeping and kids until after 11p.m. The security latch was completely missing from the door.

review.title: Close to Airport
review.reviewText: About the only good thing about this hotel is location to SFO, however if you can spend the extra would probably avoid it altogether. There is a shuttle to the Airport and that's about it. There is no late checkout, although was only offered an extra hour. The desk staff are rude and strictly adhere to the 3pm checking, whilst reminding arriving guests just how busy they are checking everyone out. Yes I would recommend the Holiday Inn or even the Best Western without even staying there. This hotel takes a printed copy of your C/C but will not give it back on checking out. They also blame Expedia if any booking details aren't received by them.

review.title: Great location not a great place to stay
review.reviewText: The staff was slow to respond and overwhelmed. Not enough staff to meet the needs of the customers
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing, I don't have my photos on hand, I wished I did!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.  I have 5 lights in my room and only the overhead and the bathroom ones worked.  There was visible black mold, sloppy repairs in the room.
review.locationRemarks: not to close to anything- but there was a Costco!

review.title: It was pretty gross
review.reviewText: If you are a low  maintenance traveler you'll be just fine but in my opinion the room was just gross .  There was dirt and trash around the bed, holes in the carpet, wall, bedding and curtains.    The staff was nice.

review.title: My room smelled terrible of some  sanitizer

review.reviewText: Will stay in this hotel next time if the price is right!

review.title: Bad experience at the hotel
review.reviewText: The room always felt stuffy and had a funny smell to it.  Also, I  felt like we got cheated on our sheets. Blow dryer didn't work and bathroom was stuffy. Not staying there again

review.title: Not up to standards
review.reviewText: This property is overdue for a renovation. A $100 deposit will be required but there is nothing in the room worth that much. I tipped the housekeeper $2.00 for an overnight stay hoping to get the deposit back. Dicey at best. The homeless guy will leave you alone but he is a bit unnerving for non city folk. The carpet in my room was threadbare last year but they keep taking in tourist dollars from the airport. South San Francisco should look into this as it is destroying the city's brand. Seriously bad accommodations that should be razed and rebuilt. The highway does provide a free massage but the noise and what feels like intermittent earthquakes from trucks is not pleasant. I hope I get my deposit back but Expedia should drop this property until it improves.

review.title: Convenient to airport.  Free airport shuttle.
review.reviewText: Comfortable stay.  Comfortable bed.  Internet slow.

review.title: Not the best, but close to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Close to San Francisco, Caltrain, BART, and the freeway. And, for this area, reasonably priced ... And, the staff is GREAT. Very helpful and caring. I really liked the people who work here, from the housekeepers to the front desk - everyone is kind and professional. But ... the Motel desperately needs renovation - inside and out. It's real iffy. And, some of the people hanging around don't look like they're waiting for flights, unless it's the kind that you take pharmaceutically. I think a stronger security presence would be very helpful. Other than security and needing a major makeover the motel serves its purpose very well. Really. Don't get me wrong - I enjoyed my stay. As I said, the people working there are helpful and kind. I did take my valuables with me when I went out - and, at night made sure the door was securely locked. I would gladly stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The people who work here! They were GREAT. Very reasonable rates and very close to San Francisco. The bed was pretty darn good, too.
review.negativeRemarks: I think the place is do for a major makeover. And, I believe a visible security presence is needed.
review.locationRemarks: Great Location - close to Everything. We took Bart and Caltrain everywhere. Too much to list. We loved eating at the local Joannes' coffee shop.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Roomy room with parking near. It was a shame they did not had microwave or a fridge available for a 5 night stay. We had to use ice to keep our leftovers cool.

review.title: accessible to airport

review.title: Old, need upgrade/ lots of deferred maintenance.
review.reviewText: Room was very uncomfortable, I was sneezing all night.... Tired next day..,will not stay here again in the future.

photos.caption: Probably original carpet, 50  years old! Worn through to the floor. Nasty!!!

review.title: Worst hotel in America
review.reviewText:
I dare the proprietor of this establishment to even spend one night in one his or her rooms at this hotel. I've stayed in cleaner 1-star hotels in 3rd world countries.

If he stays just one night in one of the rooms of the wing where I stayed, I'll pull my 1-star rating. Until then, I am left wishing Expedia offers a zero star rating.

You won't get any sleep at this hotel. Windows are paper thin. Walls too. I coin hear when my neighbors used the bathroom, hear them talking, details of their conversation, hear the freeway all night. Then of course the jets taking off; and while that's to be expected at a airport hotel, every other hotel that I've stayed (literally hundreds), the windows are always double paned and rest of hotel is soundproofed at least somewhat. Not this one. 

You're better off sleeping at the airport or in your car. Horrid Hotel!!
The worst hotel to stay ever , don't stay there for free
Shower was nasty and outdated, the water took forever to drain.

Although we were not expecting anything fancy considering the price, we were surprised at the abysmal condition of the room. The washroom was primitive, the power outlets were not working, furniture was old and stained and about to fall apart. The only advantage was the free shuttle to the airport.

review.reviewText: Office staff was nice enough  and let us check in early to find a homeless man rummaging through his things and setting up camp outside of our room. We got in our non smoking room to breathe in the air of smokers past and noticed the tears in the carpet, the degraded wall paper/ paint combo that covered the walls in odd spots in a falling off motion and the stains on the blankets and sheets that was probably accompanied by bed bugs. Walked into the bathroom to see the shower that looked like something out of a bad scary movie. Although what did it for us was the cockroach hanging out beside the toilet looking at us like he got there first. Do not stay here!!!
The tub clogged really bad after one freaking shower smh

review.title: Room hazards, inconveniences, rude employees.
review.reviewText: If you want a suite in San Francisco don't go here. It was dingy and empty. The shower had no room to keep toiletries, the carpet was folded creating a safety hazard, the whole carpet was wet, and they don't give you a comforter blanket. Only sheets and a small tan felt looking blanket. The phone didn't work. There are no easy access outlets at the bedsides for charging your phone. And they are supposed to give you your $100 deposit back the next day, but didn't for me. Also, they took out $100 TWICE and hung up on me when I called to handle it. Completely awful.

The next day the hotel did not honor the free breakfast advertised through Expedia. We were three people staying so I definitely plan to make a formal complaint about this. The staff was completely unapologetic about the no free breakfast by merely acknowledging they don't do breakfast anymore. The night stands had something sticky on them and we found a fly in the room. Overall this is not a good place even for the price.

review.title: STAY AWAY!!!!
review.reviewText: Horrible place to stay! They have BED BUGS! Two of our employees were bitten really badly with bed bugs. Stay Away from this place!

review.title: They Almost Did Not Honor My Reservation
review.reviewText: I arrived at the front desk having lost my wallet and only $132 in cash.  The clerk almost did not let me register without "proper ID". I was finally allowed to register paying cash for the room and leaving all the rest of my cash as a deposit.  I found management to be very traveler unfriendly.

review.title: Sleazy hotel!
review.reviewText: This place use to be a haven for hookers and drug dealers. Now it's hosts the poorest of airport travelers and construction crews. The place is run down with holes in the carpets, drapes , and furniture. Everything is so old and dirty, that I kept my sandals on and only touched the bed. Don't stay here alone, or just pay the extra for one of the nice hotels across the street.

review.title:
Pro:  close to airport 
Con:  everything else
review.reviewText: Our flight from Maui to San Francisco was cancelled & rescheduled so we arrived at the Travelodge at 5:30 am rather than 10pm the night before as originally scheduled. I had called as soon as I knew our flight was changed & spoke to a very nice woman who ran my credit card & assured me that our room with a king bed would be held for us. When we arrived we were assigned to a room with 2 queen beds. I would have said something but our room was located 7 buildings away from the front office & I was in desperate need of sleep. 6 hours later when we checked out we were charged a "no show" fee for one night plus another night fee even though we were there a total of 6 hours. Luckily we were able to clear that up once I explained the situation to the gentleman working the desk during the day. The room was gross. The hand towels were stained & I wasn't comfortable showering without flip flops. We got a late check out but the cleaning carts were rattling outside our room at 10am. The walls were thin & light could be seen coming in through the door jam.
Windows old outdated. Wasn't secured properly. Heater nor can worked in the room. Older tv limited channels sound was horrible. Saw unsavory characters in parking lot at night.
Nice hotel no problems what so ever!!!!!! Very clean excellent pool many vendin machines ihop on site

review.title: Location
review.reviewText:
Travel Lodge was the right price, had an Airport Shuttle, convenient location, and a restaurant directly next door. 
My housekeeping service from Maria was excellent and made a priority as I arrived earlier than expected. The front desk worked to Accomodate my needs and were very helpful, also very accommodating with each hotel guest while I was in the lobby.

OK

review.title: Close to freeways
review.reviewText: I have e been staying here for the past four years, and this is the worst year. The customer service in the hotel lobby has bad communication skills. The bed in our room was the worst ever, you could here the spring in the mattress when you sat down or lay down. Then they had continental breakfast and they took that away. Every year is going down. I will never return here, or will I recommend this place to anyone. Never a smile from hotel clerks.

review.title: Overall

review.title: Quick stay
review.reviewText: This hotel had the basics - nothing fancy, but it did the job for a quick stop. The staff was very friendly.

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: I stay here every time I need to be in the bay, it's affordable comparing it to other hotels in the area and it is 10 to 15 minutes away from downtown SF or San bruno where the local mall is. The location puts it next to iHop, gas station, Mc Donalds, and a few feet fewer away is Costco, it's right next to the freeway which might be noisy but the convenience is on point. There's an outdoor pool but it's never that hot to take a dip.

review.title: Room needs remodeling. Outlets too old to plug in.
review.reviewText:
Noise from traffic. Bathroom needs remodeling. 
Staff did a good job. Close to airport. Shuttle was excellent.

review.positiveRemarks: Excellent location very near to the airport. Good for those who are transiting.
review.negativeRemarks: It will be great if they can provide a closet for hanging clothes. Also good to consider providing an electric kettle as not everyone drinks coffee

review.title: Not comfortable

review.reviewText: I walked into room and there were personal posessions on the dresser.  I could have been shot!!!   Front desk gal gave us another room.  That room was very dirty.  I did not feel safe.  We were also told there was a continental breakfast included.  We were told we could go to IHOP and pay for breakfast.   And the bathtub was terrible and dirty.   Honestly, to save your reputation this place should be bulldozed down and our charges should be reimbursed!!!

review.title: ok to just sleep in
review.reviewText: no conditioner, telephone not even working, only one coffee to brew,no ashtray.. To make it short, just ok to sleep in.

review.title: Cheap hotel by SFO with shuttle and IHOP
review.reviewText: If you are looking for comfort or class, this is not the hotel for you. There are clean sheets on the beds, hot water, and the doors lock. It's perfect for a really cheap stay after a missed flight. Shuttles every half hour from about 4:30am to after midnight. There is an IHOP attached to the checkin building for breakfast as well.

review.title: Airport hotel
review.reviewText: Easy access to SFO Airport. Regular 24 hour shuttle service.  Room was clean, but not fancy. Adequate for a 1 night stay.

review.title: Pretty good for the price.
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco for my younger cousin's orientation at San Francisco State University. Since we were checking in late and leaving early the next morning, we didn't want to spend a lot of money on a fancy hotel room. The Travelodge fit the bill. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable enough. This hotel is right by the airport so if you are a light sleeper, I wouldn't recommend staying here as you can hear the airplanes taking off/landing. My cousin and fianc didn't have a problem with the noise, they slept through it all. I played ambient noise (rain) on my iPad, put on my headphones in, and slept like a baby as well. Bonus: There's an Ihop right next to the office so you can walk to breakfast in the morning. Overall, I was satisfied with the quality and the price.

review.title: At one of my stays I was placed next to prostitute
review.reviewText: So you just kept hearing the door open and closing very loud all night and morning very annoying especially when you have a baby

review.title: Worst hotel in years
review.reviewText: I was open minded as I only needed one nights stay. It was close to the airport and easy access to the freeway, that is all I can say positive. The room was dirty and run down, the bed not fit for anyone looking to sleep. I'm not sure if the constant police patrol was a comfort or signs of their presence being needed for the areas late night "events". This stay is not worth the money no matter what the discount or cost be for a better quality room.

review.title: My Review
review.reviewText: The price were too high for an ugly stay. Water is very dirty. Phone is not working, no breakfast and a very slow wifi.

review.title: No words
review.reviewText: I won't recommend it,  it was very difficult to find Parking and we found cockoaroches inside the room. Carpet very dirty, old tv, paint coming out.

review.title: It was close to airport which is what we needed
review.reviewText: Room was extremely run down. Bathroom had paint coming off walls, and paint coming off walls. Just run down over all. We needed to catch 6am flight....so just there for a few hours, thank goodness.

review.title: Near SFO
review.reviewText: We used the hotel to be near SFO for an early AM departure.  They had shuttle service, free parking, and were very near the airport which is what we were looking for.  It is expensive for what I consider an average motel, but they charge the same price as comparable motels in the area.  Probably not the best place to stay if you are in San Francisco for vacation but works fine for early AM SFO departures.

review.title: close to airport
review.reviewText: good enough for a one night stay if you need to be close to the airport to fly out the next day.
review.negativeRemarks: cleaner carpet
review.locationRemarks: great for getting to airport.

review.title: Stay here only if no other place has rooms.
review.reviewText: The front desk attendant was rude, finding the room was difficult, poor lighting, trash outside rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness, softer beds, regular sized pillows, new furniture, lights that worked
review.locationRemarks: Went for a conference wasn't looking for other things

review.title: An ok motel for the price in the area
review.reviewText:
If your a price conscious traveler and you're looking for a place to stay near San Francisco, and don't mind driving into the city or taking BART, This will work for you. If you're extremely picky and want Hilton elegance and the convenience of walking or taking a cab to your venue, then this isn't your place

This is an older "motorlodge" styled motel that has been remodeled inside the rooms, through the years, but kept that mid century look outside. The inside, however does need some TLC. Places where the wallpaper is peeling off, would take 10 minutes to glue back on, if the operators of the establishment cared to take the time. Also could use some painting of mouldings and stain removal on the carpets. We found the bed way too hard and the small pillows were not adequate. Why not use full size pillows? Is this European? One last complaint was the water pressure in the shower, or should I say Lack of it?

The positives are the newer flat screen t.v., in room coffee maker and an IHOP pancake restaurant on property. There is also free shuttle to San Francisco International Airport, which is where you go to catch BART (Bay Area Rapid Transit) to go to the city (Market Street). One more plus is plenty of free parking, which is a commodity in the San Francisco area.
review.positiveRemarks: The price and free shuttle to SFO
review.negativeRemarks: larger pillows, softer bed, better water pressure in the shower and better room maintenance to fix the wear and tear.
review.locationRemarks: a short drive/shuttle ride to SFO which is where to catch BART to go to the city. downtown S.F. is about a half hour drive depending on traffic.

review.reviewText: My family and I stayed at the Travelodge during our layover in San Francisco.  Good place to stay for a night during a layover, but wouldn't recommend it for any longer duration.

review.title: Rude front desk
review.reviewText: I used Expedia to book my stay for two nights. After first night I was asked to check out. I tried to explain ..... Lito the front desk manager was extremely rude and insisted that I check out saying that's it's between me and expedia. After a long argument he discovered that it's his fault but still did not apologize. Terrible staff and dingy hotel. Expedia should strike it off its list

review.title: Confusion at checkin
review.reviewText:
Even at midnight guests were having difficulty checking in.
Clerk had never seen a discount coupon from Expedia like the one you sent me and was unable to be sure to validate it's use. It was too late and I was too tired to deal with the complication. won't know until I get the credit card statement If it was useable.
review.negativeRemarks: Clerk training, room smell.
review.locationRemarks: N A

review.title: Forget about a refund
review.reviewText:
I booked an employee into this hotel paying in advance for two nights with a corporate credit card.   He decided to stay only one night.   The shower didn't work, nor did the telephone.    The following morning I called both Expedia and the hotel to cancel the 2nd night and requested a refund for the second night.   The hotel absolutely refused and told me to call Expedia, who in turn told me to call the hotel.   

Very poor customer service.   I have placed other employees in this hotel for as much as 2 weeks at a time since it is convenient to our location in SFO.   Our company will no longer use this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Apparently only the location which is convenient to our offices in San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: Maintenance and customer service

review.reviewText: Carpet was stained and filthy wore socks to walk on it!

review.title: Loud!
review.reviewText:
My room was right next and I mean next to the freeway. It was very loud all night. I didn't expect much from the hotel, but for the price it was not worth it. It was more of a $60.00 room rather than a $178.00 room !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Parking lot was pretty ghetto, though the police drove through a lot. Gave me the feeling a lot goes down there.

Really appreciated the shuttle to and from the airport.  I was a bit disappointed with the noises from the air conditioner.  Staff tried their best to help.  It would be nice to have a few more around at check-in (7 check-ins with only one staff in my case so it took over 45 minutes for me to get my keys).

review.negativeRemarks: More staff to check-in guests, furniture may need replacing.
review.locationRemarks: There is an IHOP next to the hotel, a McDonald's across the street, and Costco 7 minutes walk away.  Anything else you will need transport to and from

Close to airport. Too noisy. Convenient to San Francisco downtown and airport.

review.title: Carpets stained, garbage in parking lot/ flowerbed

Over all, we were very dissatisfied with the whole experience at the travel lodge hotel in San Francisco!

review.title: Too noisy

review.title: Perfectly tolerable
review.reviewText: Its old. Outdated. Its grungy, not dirty.  My carpet was so threadbare, you could see the thread. Sheets were mostly clean. Heater worked well.   It is absolutely not comparable to any hotel outside of San Fran in the same price range.  Anywhere else it'd be the $30-$55 road side motel.  Part of the problem is the visitors tax in san fran.  For this room it was more than thirty.   I guess that is part of the problem - the tax is high you so you pay significantly more than what it is worth b/c of the tax. Website says its the largest Travelodge in the US.  It is big.
review.negativeRemarks: The carpets at least should be cleaned &/or replaced
review.locationRemarks: Ihop onsite open 24 hours

review.positiveRemarks: Staff was nice. No loud parties, pretty quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.

review.title: Grim

review.title: Not really an airport hotel
review.reviewText: To be an airport hotel, the hotel is required to meet certain expectations for its travelers, however this hotel mesmerized me with its holes in its bathroom towels, open soap, a dirty towel on the floor, a crack in the bathroom floor, cracks around the tub, a broken shower faucet, a broken microwave, a dirty refrigerator, dirty sofas and not even lotion for your face. I called them for two wake up calls and I did not even get one. I told them about these issues and they told me they will tell housekeeping in the morning. This is a transit hotel that if you can bear the issues and having no lock on the bathroom door so you can meet your flight through their excellent shuttle service, then by all means stay here. But you will leave very uncomfortable before your flight. The ac vents were broken but the mattress was comfortable. The TV was from 1995. The room perhaps from the 1960s.

review.title: Worst motel I have ever stayed at
review.reviewText: The room felt dirty, mold or just filth built up over the window where the curtain rod was misshapen. There was food debris from previous overnighter. Carpets are super worn. Matresses were different heights not sure what's going on there, they were both queen beds but one was bigger or thicker than the other. They wait until you check in to let you know there is a security deposit of $100 extra bucks which you may get back in a few days, I havent yet, day 3. The people in to room next to us kept trying to open the room connecting door. The TV reception was terrible, the TV in our room was probably on its last limb. Fuzzy screen and very dark. The Matresses under the sheets were absolutely stained and filthy. And they have cockroaches in the rooms. If you want to save a few bucks and just sleep here uncomfortably for a few hours sure stay here. But next time I'm in the area I will go ahead and splurge that extra $40/$50 bucks for a cleaner feeling hotel. I wish as soon as I walked in there I walked out and got my money back and left. It was awful staying there with my kids in such filth.

review.title: Worst hotel I have ever seen
review.reviewText: I lived in thousand of hotels in my life. This hotel is the worst hotel I have ever seen. The room has nothing except a bed and an old and inuseful TV. The room smells really bad and looks dirty. It is close to the high way,You cannot fall asleep, even though you close the door and window. Please DO NOT book here.

review.title: Hotel at reasonable price near airport
review.reviewText: The staff were excellent, offering cheerful service and responding to any and all requests. I recommend this hotel.

review.title: Bad Hotel Not For Seniors
review.reviewText: This place was dirty, noisy, and dangerous feeling. We had to carry our luggage past five dark buildings to our room. When we got there, the heat didn't work and the phone was disconnected. When we walked back to tell the girl at the frond desk, she could care less. We asked for a wake-up call but never got it. For older seniors, the hotel does not have an elevator. The highway runs right next to the hotel and it was VERY loud. Walking to a local restaurant was difficult as there were minimal sidewalks and the traffic was very busy. This is the worst hotel I've stayed in in the last 40 years!
review.positiveRemarks: Short shuttle ride to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Tear down the hotel and build something nice instead.
review.locationRemarks: A short walk would put you on the highway and you could watch all of the cars go by.

review.title: This hotel could also be called "Bates Hotel".
review.reviewText: This hotel was dirty, old, unsafe, gross, not comfortable by any means.  The roads are broken up and very very bumpy. It is very difficult to roll your suit cases to your room.  The rooms smell of old dirty socks.  The air/heat conditioner did not work and the smell that came out of it was disgusting.   Expedia booked this room for me and they did a horrible job in finding me a room. I have never stayed in a place like this.  I am a single women and I did not feel safe at all in this environment.  If i could i would have cancelled my reservation,  i was almost tempted to sleep in my car.   The phone was so old they don't make them anymore.  There was a small frig and microwave that didn't work ,  i think it was placed in front of the door between the rooms to block the door from opening.  There were huge cracks between the walls and floors.
review.positiveRemarks: There is nothing to like about this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything, the building should be destroyed.

review.title: Good for the price and better than expected
review.reviewText:
First time, we were terrified to stay as weird looking people were at the second fl railings, but after having stayed 
a few times in between four star hotels, this place is not so bad for the price that they charge.
We.always get a room with not a connecting door which makes the room quieter. When we stayed there
this time, we had a nice corner room but unfortunately next to us had very very noisy family with children and
it was hard to accept, so that called the front desk and it became very quiet after than which made us relieved
to rest well. I think that cleaning of any rooms that we stayed were not quite complete each time.
May need the last minute check on each room by a cleaning manager, as the facility is old and not well renovated which makes the place even dirtier than it is in real unless they do vacume each corner of the rooms and bottom of the beds very well. I noticed it this time.
A/C is good to have but it blows too strong. Other than that, if we get good rate with them, request the kind of preference of the room as much as they could accommodate with you. Some rooms are noisy with traffic and all rooms are like old motel style but in general spacious, very old couches which we do not use. Front desk people are always very nice and Ihop is next to it and gas staton next to it has some little shop in there. Mac Donald is across from it, I think.

That was the only good thing one could say about it. Traffic noise from the nearby freeway made it difficult to sleep. The long curtains over the windows were blown up like balloons by the air conditioner. The worst stay I've had in a motel in decades.

review.negativeRemarks: Update their non smoking rooms and fix their curtains.

review.title: COCKROACH PROBLEM!!!
review.reviewText: When we arrived in room the first place we went into bathroom only to find live cockroach on floor. Beds were not comfortable, TV was tube TV with poor picture quality. Convenient location, right at airport. Friendly staff. If it were not for the bugs, I may return for a quick in and out stay, but having bug problem just makes this a no return for me.
review.negativeRemarks: Bugs taken care of. Beds replaced. TV replaced.
review.locationRemarks: Literally adjoining airport property - convenient.

review.title: Needs renovation
review.reviewText: Old bedrooms, carpets needs a deep clean or a change and bathrooms are old, with humidity and needs urgent update.

review.title: Not terrible, but deserves its low rating
review.reviewText:
If you are looking for a cheap hotel in a relatively safe area with good transportation options and no hidden fees, this is an acceptable option. 

The Good: Comfortable bed. Clean-ish room (the carpet was clean, the room smelled fine even to my sensitive sniffer).

The Bad: Some glaring maintenance issues like a bathroom pocket door that was off its rail (we fixed it), and plug ins that pushed into the wall when you plugged something in. Abysmal water pressure. Shower door is glass and has some issues with the roller/slider mechanics that makes the door extremely difficult to open and close. 

The Ugly: Shower tile is in horrible condition. Lots of rips in wallpaper, stains on flooring. The shower stall is huge, but there's only one tiny soap bar holder for your shower toiletries. 

The final straw that moved this from a 3 star review to a 2 star is an issue with the front desk. Check-in was fine, the woman working the desk was efficient and friendly. Unfortunately on our last night we had an issue with our room key and the evening desk clerk ridiculously accused us of not properly documenting the second person in the room (I booked as 1 bed/2 adults, which is exactly what we had). She refused to give us a new card due to this "problem" until I demanded to see whatever rule she thought we'd broken (she couldn't provide it), and finally my insistence that she call the manager. It was a mindbogglingly stupid and frustrating end to our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Comfortable bed. Clean smelling room.
review.negativeRemarks: Much could be done without incurring large costs. Simply fixing the broken things in the rooms and giving the staff a little training would help.
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport. Best thing to do nearby is leave and find a better hotel.

The hotel shows its age but again our room was clean.  Snack machines would have been nice, that way we wouldn't have needed to leave the property.

review.title: EXTREMELY HORRIBLE
review.reviewText: Looking for a quick place to stay to catch a plane early in the morning so we decided to stay by the airport. We got to the hotel around 9pm and the lobby was full of people complaining. Should have left then but how bad could it be for a few hours. WRONG IT WAS HORRIBLE. After getting our key and heading to building 4 parking lot, there was a man in a old van just sitting there staring at us as we got our luggage out. Walking up to the second floor there were cigarette buds everywhere. Got to our room and opened the door and were over powered by the smell. OK, Lets check it out and see if we can just get through a few hours. The bathroom had wallpaper coming off the walls, the drain was not attached to the tiling but the toilet was new and the towels looked clean. The sink area was old but clean. The main area was SCARY. The furniture looked like it was dragged off the streets. The chair at the door was broken, the fabric on the couch reeked and was black with dirt. I pulled back the sheets and to check for bed bugs. TV was not fuzzy. The worst was NO AIR NO HEAT. Call the front desk and we waited until they send someone up about 10:30pm. The guy said it was not working. He then said he had to check the breaker. About 20 minutes later someone called to say it was not the breaker and asked if we wanted to change to a smaller no amenity room. We said no and left to slept in the airport. Asked for a refund got none as of yet, guy was too busy with other complaints.
review.negativeRemarks: Tear it down and rebuild.
review.locationRemarks: Noisy with road and plane traffic.

review.title: Quite an odour to the room - damp and musty
review.reviewText: The room was so far away from the lobby with all our bags we were exhausted.  The room had a damp and musty smell.  We won't be back

review.title: Bed Bugs
review.reviewText:
The quality of the room was a 1 star.

However, I woke up with bed bug bites. Not cool.
review.negativeRemarks: Remove the bed bugs. Replace the carpet that didn't have much fabric left in spots.

review.title: Does not cater
review.reviewText: This hotel does not have busboy service so you would have to handle things on your own. Trying to find your way to your room is a bit difficult. I have a 1 yr old and a 2 yr old plus all my luggage. My cab driver helped me get to my room. Only good thing is that they have an IHOP right on site.

review.title: Old out of date. Smelled like mold and mildew.
review.reviewText: Only stayed one night out of the 7 we booked. Not happy with room. No where to hang clothes. Bed had a very thin blanket and a sheet.

No exterior lights on property. 
Neither bedside light worked
Electrical outlets would not hold plug
Ironing board broken

review.title: Never again !!
review.reviewText: A/C broke no fix, carpets dirty/stained non smoking but everyone smoking on balcony, smoke filled the room. Not worth the $15 less than surrounding hotels.

review.title: Would not want to stay there again
review.reviewText: Not clean, everything has a feeling of falling apart, safe inoperational, and it was not cheap!!!

review.title: Smelled like bleach and marijuana
review.reviewText: Not the best hotel to stay unless you intend to only stay there for few hours waiting for a flight to sfo
Was guaranteed a no smoking room and did not get it.  The outlets in the room did not work

review.title: The worse hotel we stayed at. Will not recommend.
review.reviewText: Bad smell, I could not dleep, it was the worse experience. It should be demolished and built a new one. Thank you.

review.title: Cheap
review.reviewText: I needed a cheap place to stay for work on my own dime.  It will have to be beyond cheaper than the other area hotels for me to stay at this Travelodge.  I didn't feel especially safe.  My room was as far from the lobby as possible.  It seemed like some people may be living there.  I stayed there a couple months ago, but this time was worse.

review.title: Looks like a multi-room crack house
review.reviewText: I arrived around midnight and was directed to a seedy, poorly-lit building at the back of the property. There were multiple rooms with doors open and quite a few people milling about. it looked as though several people lived there. Several junker cars were parked in that area. I did not feel safe getting out of my car. I left even though the room was prepaid on a non-refundable reservation. I was  willing to pay twice for a hotel room in order not to have to stay at this roach motel.

review.title: Plug-ins
review.reviewText: Need plug-ins in room thar work for charging up i-phones or other electronic devices. None seemed to work.

review.title: Old and rundown
review.reviewText: Room was quite shabby and poorly maintained.  Very close to the freeway so road noise all night.

review.title: Very unhappy
review.reviewText: The room was worn out and outdated, people hanging around talking and drinking until after 3pm. Phone nor clock worked in my room, was told by the office staff that the one ice machine was on the other end of the facility. It was a huge facility. I got there after passing through many groups of men "partying" in the parking lot the ice machine was not working and had obviously hadn't been in quite awhile. The office staff shoukd have told me.

review.title: Run down facility
review.reviewText: The rooms were dirty, sheets had stains, shower had hair on the walls and the tile in bathroom had more things in the grout than I cared to explore. I know Travel Lodge is not known as an updated facility, but this one was really bad.
review.negativeRemarks: wall paper was falling off the wall on pretty much every wall corner. At least make the room presentable.

review.reviewText: Convenient place, close by restaurant and Costco . Comfort bed.

review.title: Bare bones
review.reviewText: Nothing special about this motel.  A place to sleep and get going again.  Our room had a bad disagreeable odor of stale cigarette smoke and cat smell.  It lingered on our pajamas the next night--yuck.  No breakfast, tight parking, tons of people smoking outside our door.  Not a vacation atmosphere that's for sure.  Bring your own pillow.  The pillows here were hard and gave us headaches.
review.negativeRemarks: Pretty much everything.
review.locationRemarks: Next to airport and freeway.

review.title: Cheap motel by the airport
review.reviewText:
The staff was excellent and friendly.  The shuttle bus to and from the airport was perfect.  On time and often.  
The room itself was a bit below average.  The shower pressure was poor.  Condition of room was worn out.
Bed was fine.  Lighting was good.  It is an older motel and it shows.  It is close to the freeway and you hear traffic 24/7.
But the price was right.  You get what you pay for!
review.negativeRemarks: the shower pressure.
review.locationRemarks: It is in an industrial area.  Not pretty.  Nothing to do nearby.  It is very close to the airport and has a great free shuttle service.

review.title: Reasonable prices for a hotel close to SFO.
review.reviewText: We have stayed here before since it is close to SFO and doesn't cost an arm and a leg. The pool is clean, the rooms are adequate for a short stay while traveling through and the IHOP next door is a bonus.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location with a shuttle bus.
review.negativeRemarks: Probably time to start updates to the rooms.

review.title: not a good first experience
review.reviewText: Staff was not friendly in assisting me.  The gal was very quick to answer all of my questions as if she was annoyed.  I asked where is the laundry facility and the hours. The gal replied "its on the card/key cover, it shows you where everything is."  I then needed to purchase laundry soap.  The vending machine wasn't taking $ bills and the price of items where not showing.  Price would show on the display only when you pull down the lever for the coin return . We stayed in bldg  6 (upstairs) Parking area is limited and one of the entrance is narrow for two cars to fit.  It would be nice if there was an arrow pointing which way to enter or exit.  I tried going out the narrow exit and there happened to be a worker's truck coming my way.  So I had to back all the way into a stall to park.  My room was on the 2nd floor.  Room looked and smelled dusty.  There was a patch of dirt/sand in the carpet near the doorway.  Furniture looking outdated and dirty.  I wanted to turn the A/C on but the plug was unplugged.  There was no way to plug in the A/C unit unless if you lay on your back and move the bed over to plug it in.  The wall plug had no cover and was loose.  We stayed there just 1 night and caught our flight the next morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service.  The rooms in general (dusty)

review.title: 2 Stars mean less amenities
review.reviewText: I understand that a 2 star hotel offers less amenities, but this place was dirty, the walls were rotting, and I was welcomed to a room with full trash bags in front of the door. The bathroom could have been simply cleaned but there was fungus in the shower and the sink and it looked like it hadn't been cleaned in months.
review.negativeRemarks: Simple housekeeping
review.locationRemarks: The airport is close by so hopefully you can leave soon.

review.title: The heater was not working
review.reviewText: The room heater was not working. I told the front desk staff TWICE, on two successive days, about this problem. The hotel staff did not fix the heater even though they said that they would.
review.positiveRemarks: The low cost and general comfort and cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff should respond t guest complaints rather than ignore them.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is convenient to the airport and to San Francisco.

review.title: Good Hotel for The Price
review.reviewText: An inexpensive hotel that offer a clean simple experience with a very conveinent airport shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: They could use some new furnishings

review.title: terrible place to stay
review.reviewText: dirty,tired,uncomfortable,depressing would not recommend or ever stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: major total renovation

review.title: Good rate near the airport With shuttle service
review.reviewText: Ok place.  Met our needs.  Bad water pressure in shower.

review.title: Affordable hotel
review.reviewText: Decent hotel but pillows were in much need of being replaced

review.title: decent enough if you're not too picky.
review.reviewText: I got a good rate and just needed to sleep near the airport.  Needs a serious update, but then it would be a lot more expensive.  I wouldn't pay more than $75 for a room.  Bed was fine.

review.title: Good price
review.reviewText: I asked for a non smoking room and they gave me a smoking room, staff not friendly

review.title: You can choose better
review.reviewText: Reairs shoddy.  Staff cranky.  Canceled return & booked with Holiday Express--same cost better place
This hotel is in need of renovation. The carpet and furniture are dirty and worn. The bed was not comfortable.

review.title: Close to SFO
review.reviewText: The room needed new carpet & such.  A little grubby.

review.title: A Nice Bed Counts For Alot
review.reviewText: The layout and condition of the place leavessomething to be desired.  But the room was clean and bed very comfortable.  Consequently, I slept well...and that counts for alot.
review.negativeRemarks: The infrastructure.
review.locationRemarks: Location is on the very southern end of the airport access road.  Convenient for quick business stay-overs, not for sight seeing.

review.title: Close to sfo
review.reviewText: Disgustingly tattered furnishings.  Did not want to used the shower it was so filthy

There was no closet, nowhere to hang anything up. No desk, just a small table. No refrigerator. The floor seemed uneven, seemed to slant downhill from the entrance. Two of the three lamps were out (but this was quickly fixed when I asked at the front desk). I couldn't get the vending machines onsite to work. Surprisingly quiet, given that it's right up against the 101.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was clean, the staff were pleasant and helpful, the price was right, the airport was close. Free wifi with full internet access.
review.negativeRemarks: See above, description of my experience.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing within walking distance except an IHOP and a MacDonalds. With a car, you have easy access to the 101, and so to anything in the Bay area.

review.title: good location, that is what we were looking for.
review.reviewText: I had noted that we wanted a non smoking room but we got a smoking room. They did change our room with 2 beds instead but on the 2nd floor. We are senior citizens, but it was late and we were late because we had a 2 hour delay at the Alamo car rental. They ran out of cars.
review.positiveRemarks: location. Close to the airport, rent-a-car and where we wanted to go.
review.negativeRemarks: A little bit cleaner room, up date with the television and air conditioner
review.locationRemarks: rent-a-car pick-up location, very near airport and shopping

review.reviewText: Very close to the conference center. The service can match its price.

review.title: Terribly dirty
review.reviewText: Place was dirty had hairs in the bathroom all over the place housecleaning was lazy. I was there for 4 days I would know on business

review.title: Old, shabby motel.
review.reviewText: The best thing to be said is that it's right on Hwy 101. Parking is in short supply, the carpet is worn down to the jute backing, there are lousy repairs, a stained and soiled chair that looked like a curbside trash pick-up, and pretty much grime every where. Fortunately I only slept there. I can say the wi-fi was good and strong, that's about it.
review.negativeRemarks: almost everything, it needs a total remodel
review.locationRemarks: near the airport

review.title: Convenient and affordable.
review.reviewText: Feels like your home... you can relax... quiet zone...

review.title: Superb stay
review.reviewText: Overall experience was superb! From check-in to check-out, our 2nights stay was a OK. The hotel staffs were very friendly and accommodating. Our room was ready considering we arrived before the check-in time. The location was excellent if you want to stay near the airport.
The facility is too old and not very well maintained

We have stayed at some comfortable Travelodges but the one in SF was dingy and a bit creey looking. The beds and pillows were very uncomfortable. The bath tub is old and starting to rust. The heater was awkwardly located so it kept blowing our blinds over the bed. There were 2 washers and dryers for our use but one was broken and the other one did not dry our clothes after 2 cycles. The staff was helpful and kind though. It's not the worst hotel I've stayed at but I wouldn't go back unless it was the only option.

review.title: Old and worn.
review.reviewText: Just plain disappointed w/the room.. The carpet was worn bare in spots. It had a water damaged ceiling and entry wall w/possible mold present. It had an smell that wouldn't go away after airing out for couple of hours. The window had no bug screen and was not sealed.  Plugin didn't work so y had to choose between clock/radio or bed lamp (and there weren't enough available to start with). Half the water leaked from the coffee pot while brewing. Only got 9-10 TV channels of 40 or so listed. Easily heard the neighbors. The tub filled up while showering. Parking was limited, there were no comp computers available and there was no comp breakfast..
review.positiveRemarks: It was pretty clean and the staff tried hard.
review.negativeRemarks: see experience remarks....
review.locationRemarks:
Not far enough from airport (based on insulation factor). 
If it's raining you can play in the salt water filled parking lot next door at high tide.

review.title: Convenient but awful
review.reviewText: Had the privilege of staying in one of their "smoking" rooms. You could tell the place hadn't been cleaned in a while and it was like stepping through a time machine into the 90s. Staff clearly not aware they're in hospitality.

review.title: Close to the Airport
review.reviewText: I booked for three days and I feel comfortable in the room

review.title: Convenient location, timely shuttle to airport.
review.reviewText: I needed a hotel close to SFO with a shuttle. The shuttle ran frequently enough to make it a convenient ride to and from SFO. Staff was friendly. It's next door to an IHOP, so it was nice to get hot chocolate in the middle of the night. ;)
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient airport shuttle, close to IHOP.

review.title: In a Pinch
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby is very nice and the staff were very friendly and helpful. After signing and receiving keys to the room we moved onto the room. The carpets are stained and have worn spots in them. They need to be replaced. The furniture in the room is out of date and has stains and is falling apart. The sheets were clean and the bedding looked good. The walls need some repair especially along the floor where the carpet meets the wall. The wall near the bathroom was chipped and falling apart, needing updates as well. I would not book another stay at this facility unless it gets renovated. The images that are on Expedia are not accurate and I would be cautious to book here unless it is last minute or is the only place that fits your budget. We booked here last minute due to a flight cancellation, but I would not book here again. Additionally, this facility is a subsidiary of Wyndham resorts, if they are going to keep their name attached they may want to look into this facility and make some necessary updates to fit with their experience and quality.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff and lobby was the only good thing about this facility other than price for a last minute reservation.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms in the hotel need to be renovated and updated to match what is characterized on Expedia.
review.locationRemarks: There are great dinning facilities not located too far from the hotel. We went and ate at a local Italian restaurant.

review.title: Sleeping on the freeway.
review.reviewText: I chose Travelodge rather than another slightly more expensive chain nearby in large part because of free parking, a rarity anywhere near San Francisco. That was an unfortunate choice. Yes there were two beds and the toilet did flush but the shower did not work, there was no stopper for even a bath, opening the window a crack to air out the room meant hearing the loud roar of the freeway. Couldn't wait to get out of there, cancelled our next 4 nights reservation.

review.title: Hotel in expensive city
review.reviewText: For the price it was less than par....no working heater so they had to give us two portable heaters, fan in bathroom really loud, room very outdated.
review.negativeRemarks: Building, updating rooms, fix broken heaters
review.locationRemarks: Near airport, close to mall and shops good location

review.title: In need of renovation
review.reviewText: In desperate need of renovation.  The wall next to the bed had a huge dent where someone had kicked or punched it, the wall paper was peeling off the wall. Carpets were stained badly, bathroom door would not close all the way. The bathtub looked horrible where it had been repaired over and over. The TV was an old tube TV, the color was all blown out so the picture was dark with lots of red.  If all you need is a clean place to sleep, then this is it, but it is nothing more than that.
review.positiveRemarks: It did smell clean, the staff were friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: time for a renovation
review.locationRemarks: Location was what we needed, there was an outlet mall nearby, and it was 15 minutes from downtown San Francisco.

review.title: The stay was comfortable & pleasant.
review.reviewText: The staff was helpful & fairly safe to go around especially at night. I wish there are more parking so it will nearer the rooms especially if you are loading & unloading luggages.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport & reasonable rates.
review.negativeRemarks: Needed some repairs especially in the washrooms.
review.locationRemarks: Location is excellent & near shopping mall.

review.title: My room was much more than I expected.
review.reviewText: For the price, this was beyond my expectations.  My room was large, clean, comfortable, partially up-dated and very quiet with the double-paned windows.  The king-size bed was a bit firm but comfortable.  For only $10 extra per day, I had not only a larger room with couch and recliner, but a fridge and microwave as well.  Iron and ironing board included.   There was a fairly new 46" LED TV, but not a very good choice of stations; no CNN, HLN, Nat Geo, Fox News etc.  Did have TCM, MSNBC, PBS, C-SPAN, SY-Fi, BBC etc.
review.positiveRemarks: Great prices, friendly staff - especially Front Desk clerk named IMRAN.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything was satisfactory.
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport, restaurants, Costco, freeway access.  Movie theatres only a few miles away.

review.title: there is cheap but this is rediculous
review.reviewText: We were put into a handicap room which had no real shower no counters and no closet this was truly not what I expected. Will never stay her again this place is only good for long term parking.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: We were only staying a day so it wasn't worth paying an extra hundred bucks since we didn't plan on being in the room all that much. Showers were horrible area was less than safe, the staff was friendly however so that made up for some of it.

review.title: Don't stay here
review.reviewText: Where do I even begin? Sticky and burnt carpet, ants in the bathroom, coffee set up that looked like it had already been used, chair that was filthy and had a huge hole in it. But by far the highlights were the lamp you had to unplug to turn off and the fact that you couldn't take a shower. This was the worst hotel stay I have ever experienced.

review.title: Nice place very clean
review.reviewText:
Nice stay. Very clean however need wall jacks to charge my phone. Nice and roomy.      
Great free parking if you can find a spot.
Have nothing else to say. Easy access to freeway.

review.title: hotel just to sleep at.
review.reviewText:
Everything was satisfactory for the price. Easy to find.
BUT the chair to sit and watch TV, was as duty as could be, stains, and black spots of human grease, untouchable!!!!
Other than that was acceptable clean.

review.title: IF YOU LIKE 1960's MOTELS
review.reviewText: The price should have been a hint. First, the good news: the beds are comfortable. There is a microwave and a refrigerator, and Wif-Fi worked fine. The shuttle runs every 30 minutes on the 8. These are all things that I value. But, the room had the "old motel" smell, the heating system blew hard but delivered little, the towels were coarse, the bathroom was minimal, and there was a lounge chair that looked like it had been used daily since 1980 without cleaning. In addition, the motel has several buildings. I flew into SFO and took the shuttle, so without a car, I had to walk about five minutes in the dark. I don't think I would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds are comfortable. They have microwaves and refrigerators. Wi-fi was strong. Airport shuttle we dependable.
review.negativeRemarks: Not sure if the place can be improved.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport. There is an IHOP attached and a gas station next store.

review.title: Nice staff clean room
review.reviewText: Walking distance to ihop -overall out was nice at a good price I would stay again
Didn't amenities advertised.  Noisy. Old outdated, small room. Rug and bathroom not clean.  Wouldn't recommend this motel to good clients.
review.negativeRemarks: Whole place needs upgrading and cleaning

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Close and convenient to the airport which is the only good thing about the property.
review.negativeRemarks: Complete renovation.

review.reviewText: The bathroom wasn't clean. The facility was old and the location wasn't upstanding

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: A little noisy but it was close to the airport walking distance to good food

review.title: Close to SFO airport
review.reviewText: We stayed there for 5N/4D with 2 queen beds. No microwave and fridge and the room was dirty. The light in the washroom was dark with a sliding door that you can not lock. They never vacuum the carpet even before we arrived. It's not worth staying there.

review.title: 1 night stay before flight.
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed one night before an international early flight.  We only live across the bridge but did not want to risk a tie-up on the Oakland/S.F bridge.
review.negativeRemarks: If it was more improved the price would be much higher.
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO.  Best get dinner across the street.

review.reviewText: arrived in town early and needed a south SF place to stay
review.negativeRemarks: needs to be remodeled and cleaned up

review.title: Nice clean room very near SFO.
review.reviewText: Had to stay here for a dr appointment in the city early in the morning. Easy to find easy freeway access near food and gas. Hotel was nice and friendly, told us of problems with the room prior to issuing us keys. Our room had no phone so we couldn't receive a wake up call but other than that and not having an handicap accessible bathroom room was great.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy to find easy freeway access near food and gas. Hotel was nice and friendly, told us of problems with the room prior to issuing us keys.
review.negativeRemarks: an handicap accessible bathroom
review.locationRemarks: easy freeway access near food and gas an ihop right next door

review.title: Drive right pass this hotel!
review.reviewText: I wouldn't stay here again. The rooms are old and need a deep cleaning. The mattress were last changed during the Regan era and you feel every spring. The hotel charges you 100 dollar deposit when you check in, but the thing is the room had no fridge, and the only thing that I could rack up a charge on was the phone. Thou who doesn't have a cell phone these days. The shower wasn't that clean either.

review.title: Ok hotel, location not that great
review.reviewText: The shuttle from the airport was a nice touch, shower in my room was dirty, but overall you get what you pay for.  It's a 2-star hotel.  Location is far from everything except the airport, so make sure you plan accordingly.  The BART station in San Bruno is a 35 min walk, but if you have a car, the 101 is right next to the hotel.  There is an IHOP on site, but don't count on a quiet night's sleep.  And good luck finding an open socket to plug in your laptop or phone charger.  Would I stay here again? No, I would rather stay somewhere closer to the BART.
review.positiveRemarks: The price was attractive, the airport shuttle was also helpful
review.negativeRemarks: Mildew in the showers needs addressing, two of the lamps in my room didn't work.
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport and the 101 freeway, if you don't have a car, transportation is very limited.

review.title: Old, loud.
review.reviewText: Dated hotel close to the airport. Staff were nice. Overall area is kind of sketchy and hotel is right next to the freeway.
Hotel utilities poor. Shower running slow and weak.

review.title: The problem was there was no water due to a break
review.reviewText:
I registered near midnight and there was a fairly long line up of tired people.  Due to a break in the main water line there was absolutely no water and nobody offered us a bottle to go to our room.  Also the phone in the room did not work.  They said they will reimburse 50% on my credit card.  I hope I can trust it.
Overall, it is a cheap hotel which could have worked for me otherwise.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything but for the price, can't expect much
review.locationRemarks: Well located near the airport but very noisy as all other airport hotels are

review.title: Unforgettable
review.reviewText: Having climbed up 2 flights of stairs with two bags we entered our room which appeared ok. Went into the bathroom and was very disappointed. The bath had stains everywhere the shower curtain was awful. The handle to the toilet was barely holding up. We had an early flight so at 5.00am we got up to find no water. So no wash.brushing teeth or flushing toilet. No drink before we left. Facing a long day ahead it was not good.

review.title: Very bad hotel
review.reviewText: Very nasty , iam not see hotel like this befor OMG
Old and outdated and smelled. Close to the airport and not far from downtown San Francisco if you have a car.
Room could definitely use some upgrading, but everything was clean and worked well. Beds were clean and as comfortable as any motel bed. Overall pretty average.

review.title: Nasty !
review.reviewText:
Start here by room looks like it was a cheap MOTEL 6 

Parking lot dirty

Nice bedding , but mattress was probably 5 years old 

No coffee in reception area 

No breakfast bar any more
review.negativeRemarks: Everything !!!!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location to airport

review.title: quick stay!
review.reviewText: I've stayed here a few times when I do 1-2 night max for me because of the Expedia price (discount value only)..... Rooms are stuffy not unless you blast the AC on... All rooms have a  lingering scent of  cigarette smell... I just think they  are way behind on upgrading.... I don't get the cozy feeling sleeping there or walking bare foot on there carpet.... Again I do 1 night thus far because of the 50-65 a night sleep only and gone
review.negativeRemarks: The whole hotel needs a desperate lift
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport restaurants gas station safe area

review.title: Old and musty. Friendly staff
review.reviewText: Old and musty smelling. Smoking outside rooms didn't help. Upgrade on second stay helped a little. Long wait for shuttle.  Friendly, helpful staff made the stay.

review.title: OK....
review.reviewText: The room what we received was below standard but like saying goes "you get what you pay for"
review.negativeRemarks: upgrade the room furniture.
review.locationRemarks: There was an IHOP Restaurant walking distance.

review.title: Good price
review.reviewText: Fair price , room was not the cleanest but no bed bugs. Staff really nice .

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: It's close to airport and short drive to city. This was a business trip so I wasn't caring too much but this wouldn't be for the romantic getaway the carpet was dirty and peeling. And the wallpaper was peeling. The bed was comfy and nice looking.

review.title: acceptable accommodations near the airport.
review.reviewText:
Travelodge serves the purpose of a transit hotel upon late arrival in San Francisco. I needed such  an accommodation having flown in from a long flight and connection from Europe. The hotel shuttle was such a welcome at 12.30 AM. The night lady receptionist was friendly but the day receptionist was less accommodating (should be the other way around)
Do not expect much to avoid disappointments.
review.negativeRemarks: room facilities can be updated.

review.title: Convenient, nice and comfy hotel...
review.reviewText: Reasonable price for a short stay, very convenient, nice and clean.

review.title: Close to airport and price is ok comparing others
review.reviewText: Noisy from free way and neighbor due to old building such noisy sounded from plumbing vibrating.

review.title: Overnight Stay
review.reviewText: The overall hotel experience was good. As a 2 star hotel, it was a bit on the dirty side. For a one person overnight stay the room works! Walking distance to IHOP and gas station. Vending machines, all of them, were not working so the gas station was convenient (it has fresh fruit, coffee machines, sandwiches, fresh hot dogs, fresh popcorn, etc.)

review.title: Bad bad bad
review.reviewText: The only good thing about this hotel isn't harbor was right next to IHOP.  We didn't even have a shower curtain in our bathroom. And the tub was nasty! The room had a weird old smell. Never again travelodge! Good thing it was just for one night!!! Ugh!

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText:
This was sadly the cheapest hotel I could book for a one night stay near SFO. The location was excellent. But basically you're paying for that and the free shuttle. 

After seeing my room, I fully regretted my decision and wished I had paid just a little bit more for a safer, cleaner hotel room elsewhere. 

My room was on ground level, with cars and people passing immediately outside my front door all through the night. I would peek out once in a while and find cars just parked in front of my window (it wasn't a parking zone). I had to push excessively hard on the door to get it to lock. The curtains perhaps taken from some child's room in the 80's were like a warning that I was in some cheesy horror film (smiling monkeys in red ball caps against a sky background). Oh and they also didn't fully cover the window, I had to pull a McGyver to get the curtain to hide me from the view of all passers by. Otherwise everyone walking by my room would be able to watch me sleeping. The light fixtures were rusty and dirty. I feared walking without shoes anywhere in this room. And the dirty appearance of the chairs and furniture made me feel equally afraid to touch anything.

You get what you pay for. And I personally will not be back here ever again.

review.title: Smells like smoke and Outdated
review.reviewText: This hotel is right off of the freeway, which is some what convenient, but is very loud with all of the traffic. The lobby smelled like cigarettes the moment you walked in and  had very out dated check in methods, such as taking copies of your credit card and stamping them. The rooms were VERY out dated. The tv was from the early to mid 90's, wall paper was coming off of the walls, the shower had a bunch of patch work done and the room its self was at an incline. As soon as you walk in to the room, you proceed to go downwards (like a hill). If the rooms were priced  CHEAPER, i would recommend it for just a quick over night stay. But it is DEFINITELY NOT worth the price. The pictures are deceiving.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor. Smoking area and rooms. BASIC upgrades

review.title: Older hotel but clean and close to airport
review.reviewText: Close to airport, older but clean. I would stay here again if in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Price is a little high but being close to the airport is probably worth it.

review.title: Good motel for over-night stay near airport.
review.reviewText:
Good motel for over-night stay near airport. The price looks higher than average over US for this kind of motel, however it may be reasonable for San-Francisco area. 
Staff at front desk is very friendly and helpful, however motel rooms and equipment looks being in use for a long time without refurbishment and renovation.
review.positiveRemarks: Close proximity to airport and reasonable price.
review.negativeRemarks: Facilities and rooms need renovation.
review.locationRemarks:
Close to airport and free transportation to airport. 
I did not see anything to do near hotel, but I was told that there is a bus and train to S-F.

review.reviewText: One of the lamps in the room had burnout bulbs. The bed covers smelled like they weren't washed in months. The carpet appeared dirty and the bathroom floor was also dirty.

review.title: Pleasant stay for the price we paid
review.reviewText: It was a good experience we were worried about the room because of the reviews, but technically for that price it wasn't bad at all, of course the building is not new, but it was comfortable, the beds were clean and the bathroom too, we didn't have problems with the noise and it was a safe place. We stayed there with a 5months baby and i wasn't worried about bugs or anything, we brought our own portable crib tho, but everything was nice.
review.positiveRemarks: the beds were comfortable, it was a clean room
review.negativeRemarks: the sheets and fix the walls (paint), the carpets are old, maybe have a fridge in the room for those that have babies and  bring their food.
review.locationRemarks: it was very accessible to everything, nice place to stay if you have kids

review.title: In need of repair
review.reviewText: The hotel was in need of repair - the furniture and carpet were badly stained;  the bathroom had mold, the floor needed to be replaced, the pocket door stuck and needed to be painted. We were disappointed because Travel lodge usually is nice.
review.negativeRemarks: repair doors, paint, clean carpets and furniture - bathroom needs to be completely redone

review.reviewText: Room was located a little bit far from the lobby and room facilities was bad and too loud to sleep.

review.title: great location near airport
review.reviewText: ok for overnight stay. decent sized room. old and dated decor. bathroom needs a lot of work, looks old and crumbling. needs a serious update for prices requested. expensive for the condition the hotel and rooms are in..
review.positiveRemarks: great location near airport. free shuttle to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom. outdated decor. better linens.
review.locationRemarks: near airport

review.title: The best part was the price
review.reviewText: Location convenient but noisy. Hotel layout like a maze, multiple buildings, poorly identified. I thought the lobby was a gas station! Room smelled. Linens clean but smelled of industrial cleaner. In desperate need of refurbishing. Worn stained carpet. Inadequate outlets. WiFi excellent
review.negativeRemarks: See my original comments

review.reviewText: Quick place to stay for one night. Room was okay needs upgrades. Bathroom was very small and dirty. Was just one night

review.title: Nice hotel to relax!
review.reviewText: Everything was clean, it was spacious, great for a night of fun in the city and coming back to a great comfortable, affordable price hotel.!

review.title: Basic Hotel to accommodate 1 night stay for SFO
review.reviewText: This is a basic hotel that best serves the purpose of an overnight stay for either arrival or departure from SFO just down the road.  The room was basic but OK in appointments and cleanliness.  Their airport shuttle service (shared with two other close by hotels) was on time as scheduled, driver courteous and helpful and the shuttle was clean.  Acceptable for overnight/limited stay purposes and close location to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk had trouble retrieving reservations that were made through Expedia some time previous to the stay.  Their computer recordkeeping needs help
review.locationRemarks: Things to do nearby is very restricted as the hotel is on road located with other hotels and commercial entities focused on SFO in & out.

review.title: Stay here if it's your only option
review.reviewText: Staff was unfriendly. They acted as if guests were an inconvenience.  Very run down facility.  Lots of traffic noise.  However, the local shuttle to airport was on time and driver was friendly.  But, you don't have to stay here to park and use the shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrades to rooms.  Train staff on guest relations.
review.locationRemarks: Just stayed to catch an early morning flight at nearby airport.

review.title: Just a SIMPLE hotel!
review.reviewText: It is just a simple hotel (sleep, wifi, tight yourself up). If you are looking for cheap place to sleep, it is what you need otherwise if your desires are more sophisticated, you better stay somewhere else!

review.title: Terrible
review.reviewText: Smelly dirty. No electric lights  staff rude only good thing was shuttle to airport
review.negativeRemarks: All of it
review.locationRemarks: Airport

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is a little old so the facilities also look a little outdated. The carpet doesn't look that clean too. But if you are just staying there for one night before you catch your flight, it's probably ok. Hotels in SF are all very pricy.

review.title: Outdated State of Disrepair
review.reviewText: The room was very old, all appliances were unplugged, the bathroom fixtures were almost falling out of the wall, the paint was chipping everywhere, popcorn ceilings, musty smell, light fixtures were corroded. Did not deliver king bed, as booked, but two queens. No close parking near room. All in all, a very disappointing experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything in the rooms needed updating, particularly bathroom. Cleanliness was mostly due to old conditions of carpet and plumbing, paint/fixtures.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco Airport, ballpark, sites.

review.title: Don't stay here, unless you don't have your family
review.reviewText: I'm not one to complain but I would never come here again with my family. I might only go by myself as a last resort. Hotel was really run down... Dirty... But not as in unkept, so old and used so much that there are stains all over the carpet/walls/bathroom. And it really did stink. I only stayed because we got there late and it was only for 1 nite. Never again

review.title: This is the worst 'hotel' I have ever stayed in.
review.reviewText:
This is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The room was dirty, had bed bugs and the bathroom was a disgrace. And the price we were charged was unbelievableover $200! We thought maybe our room was an exception, but in the morning we were speaking to another guest waiting for the airport shuttle. His experience was exactly the same in fact worse as they had the audacity to charge him over $300! He thought there was a conference on and this was the reason for his high price. I would not stay at this hotel if it was offered for free! It is such a disgrace that I am going to write a letter to the Governor of California and the Mayor of North San Francisco and copy the hotel at the same time. I doubt if this will make any difference as they obviously do not care in the slightest.

You may think I am exaggerating. Do so at your perilyou have been warned.

PS. I only took the attached photos of the bathroom as the bedroom was so dark it was not possible. If the bathroom is this bad, use your imagination!z

PPS. I am forced to give this hotel a 'star rating' The lowest possible is 1*, but it does not even deserve this!
A worn out hotel.  Back to the 70's...............Norman Bates type of BAD!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Everhthng
