review.locationRemarks: between the SFO runway and the 101 Freeway - bring ear plugs

review.title: Bad hotel close to the Airport
review.reviewText:
The room was small, the shower filthy.
That about covers it.
review.negativeRemarks: Renovate
review.locationRemarks: Not relevant to me

review.title: hotel needs  many manteinance.  old room with bugs
review.reviewText: there are many other hotels around SFO.  This is not the best option.  Too expensive for the conditions of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: everything related to hotel
review.locationRemarks: 20 minutes from San Francisco

review.title: Easy access
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, clean heated pool, nice comfortable room, easy access to the city, the peninsula, east bay and the airport. Nothing special just a clean well run older hotel at a good price.
review.positiveRemarks: clean heated pool, nice comfortable room
review.negativeRemarks: The exterior could use a paint job
review.locationRemarks: easy access to the city, the peninsula, east bay and the airport

review.title: My worst stay ever
review.reviewText: Old stinking smoker's room. The building and the rooms are old and certainly require renovation. They charged me a staggering 320 per night for this dingy hole.
review.positiveRemarks: The front office staff were helpfull
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness, this hotel needs to be brought down and rebuilt.

review.title: Overrated
review.reviewText: We paid over $450 for one night for a room that did not include breakfast.  The bathroom was minuscule and  looked like it was maintained by a slum landlord.  The room was musty. The pillows were hard.
review.negativeRemarks: The cleanliness of the room and utilities in the bathroom.

review.title: Avoid this hotel.
review.reviewText: No response from the desk; the room smelled terrible; the room hasn't been updated in the past century; it was extremely overpriced; a place to avoid at all costs.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.

review.title: NO WATER
review.reviewText:
in shower hot or cold, a television sheould be a requirement. 

The staff was courteous to inform of an IHOP outside, and GABRIEL WAS MOST ATTENTIVE AND COURTEOUS, AT THE RESTAURANT. WE NEED MORE EMPLOYEES OF HIS CALIBER IN ALL HOTEL AND RESTAURANT SERVICES.

Eduardo
review.negativeRemarks:
Gabriel at the restaurant in from of TRAVEL LODGE HAS MUCH TO TEACH YOUR COMPANY.
HE IS A GREAT ASSET TO HIS COMPANY.
EDUARDO
review.locationRemarks: ONLY HAD ONE NIGHT THERE.

review.title: Dirtyyy
review.reviewText:
Clean rooms is the main thing in a hotel 
Hairs on the bed nails clipped on the floor soda spilled on counter sticky

review.title: Roaches!!
review.reviewText: This place is way too overpriced! I have stayed at nicer hotels and paid less. But what grossed me out the most was finding a cockroach on the bed!!
Room was very smelly and the carpet felt sticky.

review.title: OK for the price, but still over priced!
review.reviewText: Good enough for a night before or after flying inl  A/C wasn't working, and it happened to be a hot day!  Windows seemed to be painted shut, but finally got them open for some air.  Were moved to another room the second night.   Breakfast of some sort would have been nice.  At least  a voucher or discount at IHOP there on premises. Somewhat old and run down, and maids were outside talking at 6 in the am so we were up much earlier than we wanted.

review.title: Close from the airport!
review.reviewText: I love they provide shuttle and restaurant (IHOP) was very close and convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: It was cheaper than other hotels but it was not bad!

review.title: Not an employee
review.reviewText: I don't work for Travelodge therefore I should not have to plug in everything in the room that has been left unplugged only to find out most of the outlets are shaking loose in the wall and don't have power, worst cold shower of my life no hot water and the maid came to my door every 10 mins to clean even though I was still asleep like most people at 6 a.m., not worth the money save yourself the headache and go somewhere else.

review.title: Humm of AC made up for everything.
review.reviewText: brought back memories.   unscary but unwelcomed spider in bathroom,  but for some reason,  the hum of the air conditioner made up for it.   slept like a baby.

review.title: Great location, OK hotel
review.reviewText: This place is old & worn, but clean & decent. The location is great if you're being picked up by a friend after a late night arrival - we've done that several times. They used to offer a very basic continental breakfast, but now there's an IHOP on the property, & we had a good meal there.

review.title: Tired, worn out and in need of a refurb
review.reviewText: UK travellers don't think UK travelodge. There are no similarities. This is a sub-standard hotel and there is a holiday inn express opposite. Try there!
review.negativeRemarks: EVERTHING!
review.locationRemarks: Many better hotels

review.title: close to the airport and cheap
review.reviewText: The title explains the only thing this hotel has going for it. There were too many bad things to list about the room itself, I'm glad I was traveling alone because my wife would not have stayed a night there. There were stains on the ceiling, stains on the carpet, the desk had what appeared to be blood on it, the floor of the bathroom was sticky and the wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling off the wall and revealed more staining. I slept in my clothes and was out of there early.
review.positiveRemarks: There was nothing to like about this hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Demolition and rebuild would be the best thing for this property

review.title: refuse to refund
review.reviewText: made a mistake in checkout date during booking. when i need to checkout earlier, they refuse to correct the charges.

review.title: Affordable hotel .  good sleep.
review.reviewText: Slept well on clean sheets. A bit older but for the price. Completely exceptable.
The place is a dump. They charge almost $200 per nite to sleep with  bed bugs. The couches are stained. Curtains are dirty.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.

review.title: Good value when you need to be close to airport
review.reviewText: It's not fancy but when you're on a budget and have an early flight the next morning, the Travelodge is a good spot to stay. With the air conditioner running, we never even heard the planes overhead.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed. Good price, compared to other places nearby. Next door to a 24-hour IHOP. Free wifi was good.
review.negativeRemarks: The shower stall was showing signs of wear and tear but still functioning fine. The sliding bathroom door was very squeaky and stiff.
review.locationRemarks: Ideally close to the airport and a 24-hour IHOP

review.reviewText: Old but clean and safe. I didnt expect a 5 star hotel so it was fine for a last minute reservstion. Freeways are close and restaurants.

review.title: Worst hotel ever!
review.reviewText: It looked nothing like it appeared when I was booking.  There was no water pressure in the shower.  The AC looked liked it was 100 years old. We left it on all day and it still didn't refresh the room. The carpet was old and dirty looking.
review.positiveRemarks: It was coveniently close to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: All the above mentioned problems.

review.title: Not the best but not bad
review.reviewText:
Location was great by the airport less than 10 mins away

Room was average just a little stinch as if somebody flooded the bathroom but cleaned it and was ok 

Not your honeymoon hotel but ok for a guys trip

review.title: Free shuttle from SFO airport
review.reviewText: Good place to stay if you don't want to pay the high prices for lodging in the city.  Clean, comfortable, and quiet room. Perfect if you are going to spent most of your time out and about and just want to sleep when you are at your hotel. There is a pool for those who want to take a swim.
review.positiveRemarks: Free shuttle to hotel from the airport. You can take shuttle back to airport to catch BART to get into the city. IHOP is right next door.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle did not always run on schedule. But shuttle drivers are extremely friendly and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: You are 10 miles from a million things to do in San Francisco.

review.title: Dirty place
review.reviewText: Showers not working, lamps not working, room smells.

review.title: Good hotel around SFO.
review.reviewText: The check in is not bad, but the cleanness needs improved.
spiders on bed and in bathroom.  blanket is old.  does not feel clean or comfortable.

review.title: Bedbug
review.reviewText: I had to check out in the middle of night because I work up with itchiness.  Found two live bedbugs on my bed.  Caught them, put it in a cup and went to the front desk to show and check out.  The worst hotel ever.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: Stay at the nearby hotels that are better.

review.title: Condition
review.reviewText: Being a former Assistant Manager of this Motel, I was shocked at the condition!!!!  The first room they put us in was deplorable!!  Same wallpaper,dirty carpet, and very strong disgusting odor!..Drapes are falling apart,filthy, bathroom dirty and very outdated.  I asked for a upgraded room, it also had drapes that were falling apart and dirty carpet.  The Travel Lodge that I worked with, used to have pride in the  property for clean and well maintained  rooms!!!  At that time, the Corporate Company maintained a very strict level of housekeeping, management and maintenance.  This motel has not kept up the standard that was expected and required for customer satisfaction to encourage return business.
review.positiveRemarks: Morning desk clerks were ones that was there when I was Assistant Manger.  They were very competent in their positions as they always were before.
review.negativeRemarks: Correct every thing that I pointed about above
review.locationRemarks: Location is good, restaurant is high quality  and shuttle service to the airport is very good

review.reviewText:
If you need a place close to the airport, this is it. 

It's clean and relatively quiet (you are near the airport, after all). And it's got that FREE airport shuttle. I picked it up at front door at 4am to catch a 6am flight.  Friendly helpful staff. IHOP next door.
review.locationRemarks: You can take the free airport shuttle to the airport and get on BART to explore the city.

review.title: Not what I expected
review.reviewText:
My parents and I booked two nights here at the Travelodge and we were thoroughly disappointed. The bathroom was dirty dirty. Mold and mildew in the bathtub and the air vent made the ugliest rattle noise (it was not functioning properly). More so, there were stains on the carpet (we all wore shoes while walking around the room). The air conditioning smelled of milder, and the curtains above it were black spotted with mold. The bed was more uncomfortably than the other hotels we've stayed at, however was doable. 

For the price we paid ($120+), the hotel was truly unbelievable. Don't stay here.

review.title: Locks don't work, Air Cond. blocked by curtain
review.reviewText: First room given keys that did not work (rooms in that building right under power lines), then given other room which keys only sometimes would work to unlock door, CRT TV, no fridge, no microwave, light over sink didn't work, shower/tub dripping constantly, Air Conditioner blocked by the curtain (right next to the window),  window would not open so no way to get fresh air unless run the AC (blocked), knocking on door at midnight "maintenance" which we said to go away since its midnight and we did not call for maintenance.  We only wanted that hotel since nothing else available and it had a shuttle to airport.  Will not make that mistake again.  I think we got the last parking spot and not sure what would happen if they had booked all their rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything listed in "write about your experience".
review.locationRemarks: IHOP restaurant and gas station close and mc donalds close drive.

review.title: Good for one night
review.reviewText: Not great, not horrible.  Friendly staff, shuttle to the airport was nice.  Cheap for the area.  Room was okay - comfortable bed, chair and couch could have been cleaner.  Okay for one night, would stay somewhere else if staying longer.
review.negativeRemarks: General cleanliness.
review.locationRemarks: Near SFO

review.title: Crummy dump
review.reviewText: Awful stay, in a noisy, dirty dive.  Not recommended to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.

review.title: Terrible Hotel
review.reviewText:
The first problem was to choose the option in Expedia that doesnt give the rate or hotel (Unpublished Rate Hotel Booking). Do not choose that option!!!!, first they give you some examples of the hotels (La Quinta Inn, Days Inn, etc) and the rate supposed, but you have to pay before you know the final hotel, and you know what, surprise! I received my booking for this hotel. I know La Quinta Inn or Days Inn and they have not the same level! they are much better.

Well, we had to go there and as we supposed (We could not cancel) the hotel was terrible and more!, there were spyders all over mainly in the bathroom and had to kill them daily, first day I went to take a shower and saw that I had my foot dirty and black and it was because the carpet was very very dirty, all my family had to use shoes all the time, outside the door there was waste, plastics and cigars in the floor (they never clean them), and many things more....

Ill never book again this hotel brand and through Expedia......
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Its the only thing good, near the airport.

review.reviewText: WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER BEEN IN IT'S DIRTY,POORLY MAINTAINED,AND NOISY OUTSIDE DUE TO THE TRAFFIC.
rooms smell ugly, TV old style, shower liking water make a noice all night, front desk staff not nice and dont help or cooperate at all. bad faces all time

review.title: well places, but in need of upgrading
review.reviewText: The rooms are not bad, but the bathrooms are in terrible shape. Too bad, the position is good relative to SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathrooms, need urgent upgrades and cleaning.

review.title: Hotel Close to SFO
review.reviewText:
I found the hotel room to be very disappointing. The carpet was threadbare. But I will say that the room was clean. Most of the hotels in this category offer at least a continental breakfast, but this hotel did not even have coffee or a newspaper in the lobby. The entire facility needs to be remodeled + upgraded to command the rates they charge. 
The airport shuttle, shared w/2 other hotels, was efficient + on-time.
review.positiveRemarks: The airport shuttle, shared w/2 other hotels, was efficient + on-tim.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms are old + tired. The carpet in our room was threadbare in spots. The rooms need to be updated. The air-conditioning didn't work very well.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport--the airport shuttle is the reason we booked the hotel. We turned in our rental car before we checked in, so we were limited.

review.title: It was awful!
review.reviewText: We feared our car would be stolen or we would be blocked in by emergency vehicles because something terrible had happened. We also didn't want to walk without shoes on inside the room. Would not recommend.

review.title: Disgusting
review.reviewText: Stay away from this place. Everything about it is dirty. Save your money and sleep in a parkits more affordable and cleaner.
review.negativeRemarks: evetrything

review.title: Time brings change
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel in 2007 for my first visit to San Francisco. It wasn't a 5 star but it was clean, comfortable and maintained. This time was different. The rooms need updating and I won't be staying here again. That's all I'm going to say.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel needs upgrading.

review.title: Expensive for mediocrity
review.reviewText:
When I checked in, evening staff could not help me with room lights not working. 
We  were not reimbursed for pay movie we turned on by mistake even though it was on for less than 10 minutes before we figured out how to stop it
Room linens and bathtub were worn but stil they charged $200 + per night. 
Vendingachinebdid not work and we had to argue before they refunded money

review.title: no no way!
review.reviewText: if the rate was $20 a night I still would not stay here again, we paid $179.00, dirty!
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: good location close to airport

review.title: Decent hotel close to airport but overpriced
review.reviewText: There was dried blood trailed down the stairway at the bottom of the exit. Felt very creepy to see it and couldn't wait to leave the next day.

review.title: Good for overnight if flying in/out of SFO
review.reviewText: Very convenient to SFO with free airport shuttle every 30 minutes.  Room was good for an overnight--a bit noisy since really close to the freeway, but I'd stay again if need be.
review.negativeRemarks: It's fine for what it is--a motel with easy access to and from the airport.
review.locationRemarks: Not much nearby in terms of places to eat/drink but luckily there's a Houlihan's in the Holiday Inn down and across the street.

review.title: Just terrible
review.reviewText: It's literally on the 101 highway. Noise levels were extremely high, the staff was unfriendly, and there were long waiting lines at the counter. Room condition was abysmal (including a leaky shower).

review.title: Clean the room please !
review.reviewText: Outside appearance looks ok but inside the room is no good. No.1 complain is the carpet. The carpet is very3x dirty & soggy (looks like never get cleaned for years) You cant walk in the room barefoot because yr feet will become dirty black. The room smells bad. I think because of the soggy carpet. I try not complaining too much until I  find  2 cockroaches crawling in the side table next to the bed. Then I decide to share review in expedia so no other travelers traped in the same situation. Its really not comfortable !
Old room, old and ugly bathroom, worn out couch, noisy fan. I paid $150.00/night for this dump.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom, shower head, refreshing towels and sheets. Either no couch or cleaner one with no holes.
review.locationRemarks: it's close to the airport but it is not close to the city metro or BART. You have to go back to the Airport by Hotel Shuttle to use the BART.

review.title: A cheap motel but value for money
review.reviewText: Good shuttle service from airport. Easy access to City centre via airport and BART. Staff courteous. Building fairly run down but value for money
review.negativeRemarks: Maintenance
review.locationRemarks: Good access to shops and attractions in San Francisco city

review.title: Disgusting filthy hole.
review.reviewText: Travelodge San Francisco Airport is nothing like Travelodge's in the UK.  My room could not have been closer to the freeway.  The door lock was dodgy and the dead bolt was difficult.  There was no key in the safe.  The net curtains had rips in them and all curtains were filthy.  I doubt they had been washed for several years.  The furniture was old, torn in places, and battered.  The bathroom was usable but I didn't want to put my feet in the shower tray.  I did not get into bed for fear of bed bugs and I did not sleep all night.  I could not leave the room with all my stuff in it as it was not secure.  I wish I had not pre-paid.  I think Expedia should take this hotel off their list.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel needs total refurbishment, including double glazing to quell the freeway noise.
review.locationRemarks: I can't as I could not leave my room until I was going for my flight.

review.title: close to airport
review.reviewText: not good of breakfast, too simple some time the food is not enough
review.positiveRemarks: this is ok hotel for stay over one night
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast
review.locationRemarks: no

review.reviewText: The stay was okay. The hotel is really old and the rooms reflect that. Wall paper is peeling everywhere and carpet looks horrible. The couch inside the room was the most disgusting thing ive ever seen in a room. The bottom of the shower was all corroded and gross as well. Internet did not work AT ALL and the television signal had so much static and would go in and out of reception to a black screen.

review.title: Room smell like sewer
review.reviewText: I will not stay at this hotel again.  As soon as you open the door, the room stink.  It smell like sewer.  The bathroom is very old. The bathtub has black/rusty stain on it.  Not wroth the price I paying for it.
Good hotel wasn't aware of smoking issues so it smelled like cigarettes which was horrible but probably my fault for not saying non smoking room. Aside from that it was not a bad experience

review.title: Subpar
review.reviewText: No mini fridge to keep food from spoiling, only one inadequate ice machine on the far side of the facility. They said they offered breakfast as well but did not. Bathroom reminded me of a hospital.  Just not cozy or comfortable.  Go next door to best Western instead. Checked out a day early...

review.title: High rates for the poor quality.
review.reviewText:
Horrible bathroom and overall very dirty. Bethroom needs immediate renovation. See picture. The drapes, arm chair, walls and window in a unacceptable cleaning condition. We payed $200 per night.  We did not expected a fancy room. All we wanted was a clean room for that value.

We stayed only because we needed a hotel close to the airport and the other ones were either full or over $350 a night.

review.title: Smell like mold
review.reviewText:
Pro: close to airport
Cons: room smells like mold, no refrigerator

review.title: Terrible, Rude Staff, Non-Working AC
review.reviewText: The staff was incredibly rude. The room's AC unit didn't work properly. The bathroom sink made weird noises the entire time. The bathroom floor would randomly get and stay wet near the door (farthest from any water source), and there didn't appear to be a leak. The worst hotel experience I've ever had.
inadequate street signage.  Hotel hard to find from street despite huge sign on expressway rte 101, Sign on south airport road is tiny compared to adjacent properties.
review.negativeRemarks: signage

review.title: Room
review.reviewText: We walked into our room only to find it occupied and we were extremely embarrassed!

review.title: Gross hotel
review.reviewText: This was the worst hotel ever. The AC in the room smelled like moldy old socks. The bathroom should be condemned. We had a late flight and didn't have the energy to do something about it. Go someplace else for sure. This place may actually make you sick.

review.title: Fine hotel to crash in before early SFO flights.
review.reviewText: No frills hotel but reasonably cheap and clean.  Front desk was quick and courteous.  Some rooms looked like they might have lots of noise from the traffic.   Would only use before early morning flights from the airport - not convenient to other things.

review.title: dirty
review.reviewText: The rooms are really dirty. It smell. The over all conditions are just horrible. By pass this hotel

review.title: Had a great stay in the hotel.
review.reviewText: The Hotel was good my family had fun. The only thing was that on the pictures I saw they had microw and fridge and when we got there, our room didn't had non, but I think it was my mistake. But they should have something that say they have rooms different and give the option (with microwave, fridge) or with out any. But overall everything was perfect.

review.title: unfriendly staff and more
review.reviewText:
From the moment we arrived the staff was rude and unfriendly, also seemed to go out of her way to be as least helpful as possible. We had to carry our luggage nearly a fifth of a mile to the next to the farthest away building and use the luggage rack. My family was traveling international so lots of luggage.The key didn't work but there was a maintenance staff wondering around and told us the keys often have to be "jimmied" to work and showed us how to get into the room. I was glad we didn't have to go back to the lobby and interact with the staff.
The room was on the traffic side of the highway. My family smokes so I guess they give the smokers the worst of the worst.
I took my uncle there about 7 years ago and it was better then than now.
It was dank and dingy on top of the rude staff. 
the cost was more than displayed on the on the site. I say for that price find another place.
There was no place within walking distance to shop or eat outside of the IHOP connected with the motel.
The up side was there was a shuttle (one of the main reasons we selected this motel) to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: First, the friendliness of the staff. The locks should ALL be in good working order. They could clean up the place better.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing.... really.

review.title: Cheap motel
review.reviewText: Cheap motel, stay here only if you don't have much to spend.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location close to the airport and next to the highway to San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: I would have liked a refrigerator in the room.

review.title: The cost compared to this hotel was unbelievable.
review.reviewText: Never stay there again, it is dive and the rooms are disgusting

review.title: Not so nice stay before boarding a flight
review.reviewText:
The SFO Travelodge was a pretty awful experience.  Despite it's convenient location near the airport, the cleanliness and condition of the hotel was terrible.  I was concerned about my kids taking a bath and wondered when the last remodel had been done... before or after 1975.  I also didn't appreciate the people milling around the parking lot and smoking late at night outside our door, and again the next morning. 
I'm really surprised that Travelodge would allow one of its properties get this rundown.  I will probably never stay at this hotel chain again based on this experience. There are numerous other chain hotels nearby and I would urge travelers to seek another one.  I am an avid camper and not a "get grossed out" kind of person, but if you want to spend money to stay in a hotel, it should, at the very least, feel safe and clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Location near airport for an early morning flight.
review.negativeRemarks: Tear down and rebuild OR remodel significantly.  Monitor the "guests" or passer-bys in the parking lots.
review.locationRemarks: Less than 1 mile from SFO.

review.title: Only if you're in a bind, and then think about it!
review.reviewText: Absolutely terrible and abusively expensive! I' so surprised that Expedia would even list. No TV, no phone, and filthy dirty outside. If you don't have to stay here, stay somewhere else!

review.title: Unclear status of deposit refund
review.reviewText:
When I checked in I was told that the deposit would be released upon check out or no later than 3 days, but it has been more than 3 days and no deposit refund. My bank told me no refund authorization has been made.

I called several times but no satisfactory answer. One guy hung up my phone after telling me to wait.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.

review.title: AWFUL
review.reviewText: Was very surprised that this facility was a Wyndham property.  So far below standards I cannot comprehend how they passed any inspection.  However, I would say the gentleman at the front desk was excellent and helped me a great deal... but was very disappointed with the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Rennovation?  Deep Clean? Working shower/bath?

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: This hotel room was showing its age.  The bathroom was old and questionable - clean as well as it could be in this condition.  The carpet by the door was pulling up.  The beds were comfortable.  The tv and lights worked.  It was difficult to get on the internet.  The staff was very helpful and pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: Updating the rooms, especially the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: The airport car rental return was directly down the road - easy access.

review.title: nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: my experience is to be in this hotel because it the closes one by the airport!

review.title: Cheaper hotel near the airport
review.reviewText: While the hotel is close to the airport, and one of the cheaper hotels?  I found hairs all through the shower and there was an annoying electric hum all night which disrupted my sleep.

review.title: I lost my jeans!
review.reviewText:
I had to problems with this hotel. 

I stayed in this hotel for 1 day (21-22 June), after checking out i noticed that i forgot my jeans in the room. Next day when i called hotel receptionist and asked them about my jeans they transferred me to housekeeping. They told me that they did not find my jeans :(  

I think the problem would have been that in my jeans i had some cash (around 40$), they just stole it. 

When i told the housekeeping that my jeans was there and they should have found it because i left it there in the room and it couldn't disappear, they said they did not find it.
review.negativeRemarks: Honest housekeeping

review.title: Close to Airport
review.reviewText: Satisfactory overall for the price.  Good location near SFO airport.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and restaurants close by car.

review.reviewText: Very tired when arrived... Had to wait over an hour for shuttle from airport.

review.title: Awful do not come
review.reviewText: Awful I Couldn't shower safely. Very dingy place. Afraid of bed bugs. Most things broken. Lights hardly work. Noisy weird sounds
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing it's hopeless
review.locationRemarks: Nothing except highway noise

review.title: The coffee maker wasn't cleaned out.
review.reviewText: The coffee maker wasn't cleaned out.  !  The coffee maker wasn't cleaned out.
review.userLocation: The coffee maker wasn't cleaned out.

review.title: Depressing
review.reviewText: No frills is one thing but filthy, smelly, drippy, disgusting is another.  How can you charge what you do for this?  There was a desk in the room but no outlets for a laptop.  The shower dripped constantly.  The carpet was sticky.  The wall paper was peeling off and the smell was rancid.  Come on---is this what we've come to with our hotels in America??  I suppose we can say "you get what you pay for" but that isn't true...WAY overpriced...why?  Because you can.  Too bad the standards have sunk so low.
review.negativeRemarks: Tear it down, build a new one and don't make it another over-priced hotel a lot of us can't afford.
review.locationRemarks: I was going to get the shuttle to the airport and catch Bart into the city but even that didn't work.  The shuttle driver simply didn't show up.

review.title: Not the cleanest but the most convenient
review.reviewText: So maybe this hotel isnt the cleanest but it's well worth the stay.. they offer various shuttle service to the airport and to the pier actually pretty much anywhere in SF you wanna go.. The staff is freaking awesome so yes I'll continue to stay at this hotel everytime on a budget vacation to SF

I was very disappointed with my stay here.  My major complaint is I pulled back my blankets and sheets to get into bed and found a piece of a cigar and its wrapping inside of the bed. When I called the front desk to voice my concerns that maybe my sheets had not been changed because of the ideas I had found inside the sheets she was very rude, saying I could check out if I wanted to. I couldnt even get new sheets, so it was a very uncomfortable night. I WILL NEVER STAY AT A TRAVELODGE AGAIN.
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING

review.title: Guess there is a reason why this room was left...
review.reviewText: Carpet was "sticky" wouldn't recommend walking around barefoot! Molding and door frames were rotting, everything is old and front door was not very secure... Felt like the thing would come open with a nudge even when deadbolted.

review.title: OK for a night's sleep after long flight from Asia
review.reviewText: This place was ok for a good night's sleep after a long flight from Asia and before renting a car to drive up the coast.  There was a regular shuttle to and from the airport.  And the IHOP next door was ok for meals.

Checklist based on other reviews:
- Strong smell upon entering room: Check
- Dirty and old carpet: Check
- Aircon only good for blowing at curtain: Check
- Spiders in bathroom, next to bed, bathtub: Check

The reviews are pretty accurate. We got what we expected.

review.title: Cheapest price around the bay area
review.reviewText:
You get what you pay for,
tv from flinstones age
bathtub need to be replaced
beds ok.

review.title: Hotel from hell
review.reviewText: Baaaaaaad.not much more to say about the place,get what you pay for?????
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: You can go play on the freeway if you like ????

review.reviewText:
Our room was extremely noisy,mostly road noise. The bed was uncomfortable,there were no extra blankets and turning the heat up only made the room stuffy.
So we did not get much sleep.

review.title: Decent price for a decent place
review.reviewText: This is probably the fourth time my boyfriend and I have booked our rooms here. The rooms are clean and the staff are not too bad.

review.title: Worst hotel I've stayed in
review.reviewText: Walked in room was 85 degrees and humid and smelly, wallpaper peeling off, bathtub looked like there could have been a murder someone tried to clean up, leaky faucet, tiny pillows on the beds like couch pillows, but thank god I was only there 6 hours to catch my flight the next morning so I survived it.

review.title: Hotel is the worse ever!!!!!
review.reviewText: I wouldn't recommend this place to anybody.  I just needed a place to sleep due to an early flight.  The room smelled like pets and they had no other room available.  When I told them I probably wouldn't stay the staff said to let them know if I leave because they could still rent out!!!!!   Even after I told them the room had pet odor they were still going to rent! The room should have been not rented until properly cleaned which would take days probably.

review.title: Ok for the price. wear socks or flipflops
review.reviewText: If you walk across the carpet from your bed to the shower with bare feet when you get in the shower the bottom of your feet are black with grime. It's really showing it's age too
review.negativeRemarks: clean the carpet

review.title: Hotel iis convenient to airport
review.reviewText: Hotel is near the airport, which seems to be its only benefit.  Upon arrival, another guest was in the process of switching rooms due to bugs.  There was no available parking for those that drive to this hotel.  Was told by office manager that we could park on the street or in nearby lot, but that she could not guarantee that the car would not be towed.  Another guest was in the same situation, they were told that it "would probably be okay if they moved their car by 6:30 am.  The room although decent and clean had no towels.  Furniture was very old and dingy with stains.  The final touch was the phone that continued to ring with no one on the line but a dial tone.  Finally was unplugged to stop after multiple attempts to answer and stop.
review.positiveRemarks: convenient to san francisco airport and easy to get to and find on the airport road, however their are many other hotels nearby with large parking lot
review.negativeRemarks: More parking and clean updated rooms

review.title: Handy to airport
review.reviewText: The only reason to stay would be for the access to SFO

review.title: Bad WiFi connection
review.reviewText: Wished they didn't charge to print our boarding passes. It should be free considering that an extra little convenience goes a long way. Wifi in room kept dropping off and they charge to use the computer in the lobby. Staff was very friendly. Room was clean.

review.title: Close to the airport and affordable price
review.reviewText:
Smelly room and old fashioned style of room.. 
It needs some renovating!!

review.title: Convenient location to airport
review.reviewText: If you are planning on staying one night because you are flying out of SFO in the morning it's fine. Had only a couple towels and when requested more they didn't have any to give us.

review.title: Dirty, Smelly and an overall terrible experience.
review.reviewText: I've stayed in a lot of hotels and this one was by far the worst! The carpet was damp and filthy. I don't think it's ever been shampooed. The beds smells as if the sheets hadn't been changed in weeks. The wifi signal is pretty much non-existent. The walls are paper thin and you can hear literally everything the people next door are doing.

review.title: You get what you pay for.
review.reviewText:
Wanting to save money I stayed at the Travelodge and got what I paid for:
Noisy room next to the freeway
The exhaust fan of the room above  woke me up.
Spiders crawling in the drawers
However, the cleaning staff was great
review.negativeRemarks: Room need repainting and fumigation

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Broken shower heads with weak water pressure. No hair conditioners. Bedside had bad smell.

review.title: good location but not so nice inside
review.reviewText:
its old and needs lots of updates
Sidewalks are all broken and very unsafe
check in the clerk tried to charge me more for the room.
review.negativeRemarks: furniture, pillows,sidewalks (all broken and lifted) accident waiting to happen
review.locationRemarks: good location

review.title: Didn't expect much, got less
review.reviewText: Didn't expect much for the price and location - however, everything in the room was very old and dirty.  I don't mind a cheap hotel, but filthy is too much for me.  Also, very loud - given my experience at check-in, didn't think they would care.

review.title: Why we chose this Motel
review.reviewText:
We have stayed here before when arriving a day early before going on a cruise and found it to be close to the airport where we returned for our transfer from the San Francisco airport to the cruise pier.  And we plan to
stay here again on a future cruise.
review.positiveRemarks: Being close to the San Francisco Airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Even though it sits next to an Ihop restaurant, we felt like if there was some sort of a continental breakfast consisting of some fruit and pastry.
review.locationRemarks: Not really anything close.

review.title: Terrible hotel with high rate
review.reviewText: The room's atmosphere was stale. The washroom tub and toilet are in terrible shape. The rate being charged is too high.
review.negativeRemarks: rooms are in dire need of upgrades for carpet, tub, toilet etc.
review.locationRemarks: It is near the airport. That is the only good thing I can say as it makes it convenient to catch the early morning flights.

review.title: not what I expected
review.reviewText: I booked two rooms and one was given away despite informing them that my daughter would be arriving after 10:30 pm. This was not acceptable especially because it was a busy weekend during graduations and Memorial Day weekend. She had to find lodging elsewhere at an exuberant price. They offered a smoking room but made no other amends. Hotel staff's English was difficult to understand. We had no towels the second day and it took them over an hour to bring them. The room was stuffy and smelled like urine. It is an old hotel and in needs of repairs.

review.title: Needs remodel or demolition
review.reviewText: Not dirty but old and worn.  Felt like I was in skid row,
review.negativeRemarks: Tear down and start over
review.locationRemarks: airplanes are loud

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText:
Not worth a 2 star rating 
Carpet very badly soiled and bathroom in poor condition with stains n rusty, ceiling n floor tiles need fixing. Little or no amenities. Just have 1 hand soap n 1 bath soap n 1 little bottle of shampoo. 
No breakfast n the free wifi is so slow that it is useless.

review.title: Great price for one nite before early morn flight
review.reviewText: Good customer service, good bed, didn't have to get up at o'dark hundred to catch my flight!

review.title: All night party
review.reviewText: We had a group of 10 or so young people having a party outside our room until 7 am. At 3 am we asked them to stop and at 4 called the front desk. They said they would take care of it but didn't.

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: The beds were comfortable.  The rooms were clean but water damage and chipped paint were everywhere.  Shower was great.   The room next door was occupied by several people causing terrible noise.  Finally at 4 am the police arrived.   The hotel should have given us a credit for one lost night of sleep as they did not solve the noise problem.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to airport and freeway.  Also, a restaurant was attached.
review.negativeRemarks: Paint and repairs to damage.

review.title: Airport Hotel, and Getting Around.
review.reviewText: Our experience wasn't bad. We had a restaurant very close by, and gas station. We were close to a public transportation pickup, so we didn't need to really use our rental car. The hotel shuttle could pick us up to bring us downtown to Fisherman's wharf, but it could be costly, if using it everyday. We had to wait over an hr. after we called for a pickup, back to the hotel. Public parking was expensive, so that's why we looked in to cheaper ways of getting around. Grayline busing picked up at hotels for day tours, which worked out very well for our last few days there.
review.positiveRemarks: The price was affordable. It was clean. The bed was very comfortable. Our housekeeper did a very good job.
review.negativeRemarks: It could use a couple of vending machines in the laundry room for detergent, and getting change.
review.locationRemarks: We picked the location mainly because of it being close to the airport, and wouldn't have to worry about traffic, getting to the hotel, and back.

review.reviewText: Takes about 30 minutes to get to downtown San Francisco. We wanted to stay closer but none of the hotels had rooms with their own bathroom for what we paid at Travelodge. BART is nearby as an alternative to driving. The double queen room was spacious but a little dirty, which is about what I expected for the price. Overall positive experience.

review.title: Good choice for stopover
review.reviewText: Compared to others of San Francisco, it has quite clean and nice facilities and still not expensive!

review.title: Ok hotel, close to airport and Bart
review.reviewText: Good hotel for the price.  Right next door to an IHOP.  Every hour or so a large jet would fly over and will wake you up in the middle of the night.  Wifi was advertised but we were lucky if we could connect at all, most of the time would disconnect during the evening.  Hotel staff was friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff and an IHOP right next door.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi needs improvement.
review.locationRemarks: Airport shuttle is handy for airport (duh!) and the Bart station at the airport.

review.title: Not the cleanest hotel and the rooms were old
review.reviewText: Convenient location but the hotel is old. There were a lot of youngsters having a party until 2.30am on Friday night. The police were on site earlier but the party continued after the police left.

review.title: This was,Hands Down, the worse,DIRTIEST,hotel
review.reviewText: I will NEVER USE YOUR WEBSITE AGAIN. YOUR INFORMATION REGARDING THIS HOTEL IS TOTALLY NOT CORRECT !!!  Check out room 608 and you will see. I have traveled for 47+ years for work and have never stayed in such a dirty room.: the furniture and carpet badly stained. even the bedspread and sheets had stains on them! the loose plastic base board in the bathroom had mold showing behind it. The towels were old and dingy. As soon as I opened the door, the smell was unbearable. It was a non smoking room, however the smoking rooms were above and on the sides in the same building. Even after keeping the door ajar to air out it still reeked of dirtiness. I checked in about 6 p.m.and checked out that same evening at 9 p.m.
review.negativeRemarks: everything

review.title: awful hotel
review.reviewText:
Holes in wall, stains on carpet, door didn't shut properly, mold on skirt around bed, mold around bathtub was loose 
Door to bathroom would not slide open or shut
Rust around bathroom light,
Vent screen falling off
Very outdated
The only good thing is close to the airport and provides shuttle service to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: everything.

review.title: Terrible motel
review.reviewText: The room was in very very poor condition. The carpet had burn marks, not tacked down, the walls were rotten in the bathroom. The pocket door was broken and didnt shut all the way and lock was broken. The chairs were dirty and had stains.
review.negativeRemarks: The whole building. The place should be bulldozed.
review.locationRemarks: Airport

review.title: Cheap motel
review.reviewText: This is definitely you get what you pay for situation. We just needed a cheap motel to stay the night. The wallpaper was off the wall in the bathroom. The carpet looked dirty. The walls of the shower were messed up. The baseboards were coming away from the walls. Hardly any parking. The staff was not even friendly. We asked for more towels and we never got them. The only positive I can say is the beds were somewhat comfortable.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: When we booked you dont have. Anything that is listed as handicap. I am  handicap. Upon arrival  i asked for handicap and was given a handicap  room. The room was clean and comfortable. It was a pleasant stay.

review.title: Tolerable and efficient
review.reviewText: Room was clean although maintained like something that should have been majorly remodeled a couple times. Patches for repairs evident everywhere. Some outlets don't work. Staff was friendly and pleasant. We stay there when we fly out of SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: See above comment

review.title: Not a good hotel
review.reviewText: Mold in the coffe maker cockroach in one of thr pictures had to kill it and they never came to clean it up. Got woken up 1am by someone trying to get it cause they tried to rent our room to some one else. Windoe wouldn't stay closed. The beds were not comfortable and the water pressure sucked. No key for the safe and carpets were filthy.

review.title: Adequate hotel at a decent price
review.reviewText: This hotel was close to where I needed to be, and the price was very reasonable.  Access to many places in the region was quick and easy.  There was some wear showing in the carpet, and the ceiling had some loose material.  The bed was comfortable. The shower was good, one of the few I have seen that dispensed hot water quickly with no long warm up period.  It's a busy hotel, and parking was sometimes tight, depending on the time I was leaving or returning.  It was relatively quiet, although occasionally I could hear activity in adjacent rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Replace the carpet and scrape the material off the ceiling and repaint it.
review.locationRemarks: SFO airport is right there, and there are many eateries within a short drive.  Downtown South San Francisco was close, also with many amenities.

review.reviewText: It's pretty cheap and pretty cool. It's not so far from downtown San Framsisco and its so much cheaper than the hotels there

review.title: Layover
review.reviewText: I had a 10 hour lay over, and needed a decent place to stay for the night to get some sleep before my next flight in the AM. The shuttle service was great and got me to and from the hotel with no hassle, very quick 5 min drive. The room was clean and perfect for a no frills stay. I'd recommend this hotel.

review.title: Travelodge by SFO
review.reviewText:
Unfriendly and unhelpful staff at check-in
With a room pre-paid they still charge my credit card $ 100.00 for "incidentals" even though there is no fridge in the room and no snacks.
The room was spacious, but it was probably last updated in the '60s
The impression is that whatever maintenance is needed, it is done on the cheap.
The carpet is dark and sticky, with some large dark spots
review.positiveRemarks: The only thing it has going for it is its proximity to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: Start by changing the check-in staff, then the management
review.locationRemarks:
Not much to do nearby, besides going to the airport
Other than that it is a very run down and disappointing facility

review.reviewText: Staff is good, location very close to airport,  rooms smell bad and looks in pretty bad shape

review.title: At least it has a bed
review.reviewText:
I'll admit this experience may be a bit colored by the struggle it took to get there but I'll try to give an honest review removed from the things that weren't directly the hotels responsibility. 
First I will say that I am not disappointed in what I got for what I paid. However I would say that the room could've been in better shape. Also, I tried repeatedly to contact the hotel by phone, but wasn't successful. The hotel as a whole deserves the rating it gets but it also provides the service and function you are looking for if you are looking at this level of accommodations. My only true gripe is that I did not get the type of room I requested, two queens as opposed to the king bed, but I doubt that would've made a significant difference in my experience. The real issue, and perhaps warning sign, is that on checkin they assumed I had reserved the queens. It also surprised me that they have smoking rooms. 
Aside from the fact that we had to walk across the property to our room and it was raining and there is little shelter between the lobby and the last building on the property, I have little to truly complain about. It is a cheap accommodation close to the airport and with easy access to the city by car, however that is the key, you will want a car. It is also close to South San Francisco where dinning options are available. 
So, if you're looking for cheap and at most a place to sleep between outings then at a price below $100 a night you really can consider the Travelodge

review.title: A little old but great price.
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Free parking and convenient to the airport. Not the best looking hotel but it was neat. Bathroom a little outdated and needs upgrading

review.title: Tolerable for one night
review.reviewText: Rooms are a bit shabby. They only had smoking rooms and it reeked of spent smoke very badly. They did move me to another smoking room which was better but still smelled.
review.positiveRemarks: Inexpensive and you get what you pay for
review.negativeRemarks: Update the rooms, especially the bathrooms.

review.title: A dump masquerading as a motel
review.reviewText:
Property dates from '50s or '60s and really shows its age. Not much other than minimal care to keep things together. Rotted out baseboards, heavy supplmenental silicone seal around tub, fading wall treatment and window frames all testify to age and non-maintenance.

When we discovered that the wi-fi had gone out we also found we could not telephone the front desk because the bedside phone did not work. Visiting the desk in person and presenting the problems, the clerk replied, 'So what do you want me to do? I'm just here to survive the night.'

Enough said. Take it if you can't find anything else, it will do, one supposes. We slept, not really well, but just enough to press on with the errands that had brought us to the Bay Area.
review.positiveRemarks: Not much. The place provided the bare minimum of accommodation. Noise damping was good, considering location next to 101 and SFO's takeoff pattern.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk clerk to learn manners and management to equip him with means to fix non-functional Wi-Fi and room phone, for starters.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to SFO. Half-hour drive into San Francisco.

review.reviewText: Was able to check in early. Convenient complimentary shuttle to airport takes 20mins.
wifi didn't work, no lotion or hair conditioner, no shower door and water leaked into bedroom floor.

review.title: Business
review.reviewText: Ok, but needs to be renovated to the 21st century?
review.negativeRemarks: Renovate!
review.locationRemarks: Airport

review.title: Only for a cheap stay close to the airport
review.reviewText: Unfortunately it wasn't the best stay (taking into account the low price) - the room was spacious (regular room, king size bed), however although the room was clean on the face of it - it felt dirty (for example we felt uncomfortable walking bare foot on the carpet and in the shower..). In addition, there is no breakfast but there is a shuttle to the airport. To sum it up - we wouldn't recommend it other than for a one night cheap stay before flying.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport

review.title: Cheap!
review.reviewText: It is a cheap hotel and u get What you pay for so it worked gpost for us for a few nights. Conveniently right off the highway.

review.title: Unprofessional
review.reviewText:
Booked this hotel since I had an overnight layover. When I arrived at the hotel I was told my reservation was canceled and I should call Expedia. 
Expedia said my reservation wasn't canceled and they called the hotel to confirm. The hotel told them that they were overbooked and since I arrived late they canceled my reservation. 
After standing in the lobby looking for another hotel for about 15 minutes, the front desk person asked if I found anything yet. I said no, so she offered to cancel someone elses reservation since they haven't arrived yet.

review.title: So baddddddx
review.reviewText:
Dirty nasty, I feel DIRTY. 
We were a group. 
We had few rooms. 
The rooms were so dirty smelly and nasty that we did not touch anything. 
Also the airplanes and the cars noise were terrible. 
So old and Nasty. 
I slept 2 hours at the most.

review.title: For 1 night okay.
review.reviewText: I've seen some Travelodges much better than this one. It's old and in the bathroom was mold.

review.title: Travelodge SFO area.
review.reviewText: We stayed for eight nights.  Our only problems were parking near our room and poor lighting  due to bulbs not being replaced. The rooms were clean and the space met our requirements for our stay. We liked the convenience to the airport.  The Internet pricing for the room was also very good compared to other hotels/motels in the area. We like IHOP,which is on the property,  and enjoyed our breakfasts there three times during our stay.  There is a See's Candy Outlet a quarter of a mile from the motel; and buying candy there rather than at the airport saved us a lot of money.  The place is near to entrances to 280 & 101,which made it easier for our site seeing and relative visits.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to airport  and very reasonable on line pricing.  They have an IHOP restaurant on the site.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking and lighting in parking areas.  Parking is sometimes very hard to find especially if you have a room in the pool area or done on the second f
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is very convenient for travelers who want to stay not far from SFO Airport.  They have a See's Candy Outlet Shop just  a quarter of a mile;

review.reviewText: The hotel staff were rude and not accommodating at all. When we got in it was pretty late and cold. When entering the room it smell like toilet water and our heater didn't work so needless to say it was a pretty cold night. Also parking condition were horrible. Definitely wouldn't recommend staying here.

review.title: Highway hotel
review.reviewText: If you like a room by highway with jets flying overhead; rooms that reek of smoke: broken shower heads, no lights that work because perhaps the bulbs are burned out....this is the perfect place for you. Very noisy, horribly smelly from smoke,  and showers that you cannot get clean at because the broken fixture sprays most of the water away from you.

was totally surprised when asked for $100 cash deposit before we could check in even through room was prepaid.  Person was rude did not give explanation of why the cash deposit was needed just kept saying had to have deposit, didn,t matter if room was prepaid or not!

review.title: You got what you  paid for!
review.reviewText: Paying under a $100 for a motel room in the Bay area you certainly will get a dump such as we  got.  Starting from a extreme unfriendly check-in personal to a dirty, damp smelling room.  The room was in poor condition ( patched up cracks in the walls, around the bathtub, door jambs and front door). We had a room on the second floor which had water puddles right at the front entrance, so we had to take a big step into the room to keep our feet try. The cool air fan was extremely loud and could not be used during the night, so we chose to sweat during our sleep instead.  All together an extremely unpleasant stay.  Needless to say, our future motel stays will not include Travellodge anymore.
review.negativeRemarks: Built a new hotel in it's place
review.locationRemarks: Location was OK. Restaurants, Car rentals, and the airport are very close.

review.title: Not bad for $50/night
review.reviewText: The room was old and grungy-looking, but it was surprisingly clean. No mold in the bathtub and clean toilet. The room has a safe, which put me at ease leaving my room with thousands of dollars of camera gear.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: The hotel is located close to the airport and a 24 hour iHop (which is ideal for travellers who are jetlagged). If you want to go to the city centre by public transport, you need to go to the airport and then take the BART, which is time consuming and expensive. Ideal for proximity to airport but not if you want to be close to town.

review.title: This is a very gross hotel. Cheap though
review.reviewText: Disgusting cleanliness, but its cheap and close to the airport. I wouldnt stay there for more than one night, and definatly not if I was with my partner.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport

review.reviewText: The room was  shabbby and worn. It needs renovation.
review.positiveRemarks: I thought the shuttle service was good

review.reviewText: The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, the parking was immediate, the staff was friendly. Just fine for a basic hotel.

review.title: I wish I knew what I know now
review.reviewText:
Unfortunately, I might have had one of the noisiest rooms on the Travel Lodge campus.
I think my head was directly over the freeway.
I now know never to have a corner room over a freeway and probably never stay in a hotel or motel that is accessed from the outside (compared to entering a hotel and taking an elevator and being inside of a structure),  where the space is WAY more insulated from outside noise.
Once I realized that the noise was louder than the ear plugs and the pillow over my head, I called the front desk who never answered their phone. I was neither able to request a "wake up" call or a change of rooms. I tried twice. No luck.
I never slept before my 6:30 am. plane. When I mentioned my situation in the morning to our desk attendant at the reception, he could only tell me that airline stewardesses requested that room, as if he couldn't make me more wrong for my experience. Oh well, live, spend $$ and learn.
review.positiveRemarks: They had hot water. They offered park and fly which was important for me. They had an airport shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: Someone from the front desk might have answered my phone...
review.locationRemarks: Airport to fly out of town!

review.title: We won't ever book here again
review.reviewText: We arrived close to midnight. We had to walk to the farthest building with 2 suitcases each, no internal transportation. The phone in the room didn't work. We couldn't call out nor get a wake up call. The furniture was decrepit and the plumbing made horrible noises. Spiders fell from the ceiling.
review.negativeRemarks: Burn the place down and rebuild.

review.reviewText: The room was non smoking however it smelt horrible stuffy and smokey. Will not be staying at a Travelodge again.

review.title: Wouldn't stay here again.
review.reviewText: The clerk at check in was rude. The rest of the staff that I encountered were very friendly. The room was disgusting. I was almost afraid to use the shower. However, the price was good and hotel was easy to find.

review.title: Don't come here
review.reviewText: No refrigerator WiFi wouldn't connect, shower wouldn't operate,old,fuzzy and old tv,however 1st night only  $73., then offered 2nd night for  $237.!!, and this is a Wyndham property? ..try Ramada in San Bruno. .like going from hell to heaven,and only 91$ through Expedia. .

Been staying at this hotel like every weekend and i dont have a problem with it because its cheap but they have been charging me $100 extra like 3 weeks ago and now another $150 for i dont know reason. Would be the last time ill be staying here

review.title: Great for parking and travel to SFO airport
review.reviewText: The room & bathroom needs maintenance....floors, shower, etc.

review.title: AVOID TRAVELLODGE SOUTH SAN FRANCISCO !
review.reviewText:
Room directly facing Freeway with only chain link (very noisy), No non smoking room available, WiFi
sporadic On/Off.   The Place is extremely run down, Carpet looks like 50+ years old, dirty, ripped, worn out, Room smell terrible, Paint peeling off the wall, Rotten Wood board in the Bathroom, Filthy Bed Cover with burn Cigarette marks,  Chair missing one leg (fabric hanging).   Owner / Management seems to cheap to
invest on the hotel upkeep.

Acceptable, but there hasn't been any  upkeep on the place in a zillion years. Painted over tile in the shower??
and Caulking galore at the seems in the shower!!

review.title: Location was convenient.
review.reviewText: It located only 10 minutes driving to  SFO airport.

review.title: strange "hotel"
review.reviewText: This strange collection of spread out buildings must have served some other function in the past. We came in late after a long flight and had an early morning departure. The shuttle comes at set times, and it must have left a minute or two before its set time as we ended up having to take a taxi. The bright sign on the first building right beside the freeway was our first indication we were in for a bizarre experience. It's right next to the freeway and there are several old buildings stretched about a 10 minute walk apart. Of course the shuttle drops you off at the first building which is the office - not centrally located so that if you're as unlucky as us to be placed in one of the furthest buildings, you're in for a walk with your luggage. The room was old and really run down, especially the bathroom. The beds were okay but that was about it. Smelled musty, but at least the air conditioner worked (while loud). Staff were okay. Can's say much good about it, but we didn't catch anything, so that's good.
review.negativeRemarks: everything.

review.title: Smelly hotel, great view of the highway.
review.reviewText: I guess you get what you pay for. This was the cheapest option, and probably the poorest quality. It is super close to the airport though. I was needing a room just for the night before a really early flight. It served is purpose and had a free shuttle to the airport starting at 4am. The room smelled like cigarettes and was loud from the highway noise. All in all I would probably do it again...

review.title: Never stay there again.
review.reviewText: We were picked up at the airport by the shuttle that was 45 min. late. The driver of the shuttle demanded a tip before handing over the luggage. The hotel is in need of a complete redoing, floors were dirty, furniture was dirty. The beds were clean and comfortable. I would not recommend the hotel to anyone.
review.positiveRemarks: pool area was nice, we did not use it
review.negativeRemarks: tear it down
review.locationRemarks: there was a IHOP attached, they had great food

review.title: Great last minute stay.
review.reviewText: The guy at the front desk was very nice and friendly and understanding they ask for a $100 safety deposit and you'll get it back when checking out I only had $60 on me and he took it and let me stay the night!

review.title: No fair warning  !!!!
review.reviewText: It would've been nice to know that a $100 deposit is required !!!!

The staff was so rude, our room smelt old and like bug spray, our shower made loud noises and when I told staff they acted like they didn't care. we didn't have a refrigerator or stove like it was advertised.overall this from Stockton we will never stay here again. just wasted our money

review.title: Convenient to the airport
review.reviewText: The rooms were clean and staff were nice. The free shuttle to the airport was a great service. The Internet connection was spotty and unreliable and was my only complaint.

review.title: This hotel is really close to SFO airport.
review.reviewText: Be advised, this hotel is really old! You get what you paid for. It needs an upgrade.
My keys didn't work most of the time and they didn't serve breakfast like the website promised. Rooms were dingy

review.title: Needs to be updated
review.reviewText: Rude staff. Charged a $100 incidental fee for a already garbage motel. Carpet was stained & worn. Bathroom was filthy. Tube TV. Heard everything from planes, freeway & people in other rooms. Will never go back again.

review.title: Close to SFO with free Shuttle.
review.reviewText:
Excellent staff. Check in & out smooth, quick & professionally accommodating. Not the newest but clean, helpful staff. On lacking Refrig & microwave. IHOP next door; also free delivery from Pront, a pizza & Italian menu. Excellent service & food. 
Recommend Travelodge for comfort, price, convenience, Shuttle service & Staff & clean.

review.title: felt like i should pay by the hour
review.reviewText: no wifi. didnt work. no continental breakfast like advertised in 2015 aaa travel book. looked like 80s style room. no refrigerator. no microwave. most of staff at front desk just wanted to move you along. all quantity no quality
review.negativeRemarks: most everything
review.locationRemarks: location was fine to get back and forth from the airport

review.title: avoid at all costs - not worth the small savings
review.reviewText: I had to get an airport hotel in a hurry as I had made a mistake with my original reservation somewhere else. This 'offer' was the cheapest option and the free wifi and free transport to airport convinced me. However, when I arrived I found the place to be a dump, staff miserable, unhelpful and rude and facilities really terrible. The wifi was down, apparently permanently. I doubt I would have got wifi anyway, since I had an offer they sent me to the building furthest away from reception. It took me about 30 mins to find my room. I was carrying two heavy bags. I did say to them that I had a back problem and no car that day (I had to get a taxi there from town). They didn't care. The room itself was cleanish but so old-fashioned it looked like a 1960s film set (for a horror movie). My whole body is itching as I write this review. The saving is not worth it. Avoid at all costs!
review.negativeRemarks: everything: facilities should be updated as a matter of priority. Staff should be trained to be nicer. Wifi should be fixed or removed from hotel info
review.locationRemarks: this place is a dump. Avoid.

review.title: Very out dated
review.reviewText: Wall paper was falling off the wall.The tub had all the enamel falling off.The TV was very small and very old.They said there was wifi and it worked for the first day we were there and didn't work after that.All the caulking around the tub was falling of an what was there was molding.

review.title: It's ok for the price
review.reviewText: The room was serviceable.  It was clean but not really.  There was a lot of dirty buildup on the top of the tiles around the shower.  The internet was down and the remote control for the VERY old TV (old, small and not really clear) would only work if you stood or sat directly in front of the TV.  If you sat on the bed with your back to the headboard, nope, would not work.  So that was useless.  But pretty low price and for that price, it was fine.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel and that it was close to the airport.  It was quiet, too.
review.negativeRemarks: INternet, TV, clean the rooms,

review.title: Changed for the worst
review.reviewText: Stayed there many times before but never again!  Screwed up my reservation again. No longer have continental breakfast. Still charged deposit for amenities and there aren't any!!  When I walked around barefoot in the room my feet got dirty!  Vendmachine outside took my change and front desk would not refund it.  Maid staff wonderful and helpful Not ever Again! !!

review.title: Well priced hotel for longer stay.
review.reviewText: There were a couple nights of alot of noise. Your hotel staff handled the problem and the rest of my stay was peaceful. Love that ihop was so close. Over all a good experience.

I was suppose to have a non-smoking room, when I entered the room it smelled like smoke, found ashtrays, bed covering had holes burnt in it. the room did not look clean at all. the outside was littered with trash.

review.title: Only stay here if you're desperate
review.reviewText: Picked this hotel for one night because I was arriving in town late and close proximity to the airport. This was one of the worse hotels I've ever stayed. Run down condition, mold around the tub which was painted over, threadbare towels, dirty, stained sheets and bed spread and to top it off , customer service was poor. Only stay at this establishment if you have no other options.  What ever they charge is too much.
Close to airport, price is good, but only good fo live couple days

Dirty.  Gave me a smoking room when I asked for non-smoking.  Called the front desk to make a change.  No answer.  Called 3 times with no answer.  Finally got someone who said to bring my stuff back to lobby and they would switch me to non-smoking.  Made the trek back and they said there were no non-smoking rooms available - sorry.  I spoke to several people and one looked in the computer and said - there are 3 available, so it was resolved but there was too much work and drama.
None. Everything was good. Will recommend to all friends.

review.title: Great airport location but poor front desk
review.reviewText: This was the second time I have stayed at this hotel (prepaid through Expedia) and they couldn't find my reservation for 30 minutes.  Very frustrating check-in process.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are out dated

review.reviewText: Terrible terrible terrible terrible experience--dirty and smell like after cats or dogs. I would never ever stay their again.
MY EXPERIENCE WAS VERY ENJOYING AND RELAXING I ONLY STAYED OVER NIGHT. THE FRONT DESK GENTLEMEN WAS VERY PLEASANT THAT EVENING.AND THE RATE WAS VERY REASONABLE.

review.title: Never again!!
review.reviewText: This place was horrible. Out dated, the place was gross. Hairdryer blew up and shot sparks, shower handle broke off, staff never answered the phone for help, carpet had stains, walls were covered with stains. Plain and simple very dirty. I will NEVER be back.

review.title: Find a better low cost option
review.reviewText: Dirty room...no pillow cases...blood on the curtain.

review.title: Typical roach motel
review.reviewText: Sufficient for short stays to catch an early flight. Ihop is just next door.

review.title: Puddle in room
review.reviewText: There is was a puddle in the middle of the room. I called reported to have the leak fixed but was not fixed.  The location is nice but there coffee maker was broken and the carpets were wet.
Practical , need upgrading special the carpets, overall a good deal for the rates offered

review.title: Okay for a cheap hotel
review.reviewText: Cleanliness in the room only was excellent.  Very dirty and unkept outside but the cleanliness in the room was most important to me. The cleaning staff was excellent, friendly and courteous!!! Front desk was very nice.
Better for driving travelers. Quite a bit walking distance to some rooms.

We booked two double beds for 2 adults and 2 children on Expedia. When we got there at mid night, we just got one Queen bed. We asked the clerk to change to two beds or add a roll away bed, the clerk refused to do it. I called Expedia, and the customer service was not friendly, he said " take the room as it or cancel the reservation". How we can find another hotel at mid night?

review.title: Needs some cleaning
review.reviewText: Im glad it was only a 5 hour stay due to a flight delay

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText:
The front desk is so bad. They treat you unprofessional. The guy (front desk) is very very rude. He doesn't care about customer service.
They have 0 customer service.

review.title: Ok for the price
review.reviewText: Everything was ok except for mildew in the bathroom and the carpet needed a major cleaning

review.title: So noisy next to an interstate highway....
review.reviewText: I could not sleep properly due to the noise. Maybe I just got what I paid....but I will not stay here next time.

I don't like to complain but this hotel was a major surprise and dissapointment. The room smelled so I changed to another one which was a minor improvement. The furniture were very old and dilapidated. Also hair in the shower room. Paying $86.50 a night you expect something more liveable.

Affordable alternative to nearby expensive hotels.  I did not need costly amenities as I spent very little time actually in the hotel room.  Clean enough, comfortable and conveniently located near SFO.

review.title: Close to the Airport
review.reviewText: If one only wants to have a place to sleep, okay.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport and the availability of frequent shuttle services.
review.negativeRemarks: The leaking shower head making the bathroom area wet and slippery.  The cleaning staff should have noticed this and informed the management to fix it.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing - except the IHOP restaurant.

review.title: It's a dump! Terrible place.
review.reviewText: Worst experience in a hotel ever. This place is a hole! Should have just slept in our car it was much cleaner And probably just as comfortable. The place smells, the floor is uneven and slanted, the bath tub was in diplorable condition with mild around it which they tried covering with caulking, paint peeling in the tub, the drain plug to the tub was put rusty, we found black hair in our bed. The one that took the cake for me was I booked this hotel back in September 2014. I called on a couple of occasions to confirm my booking and had allmy documentation via email as proof of my booking.  I ended up calling the hotel 3 days before we were arriving there to confirm again and they said they had no record of my reservation. I went and gave them my reservation number and they said oh your reservation was cancelled! When I asked why they said due to bad weather. I told them I never cancelled it and if bad weather was the case how is that even possible when I called them February 8th, 2015 and wasn't checking in until 3 days later Feb 11th!!! How could they even know what the weather was in 3 days? It was beautiful outside! Anyway they reinstated my booking by the way which I paid for back in September already yet I found it funny if they cancelled my reservation why was my money never refunded to my credit card? I would never go here again or recommend this place to anyone. Stay elsewhere or sleep in your car you will be glad you did.

review.title: Terrible
review.reviewText: Filthy room, rude staff, Unsafe property. There was black mold in the bathroom and indescribable crud in the corners of the shower. The carpet was kind of moist and sticky throughout. The older in the whole room reminded me of a dirty fish tank.
Front Desk folks were not too helpful.  The first room had a window that wouldn't open and had mold above the window frame.

review.title: Good for just traveling mostly, not really staying
review.reviewText: The hotel definitely has friendly staff and cleaning ladies, but upon arrival to my room the curtains were torn, the couch had a few holes in it, and under the couch cushion there was a lot of crumbs and whatever else (I don't want to know). The bathroom had NO doorknob at all, not sure about the other ones, but it was quite a disaster. This hotel is good for staying at to sleep for the night and stuff but definitely not comfortable enough to actually stay there for long periods of time.
review.positiveRemarks:
Staff Friendliness
Free airport shuttle to SFO airport and back
review.negativeRemarks: Fixing the rooms way better.
review.locationRemarks: nothing to do nearby, you have to take the shuttle to the air port and then take the bart system to somewhere fun (like Japan town) or Union Square

review.title: Hotel'practically close to food, gas and airport.
review.reviewText:
Warm welcome. Room just OK, bathroom awful. Paper off wall, unclean look also in shower.
Badly in need of re-vamp. Noise of traffic on highway was disturbing for sleeping.
review.positiveRemarks: The welcome at reception and practical situation.
review.negativeRemarks: Spend some money on it.
review.locationRemarks: Well situated forme erything

review.title: Close to Airport but in poor condition
review.reviewText: This hotel is Travel Lodge's largest hotel and does not speak well of it's name.  The physical plant, both outside and inside the rooms is in terrible need of renewal.  Carpets have wrinkles, TV reception is poor, but you'll only know that after having an engineer come and make the remote work, the showers need new tiles and the carpets have wrinkles.  I could go on about the furniture, electrical sockets that can't hold a plug, etc., etc. but I think you get the picture.
review.positiveRemarks: Not much.  The two positives are that it is close to the SFO airport and that the price is reasonable (although high for what they are providing)
review.negativeRemarks: Everything, including staff who don't answer the phone when you need a wake up call.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco is close by and the San Francisco Airport is closer.  Napa is about an hour and 15 minutes.

review.title: Price wise good hotel close to SFO. Airport
review.reviewText:
Uneventful,  due to severe rainstorm that continued the entire day  there was little to do except
Stay indoors  and. Nap or. Watch.  TV.
review.positiveRemarks: A nice setting. In a convenient location to the airport.

review.reviewText: The hotel room could be much better for cleanliness and furniture
Nice and easy, but there is still some things to work.

review.title: Worst Place I have stayed in 30+ years
