review.reviewText: Dirty, broken down, lights and plugs did not work....no parking HORRIBLE place to stay
review.negativeRemarks: Tear it down and use the land for a new hotel
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

review.title: Travel for business - items stolen from room.
review.reviewText:
I was travelling for business that ran long so I needed to stay an extra day.  I informed the front desk about this, payed for another day and grabbed my carry on case as it had my tools in it.  I left all my bathing items in the bathroom.  When I returned that evening, I found the room cleaned and all my items gone.  Upon going down to the front desk to complain, the manager told me, "the maid probably threw them away when she cleaned".  No offer to replace them, nothing.  

I will NOT stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: New employees.

review.title: Needs Updating
review.reviewText: This hotel could use a little bit of love. It was pretty fun down on the outside and even though the room was a bit nicer than the outside, I kept waiting for the devastating detail that made me hate the room. Lucky, that never came. On the plus side, the people who worked there were very friendly and helpful and there was a 24 hour IHOP attached!

review.title: There was dead fly's near the bath room sink
review.reviewText: I booked a non smoking room and when I got there they gave me a smoking room there excuse was they over booked was disappointed won't go back sorry first impression means a lot to me

review.title: Avoid this place if possible!
review.reviewText:
The hotel sits right next to the freeway, and the airport take-off path.  Very noisy all night from the freeway, and airplanes were loud until about midnight.  
The worst was the internet in this hotel... Is was slow slow that I was usually unable to connect, and when I did, it wasn't usable because it was so slow...  I typed an email and hit send.... took a shower, then came back, it was still sending!!  
Not worth the low cost!!
review.positiveRemarks: Location was convenient, close to the freeway.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet!!!!!  Also the entire place is in need of a remodel.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown South SF has some nice restaurants... Close to Genentech campus.

review.title: Bed Bugs!!
review.reviewText: Room smelled very musty and old. Tile old and peeling up off floor in bathroom. Wallpaper in bathroom peeling off wall. And the worst of all visible BED BUGS!!! My husband and I left immediately. Tried to get my money refunded and the owner was rude and irate and said there will not be a refund. DON'T STAY THERE!!!

review.title: Close to the airport but location was scary
review.reviewText: I didn't like how all buildings were separated. I was so uncomfortable and unsafe. I was in building 4, but luckily I was able to be moved to building 1 which was closer to the lobby. I felt little safer. Thanks to the front desk guy. I wish I took his name down because he was really compassionate about my stay. He was the young gentleman pacific islander.

review.title: Theft in our room
review.reviewText:
Hotel cleaning staff took our i phone charger. we left it out unintentionally and it was missing when we returned
Front desk says they questioned the person cleaning the room that day. It was denied. 
We leave a tip every day and did so even after the missing item

the day after the "theft" the tip was not taken.,but subsequent days it was .

Sorryu that this had to happen .we have stayed here before with no problem

review.title: hotel near sfo
review.reviewText: the worst part was the cheap perfume smell  (and possibly insecticides), plus the constant noise fromthe freeway and the airport
review.negativeRemarks: just about everything
review.locationRemarks: near a Mcdonald's and an Ihop

review.title: Not very clean , very old , bad condition of
review.reviewText: Not very clean , very old , bad condition of Facilities

review.title: Close to the airport n free shuttle
review.reviewText: Room was ok. Bathroom could use some help. Other people were loud n smoking.
Bugs walking around the walls.. old small TV never again. Didn't give me the room I ordered made me get two beds!!
It was relaxing and I enjoyed the stay at travelodge.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Not that happy but I think it was ok. Not coming back next time

review.title: better than sleeping in the streets - just
review.reviewText: wow not a great hotel, bathroom was in a mess. People driving around at 2am with thumping sound system. Guys having a HUGE argument swearing at 3am, saying call the police "please" (in not those terms). Thought there was going to be a shooting or something. An experience I will not forget. Avoid unless like me you have no choice as all the other hotels within SFO were booked...
review.negativeRemarks: better bathroom, and could do with a re fit.
review.locationRemarks: SFO is close.

review.title: Weekend reception staff
review.reviewText: Weekends are usually busy for the reception office, with guest lined up checking in and out.   My question is as I wsit my turn in line, "why schedule a staff who's clearly unprofessional, handle the bulk of the guest's needs?"  So for the all you potential weekend guest out there, be prepared with lots of patience and understanding.

review.title: Worn out motel
review.reviewText: The motel is old and worn. I doubt is much attention is paid to the upkeep. The buildings are spread out and a long ways from the office. We could smell smoke through the door from the outside smokers.
review.negativeRemarks: Level it and build new
review.locationRemarks: Airport and Costco are nearby.

review.title: Staying close to SFO
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was friendly and professional. The room conditions are old and could use some renovation. Our bathroom door wouldn't close and the moldings were roting. The windows are old and being next to the freeway they didn't provide the noise reduction that up to date windows could provide.

review.title: Nice place convenient to SF airport.
review.reviewText: I found this place to be a nice place, with everything working including the TV. I had a huge bed and a nice bathroom. There's an iHop next door, 24/7. I had a very early morning flight to catch, so, knowing that I'd need to catch their first shuttle of the day (4:08 AM) I checked in early, slept for 3 hours in daylight, had a good dinner at the iHop and went back to bed. They did call to wake me at 3 AM as requested. The shuttle left right on time. Note: to get there, you have to get to the airport FIRST and then take one of the Travelodge shuttled, which also carry the names of 2 other hotels. I give it 3 stars.
review.positiveRemarks: Good service, everything worked, and having a full-service 24/7 restaurant right next to the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: I don't like having a $100 hold put on my AmEx until I check out. But it seems a lot of hotels are doing it now.
review.locationRemarks: There's the airport nearby and u can shuttle for free back and forth to it to shop if u r so inclined. Not much else!

review.title: Bad room
review.reviewText: Reserved a room with a King Bed and got 2 doubles . Was put all the way in back of motel ,no wifi signal and room was just bad ,will not stay there again  and not indorse this motel ever.Should get refund for the price paid.!!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything!
review.locationRemarks: Location was good just bad motel.

review.reviewText: It was the worse hotel could have been better for the rate

review.title: The Staff was Great
review.reviewText: The rooms was ok but the staff was great I  love the I hop that next to it the food  good

review.title: One night near the airport.
review.reviewText:
I had to spend just a short night near SFO and I did not want to spend much money.  I was looking for a convenient and cheap place to sleep, period.
This motel is just minutes ago from the airport: perfect
The rate was extremely moderate: perfect
The room was comfortable enough for one night.  The room was clean.  The internet connection [free] was efficient.  And there is a IHOP restaurant just "next door".
Obviously it is not a 5-star or a luxury resort but that's not what I was looking for.
This hotel was OK and met my wishes and expectations.  No problem, no unnecessary spending.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe some "refurbishing" one day or another.
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect for a night before early departure from SFO or when arriving late.

When requested for late check out she said, You need to pay $150 for late check out or We will call Police on you. I did complained about it at front desk but doesn't seems like they won't do to their other guest. 
Staff is rude and they will make your stay un-pleasant.
We asked for a NON-SMOKING room and they stop put us in a room that SMELLED like cigarettes!!

It is not new or fancy, and I knew that before I went.  I am totally fine with it, I just want a clean bathroom and clean bed.  The shuttle service was timely and I would stay there again without hesitation.

review.title: Brand-name hotel to avoid near SFO
review.reviewText:
This is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in with a well known brand.

The room, facing onto an open verandah, was noisy, with talking voices and traffic noises making sleep difficult without earplugs. The room itself was squalid, although the bed was clean and fairly comfortable. The carpet was stained, scuffed and looked like it had not been vacuumed properly. The heating/cooling system was really dirty, with crud and dust on the controls. Electric outlets were difficult to find in the room, making charging electrical gadgets difficult. The bathroom was small (although clean) and the air vent made a sound like a loud diesel engine when turned on. The coffee maker had only one pack of coffee.

The list goes on, with an exterior that is shabby and unkempt, with a cracked exterior hallway leading to the room, and railings needing paint.

I have stayed at Travelodges before, including at LAX, that did not give this impression. I was hard pressed to find a room at SFO for an early morning flight, and now regret having paid for this on. Give this hotel a miss unless the rate is really low (it was not in my case).

review.title: Worst potential lodging experience ever.
review.reviewText: Sketchy hotel that featured a cockroach on the nightstand and the smell of insecticide immediately upon entrance into the room. Absolutely disappointed that the staff did not apologize not make any attempt to rectify the situation when I went back to the front desk to explain the situation. Therefore, I checked out 30 minutes after checking in. I will likely never book through Expedia again given that they will allow such lodging facilities to sell their poor services. You've lost my years of business, Expedia.

review.title: Needs some serious improvement
review.reviewText:
Pros: Close (very) to SFO with a free shuttle back and forth. That's nice but all other hotels in the area pretty much has the same service, no nothing exclusive for this one. And the price was low enough, however, the old wisdom saying: You get what you pay for... Low price = Low quality.
Cons: All the rest pretty much but to specify one thing: Never seen any hotel/motel bathroom more dirty than this one. I'd seriously check my feet for some kind of infection after standing in that shower booth (no bathtub equipped at least in my room).
I saw many young female patrons coming in during my stay, and I got worried. They seem to be students from all over the world travelling to famous SF area just to add a bad memory of a bad lodging and a possible risk in personal hygiene. I'd never want to see my own daughter staying in a place like this (but for budget sensitive students, not much choice for them). They rather stay in one of those "Hostels" in the downtown area. Seriously.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: Minutes from SFO. Not much near. Not a good choice for travelling to SF area.

review.title: Basic hotel with some annoyances.
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for. Annoying that after fully prepaying, to Expedia,, hotel demands 100 USD deposit on check-in. After getting room a long walk from lobby I find it is unmade up. Call reception and must to back to lobby to get new room equally far away. Not efficient. Hotel to airport bus seems one of the least frequent - over 30 minutes wait, the only redeeming feature is the price v other hotels this area, acceptable on price.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in deposit policy, room readiness and shuttle frequency.
review.locationRemarks: Near airport, an I hop to set nearby. That is all.

The toilet was leaking under the wall into the carpet of the sleeping area. This must be a health hazard! Couldn't use the heater because of an overpowering smell of incense it produced when operating. Parking is an issue, if you get there late and it is all booked up. And yet I would go there again!

If one has a choice rather stay in another place, a hostel for $20 offers better comfort.

review.title: Inexpensive Hotel close to SF Airport
review.reviewText:
San Francisco Hotels are very expensive.  The Travelodge SF North is an inexpensive alternative for anyone visiting San Francisco or having a long lay-over between flights. Its a 5 minute free shuttle ride from the airport. The rooms are spacious and basic.  Clean  and functional but not luxurious.  

Adjacent to the hotel is an iHop where you eat, inexpensively 24 hours a day.
review.positiveRemarks: The Low Price and Proximity to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms need updating.
review.locationRemarks: The San Francisco Airport. There are beautiful bayside walking and jogging trails nearby.  San Francisco is a short BART ride away.

review.title: Basic hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: Hotel close to airport. Not expensive. Clean. Free internet and free shuttle were reasons I chose Travelodge when weather forced me to stay overnight. Facility composed of 7 old two storey buildings sprawled on a big property right along the main highway to the airport. Noise not too bad from traffic for rooms not facing road, otherwise loud. Pipes from plumbing very loud from adjoining room. No amenities except a bar of soap and a coffee machine. There was a fridge in the room. My heating worked well though a bit noisy. My friend's didn't heat at all. Walls could use fresh paint in areas. Magnetic roth om key a didn't work initially, took many tries but that could have been because it was a very wet night. Overall adequate, not great.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport. Free shuttle and Internet. Reasonable price for unexpected layover.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk clerk should give Internet ID and password at checkin rather than having to phone the desk later for the information.
review.locationRemarks: Nearby chain breakfast restaurant. Full restaurant and bar a couple of long blocks away across the Hwy. SFO 15 min away by shuttle, goes every 30 min.

I ended up calling Expedia to complain how bad it was and ended my reservation two days early.

Last, the room didn't have any blankets and when I called to the lobby the attendant said there weren't any available and that I should consider using towels....

Beds are comfortable, there's a safe in room, the fridge and microwave in room option is a plus. I had an enjoyable stay.  There's an airport shuttle but you need a car far from any tourist things but 5 mins from airport.

It still smelled so badly that I awoke in the middle of the night and couldn't go back to sleep because of the severe smell.  Wall paper was coming off the wall, there was mold at the window, door, and bathroom.  The tub was stained so badly I refused to use it.  The carpet and furniture were also stained.  I was scared to death of bedbugs after looking around so I refused to sleep inside the bed (under the covers) and instead covered the bedding with my own blanket and pillows, then immediately put the suitcases in the car.  This is the worst room I have ever rented!

The parking lot is completely filled and cars going the wrong way due to lack of instruction signs.  Staff in the front desk are rude and will totally ignore you.

review.title: Decent hotel close to airport

Also, the website says that it comes with certain amenities (microwave, fridge, etc,), and when we called the desk to ask about these we were told that they only come with an "upgrade". Did not say this on website.

I ended up being stranded and this was the cheapest choice that had a free shuttle back to the airport. IHOP is the only amenity. Stained carpets, water damaged walls, decor from the 1970s, sketchy shower, bathroom doors that don't  close, outlets and lights that don't work, and 13 channels on a TV from 1996 (it's color!!). It was either this or sleeping outside. So...basically it's a roof over your head.
