review.title: My Travelodge stay
review.reviewText: The room smells like body lotion. I stayed here twice and both rooms smell like lotion. The beds are comfortable but the pillows are lumpy and uncomfortable. The location is great for travel to and from San Francisco Airport and you can't bet the price of the room. I guess you get what you pay for.

review.title: Unorganize
review.reviewText: Everything was good, until about three in the morning, when the same room number was assigned to another person. The person went to the room and open the door, and when he realized that the room was occupied, he went back to the lobby. The lobby phone us at three in the morning, and send a security guard to tell us that we were not registered and asked us to go to the lobby to register. It was not a very nice experience.  We stayed in room 709.

review.title: a Good place near were I worked
review.reviewText:
This my first experience on a long time staying in a hotel, and would said
that it was good, the place was clean and quiet although the bed was a little
hard to sleep in the night (to may taste) other than that was good, the people
at the front counter were helpful .
review.positiveRemarks: I would say the daily cleaning at the room and the quietness in the night time
review.negativeRemarks: the mattress should be a tittle more soft to sleep better.
review.locationRemarks:
well in my case it perfect, it was a few miles away from my job, but also there are some restaurant 
and some commercial areas an few miles away.

review.title: Would not recommend
review.reviewText: Overcharged me and wouldn't refund me my money. Room smelled like mildew.

review.title: Only if you have no other place to STAY!
review.reviewText: Parking areas SMALL! NO WI-FI even advertised with, complained! Front desk blamed the telephone company, never fixed in the three day stay. NO REFREG, on in insulin forget it and use ice buckets, curtains blocked the heat and cooling unit. Only 1 person out of 6 people was of any help at front desk. FLOOR left bottom of feet black from shower to bed. 2" gap under entrance door, heat or cold to come into room. Few electrical outlets, and half didn't didn't work. Please inspect room for left behind ODOR of smoke in NON-SMOKING.  In all cases have a GPS unit, the front desk worthless as giving directions. Stay some where else!
review.negativeRemarks: STAY AWAY!
review.locationRemarks: Unknown!

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: Third time that I have stayed here.  Price is good, area is good, Ihop next door.  Rent pay movies, swimming pool.  No fridge or microwave, but I never have need of them.  Some wall paper pealed here and there, minor things.  Not fancy room, but nice.  I have stayed three time and have no complaints.  I would not hesitate to recommend this motel for individual or family stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that wouldn't make the price go up.

review.title: Close to the airport.
review.reviewText: Not recommended because of following reason during my stay; room telephone not working, room smell is bad, free wifi not working, and staff not helpful and can't resolve wifi problem, bed sheets and comforters has smell. This is my experience during my stay.

I needed a cheap place fast and was pleasantly surprised that this travel lodge was not only well located on a bus route but was comfortable and spacious. The rooms were clean, although in need of some maintenance, and I could do laundry, which was a huge plus. It's attached to an ihop, which leaves something to be desired, but for a cheap airport hotel I was very impressed.

review.title: Near airport,new to San Fran.
review.reviewText: The toilet leaked the first time we used it, couldn't get fixed till the afternoon, couldn't get another room. Was glad that the receptionist encouraged us to go on a tour as it took us away for 7 hours. Didn't  really like the pillows as they were to fat and uncomfortable. Should change to regular pillows as they are more for everybody.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom as it has much to be fixed. The tub had  some repairs that should have been done.
review.locationRemarks: The airport was near the hotel and that was just right for me as I was tired from the flight.

review.reviewText: Our experience was great. Location was good because we didn't get a rental. The staff was great and helpful. The room was clean.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: First no plug for drain in tub. I am 65 and was put in the farthest building from office with no offer of assistance in a very poorly lit trek to my room..
review.positiveRemarks: not very much would not ever stay again even if they gave me the room
review.negativeRemarks: Employees and lighting
review.locationRemarks: was close to airport

review.reviewText: First of all no WIFI and no air conditioning. Hard to find the hotel even your using a GPS.

review.title: Afraid to enter!
review.reviewText: Room showed signs of water damage.  Carpet and wallpaper showed buckling.  Where carpet meats the wall grimy.  The bathroom was ready for demolition.  The bed smelled of old sweat.  Too late at night to run away!!!!!
The staff was very pleasant and helpful, however the room I stayed in needed some help. Tiles missing from the shower and rotting baseboard in the bathroom. Would I stay there again, nope.
review.negativeRemarks: condition of the room.

review.title: Not fun
review.reviewText: Pretty grim and poor value. Stuffy humid rooms - even when it was cold outside! Brisk staff who made me feel like I was just someone to take money from.

review.title: Overpriced, decrepit condition,
review.reviewText: This was one of the worst rooms I've ever stayed in. The sofa was stained, the floor beneath the sink was stained, one outlet didn't work, the bathtub/shower was ancient and the grout had separated from the bathtub. Frankly, I didn't take a shower because I was reluctant to get into it.  I couldn't get an internet connection. I waited at least 15 minutes to talk to the IT tech (who served all the nearby hotels) and didn't get any help.  The IT guy said that someone would get back to me, but no one did.  Horrible room.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: The room needs to be totally renovated.

review.title: The wifi is free, but can never be connected.
review.reviewText:
The wifi is free, but can never be connected. When I turned to the hotel staff for help, he said they just had limited openings for the wifi connection; I can't connect to the wifi, because somebody else connected. 

It doesn't make any sense to mention "free wifi" when just a small number of the costumers can connect to it.

review.title: Ok but not good value
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because it belongs to a reputable chain and i had problems finding affordable accommodation in San Francisco at the last minute.  It provides everything you would expect from a basic budget hotel but for the price of a rather expensive hotel. Perhaps that's just a reflection on the price of San Francisco hotels in general but I thought it was massively overpriced and not good value for money - it didn't even include breakfast!
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to get to, free shuttle bus from the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Increase the frequency of the shuttle buses - only 2 per hour so likely to have a long wait at the airport. Modernise and renovate the entire hotel.

review.title: Nasty hotel
review.reviewText: I booked the hotel for 3 days. The air conditioner didn't not work the first night & I couldn't switch because no more rooms were availble. The staff said they would give us a complimentary night, which they did NOT do when I checked out. The carpets were nasty!!!!! My feet were black from walking on it. There were sketchy people hanging around. It was an poor experience. If I paid 39.99 a night, then I would expect it. The rooms were 100.00 a night.
review.negativeRemarks: Have clean rooms & honest staff!!!
review.locationRemarks: Near IHOP and the gas station

review.title: By far the worst hotel I have the stayed in
review.reviewText: Grotty beyond your wildest imagine - feet stuck to carpet, it was truly horrendous - worse than any motel you could ever imagine

review.title: Old building
review.reviewText: Facilities are old and aged. The bathroom door was heavy and pull style. Air conditioning didn't work well. Couldn't find the ice machine and the remote control didn't work.
review.positiveRemarks: Direct access from the ihop and gas station was cool.
review.negativeRemarks: The facility needs to be renovated to become a more modern  motel.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: About 30 min away from main attractions (Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz,  Fisherman's Warf, etc).  If you plan to take public transportation since parking is terrible it takes approximately an hour and a half.  Room smelled weird and sheets had stains.  However, this is one of the cheapest places to stay so you get what you pay for.  For a 1 night  stay it's doable.

review.title: Worst stay ever!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Very Dirty, right by freeway so noisy.  Bathroom so disgusting I showered with my socks on to not touch the tile! Internet so slow I couldn't download anything off the internet.

review.title: Firm beds
review.reviewText: Excellent firm mattress. We had very good night sleep. But the carpet gave us black feet when we went barefoot :-).

review.title: not a nice hotel
review.reviewText: Needed to sleep near airport for trip to Asia, hotel is old and has outdated rooms, bathrooms included.
review.negativeRemarks: new hotel rooms
review.locationRemarks: IHOP, airport

review.title: Never stay in this hotel again
review.reviewText: The bed wasn't clean. The wall and window are very thin so I heard everything outside. The air plain and air conditioner noise was so aloud.  Sleeping in the room sounds like in a battle field.  It is not worth the money at all.

review.title: Needed a place close to aiport, flying out early.
review.reviewText: Peeling paint, smelly room, black mold in bathroom, ancient bedding. The management needs to invest some money in the place.

review.title: Do not go there
review.reviewText: Booked a deluxe room.  Could barely turn around in. Air was next to non-existent.

review.title: Convenient to SFO, shuttle service good.
review.reviewText:
Got in very late and needed to use the internet. I could not use it at all. It was not available from my ground floor room.  Staff insisted that it was available just that many people are accessing it even though it was 12 or 1 am. I was welcome to come to the lobby and try. I gave up and got some sleep.  

Otherwise the room was fine. I didn't expect much from this hotel.  The bed was clean and the shower worked. The carpet and floors not so much but it was ok. I'd do it again because it was cheap. I just wouldn't count on the wifi.

review.title: Tired motel priced accordingly
review.reviewText: Basic amenities.  Tired decor, facilities, but inexpensive for the area.  Surprisingly quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Furnishings, carpet are shabby at best.
review.locationRemarks: S.F. Airport, near BART stations into city.

review.title: You get what you pasy for
review.reviewText: I don't know why people are complaining in their reviews.  This is a very inexpensive hotel for this city with a free shuttle that we used multiple times.  If you want deluxe, then pay for it.  The rooms are very basic and that's what you get for this price.  But nothing was wrong with it.  It was quiet and had a pool.  The staff was not friendly or unfriendly, just busy.  I would return.
review.negativeRemarks: it could be better maintained.
review.locationRemarks: very close to SFO and Bart station.

review.title: Ok hotel, no bath tub though
review.reviewText: It was ok for that price, only disadvantages in my room were: no refrigerator, microwave, and bath tub:(

review.title: Cheap but you get what you pay for .
review.reviewText: We were only there for 8 hours to catch a few winks between flights. It was good enough for that but pretty funky otherwise.

review.title: Only If You Need To Catch A Plane The Next Day
review.reviewText:
Knew what I was getting into by previous reviews. No frills, no thrills. I needed a hotel close to the airport, reasonable price with free shuttle. Arriving late and leaving early the next am. That is what this hotel is good for. My room was old and run down. Could tell they made an effort to freshen it up - in fact the perfumed cleaning/air freshener was too strong. Bed average, shower old and hair remained in it from previous guests. 

While a group of us from different trips arrived by the shuttle at the same time, the front desk check in was much more of an automated Mr. Roboto. Quick, efficient, not even a pleasant Welcome to Travel Lodge. 

Scheduled this since I was traveling on my own: my wife would not have stayed here.
review.positiveRemarks: Free shuttle, close to airport & price.

review.title: Rude Staff, Noisy room
review.reviewText:
We stayed here because we were lucky enough to get tickets to the Giants playoff game, but had to fly out early the next day and had no time to go back to friends in Berkeley. The person who checked us in, gave us to 2 key cards. We went out to eat and only took one key with us and when we came back, could not get in because he had not been set up for the room. When we went to the front desk to get the second key synced, the person at the desk insisted on ID and returning the other key, which of course was impossible because they were locked in our room. He was extremely rude, despite the fact that all this happened because the initial person did not give us 2 synched keys, and he acted as if we did something wrong.I had to re-sign my check in agreement in order to get 2 replacement cards. This took longer than necessary, and was filled with "attitude". Once we got back into the room, we discovered how thin the walls were, when a party next door went on until 5am. 
Needless to say, we had many hotels to choose from, and chose Travelodge based on its name and reputation. Never again!

review.title: Slight odor in room
review.reviewText: Convenience to airport and free shuttle made it a great solution for an overnight stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning
review.locationRemarks: Arrived late and left early

review.title: Close to the airport.
review.reviewText: Glad I only had to spend one night here,will not recommend to anyone. It is in dire need of a reno or just tear down and rebuild would be a better option.
review.positiveRemarks: Had an IHOP and shuttle service to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything needs improving,with the location it's in I would expect a lot more. Was tempted to go to one of the nicer and newer hotels in the area.

review.title: Horrible, old, dirty, loud
review.reviewText:
Hated it. Really, really hated it. Staff nasty at check-in. Only had smoking rooms, which they did not disclose prior to rental. Ugly experience. 
  Tear it down.
review.negativeRemarks: Tear it down
review.locationRemarks: Next to the freeway, nothing to do nearby

review.title: terrible smell in the rooms
review.reviewText: there was a terrible smell in the rooms and the guy at the reception was not polite. And the breakfast is not included.
review.negativeRemarks: the smell in the rooms
review.locationRemarks: there is nothing to do nearby, except going to the airport

review.title: you get what you pay for
review.reviewText: The room smells like pee when we turned on the ac. The carpet was slimy and filthy. The bathroom was falling apart. the room was just older and needed some love. but if you're there for a night it's not too bad

review.title: Disgusting.
review.reviewText: A shabby room with a sealed window and horrible odors. looks more like a shelter for homeless than a 2 star hotel.

review.title: NOT RECOMMENDED
review.reviewText:
Hooker activity, carpet full of iron burn marks, light top of sink not working, fan in restroom not working, sliding door to restroom broken not working stuck half way, tub leaking wet floor after shower, Telephone not working no dialtone... horrible experience. I cancelled the next nights stay...

DO NOT STAY HERE if you are a business traveler or with family, I seriously DO NOT RECOMMEND>....
review.negativeRemarks: The items described above. Namely the lack of concern the owners have for its guests.
review.locationRemarks: IHOP

review.reviewText: Not a good place to stay I would not recommend this place to anybody

review.title: Hotel close to airport. One nighter.
review.reviewText: Can't believe with how much property goes for in Bay Area that this place hasn't sold to some large hotel. The size of the property is huge. But all very old buildings. Crumbling, in fact. This place needs to be bulldozed. Staff was courteous. Bed was comfortable. Shower was warm. Guess for the discounted price I can't complain. But just be ready for lots of bathroom caulking, holes in walls and ceiling, etc.

review.title: You know it's bad when.
review.reviewText: You are lock out of the room, after you checked in. Had to go back to the front desk twice and have them open the door for me. Once the room was opened it's smelled like an old closet, half the lights works, and an old TV that buzzes the whole time it turn on. Even the easy check out on the TV didn't work. Difficult checking even harder checking out.
review.negativeRemarks: New renovation off the rooms & staff.
review.locationRemarks: N/A

review.title: Decent
review.reviewText: Not a bad last minute hotel when the city is crowded.  Your not spending a  honey moon there but it was decent and the staff was good.  Walls are a little thin and the beds are worn out but when the city is full it will do. Almost forgot their little continental breakfast was better than expected.

review.title: Needs refurbishing
review.reviewText: Bathroom tub shows signs of wear. Door peeling. No elevator or bellmen which makes it difficult for women and seniors to carry their bags upstairs. Wonderful to have an onsight laundry, airport shuttle and great restaurant next door

review.title: Don't stay here
review.reviewText: Nasty furniture. Spiders on the bathroom towels. Stay here if like me you are desperate for a San Francisco airport hotel. Nothing has been upgraded in probably 25 or more years. Yuk.
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: near the airport

review.title: Filthy & under maintained!
review.reviewText: Sheets hadn't been changed & both them & towels were dirty grey.  Woodwork in bathroom rotten & gone at bottom due constantly being wet from leaking shower. Smelt damp. Bedspreads thread bare...god forbid, thought Id done it! Curtains lank & UV rotten. Need I go on? Just sleep in ya car, youll feel more comfortable & in my case save $138! Oh & forgot to add, it's located a spit from the freeway & right under SFOs departure path. Needless to say I dozed at best! Fit for demolition only!

review.title: Old and torn.
review.reviewText: This hotel is very old and torn!  It is so dirty that I found dead flies and cockroaches by the AC!
review.negativeRemarks: Sanitation, very old furniture, and cleaning.

review.title: Love/Hate.
review.reviewText: What is your goal with staying here? Do you need to shower? Well... it is what is. Just a place a crash. Location is prime with a free shuttle to the airport. That's probably the only pro here. Hotel is rundown. Shower is stained. Parking lot is loud. Pillows were terrible. If you just trying to cut back on some costs because its just a room to sleep its bearable. If you plan on spending any amount of time or with the wife/gf, just pay a little more and go to the holiday inn next door. You can hear the planes and cars outside all night. No insulation for sound whatsoever. Also there's flimsy doors, leave no valuables... Staff is unfriendly. 2/5 is a generous rating.

review.title: Perfect for a tight budget
review.reviewText: We didn't get into SF until 10 PM and our flight was at 6 the next morning, so we didn't want to spend a bunch of money on a hotel room we weren't going to be in long. The park and fly rate was what really got me to book. This hotel offers free long-term parking up to 5 days. The bed was as hard as a rock and the bathroom hasn't been updated since the 70s, but the staff was very friendly. Riding the shuttle to the airport was convenient, but having to wait 30 minutes for it on our way back after a long day of flying was a bummer.
review.positiveRemarks: Park and fly rates and airport shuttle service.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds are very hard and bathrooms are outdated. Shuttle ride is about 15 minutes long. It would be quicker if it didn't have to stop at 3 hotels.

review.title: Stay Away!
review.reviewText: The room I stayed in was in need of repair. There were cracks in the shower titles, the carpet looked dirty and the room smelt. There is a worn out couch and bath room was not clean. There was a shampoo bottle that was half empty (assume used by the last guest). Good thing I brought my own.
review.positiveRemarks: Free WiFi, decent TV station, one movie station. Free parking, free shuttle to airport. I-Hop next door with $7 waffells.
review.negativeRemarks: This could be a cool hotel. The rooms need to renovated and outdoors needs to be redone.
review.locationRemarks: You can work to Costco, See's Candy, McDonnolds. Nothing else really in walking distance.

review.title: Good Hotel for the price.
review.reviewText: Can't beet the price and no extra charge for parking.  Rooms do need remodeling or just repaired and cleaned.
review.negativeRemarks: remodel rooms or just repair walls and bathroom.  Carpets and furniture need good cleaning or replaced.
review.locationRemarks: good location near CalTrain and shuttle to airport

review.title: Easy Peasy
review.reviewText: Airport shuttle is reliable and pleasant and the IHOP attached to the Travel Lodge made my trip even easier. Internet, cable Tv, pool and friendly staff with the low price of $80 a night was the cherry on top.

review.title: Near the airport
review.reviewText: Convenient for the airport, but not for downtown.  Had to take an expensive cab ride for sightseeing.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms, furniture & fixtures were old and scruffy and need updating.

review.title: canceled continental breakfast part of avertized
review.reviewText: Canceled advertised breakfast. Shuttle ran every 30 minutes. Great accessibility to airport BaRT. Very small room   Convient  location to the airport. Heard traffic on hwy 101 starting at 5-5:30am every morning.

review.title: Was only there for 1 night
review.reviewText: the staff was very pleasant & shuttle was on time & quick!
review.positiveRemarks: close to airport & good shuttle service---also I could leave my car!
review.negativeRemarks: Buildings could use some paint:)
review.locationRemarks: Don't think there is any thing to do near by.

review.title: nothing worked,  the location was terrible
review.reviewText: no wifi   bathroom was dirty     room was smelly and dirty
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: right on the major highway    way too much noise

review.title: Great stay for a great price.
review.reviewText: Easy Peasy! The shuttle to the airport was consistent and the room was clean. The hotel staff were nice and helpful.

review.title: Iron burns in carpet, rust stains in bathroom.
review.reviewText: Hotel sucks!! I wouldn't stay there again!! Room had iron burns all over carpet floor, bath tub had big rust stains in it. I wouldn't stay there again!! Staff where nice but truly it was a disappointment!

review.title: reasonable hotel if traveling with budget.
review.reviewText: it was ok, with the price I paid, beddings were clean as well as the bathroom.
review.positiveRemarks: staff were helpful and accommodating and did not charge us with extra taxes.
review.negativeRemarks: carpet needs to be replaced or maybe replace the building with new hotel.
review.locationRemarks: I like the location because it is close to the airport and there is a complimentary shuttle, walking distance to restaurants.

review.reviewText: Hotel not as bad as reviews make it seem. Loud though as near freeway.

review.title: This hotel has seen better days
review.reviewText: The property is worn out.  We wanted to stay near the airport to catch an early morning flight.  For that purpose, it is fine.  The shuttle service to and from the airport is very reliable.  The price is the lowest we could find in that location.  For a short stay it is a little depressing but not dangerous.  Reasonably clean.  Bed OK.  Even got our wake up call.  IHOP is right next door with decent food.  Convenient for a quick overnight by the airport without paying the price of a nice hotel in the area.
review.positiveRemarks: Shuttle service, very quick drive to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Entire property needs a complete make over.  Everything, linens, furniture etc. need to be replaced......OK when the hotel was $60. a night.
review.locationRemarks: For a cocktail and dinner go across the street to the Holiday Inn.  This hotel is just for a quick overnight.  Would not wish to linger...

review.reviewText: after tax, $180 for a  room with two beds for one night. my car would have been a more comfortable stay.
review.negativeRemarks: too much to list

review.title: Conveniently close to SFO.
review.reviewText: The Travel Lodge at SFO was sufficient for a brief overnight following a late arrival.  Understandably, the convenient proximity to SFO comes at the cost of noise from Hwy 101 and aircraft.  The cost is commensurate with the location and room furnishings that are approaching the end of their useful life.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgraded room interiors.

review.title: Terrible hotel, close to the Airport
review.reviewText:
We got a last-minute reservation (two rooms) after our flight had been cancelled. 
We arrived at the lobby, than problems started
 - the reservation wasn't noticed by the hotel at all
 - when the reservation was finally found, the receptionist said "ok, there's a reservation but I have no rooms for you" 
 - finally he gave us "unclean" rooms - no bed made, no clean towels etc.
 - he gave almost nothing for the inconvenience - just two blankets (one with a hole burned by a cigarette) and couple of towels. 

The room was full of musty smell, black must  in the bathroom, mattresses full of stains...

Final opinion: one of the worst hotels I've ever slept in.
review.negativeRemarks: room conditions, better cooperation with Expedia.com

review.title: Only stay here if you are desperate!
review.reviewText:
Sadly, try as I may to find one thing positive about this placeI cannot. However, two out of three bulbs in the room did work.

The carpet was completely worn through, the walk to the room was unsafe, bed was concave, television was difficult to see with limited stations (round as a globe), reeked of cigarettes, shower stall was such a mess due to worn tile and grout (many half-baked fixes evident). I could go on and on. Just beware.
review.negativeRemarks: The entire property should be razed and rebuilt.
review.locationRemarks: SFO

review.title: Horrible staff and rooms
review.reviewText: Discusting rooms I mean filthy. I had Issues with the front desk people. They where so rude and I wasn't the only person that had problems.

review.title: Early flight
review.reviewText: Apart from the noisy rooms (the airport and the turnpike) this hotel is perfect for spending the night before an early flight. Shuttle to the airport starts at 4 a.m., goes every 30 minutes, and the ride takes no more than 30 minutes (it stops in a couple of hotels nearby).
review.negativeRemarks: Noise, which is in fact impossible to improve
review.locationRemarks: Arrived late andf left early, no time to see around but doesn't seem to have mucho to do. It has a pool, though

review.title: Ok for one night
review.reviewText: Ok for one night to catch an early flight. Old decoration but ok for the price...

review.title: Not Worth the Money Saved
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for. This is a bare bones operation that stays afloat without any renovation due to it's proximity to the airport. I think we ended up spending the same as we would staying in town because taking Bart and Taxis everywhere adds up quick.

review.title: Not recommended unless you are in budget issues
review.reviewText: When you enter the room, you will smell the old carpets and molds. The shower facility is extremely old. I was afraid of if inside of the shower hose is molded. I am not a person who ONLY prefer extreme clean or fancy. I just recommend you to get the other hotel (motel 6 will be way better than this one, so you know how gross this place is) if you are in budget issues, then probably get this room since this hotel is the cheapest one around sfo. But if you dont, strongly recommand you to get the other...

review.title: Ok hotel
review.reviewText: Rooms are ok. Shower is kinda loud. No more free breakfast.

review.title: location. staff. free shuttle. wifi.
review.reviewText: Awesome location and very helpful Filipino frontdesk staff. I'll definitely stay there again when I'm in SFO.
review.positiveRemarks: location: very close to airport and there's a free shuttle.

review.title: old trashy hotel
review.reviewText: it was horrible, over priced, smelled like smoke when suppose to get smoking free room, very old hotel, so disgusting we were afraid of using the toilet, sinks, tub or even sleep in the beds, will never ever use hotel again
review.negativeRemarks: build a new one
review.locationRemarks: airport near

review.title: Do  Not Stay
review.reviewText: Overpriced. Most disgusting hotel I have ever stayed in.  I slept in my clothes. Was too scared to touch anything. Wanted to check out immediately but had no options due to late hour and we had already paid online.  Couldn't even take a shower it was so bad. Put a chair under the door to keep it closed

review.title: Bathroom is the size of one from an RV.
review.reviewText: The beds were comfortable, but the wallpaper was peeling, there were holes in the wall, and the concrete steps leading up to our room were cracked. The bathroom was way to small, and the showerhead leaked constantly. I'd stay elsewhere.

review.title: Dirty, smelly
review.reviewText: The room smelled of smoke so bad that we could taste it in our mouth just by walking in and out. The room looked a mess and it did not have the amount of sleeping quarters that we needed. We cancelled right away and they did not charge us a fee.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: Unclean shabby and noisy next to freeway
review.reviewText: slept in my clothes as did not trust sheets or bed, everything sticky and not a nice room could not wait to get out...
review.negativeRemarks: needs major refurbishment

review.reviewText:
It totally sucked
conditions were waaayy past horrible!

review.title: Very convenient location.
review.reviewText: Very handy to S.F. Airport and shuttle bus is free.Hotel also told us of a shuttle to get to our cruise ship that stopped right at the hotel & was roughly half of what cab fare would be.Friendly , pleasant & with a Denny's restaurant on site.Would stay again.
review.locationRemarks: Next to the freeway so handy to go Downtown S.F. or to go South.

review.title: SFO travelodge
review.reviewText: Expensive for what it was.  Close to airport and free shuttle, but no breakfast which most other Travelodges seem to provide.  Outdated decor and terrible wifi!!  Did the job, but could do better.
poor air conditioning quality, I would not recommend this hotel to a friend, it was not clean and does not include breakfast

review.title: close to airport
review.reviewText: The best part of this hotel is that it is close to the airport and some quaint restaurants within 3 miles.  The room is small,  clean but not fresh and very noisy.   The rate was okay and the proximity to the airport made it bearable for the night.   Otherwise....I would surely not stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: rooms smell musty
review.locationRemarks: Nice area of quaint restaurant within 3 miles radius

review.title: Short Stay
review.reviewText: Need a place by the airport.  Room was clean but everything looked old.  Maid keep knocking even when we told her we would not be leaving for a few more hours.
review.negativeRemarks: update the rooms
review.locationRemarks: in Industrial area but had a cafe and McDonald's close by

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: This hotel did the job. One night stay near the airport for ease of flying early next day. The price was still rather high for what we got. The room did not feel clean and the bathroom/shower was very poor.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Especially the bathroom facilities. The shower worked however the surroundings were very poor.
review.locationRemarks: Key point was proximity to the airport. Almost certainly the only reason anyone was there. Way to far out from San Francisco to be any kind of base.

review.title: Beyond Terrible
review.reviewText: When I booked the room I had low expectations due to low room rate but I never expected the conditions I encountered. First, the room smelled of cat urine. The bathroom was a closet with a tub you would not want to step in to because it was moldy and ancient. The bathroom floor was sticky and the sliding door would not shut. The room furniture was equally old looking like it was found on the side of the road and the refrigerator didn't get cold. The only decent thing were the beds which were ok but with the condition of the room I felt like I was sleeping in an abandoned motel. It looks as if not a dime has been put into to the place in years. Beware, this is not a budget motel experience, this is is skid row experience.

review.title: Ok, not great, Close to Airport
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel/motel because of it's proximity to the airport. Upon check-in, we were notified that the continental breakfast had been discontinued. We therefore had to purchase breakfast. Fortunately, there is an IHOP next door. Unfortunately, it cost us $55 plus tip for breakfast for 2 adults and 2 kids.  Instead, we could have chosen a nicer place to stay that offered breakfast. The room was clean. There was free wifi and a safe.  The beds were comfortable. However, the tub had a rust or something in it. There was an ant crawling on the wall. The vanity area was small. The pool was a good size, but a little dirty. The kids didn't mind too much. We only stayed one night and that was enough. For the price, it's fine, but I would suggest spending a little extra for better accommodations, especially if you need to stay more than one night.

review.title: Not like reviews we saw after we booked
review.reviewText:
We came in early and was accommodated with a room near the pool. 
 Was able to get to town via  a shuttle service and had a great day in S.F and was picked up by the same service. there is a charge and worth it.if you can have several hours to spare..
 No noise from planes as expected. Needed a light taken care of and it was done immediately.
 4AM wake up call on time, shuttle on time. 
Staff helpful and cooperative.
review.positiveRemarks: Able to spend the extra time we had in town to sight see and have a good lunch.
review.negativeRemarks: It's old and not shabby. Well, so am i. a do- over would jack-up the price.
review.locationRemarks: near SF airport. if you have a car it's easy. can get car service to town.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Did not hear airplanes overnight so slept fine. Was surprised they charge for breakfast especially with room price. Bathroom was in disrepair.

review.title: Ok in a pinch
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Travelodge in a last minute decision. I had a 6am flight out of SFO the next morning, the hotel was close, cheap and had a free shuttle.

The good: the shuttle was prompt and got me to the airport in time for my flight. The room had lights that worked, a bathroom that flushed, and a bed that was sleepable.

The bad: the carpet had burn marks from the iron. The door frame was chipped and the door rattled with the wind. The bathroom had an odd smell. The fixtures around the power outlets were not secure and I worried about electrical issues.

All in all, nothing bad happened and it was a relatively inexpensive way to spend a night before flying out of SFO (compared to other options). But I think next time I would definitely splurge $30-40 more and stay in a nicer, safer place.

review.title: Old Fashioned Basics
review.reviewText: I checked in, walked to my room, settled in , walked to the 24-hour IHOP next door, returned to my room , went through my bed-time routine, settled in bed with the TV ,slept reasonably well, and the next morning, I got up ready for my travel day. The shuttled came on time and I was at SFO before long .
review.positiveRemarks:
helpful cheery staff
responsive airconditioning,  great room smell
comfy bed
IHOP nearby
shuttle service
parking
review.negativeRemarks:
ancient fixtures
structurally ugly  
hair dryer a fire hazard , not usable
peeling wall corners, tired carpeting 
housekeepers' English remedial
review.locationRemarks: Best thing was location to the SFO is shuttle-friendly

review.title: Dirty Dirty Dirty
review.reviewText: I had 3 situation happen that made me realize this place sucks. 1. I took a shower early before my kids. While taking a shower I realized the water wasn't leaving. After the shower it took approx 1 hour for all the bad water to leave. 2. This was a split trip my wife and son flew out while me and our other 2 boys drove because we were just stopping here on our way to Washington to visit my brother. My older son took a shower and we left for our last couple hours together before their flight. When me and my 2 boys returned to the room the water was gone from the shower but it was all red and black stains that looked disgusting.  3. Me and my kids were just chilling in the room when they decided to clean outside. I just thought to myself this sucks but I guess the best time to do this is around midday. They began to hose the windows with water when all of a sudden all the water started leaking through the window. This was my last day there but I couldn't help but wonder how long this has been going on and how much mold is underneath the carpet and walls.
review.positiveRemarks: only the fact that it was available on 4th of July weekend
review.negativeRemarks: the entire establishment
review.locationRemarks: surroundings weren't to bad. It was about 20 mins from the Warf.

review.title: Not clean enough, I deserve more!
review.reviewText:
Good customer service provided by the staff!
When I open the door of my room, the energy of the room was scary...
Not clean and big spot on the floor like blood...
I feel this hotel need more TLC!
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity of the SFO Airport and the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Renovate all the decoration of the room
review.locationRemarks: Hi hop restaurant close by was ok...

review.title: It is a good hotel for travelers to stay shortly.
review.reviewText: Convenient location to SFO airport. Shuttle service schedules are convenient. Staff is polite and very helpful.Rooms are clean.

review.title: Comfortable stay.
review.reviewText: Close to the airport, the hotel was clean and the rooms were well kept.

review.title: Poor  quality hotel for high price
review.reviewText:
Not clean 
Staff uncaring
Poorly maintained
High price
The facility is old and rundown so there's little comfort. They do not provide complimentary breakfast, nor conditioner or lotion. It is not worth $127 a night that I paid for.

review.title: Convenient to airport - yes Updated from 1965 - no
review.reviewText: Very pleasant check in.  Very quiet room.   The walls were falling apart, the tub and bathroom area was something you would see in the poorest of projects.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk guy was nice and pleasant
review.negativeRemarks: Remodel
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location

review.title: Poor super poor
review.reviewText: Poor super poor , overpriced, staff at Lobby rude, the only convinience maybe,  is that closer to the Airport, the rest save your money ,besides everything is old and the rooms are dirty.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Airport, that's all

review.title: Atrocious
review.reviewText: This was the only room I could get near SFO on short notice and I figured its a national chain, how bad could it be? Worse than I could have ever imagined. Beyond gross, downright frightening. This place should be condemned. The foul smell hit you the minute you set foot in the room. The tub surround was coming off the wall and they had attempted to hold it in place with gobs of caulk which was now green with mold, absolutely filthy. The light in the bathroom didnt work so you had to leave the door open to see. The sliding door didnt work anyway. The vent fan was so noisy you couldnt stand if for more than a few minutes. The rest of the room had stained wallpaper peeling off of crumbing drywall. The furniture was battered and dingy. The parking lot was dark and scary. The single pain glass window and poorly sealed door let you hear every sound from the parking lot, the freeway that was a couple of hundred feet away and the airport. It was so noisy it was like sleeping outside at the airport. This is a $35 a night motel that charges closer to $200. It would take a court order to get me to stay at this dump again.
review.positiveRemarks: It was very close to SFO
review.negativeRemarks: Everything could be improved. Tear down this dump and build a new motel.
review.locationRemarks: SFO Airport. Costco with gas station.

review.title: Noisy hotel.
review.reviewText:
Very noisy due to airline flight path.  Pool and shuttle to airport were good. 
Ad did not include extra cost for breakfast
review.positiveRemarks: Shuttle to airport was convenient.  Pool was nice
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms need updating, looked a bit grubby.
review.locationRemarks:
Convenient airport shuttle.  
Very noisy for sleeping

review.title: OK for the price.
review.reviewText: Small room, comfortable bed, very accommodating staff (we needed a room with no stairs).
review.positiveRemarks: Finding any motel under $150 in/near San Francisco isn't easy. This one is clean, and has the necessities.
review.negativeRemarks: Again, for the price, no improvements needed.

review.title: late night stop
review.reviewText: arrived at sfo around 1 am.  easy hotel to get to.  nothing facing.  booked up.  nothing fancy and served its purpose.  staff was helpful in arranging transport into the city.
review.locationRemarks: restaurant right next door if you need food.

review.title: Rooms needs a huge renos
review.reviewText: Front desk staff is helpful, rooms are very average.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms, Bathrooms and carpets
review.locationRemarks: iHop and McDonalds and few miles from In n Out

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: The airport shuttle runs every 30min starting 4am and it was on time. The shower and the carpet was extremely old but the bed was clean and comfortable. The front desk staff was friendly and efficient. It was OK for the price
Lots of noise both air traffic and people milling about at all hours

review.title: Convenient and  clean but room very small
review.reviewText: Friendly staff But we were led to believe there would be free breakfast. Free breakfast is now discontinued but a convenient IHOP is  adjacent
review.negativeRemarks: Room size and I am not fond of upholstered  sofa instead of  chairs in this day of possible infestations.
review.locationRemarks: Airport shuttle  worked fine.

review.title: Convenient hotel with good airport shuttle
review.reviewText: The best part of this hotel is its proximity to SFO and the free shuttle that runs every 30 minutes. The room was adequate, but the air conditioning didn't work too well.

review.title: Not bad for the price
review.reviewText: This hotel needs an update, but the price was still good.  The room was clean, but the bathroom could have used some TLC.  Airport shuttle came when expected which was the main thing we needed.  The mattress was comfortable and the bedding was clean.

review.title: Poor service and poor room condition
review.reviewText: The hotel front desk staff is not friendly with heavy Indian accent and hardly to understand what the person try to express. Room is dirty and old, I feel like stay in the homeless shelter. Also heavy odor inside the room and you can tell the maid have sprayed strong odor remover. I do not reand this hotel, unless you really can't find any hotel in the airport area. The price is not cheap and be aware of the security deposit. Make sure check your credit card statement.

review.title: Only thing good was location to airport
review.reviewText: The rooms were smelly and generally dirty. Don't take your shoes off because your feet will stick to the sticky carpet. The end of the bed head has never been cleaned, thick black grease marks on it where peoples hands have been. The bathroom, the door is a slide door, when you could get it to slide all rotten at the bottom. The wall and wood surround of door was rotten and someone had tried to fill it but never completed the job. The bath looked like it had been there 100 years, chipped and generally unclean looking. there was mold or very thick dust above the entrance door. The toilet started making a gurgling noise, and in the middle of the night there was a banging noise which we presume was an airlock of some sort in the pipes because it went after we ran the water! Very disappointed, not a good impression for my nieces first visit to the USA!    I have photos but couldn't get them to load.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness!!

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Small rooms but clean & fine to stay in for one night before flying out. Write up says free parking- turns out that is for only 1 night.. staff wasnt very friendly or cheerfull but answered all questions

review.title: Okay for the money
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine for the price. The first room they gave me was less then average, not very clean and found hair in the bed. I switched rooms, & the second was much better!

review.title: Probation Sweep
review.reviewText: The hotel was ok... there was a probation sweep at the hotel in the morning done by local law enforcement which made it very uncomfortable staying here.  The floors were very dirty, my 1 year old daughters feet were black within 10 minutes....  the shower was terrifying... there was long black hair on the toilet ( none of us have black hair!).... but on the plus side, the bed was comfortable and we were able  to watch the Giants game (on a tube tv, not HD).
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the floors
review.locationRemarks: Right by airport... some dining.

review.title: A bit icky
review.reviewText:
There are other hotels in the area that are a bit more expensive. Spend the extra $30 and stay there. If this was under $100 I wouldn't mind as much. 
Not to take away anything from the staff. They were nice but the hotel is a bit of a dive is all.

review.title: Dirty Carpets
review.reviewText: Yes, this hotel is cheap, but don't be fooled by the pictures. It's dirtier than it looks! I won't be staying here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Please replace carpets, and fix the dents in the walls and corners of doors.
review.locationRemarks: Very loud, it's right next to the highway!

review.title: Convenient to airport for quick overnight
review.reviewText: Needed a quick place to rest between planes. Shuttle service people and front desk were helpful and efficient.
review.positiveRemarks: reasonable rate and convenient location with shuttle service to SFO
review.negativeRemarks: Carpets cleaner and fresh air

review.reviewText: Room was dirty & there was mould around the bath... there was a hole & smoke stains on the walls... sheets & toilet were clean though!

review.title: Noisy hotel by the SF Airport
review.reviewText: Our room was quite far from the lobby.  When I discovered the phone in our room didn't work, I was able to call the front desk on my cell.  They told me to come back to the lobby with my 9yr. old granddaughter at about 9:00 in the evening and they would give me a new room.  It was too difficult for us to manage, so we did without the phone.  I needed a wake up call.  The man at the front desk said someone would knock on our door at 7:00 A.M.  Didn't happen.  During the night there was very loud jack hammer sort of noise going on all night.
review.negativeRemarks: Make sure phones are working in all rooms.  Warn about construction noise.  I noticed big tour buses at the motel.  I hope people from other places we
review.locationRemarks: Not a good place for tourists.  Bad impression of San Francisco

review.title: Cheap hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: Older yet comfortable room. Lots of airplane noise. IHOP next door conveint

review.title: Motel close to the airport
review.reviewText: We needed a motel close to the airport as it took us almost 6 hours to go 2 hours to get to our destination when we arrived in town. We decided to stay close to the airport so we would be able to make our flight the next morning. We were disappointed with the room we stayed in.  The pictures on the internet make the room look a lot nice than it actually is.  The motel is older and needs some remodeling, but otherwise very clean and the beds were comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The closeness and easy access to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Some remodeling to bring it up to date and more appealing.
review.locationRemarks: The only thing we did was eat at the IHop that was right next door.  Loved that it was close.  Also that the motel is located so close to the airport.

review.reviewText: Very noisy and bathrooms need upgraded bad!  Convenient  location to airport.  Staff very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms

review.title: Avoid at all costs
review.reviewText: Started with long lines to check in as one member of staff appeared new and wasn't sure what he was doing. Expected a basic hotel but was shocked at how filthy the room was. It had an awful smell throughout, holes in the curtains, dirty looking setee and chair, enamel coming off the bath tub. We asked for a taxi to town to get away from the place which took 20mins for the staff to work out how to use the phone before I decided we really could not stay here! I felt like I was in a motel in a horror movie and wouldn't of been able to sleep. I'm pleased to say I got a refund and spent only 30 more for a 4 star union square hotel! Avoid at all costs!

review.title: Hundret of Dollars for what?
review.reviewText: One has to pay a lot for this hotel, only because of the fact, that it is located around San Francisco. This was the worst hotel weve ever stayed, but not even close the cheapest ;) it should be torn down and renews. The bathroom was terrible, the shower looked like its best days were gone, we found several hairs in the room. The WiFi was useless! If you pay like 130 USD per night, choose another location!
review.negativeRemarks: nearly everything
review.locationRemarks: SFO

review.title: Ant hotel
review.reviewText: Ants in the bathroom   Feel the springs in the mattress   Pillows flat and small. TV horrible poor picture quality.

review.title: Decent sleep, a little pricey.
review.reviewText: Jack hammers for road work wasn't a nice addition. I only stayed for 5 hours, I don't have a lot of insight.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower pressure.
review.locationRemarks: I didn't stay long enough.

review.title: A place to lay your head
review.reviewText: I swore I would rather try a different hotel - unfortunately again somehow I landed back here. If you're a traveling businessman and need a hole to lay your head in - this place will suffice. There's no real luxuries and its not the cleanest - but for prices of hotels in SF you probably don't want to be staying at any places cheaper than this.
review.negativeRemarks: I don't mind back-to-basics - but a little care in the hygiene department wouldn't hurt, like the short hairs in the shower soap dish.
review.locationRemarks: Holiday Inn across the street has a bar. There's a IHOP next door for meals and a gas station close-by

review.title: Too expensive
review.reviewText: For what I paid, I expected better.  There was absolutely no breakfast and/or coffee included.   My bathroom although clean, is very run down, needs major remodeling.  The front desk was not knowledgable about driving directions, and at check out, the guy acted like he couldn't speak English.
review.negativeRemarks: the room needs remodel- tiles in bathroom broken, door stuck a lot, drapes did not close properly
review.locationRemarks: Ihop and gas station and airport close.

review.reviewText: Bad conditions, noise, old degraded bathroom are a few reasons not to stay here.
Noisy room beside the ice dispenser curtens where torn door was jammed hard to open

review.title: Hotel near the airport
review.reviewText:
This hotel is fairly inexpensive and offers sufficient confort to travellers passing through on their way to SFO.  Restaurants are adjacent to the hotel which offers a convenient shuttle to the airport, every 30 minutes.  The staff is polite and efficient.  Perhaps not all appliences are working and the room is not in excellent conditions but it's clean and sufficiently functional, if all you need is: eating, showering, sleeping and getting to the airport.  
Great "one night stand!"  Finally, my experience was satisfactory.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the price and convenience.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need a bit of TLC and redecorating. All lamps should be working.
review.locationRemarks: Near SFO, it has a number of good restaurants nearby, such as IHOp, great for breakfast; it also has a pool and a working TV.

review.title: Hotel near the San Francisco airport
review.reviewText: The hotel was reasonably priced and clean.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  It was fine for a brief stay near the airport, but nothing special.
review.negativeRemarks: The room our first night was a bit shabby, but we had a newer room as we were leaving.  Better towels would help.
review.locationRemarks: We stayed here on our arrival and departure, so we did not do anything in the area.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText:
The staff was sooooooooo friendly! 
I felt appreciated that I stayed here.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very nice even when we ate at the restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: No. I know it's not your fault, but parking for visitors is always hard to find even right  across the street where we went to eat.  More a city prob.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to restaurants.

review.title: Beware if arriving late
review.reviewText:
After flight delays, waiting a long time for the hotel shuttle we arrived at this hotel after midnight to be told our reservation had been cancelled and that the hotel was full. While the guy at the desk said it was because the credit card info in Expedia had been rejected, we had no problem with the rest of our trip and reservations made.
We never received any email notification from either the hotel or Expedia about this. 

Had the feeling he had just given away the room to someone else figuring it was so late we weren't coming.

He told us we could wait an hour to find out if there in fact were any rooms, but at that point it was way too late to wait further to be told no rooms.

review.title: very standard
review.reviewText: Basic hotel - no frills. If that's what you're looking for it was fine. Staying by myself, I would stay there again. I would not take my family there for a vacation type weekend, but for just a place to stay it's OK. The facility is dated, however, the staff was very nice. It was challenging to find my room; it is a large facility. Even for the price I paid (for some reason, prices were very high the week I was there) it was high for what it was.

review.title: The Dump by the Airport
review.reviewText: If you want a horrible place to stay. You found it.

review.title: Dirty
review.reviewText: Horribly dirty. Was issued a King and had requested two doubles. Hotel staff were helpful in sorting this out. I didn't even use the shower in the morning, but was thankful the sheets were clean. The walls are so filthy and it smells of mildew. For over $150 per night this was a terrible hotel. Tear the hotel down and rebuild. Thank goodness I didn't see any bugs. I should have stayed in a tent.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

review.title: Not safe
review.reviewText:
The deadbolt was broken from what looked like the door being kicked open. Door knob did not lock either so I had to put a chair up against the door for some protection. Place was booked so nothing could be done. Bathroom shower did not drain and I had to take my shower in backed up water. Bed felt like it had sand in it.

Would never stay her again and will let people know that this hotel is not safe
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service and hotel quality

review.title: It was terrible because smells very horrible
review.reviewText: When I get back the key for the room l heard other lady ask for her money back because she found ants in her bathroom and a spider in her bed.also they not provide breakfast

review.title: Weekend Trip
review.reviewText: For the price I paid I expected more. For example, there were not towels, the phone in the room did not work so we could not contact the front desk for help. The T.V. remote did not work had to walk to the front because of the phone not working to ask for someone to come and fix the TV. It just did fit the price. - Will not stay here again.

review.title: Y' git watcha pay fer.
review.reviewText: We didn't want to pay Holiday Inn Express mid-week rate where we usually stay on week-ends with park-n-fly, and this came up on Expedia. When we recommend to a friend, we will tell then what to watch out for.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, really, since a facility of this quality is needed to cater to certain levels of "clientelle"
review.locationRemarks: SFO - stay overnight to catch an early plane.

review.title: Super dirty
review.reviewText: Staff was nice, location was convenient, there was a restaurant next door, and the price was the lowest in the area. However, I have NEVER stayed in such filth. The carpet had stains and the bathroom was covered in mold from the floor to the bathtub and the walls. Cleanliness is extremely important to me. I can't stay here ever again.
review.negativeRemarks: It needs to be cleaned
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport, freeway, and restaurants.

review.title: Don't stay here
review.reviewText: At check in the staff was rude and unhelpful. It only got worse when we got to our room - dirty and musty smelling. Traffic noise was also a problem. If we had not prepaid thru Expedia we would have left. Way overpriced for this type of hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Attitude of staff, renovation of hotel. Recommend Expedia remove it from their site
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

review.title: Convenient to SFO
review.reviewText: Sorry, I'm repeating my review for my stay of June 8, but the experience was the same. Quote: It's a Travelodge--what do you expect? Me, I expect a clean room, a relatively low price, and a convenient location. So long as the staff aren't rude--they were sufficiently pleasant--and the rooms are clean--they were--I was going to be satisfied and I was. Nothing fancy, but I just needed a place to sleep near SFO. The bed was reasonably comfortable. Of course, you want earplugs given that you are directly under an airport flight path, but if you take a room in lodgings right on top of an airport you should expect that. I know I gave it an "OK" rating of 3 points, but in this case that's not a bad sign. I had no high expectations, and the motel did not exceed them. The more important thing is that it satisfied them. I expected a Travelodge and I got a Travelodge. It was *OK*. No complaints whatsoever.
review.negativeRemarks: The Wifi in the room occasionally dropped out. Perhaps more relay stations could be installed to boost the signal.

review.title: Convenient to SFO
review.reviewText: It's a Travelodge--what do you expect? Me, I expect a clean room, a relatively low price, and a convenient location. So long as the staff aren't rude--they were sufficiently pleasant--and the rooms are clean--they were--I was going to be satisfied and I was. Nothing fancy, but I just needed a place to sleep near SFO. The bed was reasonably comfortable. Of course, you want earplugs given that you are directly under an airport flight path, but if you take a room in lodgings right on top of an airport you should expect that. I know I gave it an "OK" rating of 3 points, but in this case that's not a bad sign. I had no high expectations, and the motel did not exceed them. The more important thing is that it satisfied them. I expected a Travelodge and I got a Travelodge. It was *OK*. No complaints whatsoever.
review.negativeRemarks: The Wifi occasionally dropped out. Maybe some more relay stations could be installed to insure the signal.

review.title: Fair for a one-night stopover, nothing more
review.reviewText: I needed a low-price hotel close to the airport as my flight left in the morning. I called after I made the reservation and made sure it was a non-smoking room, which I got, thankfully. The outlet behind the bedside table was falling out, the shower/toilet area was kinda beat up but at least the room was clean and my daughter and I were able to get a good night's sleep. So if you're arriving late or leaving early and need a cheap motel to stay in for the night, you couldn't do any worse than this.

review.title: Very Bad
review.reviewText: Room was too small. Was very dirty. The service was very bad, had to ask 3 times for towels that were not in the room. Charged extra for microwave and frige even though I was told on the phone prior to our stay it was included. Also said it on website.
review.negativeRemarks: Every thing

review.reviewText: Good place to stay just outside san fran and next to the airport. Clean rooms. Miserable foreign gentleman on reception but all other staff were good & helpful. Enjoyed my stay.

review.title: Good for the price and close to the airport
review.reviewText: If you're looking for low price then this is the place to come. The value is worth what you get. The continental breakfast is pretty good.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom door is difficult to open and close, it's a sliding door (not a standard one with a door knob).

review.title: Hotel is okay cops here looking for hookers pimply
review.reviewText: Its okay service not the greatest lot.of trash outside the lot parking problems

review.title: Great Convenient Hotel Near The SFO Airport.
review.reviewText:
The Front Desk Staff was excellent.  They were friendly, knowledgeable and gave us a warm welcome and quickly checked us in.  We stayed in a two queen bed setup towards the quieter back of the property.

Going in, we knew that this Travelodge was an older property compared to the Newer, more modern high rise construction of the neighboring Holiday Inn or Best Western.  Our objective was to simply spend the night in a hotel room prior to a noon flight out of SFO. For this purpose, this hotel was excellent.

It was only 1.25 miles to the Rental Car Returns building. In less than 5 minutes, we had returned our rental car and was on the Airport Tram to the Terminals within 30 minutes later.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked its location - close to the SFO Airport. Clean rooms with double queen beds. Amenities like a fridge, coffee maker, sitting/reading area.
review.negativeRemarks: The age of the building is definitely showing.
review.locationRemarks: There is a 24 hr. IHOP restaurant in the property.  Extremely accessible by freeways making an easy commute to any Northern CA city.

review.reviewText: Not good if u have small kids. Carpet was very dirty. Bathroom tub was terrible. Price was ok.

review.title: Convenient location from Airport, Value for money
review.reviewText: Very convenient location from SFO Airport, the hotel shuttle is the best part of the stay here, rooms are average in terms of condition and cleanliness but they are certainly suitable to stay overnight and then you can roam around in the city of SFO for the rest of your day. We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights and primarily only for sleeping at night and as per our plan, the hotel turned out to be okay for us. We were skeptical about entering the hotel earlier after reading the other reviews that were so negative. However, we found this hotel to have average room condition still clean enough and good value for money especially considering that you are staying close to SFO in such a great deal ($). Hotel staff was excellent in providing any support needed. they even held our luggage after checkout since we asked them to do so as we could not carry our luggage to a tour we had on that day post-checkout from the hotel. this was very courteous of them to do so. I'm happy overall with this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: location, hotel shuttle is excellent, average rooms but still clean, hotel staff service
review.negativeRemarks: room condition (small cuts on the floor and on walls), need complementary bottle of water in each room, toothpaste was not there in the room
review.locationRemarks: very convenient location - close to SFO airport. no major attractions nearby. but commuting to SFO downtown is easy via BART from the SFO airport

review.reviewText: OK room - a little noisy. Breakfast was OK - cereal and coffee
review.locationRemarks: near airport

review.title: Not that great

review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport with 24hr restaurant close by. Continental breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs updating and maintenance. Drapes were smoke stained with holes. Mold and broken grout in the bathroom. Old TV with bad reception. Carpet dirty.

review.title: Hotel close to airport
review.reviewText:
The hotel room stunk of cigarette smoke in fact reeked of cigarette smoke .
No bath plug to have a bath!
Staff didn't return call when asked either.
Staff not helpful.

review.title: Close to airport. Shower dirty.
review.reviewText: Fast check in. We arrived late and left early. Did not get to try their breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom. Shower was dirty and nasty.
review.locationRemarks: We didn't do anything.

review.title: Travelodge near airport...
review.reviewText: One manager was rude, and the other was quite helpful. The exterior of the buildings was clean. Inside our room though, the floors turned the bottoms of our bare feet black. The door jam had obviously been previously busted in and one lock broken. It made me feel uneasy and unsafe. There was a shoe box of loose wires with an electrical plug sitting under the air conditioner. That was a safety concern for the toddler. One door on the tv armoir wouldn't stay open and had to be propped with a chair. My toddler hit his head on it, walking past.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the airport, affordable, and had a free shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: Repairs to the rooms, more family friendly...
review.locationRemarks: There was a gas station/convenience store and IHOP within walking distance. The IHOP gave us food poisoning.

review.title: Not worth the money I paid.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Basic but ok for a one night stay. The room was extremely basic so I wouldn't want to stay there for a long period of time but if I was a tourist I guess it would be good for just sleeping there.
review.positiveRemarks: location and that there was tv in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: update bathroom and put single beds instead of queen beds. Possibly a refrigerator in the room too.

review.title: Good Value for one night in transit
review.reviewText: This is a good choice when you need a place to close your eyes for a few hours between flights.
review.positiveRemarks: Very close to the airport. Free Shuttle

review.title: Convenient for the traveling businessman
review.reviewText:
This is not a vacation hotel - its a cheap place to crash for the night for road warriors.

Improvements: Unfortunately I arrived 3 hours before check-in. The staff were not accommodating with my request for an earlier check in dispite the fact that the hotel was not full - I waited the full 3 hours.
Got to my room - left my bags and headed to the car to get more - came back to find that someone else had already occupied my room which had my money and passport. Had to spend another 30 mins with staff to sort out.

Is this place conveniently close to the airport - yes... would I stay here again... most likely not.
review.negativeRemarks: More welcoming staff. Better management at reception.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing - only an iHop next door and a Holiday Inn bar across the street. The Holiday In has Racer 5 IPA on tap :)

review.title: Hotel really needs updatiing
review.reviewText: I booked a non-smoking, King for one night, and was given a smoking double Queen. It smelled so awful that I slept under the covers to keep out most of the smell (at least the sheets were clean) and I was worried that I smelled like smoke at my job interview the next day. The whole place is really run down and my television didn't even work.
review.positiveRemarks: There is an IHOP on site where I could gran breakfast. The desk staff was nice as well, and helped me get a cab.
review.negativeRemarks: The whole hotel needs to be shut down and renovated.
review.locationRemarks: It is really close to the airport and great proximity if you are going to one of the many biotech companies near by.

review.reviewText: Its written no smoking room, but smells like ash trial.

review.title: Don't stay at the Travelodge SFO North
review.reviewText: Dirty carpets, filthy decrepit furniture, no way to communicate by telephone with front office in case of emergency, keys/locks don't work, toilet doesn't flush, all but one lightbulb burned out, no luggage assistance.
review.positiveRemarks: Worst dive I've been in for a long time.
review.negativeRemarks: The whole place needs an upgrade. Management is evidently too cheap to perform even basic maintenance.

review.title: An inexpensive airport hotel
review.reviewText: This huge hotel (more than 5 buildings) does not pretend to be anything than what it is: an inexpensive place to stay overnight that is near the SF airport. Quite clean, no frills, but it's not for those who are looking for frills. You will get a good bed and shower, micro and mini-fridge in the room, hotel pool, adequate breakfast, and very good and frequent free shuttle service to the airport terminals. Try to get a room on the east side, away from the freeway sounds.

The room was ok. It needed a more
Modern tv.The tv was old. The mattress was also old

This was a dingy hotel and not worth the price. Staff were not too helpful either.

review.reviewText: I only stayed for the 1 night for the purpose of getting to the SF airport on time, 7:00 am take off flight. The price was right and I got to the my flight on time. It was a basic simple room that satisfied my purposes.
review.positiveRemarks: The price. The shuttle to the air port was free. The hotel was only 1.5 miles from SFO airport.
review.locationRemarks: It was 1.5 miles from the airport and the airport shuttle was free.

review.title: Convenient location and adjacent IHOP
review.reviewText: I had a late check-in at the hotel. The hotel was easy to access from the road, had ample parking, and my room was light up bright when I am checking in, which I felt safe since I can see if anyone was in the room. The room was in general comfortable with microwave and fridge, but I think TV and the outlets needs to be updated (most hotels now have outlets on tabletop lamp for easy access for 3Cs), but that is no big problem since I did not stay long and had a flight to catch. The hairdryer however was new.
review.negativeRemarks: update TV and outlets
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is right on the strip of hotel near the airport, a short drive brings you to Tanforan Mall, which is pretty decent to spend a few hours.

review.title: JUST AN OK HOTEL
review.reviewText:
THE PRICE WAS RIGHT BUT IT WAS JUST AN OK HOTEL. NOTHING SPECIAL.
IF PRICE IS IMPORTANT, THIS IS A GOOD CHOICE.
review.positiveRemarks: NICE STAFF AT THE FRONT DESK
review.negativeRemarks: THE ROOM COULD HAVE BEEN CLEANER, ESPECIALLY THE SHOWER
review.locationRemarks: GOOD LOCATION FOR SFO AND RESTAURANTS

review.title: Easy access to So.SF
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Room was clean, bed comfortable.

review.title: Cheap and suitable for a one night stay.
review.reviewText: A friend and I needed an airport hotel last minutes and found a cheap deal for this hotel; for the price we paid, we couldn't have asked for more. It was clean, there was a big bed, a bathroom and therefore suitable for the 12 hours we were going to be there. The condition of the room was not at its best, it looked very tired however the staff were friendly and granted our request when we asked for a different room that was closer to reception due to the amount of luggage we had.

review.title: Worst motel ever
review.reviewText: Needed a quick rest before we changed planes in SFO flew out next morning. We got there past midnight and they put us in the building that was furthest away from the lobby. This is a big (old, dingy, worn) complex and it took us 10 minutes to walk to our room in cold rain and wind. Pretty bad experience that lead us to even more disappointing room that had bad a smell, paint peeling, and a bathroom door that was stuck and did not pull out easily from the wall. When I managed to pull the door out a few inches and regretted it. - - It had green and Black mold/mildew all over it. Bath tub was so grose I had to cover it with the shower curtain so I did not have to look at it. I wanted take a picture to warn future unfortunate guests but did not want such a grose picture in my cell phone! Filthy carpets with cigarette holes, loud and dirty heat/AC wall unit, it goes on and on. It made our 5 hrs of rest an awful experience. Think it would've been so much better to have waited for our next flight at the airport. Stay Away!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Location - close to SFO and they provide shuttle service.
review.negativeRemarks: everything.

review.title: Outdated in need of remodel
review.reviewText: Furniture worn out with tears in fabric. SHOWER terrible needs replacing

review.title: Room caught on fire
review.reviewText:
We showed up, turned on the TV, to relax. Around 25 minutes later, the TV dies and started releasing smoke. The stench if burning plastic was terrible, will never leave me. The sound was ear piercing, but I garnered the strength to call reception for assistance. Ring, ring, ring... Nothing.

I called again. Ring, ring, ring..
Hello?
My room is catching on fire help the TV is burning!
Oh that is bad. Would you like a new room?
NO I NEED HELP THERE IS SMOKE COME FAST!
Oh. I will call the maintenance guy to fix your TV, but if you like I can give you a new room..
I DONT THINK YOU UNDERSTSND THERE WANT BE A ROOM IN 15 MINUTES!
Oh. You can come to reception to get a new key....

Never again. Pay 5$ more and sleep safe.

review.title: close to airport

review.title: Only good thing is proximity to the airport
review.reviewText: I'm not sure what I was expecting. I think I was suduced by the low rate. I was just looking for something reasonable by the airport and this one had a free continental breakfast so I thought why not. I'll tell you why not. The walls are paper thin and I heard cars driving by all night. The pillows were rock hard and the covers on the bed were super thin. The tub in the bathroom was peeling and looked filthy. I wore my sandals in the shower. Half of the outlets in the room didn't work and half the light bulbs were burnt out. Overall disappointed with the hotel but it was cheap and close to the airport so I guess you get what you pay for.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport. Did have a complimentary breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Desperately needs a remodel

review.title: Lied to!
review.reviewText: Our flight was changed and we ended up having an overnight lay over in San Fransisco. I called before we caught our flight and booked a room here. I was told there was shuttle service. I explained that our flight would be getting in at midnight. I was told no problem. When we went to catch a shuttle I called the hotel to get shuttle service and was told there were no more shuttles for the night. We had to take a taxi that was a bit spendy. Our room had a funky smell. The hotel front desk was rude and there was a terrible loud noise that sounded like a vacuum in the room above us. Would never stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: I really can't think of anything. It was very disappointing.
review.negativeRemarks: The room and hotel was run down. The staff needs to be friendly.
review.locationRemarks: It was fairly close to the airport.

review.title: Dissatified with room 617
review.reviewText:
The hotel is reasonable however room 617 had a worn out rug with white stains. My check in was late in the evening and i was tired so i didnt have time to make a complaint.
Overall, i would still recommand this hotel.

review.title: Fine for a night or two. Good price for SF.
review.reviewText: Best price I could find for San Francisco and easy to find. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was mostly clean except a few things on the floor and in the chair left from previous guest. Nothing gross though. Tight parking, but it was free. Beds were clean and comfy. Not very many outlets for plugging in phones or other electronics. Had to unplug the clock for my husband to plug in his CPAP machine. Didn't get to use pool due to cold weather and late arrival, but it looked nice. Passed on the continental breakfast due to room too packed and went around the corner to the IHop which was wonderful with a very friendly staff. I would recommend going down to the continental breakfast before 8am to get a table. Easy access to the airport with shuttles and only about 15 min away from the zoo. Would definitely stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: More selection at the continental breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Only about 10 to 20 min drive to most of the attractions like Pier 39, the zoo, the Golden Gate Bridge, ect. Very close to airport.
