review.title: Close to SFO
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for, as they say, so it was pretty much what I expected. But it was REALLY run down. Wall paper in the bathroom was peeling off the wall. The shower tile was either worn down or had been painted before and the paint was wearing off, but it looked like crap. The TV was from the 90's and pretty much just filled the space on the dresser. several of the lights didn't work and the heater/ac was DOA. The bed was comfortable enough and there was an IHOP right next door, so for convenience it worked.

review.title: It's not the Ritz, but it did the job!
review.reviewText: I arrived at SFO at midnight and had a connecting flight at 8:00 AM, so I just needed a place to lay my head for a few hours. Pretty close to the airport (5 minutes via taxi, about 10-15 minutes via shuttle, depending on how fast the driver is and how many other stops are along the way). Check-in was very fast and easy, and the room was clean, and had a bed and a bathroom. For $72 that was fine by me. The best part was that the bed was surprisingly big and comfy! Check-out was also super fast and easy.

review.negativeRemarks: Air the room. Use better internet connection.

review.title: We needed a convenience to the SFO airport...
review.reviewText:
This Travelodge was only 2-miles from SFO, had a shuttle, on-site parking and food served in the room!
Breakfast attendant was exceptionally observant and good. I would have liked some youghert, but gosh, a banana and toast was fine.

At first I was concerned about noise, but all traffic and airline noise faded out by 11:00pm. Beds were comfy and clean.

The check-in was busy but the staff (only two men) were GREAT! Professional and friendly, inspite of the stressful conditions.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking prices through Global Parking were misleading: advertised at $5.99 / night zoomed to almost $10.00/night after "taxes and +" . YUCK!
review.locationRemarks: Weonly used the hotel and it's quite acceptable facilities...

I didn't really bother to look at the free breakfast after experiencing the room i didnt really wanted to try anithing to eat

It was a place to lay your head down and not much more.

review.reviewText: Great price, wonderful staff. made up for the weird heating in the room (not very regulated i was either too cold or too warm after a while) and the noise of the airport nearby. I would stay here again for a night or two for sure!
review.positiveRemarks: The price and location are worth it it was so close to the airport, and there was a shuttle to take us at 5 am. The staff was very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The building we stayed in was older and not insulated for sound-proofing I recommend earplugs if you wake easily or are distracted by noise!
review.locationRemarks: There is a great Mexican Restaurant near the water 9 min away on Old Bayshore Road we watched the planes land at the airport while we ate.

review.title: Did not stay a second night.
review.reviewText: For the rate I paid, I couldn't ask for very much. However, I was willing to pay more to stay somewhere else the following night. The staff was friendly, but the rooms were just too old, dark and dingy. It's not that the rooms weren't clean, it was because the carpet, walls, and bathroom tiles had stains from being many years old, which gave the impression of being dirty.
review.negativeRemarks: Complete renovation.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport, just off a major highway.

review.title: Breakfast, and clean room. Wireless Internet acces
review.reviewText: Breakfast, and clean room. Wireless Internet access is ... unstable .. meets all of the other.

review.title: Just OK.
review.reviewText: We needed a one night extra in San Francisco. This was OK for the price. Right next to the 101 Highway. Room could use some cleaner furniture.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean or replace couch and recliner chair in room. Really looked dirty and dingy. The rest of the room was clean enough.
review.locationRemarks: Close to freeway, but was ok on noise level for sleeping.

review.title: It worked
review.reviewText: It's close to the airport and it's inexpensive. The staff was polite and helpful but the room and bathroom were old and worn down. The price was low and it worked for a one night stay

review.title: Disgusting!
review.reviewText: The hotel room was filthy. The carpet was wet and dirty. We realized this after taking our shoes off only to find our socks immediately were wet and black. The bathroom had mold and there was a huge burn in the carpet from an iron. We didn't even want to shower for fear of getting dirtier. The room had a sour smell to it too. The lady in the breakfast area worked hard and was very attentive to our needs. For the most part...YUCK!

review.title: there are better ones in the area
review.reviewText: room was dingy nice ride to airport bed uncomfortable
review.negativeRemarks: needs to be redone

review.title: Travelodge Review
review.reviewText: The room had four lights, three of which were broken and did not work. The bathroom door was broken and was very hard to open and close. The step outside the door was lower than usual and I fell out of the room twice.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix all the damage in the rooms.

review.title: Horrible
review.reviewText: Room stinks very old facility . Will recommend this to any one

review.title: am flight
review.reviewText: very low price, clean room, no frills, close to airport and I-Hop

review.title: okay for the price.
review.reviewText: One night stay is okay here as its not super clean and smoking odor everywhere.
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness

review.title: It was nice clean quit and comfortable..
review.reviewText: It was a nice get away. Very close to the airport and the shuttle was available when I needed it.The IHop is attached to the office and was very convenient. I will come back

review.title: Hotel appeared old/run -down, needs upgrade.
review.reviewText: Did not spend a lot of time in room, but there were 2 big stains in the carpet.
review.positiveRemarks: 1 good thing is that its close to SFO
review.negativeRemarks: remodel
review.locationRemarks: location is close to SFO and Caltran sta.

review.title: Easy near SFO
review.reviewText: Economical good choice to overnight before an early flight. IHOP resautant is nice.

review.title: Could be a lot better with a little effort!
review.reviewText:
Basic but usually good enough, this time the heater wasn't working and the weather being a bit cold we had to use our coats to add to the bedding so as to be warm enough for sleep.
Just a bit of maintenance and a lick o paint here and there would make so much difference...

review.title: Maybe if it's all you can afford
review.reviewText:
Got stranded in SFO and saw this hotel available and it has an airport shuttle that picks up every 30 mins at the hotel stops at SFO.
It took them 10 minutes to find my reservation. Then I get a room that's a long hike through the parking lot. It smells like pot. There is a police car potrolling through the large parking lot which isn't well lit. Get to room and it's pretty run down. The door to the outside has a big gap under it so I stuffed a hotel towel to keep the cold and any critters out. The bed spread and carpet were stained. The TV, toilet, and shower worked. The door locked. If that's all you care about then it's OK. You get what you pay for I guess but I would not stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Just about everything.
review.locationRemarks: There is a McDonald's accross the street and Houlhans a couple blocks away.

review.title: bad choice
review.reviewText:
picked this place, at the last minute and reviews seemed okay. The folks at the reception were polite and friendly.Unfortunately the room left a lot to be desired, i was itching all over after an hour in bed, not sure if it was bugs or whatver. The less said about the bathrooms the better. Internet connection was good

Had to check out and book another hotel. The ratings for this place are misleading, it truly was a bad experience

review.title: The hotel is rundown.
review.reviewText: The hotel is in need of some serious repairs. The shower soaks the floor, the bathroom door gets stuck and doesn't lock. I should have stayed somewhere else!

review.title: San Fran airport
review.reviewText:
Good for the price
Heater could have been warmer and blankets thicker
But an okay room
Don't expect much from bfast.
Fruit and cereal.

review.title: Pitstop
review.reviewText: We took a road trip from LA to SF and just needed a place to crash before we went into the city the next day. This place was decent enough. It could really use some updates, like ensuring every restroom door closes completely. The room was a little more rundown than i would've liked but we did pay like $50 for the room. It was quiet and i highly recommend it if you are just crashing here for a night. Maybe two. But no more than that. Also, the sea birds are really loud in the morning.

review.title: convenient for air travel.
review.reviewText: shuttle personnel were helpful and friendly stay was too short to evaluate more
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast was acceptable but might have more fruit

review.title: Close to the airport w/ free parking & a shuttle.
review.reviewText: I've stayed here many times & enjoyed it every time!

review.title: Excellent stay for budget
review.reviewText: Ihop resturant on prop...front desk staff were awesome...friendly....cared!

review.title: Perfect for the price. Mostly blue collar guests.
review.reviewText: Next to freeway but noise level wa acceptable. Definitely would stay again.

review.title: The price is right.
review.reviewText: The hotel is very conveniently located near the airport. Nothing fancy but adequate in all respects and a good value. I have stayed there before and plan to return again.
review.negativeRemarks: TV's are old and standard definition. Rooms could be updated.
review.locationRemarks: Primarily I was interested in its convenience to the airport.

review.title: Great facility for the price
review.reviewText: Expecting less because of price but got a very decent single room (King bed). Room was clean, bathroom very clean, no room smell, wifi in room and very friendly hotel staff. If you're looking for the cheapest stay for a night or two around SFO, look no further.
review.positiveRemarks: Low price, clean room, friendly staff and free shuttle bus.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: Simple, economy hotel. Non-smoking room still smelled like smoke. But it was clean, and they provided a decent breakfast in the morning. Pre-paid on expedia, so check in and check out was very fast and super easy
review.positiveRemarks: It was inexpensive. Good breakfast for the price of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Non smoking rooms should be deodorized to actually smell non smoking
review.locationRemarks: Not much close to the hotel. We were not flying out from the airport, just stayed there because it was cheap. There is an IHOP attached to the hotel

review.title: Spend a little more and get a better room.
review.reviewText: The staff was polite, it's convenient enough to SFO, but if you spent a little bit more you could find a hotel that doesn't have big cracks in the wall, rips in the curtain, and that has rooms that are just generally a little bit gross. The long term parking for SFO they have here is very reasonably priced, and the hotel room's price is fine - the rooms are just a bit grubby. If you don't care about that and purely wanted to get the absolute cheapest option by SFO, then you've found the right place. It's not horrible; just a little sad.
review.negativeRemarks: Room quality and cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO, that's all I needed it for.

review.title: Close to Airport
review.reviewText: Really requires some renovation work, not a lot of plugs, and the ones you found the plug wouldn't stay in. The bathroom really needed work and a new fan. Windows were old, and the decor was very out of date. The breakfast in the morning was disappointing not a lot of options.
review.negativeRemarks: Renovations to the rooms
review.locationRemarks: The Airport

review.title: Got bitten by Bed Bugs & Scabies
review.reviewText: I had a terrible stay and although i was offered a discount feel i should have a full refund of my fee. My room was shabby which actually i didn't mind but the sheets were obviously dirty and in the night i got bitten by bed bugs. When i arrived at my holiday destination my skin was crawling and i had to go to the pharmacy as i was diagnosed with Scabies. There are apparently some newer rooms i was told later but i would say avoid this place at all cost unless you need somewhere cheap. Staff were lovely though.

review.title: Good airport parking
review.reviewText: Room was only okay, but had a very good airport parking lot.

review.title: Economical and accommodating
review.reviewText: We were kindly assisted in booking excursions, and we appreciated the hotel staff, including the breakfast room attendants.

review.title: LDecrepit dirty shabby - a disgusting rat hole,
review.reviewText: Old dirty decrepit neglected over priced long term parking an $11 per day scam. Furniture worn and dirty carpet needed replacement years ago so too the furniture and accessories. Linens threadbare and worn. All in all a bloody disgusting digrace

review.title: poor hotel near the airport
review.reviewText: a hotel that does not accept our debit card, when all the ones in New Zealand where we just were do the room curtains did not cover the windows so we were on display to people passing by on the way to their rooms
review.negativeRemarks: service and curtains
review.locationRemarks: none or your business

review.title: Good for the price you pay.
review.reviewText: You can't go into this hotel expecting anything exceptional. But it was very decent for what you are paying.

For the price it was great, I guess. But, I had two different rooms during my stay. Both were wildly inconsistent in terms of upkeep. First room had a standing shower only, Second bathroom had a bathtub/shower both looked very old, patched up, and cheaply upkept. First room broken AC/Heater controls, second room AC/heater worked great. Both rooms 4 chairs all appeared soiled, and disgusting. Putting some type of Fitted sheets or something on top of them may make them appear less disgusting. I didn't use either coffee pot but the first room's one looked really old and gross, while the second room had a nice new looking one(which i would have used if I needed to). First room's TV had many channels TV appeared to work as intended, while the second room's TV only had about 11 channels maybe and 3 were ESPN's. Both TV's are extremely dated. The safe in the second room appeared broken. Little things like the first room appeared to be missing hangers, the second room's door was little broken (you almost have to slam it to make sure it is shut). The staff was very helpful and nice. I wish there was a little more to the breakfast other than just carbs. The internet was wildly inconsistent but overall very slow, if I got any speed over 80kbs a second it would be a miracle. I tried at least 4 different networks but all were slow, and they also would kick you off or disconnect you after a while, this was the case on two different devices.
review.negativeRemarks: Upkeep
review.locationRemarks: Located nicely around the bay area and a short trip into the city,

review.title: Just fine, but not the greatest
review.positiveRemarks: It was convenient to the airport and reasonably priced.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast was disappointing. The internet did not work at night and the night person did not pass on the info to the day people.

review.title: Nice quiet hotel close to airport
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for 2 nights. Now, if you are expecting he Ritz, then stay at the Ritz. This hotel was cheap and cheerful and the staff were very friendly. The breakfast is basic - toast, cereals, coffee, pastries, fruit and juice. That is all but there is an IHOP attached to the hotel. The shuttle bus to the airport is very convenient with shuttles every half hour and it is easy to get to the Bart. There is a mall that is 2.5 miles away by foot which also has a Bart stop (to get into Sf city). If ou want, you can also walk to the car rental area or to the airport as it is only about a mile or so way.

This was an excellent base for our visit to the Bay Area and the room served its purpose well - ie a comfortable bed, in a clean, quiet room.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast could be a little more inclusive. I have seen better breakfasts at similar motels
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport, a mall and the Bart which can take you into downtown San Francisco. Has a big car park if you have a car.

review.title: what a dirty hotel
review.reviewText: i made a reservation for a single bed non smoking room instead i was given a double bed smoking room. it was dirty there were parts of the carpet that were missing and the internet was a joke. Very loud at night too.

review.title: Was nice room and price we love the day at Sf
Easy access to the airport. TV remote was broken.
review.reviewText: Apart form the broken TV remote and the wake-up call that I did not get, everything else was within expectations.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, simple and an efficient shuttle to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Make sure the rooms are fully functional. Make sure wake-up calls are dependable.
review.locationRemarks: Not of interest to me.

review.title: Cheap option near airport
review.reviewText: We needed a cheap place to stay near SFO before a 6am flight. This fit the bill. We had realistic expectations and just needed a place to catch a few hours of sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: Some bonuses: free parking, microwave, fridge, free shuttle to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: You get what you pay for - the room was a bit grungy.
review.locationRemarks: SFO airport

review.title: tres decue
review.negativeRemarks: every thing

review.title: The place should be torn down.
review.reviewText: The room smelled so bad we could hardly sleep. We heard every person who walked by and every word they said, the blankets were dirty, the bathroom was moldy and the wood work rotted. Even the TV cable connection was broken. I had to prop it up with a magazine and there was only on broadcast channel.
review.negativeRemarks: Tear it down.

review.title: Terrible hotel!
review.reviewText: The room was terrible! It was suppose to be a non-smoking room but the room smell like smoke all the time. I got sick because of that!

review.title: The bare minimum - as expected
review.reviewText: Totally fine if you just need a bed.

review.title: Practical place to stay but do not expect much.
review.reviewText:
Room is worn out with bathroom almost rotting away. Quite outdated furnature and badly insulated cealing and walls. Noisy and bedding not warm enough during our stay in december.
Is was clean, though.
Staff really makes an effort and is hospitable.
review.negativeRemarks: Please see above: technical state of the rooms and the bedding.

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: Shuttle service was useful and the front desk checked us in early. Even though one of the bed side lamps didn't work, no biggie, bang for the buck!
review.locationRemarks: Gas station with a convenience store

review.title: for the sake of affortable price
review.reviewText: useless Wifi, disconnected landline phone, shaking down washroom fan, noicy street over night through the window, cheap breakfast in a dirty crowded small room, etc.

review.title: A very simple hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel looks like a very a motel. It supply free breakfast which is OK, but the problem is there too much people eating breakfast, but the staff close the supply of breakfast no matter how many people are still in line.The hotel has 200 rooms. It always has a lot people waiting for breakfast but it close at 9:00am exactly.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast time should be extened.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located near San Francisco International Airport about 5 minutes to the terminal. With some restaurant closed by. There is a Costco Store

review.title: Everything is ok
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for the place is clean and I like the small amenities as well as the breakfast. The parking seems to be shared so there's not enough of it, you may need to walk a distance to your car humping heavy luggage.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: Room is fine except no microwave or fridge. A little noisy since close to highway.

review.title: It was pleasant
review.reviewText: It was nice stay

review.title: Amazing
review.reviewText: For the price I for the room couldn't ask for more. Would stay here again if I'm ever back in San Francisco.

review.title: Good as a place to sleep
review.reviewText: Location and everything was good. My problem is that they require a $100 security deposit. They said I'd get it back but I don't think its fair they run the card with the charge upon checking in. I also don't like that there's no warning about that charge until you get there.
Fair at the price

review.title: Nothing to write home about.
review.reviewText: Poor @ best.

review.title: Much nicer than expected
review.reviewText: Although the accommodations were rather basic, the room and bed were both comfortable, the staff were very nice and the continental breakfast was a surprise. The room was quiet and the free airport shuttle fit the bill. This was just an overnight to be close to the airport for a very early morning flight. The hotel worked fine!
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, comfortable and I especially liked that it had a free shuttle to the airport!

review.title: Clean & close to everything
review.reviewText: The mattress was a little worn but overall this was a clean inexpensive hotel. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: great stay for price
review.reviewText: The staff is amazing at this place!!! super helpful and willing to give any info to make your stay a positive one. The room was simple. A bit outdated. However it had coffee maker and safe in the room which was nice to have. One thing that stood out was the smell of a CLEAN smoke free room! The place was spotless and the beds immaculate!!! I would definitely stay again!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was fabulous and the room was AMAZINGLY clean!
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms definitely need to be updated, showers furniture etc. But with the cleanliness going on here who cares! Give me old and clean any day!!!
review.locationRemarks: Not much on the location. Very close to freeway so kinda noisy. BUT THE amazing staff will offer you a shuttle to downtown for 15 bucks per person!

review.title: Functional
review.reviewText: This is a functional hotel to stay at if you have an early flight out of SFO. The hotel has not been updated in years and everything is a bit run down. The rooms are clean but rather dingy. The staff was polite and efficient. The airport shuttle came on schedule.
review.positiveRemarks: It is close to the airport with a free shuttle. For an early morning flight it is very convenient. It was inexpensive.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel needs a renovation, new fixtures, furniture and carpet would go a long way.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport. Close enough to the city and with the free shuttle you could easily jump on BART at SFO to get in and out of the city.

review.title: Best value for the price
review.reviewText:
I had a room at the furthest end of the hotel and it seemed almost dead with tons of vacancy and parking. By 9 p.m. the entire lot was full and it seemed that every room was booked.

Pros:
price- I stayed in a room 3x the price in downtown Oakland which was much more cramped albeit in a more hip area but this place charged an additional $20 for parking. Travelodge doesn't charge for parking but I advise that you get there before 8 p.m. to make sure you have a spot.
room- the size is adequate for four people and you won't feel cramped if were a hotel in the City.
proximity- walking distance to restaurants and McDonalds. Its South San Francisco so it is close to East Bay and the Peninsula

Cons-
Hot water took forever to start. I had to have maintenance see if there was a problem.
Condensation all over the floor surrounding the room heater/cooler
Thin walls. I could hear people next door

review.positiveRemarks: location to the airport very closer
review.negativeRemarks: bed is not good
review.locationRemarks: NA

review.reviewText: The reservation was there, and the staff was helpful and friendly. Having IHOP there was great.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport and reasonable price, as well as the shuttle service.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs renovations
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport.

review.title: Good location for our visit.
review.reviewText: Pleasant surprise by the size and amenities of the room for the price.

review.title: Grossed Out in San Francisio
review.reviewText:
Where to start. How about pulling into this hotel and always feeling you need to watch your back or you will get mugged, which is reinforced by police cars that drive through the parking lot like an episode of COPS. And then there are the room keys that don't work - it took 4 different keys for me, and one of them only worked occasionally. And then there is the room, the glorious room. When you walk in you will realize you have hit rock bottom, and this is the gateway.

My room had iron burns from the doorway to the bathroom (not sure why), the rug was so grimy you will not want to take off your shoes let alone your socks, broken furniture, wall paper peeling off the walls, sheets that feel fifty years old, and a bathroom that was the grossest I have come across in a US hotel. The towel rack was broken in the middle - I didn't even want to know what that was all about.

If you are travelling for business, or are concerned for your personal safety I would recommend you try some other place. This place is just plain gross and scary.
review.negativeRemarks: It was unsafe, dirty & broken
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport, but in a sort of industrial area

review.title: Nice Hotel close to airport and freeway
review.negativeRemarks: small fridge would be good
review.locationRemarks: airport freeway and gas station very covinient

review.title: Strategic location
review.reviewText: Very convinient and comfortable. Few minutes to the airport and easy transportation.

review.title: Cheap hotel, you get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Experience was fine, great staff and rooms were available last minute. The condition of the room was another thing! Wallpaper peeling off throughout the room, furniture looked like it had been beat up in the mud, the tub was beyond repair and you couldn't pay me to take a shower, the bed was the only thing I touched in that room! Wouldn't wven walk on the floors without shows on!

review.title: No parking near room. HVAC system extremely noisy
review.reviewText: See above
review.negativeRemarks: see above

review.title: No room service was done for our 3 days stay
review.reviewText: Not good

review.title: Pretty basic
review.reviewText: The hotel was pretty basic and not very clean. Staff were ok and there was available parking even late at night. Breakfast was a nightmare - a tiny room with lots of people having to wait for tables. But its cheap and a very easy to get to from SFO airport
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness, staff attitude, breakfast area
review.locationRemarks: The airport & San Francisco!

review.title: Very old property, needs remodeling
review.reviewText: Not worth $215 per night. This is a 1 star hotel at a 3-4 star price.
review.negativeRemarks: Cannot provide Expedia reciept

review.title: Welcome home
review.reviewText: My son came home from Arizona after many years and I live in a home with a lot of people and my other children and myself wanted private quality time with him so we got a room at this hotel. I was surprised to find that at such a great low price the rooms were clean comfortable and the service was excellent. The breakfast was a plus! I ended up staying for a week! Awesome!

review.title: The rooms were filthy and outdated.
review.reviewText: We had to request to move rooms and when moved we were put in very back of the property. Where police patrolled and illegal activities took place. My family and I will never stay at a travel lodge again.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade rooms and make guests feel safe and appreciated.
review.locationRemarks: Good location to visit San Francisco and outlying attractions.

review.title: Worst stay in A long time
Noisy and tired
review.reviewText: If your used to sleeping between a motorway and a main highway with constant traffic noise then your ok. Old units that need major renovations. BUT it is what it is, close to the airport, cheap and you wont be late for your early flight.
review.negativeRemarks: Accomodation blocks

review.title: Not bad, slow Internet
review.reviewText: The Internet was almost useless, it was so slow and prone to endless waiting. The front desk seemed to be overworked and not always very responsive. The room itself was fine; could have used more outlets. Lots of noise from a very nearby highway, and the people staying at or near the hotel were somewhat dodgy.
review.negativeRemarks: Terrible Internet connection
review.locationRemarks: Excellent proximity to SFO

review.title: Not a very good hotel to stay.
review.reviewText: The air conditioning was not working. Also. The bath tub was in horrible state. The hotel staff was kind enough to change my room. But even the 1st change room was same. I had to change again.

review.title: Inexpensive for a reason
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful and pleasant. There is no elevator to the upper floors which made taking a large suitcase up there a little difficult. My room had a weird smell, like the carpet had mold in it. The shower tiles were chipped, some of the paint was peeling in the bathroom, and the bathroom floor had some deep scrape marks in it. The bed linens were clean and fresh though, and the bed was comfortable. I'd rate this as an okay place to stay, although I will bring a room freshener next time....
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was pleasant and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms need some serious upkeep, new tiles, fresh paint, carpet deep cleaning....
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO with a free shuttle service to and from the airport.

review.title: Not a clean hotel or safe one
review.reviewText: We paid to keep our vehicle parked for a week in their parking lot. When we got back from our vacation we found the window broken into, & and another guest also found his car two windows broken into. When I reserved or room I asked would or car be safe and they said yes & the rooms were so bad & the noise from the HWY ,I will never stay their again.
review.negativeRemarks: Improved!

review.reviewText: Terrible, Room smelt of mold, front door seal half gone, rotten door jambs on bathroom, heater had cold air then once in a while it would turn into an inferno. I almost would rather sleep in my work vehicle.

review.title: Just Say No!!
review.reviewText:
There were absolutely NO other rooms to be found when I looked this one up on Expedia. I had an early flight and it was unexpected so I didnt have prior knowledge to have made reservations somewhere else. Anyway, I check in and the young man behind the counter stated they were the only ones left with rooms. He did not lie. The front desk staff both the Gentleman and the Lady were busy but so friendly and helpful. The staff could not have been better. 5 stars for them!!

The room... No.. Just no. I did not lay on the bed. I sat on the corner of a couch and looked at it. Stared at it. I started itching. I think it was mental maybe but there were too many tiny bug looking creatures crawling around in the recesses of my mind to dare to lay on anything. The bathroom. Dirty. Carpet? Never took off my shoes. If I had it to do over again I would have slept on a chair or even the floor of the terminal at SFO. Gross. I would never stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: It could be bulldozed, rebuilt and give the awesome staff a building worthy of their service level.

review.title: Not so nice
review.reviewText: The room needs an update. The shower looked and felt dirty. Beds were ok. I will not go back to this hotel.

review.title: Cheap, that's about it
review.reviewText: Well, sheets felt like they were clean... Can't say either of us took a shower - the bathroom was absolutely DISGUSTING! There was visible mold, paint peeling and it was just old and dingy. For a brief stay before going to the airport early in the morning it was tolerable. However, I would never stay there again and definitely never recommend it to anyone else, ever. Location and shuttle were convenient to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Lots

review.title: This place was gross and I felt that it was unsafe
review.reviewText: The whole time I was here I thought I was going to get robbed. Also, my room was small and extremely dirty. The only good thing about this place is that it has HBO.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: There's not much to do.

review.title: Bad condition
review.reviewText: Everything in the bathroom need to be changed!
review.negativeRemarks: Renovate!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was pleasant, but maids attempted to enter the room in spite of do-not-disturb sign, disrupting sleep. Bedding went unchanged. Carpeting was permanently damaged and felt dirty. There price was right and the location was convenient.

review.title: Worst experience of my life
review.reviewText: I will like to have my money back------the worst experience of my life

review.title: Good Price!
review.reviewText: I found this hotel on Expedia and liked the price. The closeness of the hotel to the San Francisco Airport was exactly what I needed. I had a 6AM flight and needed a shuttle bus to get me to the airport at 4AM. The shower facilities are old and needs fixing. It was not attractive and seemed like it was not clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to the airport and offers a shuttle bus to accommodate my early schedule. The gas station located next to the Travelodge had good price.
review.negativeRemarks: It seemed to only show 4 restaurant listings (2 were pizza) - yuck! What about Asian fare and other options? IHOP was expensive and OK food.
review.locationRemarks: Arrived after dark and did not see any information showing what to do nearby.

review.title: Decent hotel, close to airport.
review.reviewText: Good hotel for last night in SF. Free transfers to airport and great pool.

review.positiveRemarks: Maintenance personnel were very friendly and helpful when the tv in my room did not work. He moved me to a different room and helped me carry my lugga
review.negativeRemarks: Smell of room, sheets stained, blankets stained burn holes, moldy caulking in bathroom, mattresses very hard and pillows also.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText:
Good: The hotel was close to the airport, cheap, had wifi, easy check in, perfect for our unplanned overnight layover
Bad: It was quite run down. The lobby is undergoing renovation, and I hope the rest of the hotel follows. The mattresses had rips in them, there was a bit of garbage near the bed that was missed, half of the outlets didn't work, and the carpet was damp and stained.
grumpy clerk outdated room over priced
review.negativeRemarks: every thing

review.title: My One Night Stay
review.reviewText: The staff were friendly and very helpful. The hotel was located by the airport, which was very convenient when I had to fly back to my final destination. However, I was a little disappointed when I stepped into water on the floor in the bathroom when I had not even showed or gone to the bathroom. It seemed kind of gross to me. The walls are also somewhat thin, so it was easy to hear people next door watching TV and the wind, etc. outside.
review.positiveRemarks: The king sized bed was pretty comfortable and TV was decent.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe make the bathroom a little cleaner and provide some of the basics (i.e. lotion, etc.) in it.
review.locationRemarks: The airport is nearby, but I don't really know San Francisco all that well.

review.title: Affordable and basic
review.reviewText: If you want a comfortable hassle-free stay, you should probably spend a little more and select a different property. But if you want something basic and inexpensive that is safe and relatively comfortable, this place is ok. If you don't have a car it is likely you will have to walk some distance outdoors to your room. Shuttle service to the airport runs every thirty minutes and is reliable.

review.title: Good For A Late Night
review.reviewText:
The staff were great. The subway from the airport to downtown was on strike, and they made a reservation for me with a van that was much cheaper than taking a cab to town. Staff was great.

The room was okay. Nothing special. It was clean though the towels could use a little more bleach.

I spent one night and it was nice. There's a IHOP that's open right next door, so I had a late night snack.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaner walls and nicer towels.
review.locationRemarks: IHOP right next door.

review.title: Affordable Accommodations near SFO
review.reviewText: I was attending a conference at another hotel in South San Francisco. Our group rate was $150. The Travel Lodge was half that amount. It was literally across the street from the conference hotel. The room has not been renovated in some time. There was some pealing wallpaper in the bathroom, and the TV was probably about 20 years old. The mattress was comfortable and the heater worked. The complimentary breakfast was Spartan at best. All in all if you just need a place to lay your head down at night, this is most certainly an affordable alternative.
review.positiveRemarks: The room rate was great and the front desk staff was very accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: Most everything
review.locationRemarks: South San Francisco is basically one huge industrial park. Unless you are going there are business, don't bother.

review.title: Horrible, bathrooms are vere disapoiting
review.reviewText: very disappointing experience,carpet very dirty,bathrooms very old and inadequate
Did not want to stay. I checked in another hotel in the same area. Hotel is dirty and worn out. It should be taken off the list by Expedia.

review.title: Poor Quality
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very accomodating but the room condition was terrible. Old and peeling bathtubs, uncomfortable beds, very old and needs updating (we stayed in two rooms), People that obviously were homeless going through the property throughout the night making you feel unsafe. The shuttle was prompt and got us to the airport with plenty of time to spare, The Expedia write up said free parking, that was deceiving as it cost us to leave our vehicle, but was 'free' for the night... as hotles generally are.
review.negativeRemarks: Condition of the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Location was good to the airport but would never stay there again.

review.title: Big walk, smelly room.
review.reviewText: This Travelodge has about 6 or 7 separate buildings and mine was very far away from the front desk and check-in. If you are not there with a car (and as an airport hotel most guests wouldn't have one) it was a real long hike to my room with heavy bags and being faced with cold SF temperatures. The room was clean but had terrible smell of chlorine bleach. The electric outlet by the sink didn't work, there was no place to charge my phone except to dig under tables and unplug lamps in the room. After hiking several days in Yosemite I wanted to take a hot bath, only no plug to stop the drain. Try to find someplace else.

review.title: Airport hotel
review.reviewText: Chosen wholly as a result of the threatened strike on BART otherwise we would have remained in Berkeley.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to the airport with a free shuttle service thereto
review.negativeRemarks: Plumbing
review.locationRemarks: An overnight stay only. Location unimpressive - but all we needed was a bed near the airport.

review.title: Worth hotel in this trip!
review.reviewText: They have almost thousand room but only one ice machine! The shower is very old and ugly. Bring your own towel cause it smelt bad. Facilities were not helpful. I do not recommend this hotel. Worth hotel ever
review.negativeRemarks: Room, bath room, towel.
review.locationRemarks: many restuarant, close to casino.

review.title: Convient Location
review.reviewText: Very convenirnt location, but rooms are a mess. Floor feels dirty and looks like it has been burned. Drapes keep air conditioning from permeating into the room.

review.title: Scary place, but cheap and close to airport
review.reviewText: When you get your hotel room for less than the cost of your supper, you already know it won't exactly be luxury accommodations. However, you don't expect to see holes in the walls, major stains all over the carpet and walls, or rotted wood around the doors. Arriving late at night and having to wander the complex because there are no direction signs and you can't see numbers didn't help. I would recommend spending a few bucks more and staying somewhere you'll feel safe and clean so you can actually get a good night's sleep. Avoid it unless you have no choice.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything else.

review.title: Needs a little bit of work.
review.reviewText: The house keepers didn't speak English, so it was very hard to communicate with them. The tub was in serious need of a refinishing job. Place could use some updates. Everything else wasn't to bad.

review.title: Completely fine
review.reviewText:
Hey fellow travelers, we got a good rate for this hotel so were happy with what we paid for. We also had a car so parking was a necessity, but if we were to return to San Fran and we didn't have the car, I would stay nearer town and closer to public transport options.

The price included breakfast but it was more of a very basic hostel breakfast, not really to our liking. There is a IHOP next door and that suited our needs and budget so that was great. There is a laundry onsite and that was a big plus for us. Although completely fine for the price, unlikely to recommend to friends and family.
review.positiveRemarks: Price. Our room was clean and comfortable, more than adequate.
review.negativeRemarks: Slightly tired, but was clean.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great, but we had a rental car - unsure of public transport options this far out of city.

review.title: Ok for an overnight sleep
review.reviewText: Booked this room only to bypass the commute traffic in the morning to the bay area. I didn't want to spend a ton of money on a room I was just going to sleep in. The hotel is old and shows its age, but overall it was a good place to stay. The staff was friendly. The ihop attached to the hotel was convenient. The breakfast in the morning wasn't spectacular but was "take with you food". The shuttle was very nice. Overall, the place was quiet, clean and served its purpose.
review.positiveRemarks: The convenient restaurant at the hotel and the shuttle to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: New mattresses on the bed
review.locationRemarks: Wasnt here for vacation, only to catch a flight the next day

review.reviewText: Due to a potential BART strike, we were extremely concerned about making it across the Bay Bridge in time to check in for our flight at SFO. We opted to spend the night and leave the car where we had spent the night. Many of the stay and park hotels/motels were booked and we were fortunate to find that Travelodge had rooms available. The room was extremely large, the bed was comfortable, the room appeared to be clean and neat and the transportation van was prompt. Our trip was great and we were picked up with in one-half hour after our arrival and dropped back at our car within 15 minutes. All was well.
review.negativeRemarks: The accommodations were comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Dinner locations were near by.

review.title: In need of a good night's rest
review.reviewText:
My wife and I needed a good night's rest, this Travel Lodge location didn't not accommodate us. This location was next to a very heavily traveled interstate and in the flight patterns of the airport. The noise level was extremely disturbing, so disturbing we had to wear ear plugs. The room was King Deluxe, far from deluxe and not fit for a pauper. The cleanliness level was below standard at best and the room itself needed very badly to be remodeled and upgraded. The tile in the shower was old, worn and cracked.

The smell of the room was musty and the rug, chair and bed were nasty. I suppose the $127.50 cost for the night was a great price, but, not a great experience for a weary couple. We would have stayed at another hotel, but, could not find a room near the airport so we could catch an early flight.

The front desk personnel were very nice and friendly, The continental breakfast was lousy. The shuttle driver was really nice, professional and helpful.

I would not recommend anyone to stay at this Travel Lodge.

review.title: Convinient location
review.reviewText: Helpful desk clerk, but firdy room had defective plumbing.

review.title: OK room at decent price near airport.
review.reviewText: Nothing to rave about, but fairly cheap and convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom was old and room kind of shabby.
review.locationRemarks: Very near airport.

review.reviewText: old building
review.negativeRemarks: tear down and rebuild

review.title: Find Another Better Hotel
review.reviewText: I needed a hotel at the airport and paid $107 including tax for a room close to SF Airport. First be aware that the shuttle from the airport to the hotel stops running at 12:30am. So if your flight is late, you will need to spend about $15 for a cab to the Travelodge. Overall, this Travelodge is disappointing at best. Naturally, the hotel is close to the airport and you will be under flying jets; the windows in the room are old and do not block out sound effectively. In my room there was some cardboard stuck in the window lock to ensure it would lock tightly. The 200 rooms are scattered over about seven separate small spreadout structures. If you arrive on foot, you will need to walk and carry your luggage from the lobby to your room. There is no golf cart to take you and it could be a 5-10 minute walk, depending how fast you walk. The rooms are old and the walls and bathtubs show it.The electrical system seems to be also old with few AC plugs loaded with AC splitters. The rooms come with an ok fridge and an iron with an ironing board but be careful as I ironed a garment and it was ruined by the deposits in the iron. The hotel breakfast is very basic with only basic cereal, tea coffe, a few packaged danishes and some oranges and apples. No chees or yogurt is available. The staff you see is basically at the check-in and check-out process. They do their processing in/out job and that's it, not much more. This hotel experience is worth $50 at best.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need to be renovated and the breakfast needs to be improved.

review.title: quiet everything works
review.reviewText: get what you pay for not the greastest not the worse
review.negativeRemarks: bigger dining room more time

review.title: Good for a quick stay
review.reviewText: The free shuttle ran every 30 minutes til midnight. The front desk were very helpful however the cleaning staff seemed to think 8am was a good time to clean rooms every morning. Room was as expected for price. Annoying if you dont want to spend money on the Metro and you dont have a car.

review.title: Do not stay here!
review.reviewText: Non smoking room smelled of pot and cigarette smoke. Cigarette burn in furniture. Not worth the money for a one night stay. Curtains did not cover the entire window.

review.title: It's Travel Lodge I didn't expect much.
review.reviewText: It was what we expected. Just needed a place to stay for like 12 hours. It's definitely not a place I would stay if I was on vacation with my family. Beds were okay seemed like new blankets and sheets which were nice. TV was terrible the screen would go out every few minutes. We called the front desk and all they said were that way old and there was nothing they can do. But like I said its a Travel Lodge. So don't expect much.

review.title: Mediocre
review.reviewText: It was ridiculously over priced for mediocre services.
review.negativeRemarks: Prices, they should not be so high. Services, they could be more kind and accommodating.

review.title: Don't book a Deluxe Suite. It is a scam.
review.reviewText:
While the desk staff were ok this was a pretty disappointing hotel. We paid extra for a "Deluxe Suite" and they put us in a terrible room. The wallpaper was peeling off in many places and the bathroom had mildew. We complained and were moved to another slightly cleaner but otherwise identical room, except it had a fridge and microwave. When we asked about the "Deluxe Suite" we were told that the original room they put us in was a Deluxe Suite and that the only difference between deluxe and standard is that Deluxe Suites *don't* have a microwave and fridge. Go figure! It seems that they advertise Deluxe Suites to get a little more money from folks that don't know better.

We were prepaid for three nights, and the only good thing is that when we left after the first night they reassured us that we would not be charged for the remaining two nights. Hopefully Expedia will honor that.
review.positiveRemarks: Desk staff were helpful and the bedding was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the rooms to get rid of the smell and do some basic repairs.
review.locationRemarks: North San Francisco is not a nice place to stay. Consider somewhere on the Pacific Coast instead.

review.title: Nice hotel for the price.
review.reviewText:
Staff was friendly, rooms were clean, a little outdated but comfortable.
Free continental breakfast, adequate parking. IHOP next door.

Overall, it was a good place to stay for the price.

review.title: Stay away from this dumpy place
review.reviewText: This hotel has the nerve to charge $109 per night when it should only charge $45 (or less) for such a dumpy, rundown place. It needs major renovation. The carpet is worn out, old and dirty. The bathroom could use a new tub! Instead it was painted over to look new and the paint was peeling off. For few more dollars you're better off staying at the other hotels in the surrounding area. I will never stay at this Travelodge in South San Francisco again!
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING!
review.locationRemarks: Only minutes away from the SFO Airport.

review.title: Very Close to the airport
review.reviewText: Stayed one night so don't have much to say but the overall appearance from inside was good and it was quiet. Have a big gas station, Ihop and Mcdonalds very close by.

review.title: location is best feature
review.reviewText: Overall, this is an older hotel and it shows. However, the location was right where we wanted, close to Candlestick after a 49er game. Freeway access was easy and there are places to eat nearby but I will be trying some of the other hotels nearby next time.

review.title: sfo travelodge
review.reviewText: one night only, traveling for business so it was acceptable wouldn't take may family to this place.
review.negativeRemarks: update the rooms
review.locationRemarks: close to airport, Costco is on the way to the airport so good for fueling up the rental car.

review.title: Bleckh
review.reviewText: We booked this on expedia non smoking confirmed. Got to the hotel and they said they only had smoking rooms and as it was late we felt obliged to take it. Said the expedia booking was only a preference not a part of the confirmed booking. My advice is steer clear of this place.

review.title: Felt damp/musty and dingy
review.reviewText:
The whole room screamed 'not remodeled since the 90s'. there were burn marks and holes in the carpet, the sheets had these weird worn-spots in them. at first we thought they were stains, but it looked like spots where the sheets were just getting really thin. The bathroom was dim, and looked like they hired someone with zero expertise on fixing the bathroom (tub was resealed sloppily, wall had a hole fixed, but not correctly, etc)

It is close to the airport, but go elsewhere.

review.title: Yikes! Don't go
review.reviewText: I'm rarely motivated to pipe in but I couldn't get out of this place fast enough. I slept with the light on and a suitcase pushed against the door, used my laptop battery rather than plug into the outlet hanging out of the wall, and opted to get up an hour earlier (at dawn) to move my car to a nearby vendor rather than leave it in the hotel parking "area" for a fee. The best I can say is that housekeeping tried to present a clean room but had very little to work with.
review.positiveRemarks: Only that housekeeping tried to present a clean room but had very little to work with -
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING!! This place needs a major overhaul.

review.title: for the money it is a good deal
review.reviewText: a little crowded in the dining room but you get what you pay for
review.negativeRemarks: dining room size

review.title: Close to SFO and San Francisco
review.reviewText: Faces the freeway but many older hotels do. Left a'c on to drown the freeway noise.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was comfortable. Value for $. Easy location.
review.negativeRemarks: Additional parking
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO and San Francisco

review.title: Will not recommend
review.reviewText: Cold and unclean, grounds were filled with trash. It seems that grounds keeper was off that week. Steps were chipped on the edge of the perimeter with a thin wooden platform bridging space on second-floor deck. Restoration or raising is needed.
review.negativeRemarks: Cold room and ants
review.locationRemarks: Close to Treasure Island

review.title: Very convenient to SFO airport and hire cars
review.reviewText: Reception staff very helpful with our request to add extra night to original booking despite rooms at a premium during a very busy period in San Francisco. Could tighten up courtesy bus schedule. Room was basic but clean and freeway noise not as bad as expected despite its proximity. A guide to shops and eating establishments nearby would be handy as we have certain dietary requirements that were not met by IHOP and inclusive breakfast. Found out about Costco up the road by accident.
review.negativeRemarks: Redecorate bathroom and maybe provide bar fridge.

review.title: Very convenient to the Airport
review.reviewText: Not nearly as bad as the reviews I read. I was only there one night and my room was clean and the staff very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower could be renewed
review.locationRemarks: Ideal for where I needed to go.

review.title: Modest, Good Price, Free Parking
review.reviewText:
I chose this hotel because it was listed among those in the S.F. Bay Area with free parking, was relatively inexpensive, and not too far from Golden Gate Park. I didn't expect it to be fancy. It is older and very basic, but clean and adequate. On Saturday afternoon and Sunday morning it took about 40 minutes to and from the Golden Gate Park.

Printed warnings about room security caused me to be concerned about leaving anything in the room. The room smelled stale.
review.negativeRemarks: Air out the rooms. Insure room security.

review.title: Old hotel in dire need of renovation
review.reviewText: We had to change rooms because our room smelled bad. The second room was not much of an improvement. Never again.

review.title: Convenient.
review.reviewText: The Continental Breakfast room was very small and crowded, but adequate selection of breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: The price. Grosvenor hotel where event that I was attending was right next door, as well as closeness to the airport. Friendly staff at the desk.
review.negativeRemarks: Stains on carpet and chairs---better cleaning or?
review.locationRemarks: Airport, San Francisco, and the Peninsula. Ideal location.

review.title: Near airport, easy cab ride from city
review.reviewText: It was fine for one night and close to the airport for an early flight, but I wouldn't want to have an extended stay there - very plain and older facilities
review.positiveRemarks: very close to the airport, cheaper than in the city
review.negativeRemarks: update the rooms

review.title: Okay stay
review.reviewText: Didn't get the room we wanted but even tho we got a smoking room it wasn't too bad. Didn't smell like a soaking room. Super packed parking lot tho.

review.title: avoid the place
review.reviewText: terrible experience. I don't know what the owner does with the money because 200$++ stay per 2 nights should show some expectation. horrible room, wifi no working with " we are working on it " , noise from highway as room is next and walls are made of paper or something. sleep rather in the car.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: The room had a bad stench & the bathrooms were in pretty bad condition. Eg. The shower looked gross & our toilet flush button fell off a few times. The free brekki was very basic too. Other than that it was ok & the staff were friendly so you basically get what you pay for.

review.title: Old dumpy and dirty
review.reviewText: Between staying here and turning around, go home. Unclean and overpriced.

review.title: standard accommodation well suited to tourists
review.reviewText: rooms were not as described in terms of no king size beds sits directly under flight path which is active until about 1am
review.positiveRemarks: access via hotel shuttle to train service downtown

review.title: Built in 1965 and Really Showing It
review.reviewText: This hotel is a disappointing blast from the past tucked up close to the Bayshore Freeway. Everything is frayed, tired, uneven slab floors & carpeting full of stains & divots, bathroom caulked by amateurs & the shower did not encourage actual use. On entering the room, there was the pervasive smell of mildew overlaid with a some kind of chemical-smelling air freshener. Reminiscent of a 1970 Motel 6 poorly maintained. Cleanliness of the bedding/linens, etc. was adequate, only just. We took great care to check around the headboard and foot of bed for bedbugs. There weren't any we found, but the general condition of the room made us thoughtful about the possibility. During a flood of people checking in there was only one single person at the front desk ("I'm sorry sir, the other person is on break and really needed one" ...and... "We never have enough staff."). Though very pleasant under stress, he was processing about one party per 10-15 minutes due to several parties very confused about reservations. There is Park-n-Fly, but you are compelled to sign a total liability waiver to park, and there is no evidence of any security arrangements aside from scattered streetlights, one of which died while I was parking in the early AM. We will never return to this establishment. I just hope my car is still there in one piece when we return.
review.negativeRemarks: Just about everything mentioned in the description above.

review.title: Only if there is no choice
review.reviewText:
It was my last resort. I had to fly out of SFO at 6:00am and needed to be near by. There are other hotels (not MOTELS) near by, they are newer and clean.

sleeping on the bed was like sleeping on the garage floor.

room was noise.

door opened to the outside. people coming and going all night long.

the shower? It was so gross that i never even opened the sliding door!!

Like i said, if you have no other choice....
review.negativeRemarks: demo it and build a new hotel

review.title: Worst motel ever!
review.reviewText: This is probably one of the worst motels I have ever stayed at. My main complaint is that there was no hot water, only lukewarm. There was no light in the vanity area, carpet was dirty, towel rack fell apart when we used hand towel. When we arrived, there was only 1 hand towel and I had paid the fee for an extra guest. There were 3 cats prowling around the door. I wonder what they were after! My nephew commented that the place probably shouldn't be open for business. The positive is that there was a continental breakfast and the ladies serving it were nice. All lodging in San Francisco area was full, if not I wouldn't have stayed there.
review.positiveRemarks: Free continental breakfast. Easy to find.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything. Needs to be completely refurbished and water heaters updated.
review.locationRemarks: Good location near the airport.

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: I saw a lot of bad reviews about this hotel after I had already booked it. I prepared for the worst. I was pleasantly surprised. Don't get me wrong, it's not the Ritz but for the low price it was adequate. It is in a very convenient location and I didn't have any problems. I would stay there again, it's a place to sleep and a shower.
review.negativeRemarks: Their "continental" breakfast was very limited and the volume on my remote control did not work.
review.locationRemarks: It is near SF Airport and the Bart is pretty close in San Bruno.

review.title: Demolish this fleabag
review.reviewText: This motel was so disgusting and every surface in my room so dirty, that I was too grossed out to stay there. There was so much black mold and grime in the shower stall (including on the soap dish....how does that happen where soap sits?) I was afraid to touch anything. Several parts of the wall had been destroyed and patched over and the wallpaper was peeling everywhere. There was an old recliner in the room (beside the sink area) that looked at least 30 years old and I would be genuinely astonished if anyone would sit in it. After having been in the room for less than 10 minutes I could't take it any longer and left, which meant I had to pay for another hotel room. I don't know how anybody stays in this place. *shudder*
review.negativeRemarks: Completely demolish the building, have an environmental clean up of the land, and start from scratch.

review.title: Motel ok. Location excellent. Near airport.
review.reviewText: Nothing special to say. Run down but clean. Ihop right next door. Very convenient when just in transit and no car. Very lovely waitress from Mongolia.

review.title: The price was right.
review.reviewText: The price was right. We were stranded and were running out of money. Unfortunately I didn't tip as well as I usually do. We were freezing and had no extra blankets. However, since it was so late, they let us have a slightly later check out. I then later figured out that I had left my blanket. "Nina" was wonderful! She took on personally the quest to find it. Unfortunately they couldn't find it. Also, the shuttle back to the airport was very good. Again, I would have tipped if I could.
review.negativeRemarks: Extra blankets, maybe some lotions in addition to shampoo.
review.locationRemarks: I don't know..We just needed a place to sleep while stranded at the SFO.

review.title: Conveniences available
review.reviewText: This hotel is not for everyone. It is a 3 ring circus. My experience was very good. Large clean room, good breakfast, restaurant in the hotel, peaceful night. I really enjoyed it.

review.title: Stay away
review.reviewText:
If you can pay a little more and avoid this place, you'd be doing yourself a great service! This is not a 2 star hotel, Extended Stay America is a 2 star hotel. Travelodge San Francisco is a 1 star at best.
An unfriendly older Filipino man with dark hair at the desk checking people in and out, did not even make eye contact with guests, he talked to me angrily like I was a child doing something wrong... I was just checking in :) I don't know if he was overwhelmed, had a bad day or this was his general disposition... I have compassion for people like that, but I don't want to be serviced by them. The really old house keeping lady was sweet and cute, she knocked on my door 3 times before 11 am the next day, asking me when I was going to check out, despite of the "do not disturb" sign on the door :)I think she didn't speak English well.
The rooms are really really old... every time I turned on the a/c it sounded like a vacuum cleaner and it was still very hot and humid in the room, seemed like only the vent was working.
The hotel needs a lot of TLC/remodeling before someone can have a good experience here. Besides the convenient location close to the airport with the shuttle service, it has nothing else going for it.
review.negativeRemarks: facilities in general, staff friendliness
review.locationRemarks: not much to do around, there was an ihop within walking distance

review.title: Basic and rundown
review.reviewText: Having just basic hotel facilities is fine, don't expect much more for the price. The room I had backed on to the freeway and was noisy with single glazed windows. None of the sockets in the room would keep a plug in because they were so loose, several were falling out of the way and all of them were behind furniture and then fully occupied with lamps and TVs etc. The bathroom had sealant peeling off, a fan covered in lint and the bathroom tiles which had been painted had half he paint coming off.

review.title: Poor management
review.reviewText:
This was the worst experience I have ever had staying anywhere. The front desk demeanor was terrible from the get go. Staff was more concerned for themselves than helping the line of guests. In my four interactions with them, only was did I get a "Thank-you" for my patients and waiting.

The first room I was booked into should have been marked as unavailable due to maintenance. The carpet was pulled up and a blower was running. I hate to think how that was affecting the rooms next door, being it was after 8pm. Upon telling the front desk, I didn't even get an apology. Instead being treated like I was an inconvenience.

This treatment was continued when the WiFi network was unavailable for the entire one night stay. I was directed to try the WiFi in the lobby. On my third trip from my room to the lobby to do as directed, still being unsuccessful. This is when the front desk told me they were over sold, there was nothing that could be done and if I needed internet access that bad, I could pay to use the desktops in the lobby.

The reasons I chose this hotel was location, price, airport shuttle, free internet, and complementary breakfast. The only two things that I felt like I got from the stay was the shuttle and cheap room.
review.negativeRemarks: Management, customer service, site maintenance, internet - WiFi connectivity (specifically DHCP address allocation pool), and cleanliness.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the San Francisco airport. The IHOP being attached to the hotel was nice and convenient.

review.title: Economic hotel close to SFO
review.reviewText: Quick check in time. On time airport shuttle. Would stay there again the night before an early morning flight.
review.positiveRemarks: So close to the airport and easy to find.
review.negativeRemarks: Will be a bit nicer when they finish remodeling
review.locationRemarks: Close to IHop, Denny's, McDonalds, all within walking distance. Great Chinese food. Lose by as well.

review.title: Overnight on a long layover
review.reviewText: I needed just a place to sleep, shower, and rest between legs on a long journey. I felt comfortable and cared for in this budget hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport; comfy bed

review.title: Possibly the worst hotel in San fransisco.
review.reviewText: Wifi worked for a total of 4 minutes on both my phone and laptop. No hot water in shower, I spent 20 minutes fixing the rattling AC so I could sleep with only the highway traffic trying to keep me awake. Moldy sink, cracked paint falling off walls, hotel staff doesn't speak English.... Worst hotel I've ever stayed at.
review.positiveRemarks: The price was ok, and had free parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Pretty much everything.

review.title: travelodge san francisco
review.reviewText: clean and very affordable. Free breakfast and internet is a big plus.
review.negativeRemarks: its worth for what you pay for
review.locationRemarks: a little bit confusing for first timers

review.title: Near to SFO.
review.reviewText: Really cheap and its good for one night. Room was clean, but really noisy. Airport shuttle serivce was perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: Modernization

review.title: Close to Airport when I was stranded but not clean
review.reviewText: I ended up having to book last minute bc of airline and my standby ticket. It was the least expensive and now I know why. The shower was pealing and kind of gross. The carpet was horrible, old, and very stinky. In fact the entire room really stunk bad. Had to keep windows open and it was noisy. Got out as quick as we could in the morning...
review.negativeRemarks: Carpet! upgrade bathroom tub and fixtures!
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport was good

review.title: Easy access to airport & freeway, fair priced.
review.reviewText: Room small, A/C OK, good shower, easy access to airport car rental and freeway.
review.negativeRemarks: Construction was underway during my stay,so I do not feel I can give an honest assessment.
review.locationRemarks: Location is right off the airport grounds, real easy access to car rental return and freeway (101).

review.title: Relly disappointed and will not recommend
review.reviewText:
The lobby and the breakfastroom are small and very crowded.
The facility in the room is old and not maintained.
In the first room there is no hot water and the toilet can not be flushed. We have to change the room.
In the second room, the Safer is locked without key and can not be used. We have called service, but the staff told us that the techniker is already out of duty and the safer can only be fixed in the next day but until we left the hotel, no one is come to fix the problem.
The only consolation for us is that the cleaness in the room is OK.

review.title: Too expensive for price. No wifi reception.
review.reviewText:
First of all, fees and taxes were $15 to book this hotel on Expedia. As soon as I walked into the room, I started coughing and sneezing because it was so dusty. It smelled dirty and stuffy. The bed was big, but you could feel every spring in the bed. Although they claim to have wifi, it doesn't reach all of the buildings, only the reception/lobby area.

The shower/bathroom was by far the worst part. The shower floor was rusty and brown. I didn't even take a shower because it looked so unsanitary.

I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. There is a Holiday Inn, 4 Points hotel, and a lot of other cheap hotels nearby that I would recommend trying.

review.title: budget deal. Great for the price.
review.reviewText: Very pleasant. For the price and location it can't be beat. Its not the Ritz, but it is very user friendly for the practical person.
review.positiveRemarks: It was cheap and in pretty good condition. Great deal for the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Some touch up work in the bathrooms. Some sloppy work done.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel right on the pipeline to go north (sf), south (san jose), west (half moon bay), or east (alameda). Very easy commutes.

review.title: Find another hotel
review.reviewText:
The room was horrible...looked like the door had been kicked in, and slopily replaced with boards. The plush chair had cigarette burns and yuck...we found a ketchup wrapper on the floor. The carpets seemed to have burn marks. I could smell bug spray too.
Don't let the picture of the pool fool you, the hotel sucks.
The breakfast was minimal; jelly, toast, coffee and cereal and fruit and sweet roles, 100 to the box. Breakfast ended promptly at 9 a.m.
I recommend you find another cheap hotel; I would have if I had not previously paid for it.
review.positiveRemarks: The international tourists staying there were friendly! As was the cat hanging out.
review.negativeRemarks: room carpet, and chairs could be newer, the door could be fixed... get rid of the bug spray smell.
review.locationRemarks: close to the airport; no worries, you could walk if need be.

review.title: very handy for early morning take off
review.reviewText: Thisll worked out well. Iwas worried about traffic with the Bay Bridge closed, so spent the night near the airport.

review.title: I would recommend this place to anyone.
review.reviewText:
Although we did not get a non-smoking room, it did not smell of smoke. We had requested a non-smoking room.
We liked that we had a free breakfast. Parking was ample. The location was fine. We were able to get back and forth to town
easily. It was a quiet location. You only heard the busy freeway when you were outside. This place was well worth the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Reserve non-smoking rooms for those who request them.
review.locationRemarks: Location was fine, not too far away from all the attractions. Kincaids was not too far away, where you can eat overlooking the water.

review.title: it is not worth the money.
review.reviewText:
The room had bad smell.
complementary WI-fi is a jock. never worked for us.

review.title: Travelodge near SFO North
review.reviewText: Facilitlies are aging, hotel is crowded, signs are not clear, Wi-fi is slow, insufficient parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Room for breakfast is too small Parking is insufficient Facilities & renovations are too old
review.locationRemarks: location is ok, Mcdonald & Costco are nearby

review.title: San Francisco Travelodge
review.reviewText: A well worn and over used hotel, in an ideal location for the airport but fairly grubby, worn and not that well kept. Room was small and despite being non-smoking wrecked of a cross between stale smoke and BO. Not pleasant.

review.title: Very economically priced!
review.reviewText: Good hotel that fit our budget. Staff very helpful. Conveniently close to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet access wouldn't work in room, signal not strong enough for a wi-fi.
review.locationRemarks: Reasonably good location near airport, near decent eating places.

review.title: It was the least expensive
review.reviewText: On fixed income and needed a cheap place to stay near sf airport. It was.
review.negativeRemarks: the breakfast was terrible. they ran out of bread, hot water, and other things and did not refill 30 minutes before closing.
review.locationRemarks: nothing, just a place to stay after flight

review.title: Cheap but poor hotel by SFO
review.reviewText: Didn't expect much from a Travelodge but the bathtub was utterly disgusting.

review.title: Rude reception
review.reviewText: I was greeted by a receptionist with bad attitude. He first assigned me to a room that was not cleaned. When I came back to tell him that he tried to deny that until I showed him a picture that I took with my phone. He then assigned me another room but failed to program the key properly and it didn't open. I was very frustrated with the whole experience because I arrived at midnight after 16 hours of flight and had to leave before six the next morning to catch a train to my final destination. Instead of accommodating me professionally, he went on to instructing me to not be nasty and rude. All that for asking him if he could make that that the key he was giving me was properly programmed.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the airport and the price was reasonable with advance booking through Expedia
review.negativeRemarks: They need to train their employees better

review.title: It was a place to sleep
review.reviewText: Our room was in disrepair and tacky. I guess you get what you pay for.

review.title: Only good thing is the shuttle.
review.reviewText: Hotel needs major construction work. Only positive thing was their airport shuttle. Staff needs to be trained with customer service skills, and for housekeepers if check out is at noon don't come banging on the door at 8am.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything. Bed was extremely hard even felt the springs. Bathroom needs major maintenance work.
review.locationRemarks: Airport

review.title: You get what you pay for.
review.reviewText:
This is a Travelodge, which means I shouldn't be rating it with 5 star hotel accommodations in mind.

So, this is an older Travelodge and it shows in every corner of the room.
The carpet, the fixtures, and the paint are all indicative of it.
The noise outside of the room is excruciatingly loud because of the freeway. Thankfully, I'm a heavy sleeper. The curtains won't stay completely closed. The staff at 11pm was very polite and helpful.

It was the cheapest fare I could find last minute and you get what you pay for.
review.positiveRemarks: Price, Proximity to SF airport and SF downtown, Staff
review.negativeRemarks: renovation of rooms. Double pane windows to block out noise

review.title: old dingy decrepid
review.reviewText: old bedding full of cigarette burns ,whole room grubby, not fit for pigs
review.negativeRemarks: take it off your website

review.title: Budget hotel, avrge condition, almost $100 a night
review.reviewText: About what I expected. No surprises. Nice front counter guy. It is worth a solid $60-$70 a night. Convenient to SFO
review.locationRemarks: SLEEP. That's about it.

review.title: Wasn't what I expected,,
review.reviewText: The room was old and dirty. Waited too long for shuttle and my experience was good.
review.positiveRemarks: Waited too long for shuttle and took too long to check in.
review.negativeRemarks: Remodel and better shuttle program.
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: close to the airport, but a terrible place.
review.reviewText: I would never recommend this place to anyone. Room was dirty, hair all over bathroom, toilet paper was nowhere to be found, shower tub didn't drain properly. The staff attempted to fix the tub, they said it was ok, but it wasn't.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything has to be improved. They need major remodeling.

review.title: Poor
review.reviewText: Not satisfied everything from cleanliness, breakfast.....blahh
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Forget it

review.title: Paid too much for this bad quality hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was expensive our rooms were not very clean, the washrooms were untidy and very old. The breakfast in the morning was embarrassing notably things were offered to eat and then the refilling was done very slowly and in some cases no refilling was offered once the good ran out.

review.title: IT WAS AWFUL
review.reviewText: tHE BATHROOMS WERE PATCH AND LOOKED DISGUSTING i WOULD NEVER STAY AGAIN
review.negativeRemarks: Fix your bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: We stayed at the airport location

review.title: A motel, not hotel, very close to the airport.
