review.reviewText: The shower stall and the rest of the bathroom share the floor i.e. there is no barrier preventing shower water from flooding into the toilet area. Damaged walls, damaged carpet, sheet with cigarette burns in them, suspicious spots on sheets and blankets. For over a $100 per night, one should expect better even in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Pleasant staff, very polite and efficient. The cleaners bending backwards to keep this rundown place in a livable condition.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs renovations NOW. Buckled paint, peeling wallpaper, damaged walls, damaged doors need to be replaced immediately to meet USA/Canada min standard.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to SFO, major highways. McDonald's across the street.

review.title: Two negatives
review.reviewText: The only real negative was the noise from being so near the freeway. Also, the room offering the continental breakfast was not large enough to accommodate the number of guest. Other than that, it was fine.

review.title: Hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Looked seedy. Staff could not guarantee that we would get on the airport shuttle. Shower had chipped tiles. Paid premium price because it was a busy night. Paid more than a beautiful hotel in downtown San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: That it was close to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Have more than one shuttle bus.
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport.

review.title: Squalid airport motel
review.reviewText: The room was smelly, the bathroom floor sticky, carpet was dirty. The noise level was very high because the windows seemed to be made out of thin plastic, and the motel stands next to the highway. All that for a hundred bucks.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport; free airport shuttle with frequent departures.
review.negativeRemarks: Room cleanliness; noise insulation; cheaper price
review.locationRemarks: Eat at IHOP or hang out at the nearby gas station.

review.title: Hotel experience
review.reviewText: I booked a suite for three adults and two teenagers but was disappointed to see only two beds in a regular hotel room, not a suite. I called the front desk and said I reserved a suite for five people and was expecting two queen beds and a sofa bed for the fifth person. They sent in a roll away bed. With the roll away bed in the room, no one could walk anywhere, we had to walk on the beds and then climb over a chair to get to the bathroom. Don't advertise a suite for five when it is just a regular room with two beds.
review.negativeRemarks: upgrade needed, room was dark and old looking.
review.locationRemarks: easy access to Fisherman's Warf. Only about 10 miles. Very easy access to airport.

review.title: Travel lodge in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Room was furnished with dirty furniture, outdated equipment,
Drapes were dingy and unappealing. Bathroom did not close
review.positiveRemarks: Free transportation to airport, opportunity to store car for two weeks at a reasonable price.
review.locationRemarks: Did not have time to investigate. Enjoyed dinner at Hollahans.

review.title: Ugly hotel by the freeway
review.reviewText: My experience was bad. The room smelled horrible and everything seemed dirty. The price was really high for what we got. Would not recommend to anyone. Very unhappy.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything!
review.locationRemarks: Having an IHOP next door was nice.

review.title: Old motel next to freeway
review.reviewText: The hotel was under some kind of renovation. They put me in a rm right on the freeway in the furthest bldg. it was late at night and I had to walk there by myself (single woman) in the dark. I was so scared. Then I had to trudge up a flight of stairs with my suitcase. If I fell I probably would have had no help. The shower had been painted but most of the paint was chipped off. I Didn't take a shower. It was one scary place.
review.positiveRemarks: It was one of the cheaper ones and the online pictures looked pretty good
review.negativeRemarks: I'd tear the place down

review.title: Run down! Dirty
review.reviewText: I expected something better for the price I payed.

review.title: disappointed
review.reviewText: Not good value for what we paid. Picures of rooms looked better than they where.

review.title: not worth the price!
review.reviewText: the room condition is simply disappointing.. there are cheaper hotels that are in better condition.
review.negativeRemarks: overall room condition particularly the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: location is convenient

review.title: 2 Stars hotel
review.reviewText: Really old hotel. Bad experience, Loud music playing in the parking lot at midnight. I would not stay at this hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: new paint job.
review.locationRemarks: not a good location. traffics are very loud.

review.title: Gang activities in the parking lot
review.reviewText: 911 had to be called due to a ruckus in the parking lot at midnight. When tried to get in touch with front desk they wouldn't pick up the phone. When they finally did I was told it really wasn't their problem and the cops were on their way, which we knew since we and several other people had also called 911.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk people could act a little more concerned about what is going on in their hotel
review.locationRemarks: Drive into San Francisco or catch a flight out

review.title: Clean but run down
review.reviewText: We needed an affordable place for one night by SFO. The picture looked decent and we have had a few positive experiences with Travelodges. The approval rating was 60% so we tried it. The bed and bath were clean. The chair was worn and wallpaper torn in places. Not afraid to stay but not real comfortable either.
review.negativeRemarks: General updating of interior. They were working on the grounds and it was a construction z
review.locationRemarks: There is an IHop next door

review.title: Disappointment
review.reviewText: Room description includes microwave and refrig. When we got into the room, there's none. The wifi is not working too. Called the front desk about our needs and was told that someone will come to our room to check but no one ever came. When we came back from dinner, we had a hard time going to the building and parking because both sides of the driveway have parked car and dont want to move when we asked the drivers to do so. There was no one in front desk to ask for help so we waited for someone to solve the situation. The bathroom door doesnt lock. My wife and I are not happy customers in this hotel. We checked out with disappointed remarks but no one even said "sorry".
review.negativeRemarks: driveway, wifi, appliances as described on brochure
review.locationRemarks: we're new in the area.

review.title: This place is scary!
review.reviewText: This place was HORRIBLE! Rooms in disrepair. Window didn;t lock. Inside door lock broken off! No one available to respond. We moved!

review.title: Time to Update!
review.reviewText:
The Travelodge was overpriced, less than a star hotel. If it weren't in a red-hot hotel market, it would be out of business. The "park at your own risk" sign is a foreshadowing of things to come.

The our hotel room's bathroom condition would keep us from going back there at any price. The bathroom had mould growing on the ceiling, no drain cover in the tub, old fixtures and it was similar to the "second-world" countries I have visited.

The "continental breakfast" was in the same building as the I-Hop. Sitting in the breakfast room with the minimal breakfast and looking at the I-Hop restaurant isn't very appealing.

On a positive note, the staff were really nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Opening the door to our room.
review.locationRemarks: Noisy, high-traffic, and sketchy.

review.title: Drive was not to bad to San Francisco
review.reviewText:
when I entered the room it had an order of bug spray, their was a whole in recliner chair , there was rust and a hole in the bathroom wall. We just used the room to sleep , my family was disappointment there was no internet at the hotel and the cable was weak.
I bought Lysol disinfectant from the local Target store and sprayed the room before and after we entered. It made feel a bit better was we slept. It was a good place to rest and that about it, the price was fair and that about it, the staff was friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was friendly , continental break was okay. My girls were excited to see a pool but the weather was to cold to swim in.
review.negativeRemarks: Keep the maintenance of the building up.
review.locationRemarks: Target was near by, drive was not bad from San Francisco .

review.title: Never again Travelodge in San Fran!
review.reviewText:
Over priced, dirty, panels on the wall were pealing off.
Just because you are in San Fran you should never pay around $100 for
such a dump like this.
review.negativeRemarks: Tear it down, rebuild it and cut your prices in half and maybe I will be back!

review.title: Don't waste time Patronizing this terible Hotel
review.reviewText:
I used to live in South San Francisco. I went to high school there. The TraveLodge was there when I went to school there in 1962-1965. It looked and felt like that was the last time this hotel had been worked on.

The room smelled of disinfectant as soon as I opened the door. That smell never left the place. The bathroom was a disgrace. The shower had been patched with something that was a completely different color than the shower. That shower was thirty years old.

One of the reasons I chose this particular hotel was because of the WiFi. Well, guess what, no internet. I called down to the desk and the guy said that they had called someone. When I asked when they would have it working, he gave me an attitude. They never had any internet the two and a half days I was there.

I came back to the room at 3:30 pm the second day we were there. My room had not been made up and no one ever came or knocked on the door to do the housekeeping.

I would rate this Hotel at a 1. Certainly not worth over $100 a night for a flop house room. Stay Away if you can!
review.positiveRemarks: The best thing about this place was the pancake restaurant out in front of it. The parking was good as well.
review.negativeRemarks: This Hotel needs to have some of the money that they are making put back into cleaning it up. It is a dump and because of it's proximity to the airpor
review.locationRemarks: N/A

review.title: OK if you have to be by the airport.
review.reviewText: Room smelled of smoke,traffic noise is terrible and the beds weren't very good. But the shuttle drivers are great!

review.title: Cheap hotel
review.reviewText: Noisy area, old not updated rooms. But clean and make sure you get a cheap price!
review.positiveRemarks: It was cheap much cheaper than other hotels but for a reason.

review.title: Acceptable
review.reviewText: Room had small fridge; air-conditioning worked; pocket-door on bathroom was a little difficult to move; plenty of hot water; gave us extra towels on request (room came with two bath towels); could hear planes once and a while, but not intrusive; 25 min drive (without traffic) from downtown San Francisco. Good price for acceptable motel.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Not a good experience, very disappointed with the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness and noise levels.
review.locationRemarks: Not that close to attractions.

review.title: Close to Airport..shuttle service good
review.reviewText: The front construction couldn't be helped, but the general appearance of the place was below average, and the "continental breakfast" was barely ok. We looked in the bathroom and there was somebody else's wet washcloth thrown over the shower control, which didn't encourage me to take a shower there. walls were "iffy" poor patch jobs, etc. beds looked ok, so hope so. Cost high for quality. I was disappointed to say the least
review.negativeRemarks: get patch-up personnel to do better work, i.e. caulking around doors, tub, lite fixtures, also remove previous wet towels from bath tub area..cleaner
review.locationRemarks: airport

review.title: High price for poor old motel
review.reviewText:
We were shocked at the state of disrepair of this old motel charging $130 a night. The internet fee was $1.00 a minute.
Shower cracked and poor water flow. Drain lid popped up under my foot to expose a lot of crud.
Travelodge obviously don't inspect their premises.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs to be refurbished
review.locationRemarks: South San Fran area, 1/2 hour to Fishermans' Wharf

review.title: A good park and fly hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel needs to upgrade their mattresses. It was uncomfortable at best
review.positiveRemarks: The room rate was good and It was located close to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: The mattress was uncomfortable.

review.title: Was close to airport and freeway.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was adequate - but needs some updating. The staff was helpful and courteous - and breakfast very
good. Beds were comfortable and water pressure quite good.

Wanted to be close to airport and freeway.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds were comfortable - room was large enough and nice to have sink outside of bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Windows were painted shut in one room. Other room the window screens were ripped. Molding in bathroom was gouged and needed work.

review.title: Never again. Save money is good but don't be cheap
review.reviewText: My worst experience in a hotel of my life. Everything is old in the room.

review.title: Very dirty. Broken toilet.Rude staff. Dirty towels
review.reviewText: We were told parking was free when we booked the room. Upon arrival we were told we must pay $11 each day. The room was filthy, towels were filthy with other people's hair everywhere. It smelled. The toilet tank was broken in pieces and they had just covered it with a plastic bed tray. I will never stay or recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: The lust is too long.
review.locationRemarks: IDK

review.title: Great Airport hotel for the money!We'd stay again.
review.reviewText: Hotel had more amenities than a lot of the San Fran hotels. Close to airport, good movie channels, pool and great breakfast. Good value for the money!
review.locationRemarks: Awesome - free shuttle to the airport, just minutes away. If you have a car, the mall and restaurants are close by.

review.title: Good value in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Overall value was excellent, there were many good things about the hotel that outweigh the bad.
Pool was nice and well-maintained, easy access to highways and airport and even an IHOP Dinner you could walk to.
Rooms were satisfactory; beds were nice and comfy with lots of pillows, recliner in the room, showers were nice.
The only true complaint about the entire stay was the outside noise caused mostly by the airport and highway, the hotel is between HWY 101 and So. Airport Blvd so there was plenty of road noise and then the occasional plane overhead BUT that was it. The area was busy with plenty of travelers and seemed very safe and secure.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was comfortable and plenty of pillows. The shower was great, no water-saver type. Convenient location to IHOP, highways, and airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Airport noise and road noise was horrible but what can you expect.

review.title: Convenient location near Airport
review.reviewText: Nice accomodations , we noticed some rooms had frig and micro and some did not. We thought we booked one with since we were staying for 3 nights, but we did not ask to switch although it would have been nice to. There were always a lot of people looking for tables to sit for breakfast. The motel accommodations were greater than the space available for breakfast. Overall, price and comfort was good especially the free parking and shuttle to airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Free shuttle to airport, parking, and swimming pool except it was too cool to swim outside.
review.negativeRemarks: Space in the breakfast room. Add bagels and cream cheese to the menu.
review.locationRemarks: We went to San Francisco. This was a good place to stay in order to get to the airport when departing.

review.title: 2 nights of feeling uncomfortable!
review.reviewText: Did shower cuz the bathtub was disgusting! Went to bed feeling like lying on a bed full of dust! Scared of sleeping that insects will climb on me! Breakfast is literally svenhards and orange juice.. Scary environment! If i could give 0 starts i would give it!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything!

review.title: Ok for a night
review.reviewText: We arrived well after midnight, extremely tired. The room was dreary but seemingly clean. The air conditioner was blowing air but not de-humidifiing or cooling. As a result the sheets seemed damp. It was still rainy when we awoke and the "breakfast" seemingly consisted of sugary pastries and some cereal that had to be brought out of the small breakfast room and eaten in the drizzling rain in the open air courtyard or your room.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff was very pleasant The hotel rates were very reasonable
review.negativeRemarks: Update decor, improve breakfast offerings and fix the air conditioner or install a de-humidifier.
review.locationRemarks: It was in an industrial looking area just off the airport. There didn't seem to be anything to do within walking distance.

review.title: Smooth
review.reviewText: Everything went smooth with this stay. Booked at the last second on the 4th of July and the room was clean and spacious.
review.positiveRemarks: It was available on the 4th of July as we were passing through town back from the coast.

review.title: Tired old hotel near the airport
review.reviewText: Arriving late at night, I was disappointed to find that the airport shuttle was not running and I had to take a $30.00 cab. My room was several buildings away, a slightly scary walk, and the room was essentially worn out. It was generally clean, but dated and old. I would not stay here again unless absolutely necessary. The continental breakfast was very limited, but there is an IHOP in the same building.
review.negativeRemarks: renovate and update the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Located in South San Francisco, the only thing nearby is the airport. San Francisco attractions are readily accessible by car or BART.

review.title: At the "lower end" of quality.
review.reviewText:
have stayed at this particular hotel on a few occasions. following each stay i always tell myself "this is the last time i'll stay here".
i guess there are worse places, but this place can hold its own with them. :)
review.negativeRemarks: put at least one or two premium channels "back" on the televisions. shades/window coverings that actually offer privacy.

review.title: Poor parking
review.reviewText: When you pull in front the hotel to check in, their was water you couldnt get out to regestered, and the people in the front desk wherent friendly, and the rooms very old and worn out and not very clean, and moldy around the front door, and the bathtub it was very ugly that they paint the tub and the paint was pilling off. I wouldn't recomended.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Needs to be up dated.

review.title: close to freeway and airport....but
review.reviewText: at least I didn't find bedbugs. This whole facility was worn and not much above seedy. there were stains and burns on the carpet, The bathtub had no drain cover and so it backed up when you took a shower. We were stuck here for four days and in that time had to always ask for more towels. We had four people in our group and only three towels and two washcloths were ever provided. They use paper cups which were also in short supply and half the electric plugs in the room did not work.Can't say I will ever return, although the office was quite nice, maybe they are just starting a renovation.
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco is a short drive away

review.title: Close to airport, otherwise disappointing
review.reviewText: Booked a room here because of a late arrival by car and a flight the next morning. Get to the hotel at 1am after long day of driving and am told that they only have a smoking room available even though my reservation was clearly non-smoking. No discount or other attempt made to make up for their mistake. I don't think this is a mistake hotels should be allowed to make considering the negative health impacts of smoking. Room was far from nice and of course had an unpleasant smell - did not sleep well and did not enjoy the stay. I did not feel that I had any real options at 1am otherwise I would have gone elsewhere, certainly will not be back.

review.title: Just Okay
review.reviewText: It is okay to stay here for a night. Specially when it is very near to airport. For a longer stay I would not recommend it.

review.title: Hotel very near the San Francisco airport!
review.reviewText: The hotel is very near the airport and a shuttle goes back and forth from the airport to the hotel frequently. The hotel is antiquated with limited facilities. Rooms were close together and not well insulated so neighbor noises were obvious. The sheets were clean enough but the rug seemed dirty and old. The swimming pool was OK and its water was heated. They do serve breakfast but we didn't have time for it so can't comment. The door was so old that it barely opened with the room card; we had to kick it hard to get it to open. Bathroom was tiny and had a door that only partially closed.
review.positiveRemarks: What I liked about the hotel was its shuttle service and its convenience to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: It probably should be renovated completely!
review.locationRemarks: There is a nice pool at the hotel. The shuttle takes you to the BART station at the airport, from which there are many places to go.

review.title: Keep Looking

review.title: Overall Travelodge is OK to stay
review.reviewText:
Travelodge is nothing but a motel and as such it's OK to stay. You don't expect anything fancy from the begin with.
But charging a bit too much due to the location, right next to San Francisco Int'l Airport. Furniture in the room is acceptable level. Simple furniture, not dirty.
Bathroom, no tub but only shower, tiles are partially off.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience, my car right in front of my room
review.negativeRemarks: Repair bathroom tiles
review.locationRemarks: Right next to San Francisco International Airport. IHOP in the facility. McDonald in a walking distance. a couple of minutes.

review.title: Easy stay

review.negativeRemarks: Shower was a bit old

review.title: Worn out!
review.reviewText: We spent the night here so we could catch an early flight out of SFO. We went for a lower priced hotel figuring we would just be sleeping there. While the staff at the registration desk were friendly, the Travel Lodge is an old and worn out hotel. The carpet in the room had burn marks from the iron, etc and there were smudge marks on the walls. There were a few unsightly plaster repairs over the wall paper next to the towel bar. The slider door for the bathroom was hard to slide. The sheets were worn thin by over bleaching in the laundry. The location was noisy being next to 101 and close to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: A lot. See above.
review.locationRemarks: Not much.

review.title: Avoid at all costs!
review.reviewText: This hotel is old, dirty, and noisy. I think the only reason it hasn't been condemned and torn down is because it's so close to the airport and they suck people in with easy access. But seriously, you're better off sleeping in the airport than this dump. I had a "suite" -- a king bed with a broken down sleeper sofa, and a refrigerator/microwave stack sitting in the middle of the room. The carpet had huge stains, the bathtub had been painted and was peeling, the suction mat for the tub was covered in black mold on the underside -- I could go on, but you get the picture. It also sits right under the flight path, so when planes take off and land you might as well be sitting on the tarmac. This is definitely not a place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the airport and the shuttle was free.
review.negativeRemarks: Tear it down and build a Holiday Inn Express.
review.locationRemarks: It's close to the airport, and frankly, I was afraid to leave my room and see what else was nearby.

review.title: Family San Francisco trip
review.reviewText: I reserved 3 rooms 768, 769 and 770 were issued to us for the evening of 6/23, 2013 the rooms were clean how ever the rooms, carpets etc are old the rooms smelled bad Room 770 had no hot water for showers and the bath tub drained very slow. The office said that I would get 1/2 off Room 770 for the inconvenience they also asked us to tell you. there was also 3 $1.00 charges added to my credit card that should be credited to me as well. waiting for those refunds to show up on my credit card.

review.title: Forsaken, Dumpy Hotel in So. SF Airport Area
review.reviewText:
The Travelodge Hotel in South San Francisco Airport Hotel was the worst hotel experience I can remember. I stayed at his dump for a business trip. The photos are a bad misrepresention of the hotel, as it appears to be clean. The room I was assigned, was located in the furthest part of the property. It was dirty, smelly, musty and small. Eectrical outlets to the bed lamp and desk lamp did not work. The bathroom door did not close properly, privacy is not even an option. No fan in the bathroom either. The complimentary internet connection had extremely poor reception and it did not work during my stay.

I made the mistake to walk on the carpet in my bare feet. My feet were sticky from the disgusting carpet. A refrigerator and a microwave in a room is an additional fee. The desk clerk in the lobby didn't even bother to offer a room with a fridge and microwave. An expensive amenity fee was required to stay at this dump.

I couldn't wait to leave the dump they call a hotel. Do not stay here, unless you want to waste your money on a dirty, smelly room.
review.positiveRemarks: There is nothing I like or find appealing about this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Demolish the place and start fresh. Build a newer and clean hotel that is appropriate for humans to sleep in.
review.locationRemarks: Near the 101 Fwy., couple of restaurants, gas station, and the airport.

The room smelled almost like cigarette, although it was "no smoking" room. The shower was in very poor condition. Breakfast includes toast, cereal, and some fruit.

review.title: Cheap and cheerful

Free shuttle every half hour so I used the BART to the airport and shuttle to hotel, then shuttle back again in the morning. Motel style on two floors so if you can't handle stairs be sure to get a street level room. Cheap and basic, I'd stay again.

Room was very far from the front desk area and seemed a little unsafe as there was not visible security in place. Also, the continental breakfast that came with the room rate was served in a room by the front desk which was quite far from our room. The room itself was very outdated and wasn't very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Need to update everything in the room. AC, bathroom fixtures, lighting, carpet and furniture are all very old and worn.

review.title: Shuttle was great.

Stucco on the ceiling and there is a wooden sliding door to separate the toilet & shower from the sink which is in the bedroom area. Water literally trickled from the showerhead. This was definitely more of a motel than hotel and the price per night should be less than $99/night.

review.title: Cheap and Clean but not a two star, one star maybe

This property was straight out of the 1970's. It was clean, there were no bugs, the location to the San Francisco Airport is GREAT and the price was cheap.

That said, the tiles in the shower were ready to fall off the wall, it looked like there have been 10 layers of paint on the walls. The pillows were lumpy, the bed extremely hard. The AC unit would only blow air, but not cool, fortunately it was San Francisco so I just cracked a window. Since this is a one story MOTEL, that does present a bit of a security issue having to leave a window open.

The owners of this MOTEL should bulldoze the place and build a new hotel property as it is a great location for a stopover or night before leaving from the airport location.

review.title: Old and smelly!
review.reviewText:
We had friends drop us off at the room, but didn't have them wait until we got all our luggage up the stairs to our room.

When we opened the door our nostrils were met with a very strong odor. The room smelled like mildew and old smoke( it was a non-smoking room). We thought the smell would lessen as we aired out the room, but it didn't.

When we complained the management did say we could have another room, but it was so far away from where we were and from the lobby where we had to be at 4 in the morning.

The smell was so bad that two members of my family and I went and played cards at the ihop restaurant for 4 hours until we were too tired to keep our eyes open.

My husband didn't sleep all night because of the smell.

To be fair, the staff was apologetic and the morning manager did take off the price for the roll away bed ( which my son said was so bad he just slept on the floor)

review.reviewText:
It was a pleasent surprise, after reading so many -ve reviews . The check-in was fine ( But for one Super smart guy who wanted to take refund for the booking done by his fiend, without ID and another guy who had never ending questions with 'Suppose' as prefix to each).I found the staff to be helpful and fast. The delay in check in of 15 minutes cannot be attributed to the staff.
The rooms were nice.Simple and functional. No mold or dirt seen.
No disturbance in the night.
We could get taxi thtrough Reception in less than 10 nminutes.
The 24Hrs IHOP within complex was a saviour for late night hunger attacks.
I would definitely recommend this hotel.
The swimming pool was nice and clean. No issues of 'Cats' or any dirt floating.
Very conveniently located prperty. Near to SFOAirport.

review.title: Horrible Experience!
review.reviewText: I had chosen to stay at this hotel as it is super close to SFO and also had a free airport shuttle. The staff was great and the room was ok. My horrible experience occurred around 10pm, when several police cars arrived on the hotel property (right outside of my hotel room) blaring their sirens. Apparently someone in the hotel was wanted by the cops. Anyways, it was very disruptive and I immediately did not feel safe. I had planned on staying in this hotel for 3 nights, however, I cancelled my reservations after the one night. This hotel is not enclosed, meaning your hotel room door opens directly to the outside. Again, the staff was great. There are not many options for food as this is in the industrial area. There's a McDonald's across the street and an iHop attached to the hotel. I will not stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Fine Hotel for a day or two
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel 3 or 4 times and have always found it satisfactory. It is an older property and could use some work, but overall it is fine for a day or two. It is not a fancy resort or luxury hotel and I would not want to stay there for a week but my room was clean and comfortable. There was freeway noise but it is not overwhelming. WiFi worked great for me (and it was free!). You can spend a lot more $$ and get someplace nicer but for the 8 hours I spent in the room, this hotel was fine. If you want fancy there are a lot of other hotels nearby that will cost you hundreds of dollars a night. If you just want a place to sleep overnight before/after a flight, you cannot go wrong here.

review.title: Get what you pay for...maybe.
review.reviewText:
It's a Travelodge near SFO so my expectations weren't high, but I was still surprised by the condition of the room and the noise level. The heater/AC unit has to be from 1976, though it blew warm air fine. The windows, albeit facing away from the freeway yet towards SFO, were circa 1967, i.e. 'swing' windows with a latch that did little to bolster against noise and weather. You'd think that at some point in the last 40 years they'd spend the $$ to get double-pane windows given their location. The room was clean aside from the usual stains on the chair cushions and carpeting. The shower (not shower/tub) was in pretty desperate need of replacing, frankly. It had seen better days.

Finally, while I appreciated the 'free breakfast' offer from 6-9am, I don't consider individually packaged Svenhard's sweet rolls, two cereals, and white/wheat toast as breakfast, but that's just me. Oh, they had some bananas (not replenished) and oranges & apples, as well as juice & coffee. Call it a continental offering then, don't offer me free breakfast that leaves me eating two pieces of toast and a cup of OJ.

My total cost was over $90...I know I'm in South SF and near SFO, but I've spent half as much for nicer rooms and better amenities all around CA.
review.positiveRemarks: Almost the least expensive lodging option near SFO
review.negativeRemarks: Underwhelming condition of facility.
review.locationRemarks: A bit loud given freeway and SFO traffic, easily remedied with improved sound-proofing.

review.title: Eh. Okay for last minute trip...
review.reviewText:
I knew because of the price I paid (last minute trip) that I wasn't going to being staying at a 4-star hotel but I expected at least a few things to be at a minimum standard. The water pressure in the shower was so low that it took twice the time to take a shower. The wifi was open and unprotected so just about anyone could log in which meant the connection was pretty slow. There were also only like 7 channels available to watch.

I've stayed at other hotels in the similar price range but this was the worst. I will not be coming back.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi, showers, and TV selection
review.locationRemarks: The location is good because it's right next to the airport so you can shuttle back and forth to the airport/BART.

review.title: Awful
review.reviewText:
I booked a non-smoking king and ended up with a smoking double. The room stunk and felt unclean. The bathroom was also gross.

When I arrived it took approximately 20 minutes to get through the line. The manager(I assume) was yelling at a guest who apparently had been a bit of a bear earlier. I did not see that interaction but the one I witnessed was uncomfortable. As I said, the room I was assigned was not what I had booked. At the counter he said, no kings, you get a double, but it wasn't until I arrived at the room that I realized it was smoking. The stench was so strong I knew before I opened the door that it was a smoking room.

Would absolutely not stay here again, nor recommend it.

review.title: All in all, it was a great stay.
review.reviewText:
To me this hotel was really nice. I think the only cons that I would point out is the breakfast, and the sound of the airplanes.

The breakfast was mostly toast and cereal, so we ended up going to ihop instead for breakfast.

The airplane sound didn't bother me at all. I actually only heard one once, and I was awake then.

I would also point out that the hotel charges your credit card a $100 deposit for incidentals, and it took quite awhile for them to take it off my credit card.

review.title: Just Okay...
review.reviewText:
First, I don't believe I've ever written a review for a hotel and I've been traveling for more than 15 years. That said...

Front desk clerk (Asian guy named John?) was really rude to several customers. I was shocked at his level of customer service, which definitely needs improving! However, I personally had no issues with him.

Wi-fi internet connection was virtually nonexistent in my room, which was just yards away from the front desk! Apparently the hotel got a new wireless network the day before I arrived, however, I think that was a lie! If "free wi-fi" is a key reason why you would select a hotel, than this hotel is probably not for you!

If you use the "business center" in the front lobby, internet usage is charged by the minute; additional cost for printing.

Free shuttle service was definitely a plus!

Overall, the only real problem I had with this hotel was the lack of wi-fi connection because I needed to get some work done, which is why I was in town. Furthermore, front desk agents could definitely benefit from some customer service training.
review.negativeRemarks: Virtually no wi-fi connection; customer service
review.locationRemarks: Just minutes from the airport, AT&T Center, etc. Excellent location.

review.title: Great for small family on tight budget
review.reviewText: It's perfect for a small family on a budget either in transit or catching an early flight. They have a free hotel shuttle that comes around every half hour--they don't wait for you, so be on time. The staff including shuttle drivers are very friendly and accommodating. There's a heated pool and also a 24-hour IHOP literally next door, so that was great for grabbing meals at any hour. The room itself could use some work especially on upkeep and maintenance (particularly the bathroom/bathtub), but overall, it was okay and great for our small family.

review.title: good option for an inexpensive overnight
review.reviewText:
I had to change plans and travel a day early to the San Fransisco area. I was looking for a cheap hotel for one night with a free shuttle to and from the airport. I was not looking for anything fancy. This hotel delivered.

This hotel was a good option for a quick overnight. The price was right and the free airport shuttle was a huge help.
The room was dated but clean, although there was a slight peculiar odor-- I just turned the vent on and didn't notice it after a while. I thought the bed was comfortable and I did not find anything dirty or questionable about the bedding.
I had no problems with the staff, they were all friendly and willing to give information.
There was a free continental breakfast. Nothing special. Fruit, toast, coffee and hot water for tea and a few prepackaged pastries.
I actually went to the IHOP that is also attached and was happy.

The hotel is in a busy area but I didn't feel unsafe at any time (single female traveling alone)

In a nutshell:
Easy to find shuttle to and from airport
Pool (I didn't use but looked decent enough)
dated but clean rooms
IHOP attached

The room was kind of dumpy. No electric outlet for the computer, had to unplug a lamp for the outlet. TV was disappointing, very few channels.
On the other hand, the price was good, there was no parking fee and a good breakfast of toast, cereal, oatmeal, apple or orange juice, danishes and coffee or tea was included, so overall it was ok.
review.negativeRemarks: The room
review.locationRemarks: Location is just north of San Francisco airport. Convenient to city and other attractions.

review.title: Website was misleading-no wi-fi in rooms
review.reviewText: The website stated that we would have wireless internet in the room, not so...you have to go to the lobby to get the wireless internet. When I called the office, she informed me that it doesn't work in the rooms, when I informed her that it was on the website, she said you can try it, but it doen's usually work. That was frustrating as lots of folks were in the lobby using wireless, not happy. It was a cheap place to stay as our flight was cancelled due to the weather in CO. The beds were hard, the heater was on or off, it is a cheap motel. The free shuttle to and from the airport was nice and they have a laundry to use, that was why we chose this one over another, we needed the laundry. There is also really nothing to do around there within walking distance, so I recommend staying further south so you can at least walk around the water on a path! It is by a IHOP and McDonalds, so that was helpful or you can use the shuttle to go to the airport and then take the BART to downtown. No, I will not stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Had a laundry room and airport shuttle
review.negativeRemarks: hard bed and pillows and mis-leading ad on the internet
review.locationRemarks: Nothing to do and no good walking paths, safe area other than this.

review.title: Horror
review.reviewText: Stayed there for one night for an early flight next morning. Although I didn't expect much from such hotels, I was still shocked to see its poor conditions. The first room they gave me was filthy. The second room not much better. I was even afraid that I might catch anything by sleeping on the bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Dreadful...even at that price.

review.title: Not Bad
review.reviewText: This Travelodge is located just north of San Francisco Airport with a shuttle service to and from the terminals. The rate was good and the room was clean and in decent shape but certainly not fancy. There was a complementary breakfast near the lobby with toast, cereal and fruit.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was outdated and could have used some improvements.
review.locationRemarks: Located just north of San Francisco Airport with a shuttle service to and from the terminals.

review.title: not good
review.reviewText: bad service, and bad enviroment. wait airport shuttle very long time.

review.title: Great for the traveler!

review.title: I would recommend your hotel.
review.reviewText:
I would not have choosen the hotel.
but after I had been there once, I liked to go back.
the rooms are clean.
the people are friendly.
the service is good.

review.title: Good price, but bad WIFI and breakfast service.
review.reviewText:
Overall good hotel and good value. Front desk was very friendly.

WIFI wasn't strong enough to access in the two different rooms I stayed in.

Continental breakfast ends at 9am, which is pretty early. One day, I only got there at 10am, and they were cleaning up. I asked the lady if I could grab a pastry from a basket for the road, and she refused.

The tub faucet leaked in one of the rooms.

review.title: No wifi signal in room
review.reviewText: Average for an overnight stay near the airport but I give it low marks because the "free wifi" does not work in the room at all, even though the room was close to the lobby. The hotspot is in the lobby and you have to be within 15 feet of the front desk to get a wifi signal. Not ideal for the busy traveler who needs to get a lot done!
review.negativeRemarks: No wifi
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

review.title: OK for One Night Only!
review.reviewText: grounds are okay but the condition of the room needs much improvement
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, especially the manager, was very helpful.

review.title: repeat customer

The staff is very easy to work with and will try and help anyway that they can. The continental breakfast is very good. They pool is also heated for year round swimming. Also an iHop restaurant is right next door.
review.negativeRemarks: The provided wifi is a little weak and needs to be enhanced
review.locationRemarks: Very close to San Francisco, and the airport. Very good jumping off point to enjoy the bay area

review.title: Ghetto hotel

review.title: More bang for the buck
review.reviewText: is a little worn but that's because it's always sold out I stay here after attending a party social event i would stay here again. The staff is great, I've stay at hotels that have a 3 or 4 rating , there not as clean. Or worth it. Travelodge more bang for the buck

review.title: About the motel
review.reviewText: Ok price.But only had wifi in office,only had under 5 channels on TV,rooms are old.And also bad service for the breakfast(The asian woman don't let me to get breakfst before the time end,she stopped me to get toast 5 minutes before the breakfast end.) and worst breakfast.One of the worst motel that I seem before!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Bad breakfast and bad breakfst service(The asian woman don't let me to get toast 5 mins before the time end),no wifi,old rooms,and under 5 channels.

The Wi-FI internet does not work in the rooms. It only works in the lobby. The floor carpet of the room I stayed in, is pealing off. The bath towels are very rough. The reading lamp was not working. I called the person on duty about the lamp and the internet and I was promised that the technical person will come to solve the problem but nobody came.
The rooms are super small. There is no plug free plug for charging ones cello phone or computer unless in the bath room.

The hotel is not upgraded to the modern technology.

review.title: SFO Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: Easy acces from freeway 101 and right next to SFO airport. Close to big shopping mall. Plenty of free parking and an out door pool. Free wifi and continental breakfast. Ihop and McDonalds restaurants just across the street.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice big room and great maid service.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi signal was too weak in my room to connect my iPad.
review.locationRemarks: Right off Freeway 101 next to SFO airport.

review.title: Wouldn't recommend for a family.
review.reviewText: My cousin and I stayed at this hotel because we weren't looking to pay much. Since we are never in the room, we just wanted a place to sleep. It's not someplace I would take my wife and child. Walls are too thin. Bathroom is not very updated. But if you just want a place to sleep, the price is worth it. Very close to the airport and Candlestick park. Mcdonalds down the street, because the continental breakfast is basically cereal and toast.
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom

review.title: budget stay
review.reviewText: The room was clean Did not expect much for the cost. Breakfast not great but at least it was provided
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast
review.locationRemarks: it was outside of San Francisco Ca

review.title: "First and LAST time... NEVER again"
review.reviewText:
I usually never take the time to write reviews for hotels... but in this case, people must be warned!

This "hotel" is extremely run-down and you can tell that the upkeep of it is not made a priority, as if they expect guests to just suck it up and endure the crappy conditions during their stay and most likely never return again. The front desk staff is rude and unaccommodating, even when several mistakes were made on their behalf. I would definitely NOT recommend this "hotel" to anybody... You would have a much more pleasant stay at a Motel 6... for a fraction of the cost!

review.title: if you just need a place to sleep
review.reviewText:
The towels, sheets, etc were clean and the things the people who do the daily house keeping were clean. However, there was some mold on the walls by the door, and the wall paper by the bathroom was pulling away from and rolling up the wall.

The largest issue for me was that I purposely looked for a hotel with internet when doing my search and they did not have any. The desk staff said they were upgrading it it and it would be better in a few months.

review.title: Great value for money!
review.reviewText: Convenient location, cheap, clean and confortable rooms!

review.title: Parked our car during our trip
review.reviewText: We parked our car during our trip and liked the shuttle service to/from airport

review.title: Cheap rates, Cheap rooms
review.reviewText: bathroom needs renovating.Paint chipping,cracked tiles,etc.Room has a strong deoderizer smell,maybe trying to mask an unpleasant odor. The good side, it is within a mile of downtown So San Francisco. lots of dinning and stores.

review.title: The best bargain for SFO fliers
review.reviewText: I've stayed in Travelodge San Francisco Airport North twice in 3 weeks. The first time I was given a small dormer style room that was very quiet and the bed was quite comfortable. I used few of the services, for the price and last minute booking, it was perfect for my need. This last one was in a larger room right off the pool and can only be described as very pleasant. When I left on the free airport shuttle, I was the last one dropped off and found that one of my bags was missing and one in its place looked just like it. I could not contact the shuttle company,my flight was fast approaching in a panic I called the lobby of the hotel and the desk manager took charge and within 20 minutes my by was retrieved from the person who was given the wrong bag, and the rest of the international flight was uneventful. If the desk manager had not gone out of his way on that busy checkout morning I would have had my entire trip ruined. I will definitely return and will recommend the Travelodge as the best bargain near the airport. An additional point. The complimentary breakfast was a full restaurant breakfast, I was expecting the usual coffee and stale roll but was surprised by this generous feature.
review.positiveRemarks: Big, comfortable bed and quiet clean room and free full restaurant style breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, everything was fine
review.locationRemarks: Just north of San Francisico International Airport, with free on-the-half-hour shuttle

review.title: Best Value Stay and Park
review.reviewText:
This is a perfect place for a Stay and Park. We left our car for 16 days and since we had a midnight arrival with a 4 hour drive home we spent the night before the drive home.

Having the 24 hour IHOP restaurant onsite really helps with off hour arrivals and departures.

An added plus there's a row of nice restaurants on Grand Ave just a 5 minute drive from the hotel.

review.title: Miss and Hit
review.reviewText:
Our reservation was for a room with a king size bed. When we arrived late at night (nearly Midnight) we were tired and when we got to the room found two smaller beds. We didn't have the energy after our flight to dispute this. It would have been better if they had told us at the desk that we weren't going to get what was expected.
On the positive side the price was a good value and the hotel is near the airport and is quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Finding the room was difficult due to poor lighting.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the San Francisco Airport

review.title: Great place to stay between flights
review.reviewText:
I was able to check in early, at 11:30 am. Very kind of the hotel manager to do this. The room was clean. It needs a little painting and fixxing up. I was anoided that there was No basic TV channels to watch. You have to pay for everything.

Price was excellent and they have free shuttle from the Airport.

Over all, I was happy and will stay there again, between flights.
review.negativeRemarks: No free TV to watch, must pay for everything

review.title: A short stay is a pleasant stay!
review.reviewText: If you are working in the area for a couple days or staying overnight to catch an early flight this is your motel. If you are on vacation here this is definitely not your motel. The room rates are great, the beds are comfortable, the shower water pressure is good, there is an IHOP restaurant on site, a heated pool, and a gas station snack shop nearby. All good things! However, this is the type of motel where you have to wear socks at all times, spray disinfectant on the tv remote, get bye the lack of maintenance of the shower, stained floor coverings, and the freeway noise. The breakfast is basic with toast, bagels, cereal, coffee & OJ, in a small crowded room, but free is free! Also, they charge a $100 security deposit that takes several days to come off your credit card.
review.positiveRemarks: The room rates, restaurant on site
review.negativeRemarks: Freeway noise, stained carpets
review.locationRemarks: Just north of SFO airport, about 3 minutes from long term parking. About 15 minutes from downtown SF (during non- commute hours)

review.title: Overcharched.
review.reviewText:
The only problem I had was that they asked me for a credit card just for security and at the end I was charged 100 dollars more on my credit card, which I am disputing now.
A second bad thing is the fact that there is no wireless connection on the room

review.title: Worsst experience I have ever had...
review.reviewText: The hotel room had a mold problem, smelled moldy + strong chemicals. The bathroom was disgasting and I did not want to touch anything. We left the room early morning since did not want to stay there longer.

review.title: Quick, cheap and convenient
review.reviewText: For the price, this is a great place although I would not spend more than an overnight between flights. Quick pick up and deliver to and from airport, near a few restaurants for late night stroll and dinner or breakfast staff are friendly and quite helpful. Shower was hot and coffee pot was nice touch even though the price was low.

review.title: Highly rated!
review.reviewText: Only there for a few hours, but it was a pleasant experience. I would recommend this to my friends and family ! Thx so much!

review.title: You get what u pay for

review.locationRemarks: Great location close to airport

review.title: great place to stay

review.title: The place is a war zone
review.reviewText: The bathroom of my hotel room had mold growing all over it. The room smell like old dirty Construction clothing. The bed was so dirty that I slept with my clothes on and a hat on so my skin did not touch the blankets. The staff was rude arrogant obnoxious and smelled horrible. I stayed at lot of places in my time in the United States Marine Corps but none were as bad as that hotel.

review.title: Great value for your money!!!
review.reviewText: For the price I had paid for the room, I cannot expect more.

review.locationRemarks: Conveniently close to the airport near an ihop

review.title: Close to SFO and cheap...
review.reviewText: The best thing about this hotel is that it's less than 2 miles to the rental car return at SFO. That being said, it's also pretty cheap and the room was clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. My main concern were 'security' issues. I was somewhat nervous about being alone as it certainly looked easy to break into the room if someone was motivated to so and who would ever hear you? I didn't see any security people stationed or walking around and it's a very large area. Also, there is a large sign at the check-in desk about pets not being allowed but my sleep that night was punctuated by a dog barking ALL night long (not constantly but every 15 minutes or so) it must have been right next to my room but I didn't feel comfortable complaining.
review.positiveRemarks: Cheap and near rental car return at SFO

review.title: Cheap Cheap Cheap...
review.reviewText:
Needed to reset the card key 5 times to get in.
Heater is not working

review.title: Disappointed Travellers
review.reviewText: The staff was very accomodating before we checked in. Our flight was delayed by 4 hours and we had to do a late check-in. We were very disappointed with the state of the hotel. It was quite run down. There was mold or something in the bathroom. They list WiFi as one of their amenities, unfortunately the WiFi hotspot is in the lobby and we were located at the far end of the furtherest unit and we did not have any WiFi. We had to rely on my cellphone's hotspot feature. The security latch on the door was only half secured, the bottom screw was either stripped out or the door frame had rotted around it. The beds and pillows were hard and uncomfortable.

review.title: OK for one night
review.reviewText: The condition of the hotel isnt the best anymore. But if youre just looking for a bed and a shower for a one night stay, youll get it here for a good value.

review.title: parking is bad

review.title: Terrible Service
review.reviewText: The guy at the front desk was very rude. Just unbelievable.

review.title: For the first time dsappointed by a Travel Lodge h
review.reviewText: Noisy and too busy. Internet available ONLY in the noisy and crowded lobby, with only 2 chairs and a sofa!
review.negativeRemarks: Noise

review.title: Dank and wet
review.reviewText: The only reason this hotel worked was I needed something close to the airport! It was utterly disgusting! The carpet through out the room was damp and wet!

review.title: Great if you like third world living.
review.reviewText: This is THE worst place I have ever stayed in and that includes some rather "rustic" places in the Caribbean. First, the "free internet" is useless. Couldn't get a connection at all. The room is so small that we had to yield to one another to walk around the bed to the bathroom. The WORST thing was that it was freezing in there and the heater id not work. All of the buttons on it were broken. I called the front desk about it and they sent some guy with a fire hazard of a space heater (picture included) to take up MORE walking space in the already impossible to negotiate room. A broken down heap of a place and I will NEVER set foot in anything under the Travelodge name again.
review.positiveRemarks: ONLY that is was close to SF but there are WAY better options.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything else.

review.title: Clean good budget hotel
review.reviewText: It's a hotel to get a night of rest. I really didn't think it deserved so many of the harsh reviews it had received that I read about before booking my stay there. It was very clean and had what I needed, a bed. I had to stay there as a last minute thing and it was fine, I'd stay there again for the price.

review.title: low price and very good

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport.

review.negativeRemarks: No restaurant service and to pay for the cable tv. The price is hight.

review.title: It's feels like a rundown motel.

Pros:

- good size fridge, with microwave.
- Clean room.

Cons:
- stain in the shower and paint pealing off in the bath tub.
- broken tower hanger in the shower.
- Limited wall outlet, so bring your own power strip if you want to charge all your electronic stuff.
- There is WiFi signal, but you can't connect to it.

Luckily this was just a quick resting place for the 7 hours between flights...should have slept on the chairs in the airport! If my wife had been with me, she would have said let's go someplace else, this is disgusting! They say you get what you pay for...in this case I paid way too much!

I would never stay in this hotel again for sure.

review.title: Simple, Convenient & Economical
review.reviewText: It served its purpose well. It afforded me a good night's sleep within close proximity to the SFO Int'l Airport and Rental Car Center. That's all I really needed. It was far and away the least expensive option I could find in the area... I did find it shocking that the "business center" computers near the front desk cost $3 for first 10 minutes of use, even if all I wanted to do was print out a boarding pass. Totally ridiculous. But, of course, I had the option of not using their computer and printer. So, I didn't... Other than that, the old place was comfortable and convenient. Parked right outside my door like at any of the classic old travel motels. Car rental return is a minute or two drive down the street...
review.positiveRemarks: Inexpensive room rate, parking close to room, close to airport & car rental center.
review.negativeRemarks: Charge $3 for first 10 minutes of use for computers & printers at front desk area's "business center".

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Perfect location for a one night stay if you missed your flight
review.negativeRemarks: High price for what they ofer
review.locationRemarks: perfect for one night

review.title: The 90's called and they want their hotel back.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in dire need of renovation. It is extremley outdated & in poor condition. The wallpaper in the bathroom was seamed together with a staple gun. The mattress was hard as a rock. The only thing between me and the coil springs was a thin mattress pad. The sheets were questionable and did not look fresh & clean. Unfortunately this was the only hotel in the area with rooms available due to the World Series in San Francisco. There are several other hotels in close proximity that were sold out. Their continental breakfast consisted of pastries from Costco still in wrappers. We upgraded to a Suite. Overall, it was not a good value for the money. We would never reserve a room there again. Would have been better off selecting another hotel and having the inconvenience of a further commute to our destination.
review.positiveRemarks: It was next door to IHop and a gas station.
review.negativeRemarks: The entire room especially the mattress.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport. Better hotels located across the street. Holiday Inn, Holiday Inn Express & Four Points.

review.title: dont go

review.negativeRemarks: Sewage

review.title: Not a bad stop!
review.reviewText: The hotel is obviously in need of hard furnishing renovations, but the soft furnishings were quite new, and the bathroom, shower etc were in very acceptable conditions, again given the level of hotel and price. Staff was friendly at check in/out and very efficient. Denny's restaurant on premises.Traffic noise was high, but easily masked with the sound of the room AC/heater, which monotone him drowned out the traffic noise from Hwy 101 nicely. The king bed was very comfortable, and the linens crisp and clean. A good stop for the tired traveler, especially if you have a 6AM flight! Shuttle to airport is on the half-hour starting 4 AM, takes about 20M.
review.positiveRemarks: the bed and free wireless internet
review.negativeRemarks: Windows did not seal out traffic noise, and thin walls (made for interesting entertainment).
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient location close to airport and Hwy 101, Denny's, McD, Houlahans and other restaurants steps away.

review.title: Choose Elsewhere

review.title: Comfort & Economy
review.reviewText: Efficient service. Good natured welcome. Reasonable cost.

review.title: one night

review.negativeRemarks: airplane noise but not terrible

review.title: Give me a break!!!

Very few tv channels because they are trying to make you pay for movies. it's bad enough when 5 star hotels do it, but a 1/2 star hotel like this. Rediculous!!!!

I only recommend this hotel because the rates of all the other hotels in the area are outrageous and this hotel thievery should be outlawed!!!!!!!

review.title: Very disappointing
review.reviewText: This hotel is very basic, and not well maintained. One of the beside lamps did not work. We stayed there one night in October and there was only a thin blanket on the bed. The staff is not particularly friendly. The cleaning lady knocked on our door at 8:45am waking my daughter up, this was irritating. Breakfast is available 6am-9am and we got to the door at some seconds passed 9am and the door was locked. Will not stay there again.

review.title: maid service and front desk ignored our compliant
review.reviewText: we had a leak in the bathroom and tried to mop it up after the cleaning services had left. despite our informing the front desk, they said it was a handicap room and we must have just allowed the water from the open shower to flood the floor. we told them that after our showers, we didn't have this problem. It was the next day after the maid service came in to clean our room while we were away that they left a huge puddle of water on the floor. either they had a leak from their toilet or the maids didn't mop up after themselves. either way, the front desk did nothing about it and just ignored our compliant. bad form, travelodge!
review.positiveRemarks: closeness to the doctor's office and the price was decent enough that we may travel and stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: service from front lobby staff

review.title: Never recommend

In the room of this hotel does not have a microwave nor refrigerator, unlike the hotel's web.
The response by the hotel staff to my complaint was "only suite rooms have microwaves, but those rooms are all occupied".
With the true information on the web, I would never never book that hotel.

review.reviewText: There was no WiFi in the Room and one has to go to the lobby to access it. Also toilet construction wasn't that great. The door wouldn't even lock

review.title: Needs Improvement
review.reviewText: The room stunk and was muggy when I first walked in. People were hanging out in front of their doors and the police were constantly in and out. It reminded me of the projects.

review.title: Avoid at all cost
review.reviewText: This is a place to avoid. I would normally never stay at a Travel Lodge but was in a jam after after another website booked me on the wrong night. The hotel has not been maintained at all. There was wood rot throughout the hotel. A plate cover for an outlet was missing. The carpeting was stained. The TV was an old tube TV and all the channels were snowy. The front door did not feel secure. The tub was just plain gross. It is the only time I have showered and felt dirtier after I was done. The only reason I stayed was because there were no other rooms avaiable in the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything listed above.
review.locationRemarks: The area was dingy and I did not feel safe.

review.title: South San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is reasonable priced and clean. It is an older hotel, but no complaints consider the price.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, it isn't that far from San Francisco and you don't have to pay a toll everytime you go into the city like you would if you stay in Oakland.
review.negativeRemarks: The water did not stay warm the entire time I was in shower.

review.title: Okay hotel, don't expect much
review.reviewText: Staff was nice and allowed us early check-in. The AC did not work in the first room given to us, so we switched rooms. The layout of the room was a little strange as it had the AC blowing right into the window, but the room did eventually get cold. Parking was not great. We choose this for easy access to SFO airport and Candlestick park and was accomodating for both. No free wi-fi. My husband picked up small signal in the room, but it kept going in and out. Had to take laptop to the lobby to work on school work (this was frustrating as it was busy and loud in there). There is a charge for using their computers in the lobby, but not sure how much. We did not use their shuttle for the airport, but I overheard it was $15 per person. It was very loud in the mornings with people walking past the rooms and maintenance guys doing yard work. Also, no tub in the bathroom, and door to the bathroom did not work, but shower was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: No free wi-fi in rooms, had to go to lobby to access internet for school work.

review.title: don't stay here
review.reviewText: unwelcoming staff, cold, musty, dark and dank rooms. we had to walk almost a block in the dark just to find our room. Stay someplace else.

review.title: It was the Best Price Deal In South San Francisco
review.reviewText: For the price, it was the best deal in SSF. I was a bit taken back by the smell of the room upon first entering - most likely due to some deoderizer being used. After ventilating the room for a while the oder dimished. The furnishings were all in good condition, the beds were clean and comfortable, the WI-FI operated at a snails pace, the carpeting was clean and the TV was old but in good condition. The motel is a large complex of two story buildings with most of the parking some distance away from the room. We pull our car right up to the room for loading and unloading. This motel is very well situated for freeway easy freeway access to San Francisco or south toward San Jose. Frontage roads provide easy access to SFO and car rentals. There are frequent shuttle to SFO. IHOP restrurant is attached to the motel plus there are many other eateries close by.

review.title: I would not recommend this hotel. Period.
review.reviewText:
Our room was almost tolerable, and we were given a roll-away bed with a mattress that should have been thrown out ages ago. The beds were hard, bathroom door (pocket door) not only didn't lock, but was extremely hard to close.

The continental breakfast was poorly designed in a very crowded room and appeared to let in many people who may not have been hotel guests (that is just an assumption).
Most disturbing was that we drove in and out 2 times, and EVERY time, a police officer was either coming in or leaving one of the areas of the hotel. Did not feel safe AT all.

The only plus side was that the staff was pleasant and kindly knocked off the $10 roll-away bed fee, but honestly you would have to pay me to stay there.
review.locationRemarks: Noisy, but expected due to proximity to airport and freeway (and single paned windows)

review.title: it is ok for one night, not more.
review.reviewText: very noisy just rigth beside route 101, breakfast disappointing.

review.title: OK hotel in a pinch.
review.reviewText:
Hotel was OK, but the online listing said there was WiFi in the room. There was none. Wifi worked in the lobby, but only sometimes.
Listing also said the rooms had refrigerators. They did not. Staff said I could get a refrigerator if i paid for an upgrade.
Desk staff was polite but way overloaded, so it was hard to get to them.
review.negativeRemarks: deceptive listing of services
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to airport, but not exactly scenic.

review.title: Worst hotel for a family.
review.reviewText:
We were VERY dissapointed. I felt mistreated by the front desk staff when I got to check in.
They lost a CUSTOMER.
review.negativeRemarks: No comment
review.locationRemarks: Good.

review.title: Affordable near SFAirport
review.reviewText: It was a bed, in a clean, affordable motel. That's all I was looking for. Good job.

review.title: They provide less services than what they say.
review.reviewText:
The person who was in the lobbit was rude and uncompetent, they just provide 1 key. They say in expedia that they have wifi, and thas's not true, they say that they have but it just works in the lobby. In my opinion they cannot say that they have wifi. The room has not microwave oven, and it would have been very convenient because we travel with our baby. This is the only Travel lodge which has not microwave oven in the room and that doesn't include breakfast.

If youre going to go there go to the other side of the 101 in San Bruno, we were in 2 motels there and they both were much beter.

review.title: Very dissappointed!
review.reviewText: 2 adults and 2 children. Booked this hotel due to its location near to the airport. Was so shocked and disappointed. The room had this awful smell, which we soon found out it was because of the faulty toilet! We had to report it and call out a member if staff on 3 occasions has it was not flushing and smelt! Staff was in no rush to rectify the problem! !Bearing in mind this was only 1 night stopover! The beds were extremely uncomfortable and unbearable even for just to get your head down for a quick rest! Very disappointed and shall not be recommending this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location- near to the hotel And shuttle service!
review.negativeRemarks: The room and service! Basics not working!
review.locationRemarks: Near to the airport!

review.title: OK for a "one night stand"
review.reviewText: This hotel served it's purpose. The room was not as clean as should be expected, however the staff was very pleasant and accommodating.

review.title: Very worn out.
review.reviewText: They need to knock this place down and start again.
review.negativeRemarks: Room and furnishings are from 1970.
review.locationRemarks: Noisy. No amenities.

review.title: nice price but poor service
review.reviewText: We waited 45 nimutes to check in - only one employee gave a service to the long line. The line for the breakfast was also long (10 minutes).

review.title: Good quality/price/location
review.reviewText: The main advantage is proximity to the airport at a reasonable price with shuttle access. The main disadvantage is the street and airport noise. Also lack of wi fi in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Easy airport access with a gas station next door for those returning a rental car.

review.title: Hotel from HELL
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel and our stay here was DREADFUL, I would not have my worst enemy stay here.
review.negativeRemarks: Staying
review.locationRemarks: Dirty, gross, no guest service at all

review.title: Manage your expectations
review.reviewText:
The first room I had smelled like pool towel mildew; the smell was so over power that I almost vomited after opening the door. I immediately went to the front desk and complained. I was told it was nothing wrong with the room, and they did not have any more. Since I was stay for one night, I thought it would be ok.

I went back to the room, and was again over taken by the smell. I marched back down to the front desk and requested another room or a refund. I received another that did not smell like mildew. I was a lot happier.

The only thing that sucks, is limited to no access to wifi. You have to be in the lobby in order get receive wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: limited to no access to wifi from your room.
review.locationRemarks: good location, close to McD's mini marts, and denny's

review.title: GREAT HOTEL
review.reviewText: WE WERE PLEASED OF HOW FREINDLY THE PEOPLE WERE. ROOM WAS GREAT, THEY HAD AN IRON WITH IRONING BOARD WHICH WAS GREAT! ONE FLAW WAS THAT THE CURTAINS WERE IN THE WAY OF THE A/C. BUT OTHER THAN THAT, WE HAD A PLEASANT STAY
review.negativeRemarks: CURTAINS FLYING AROUND WHILE A/C ON.
review.locationRemarks: IT WAS OF COURSE VERY BUSY AND CONGESTED, BUT OVERALL GREAT PARKING
review.userLocation: San Francisco International Airport (SFO), San Bruno Ave E, San Francisco, CA 94128, USA

review.title: Not so clean
review.reviewText: If you are just staying one quick night for a flight this hotel will work. It looks like it was remodeled 30 years ago and the bathroom was not real clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Quick to and from on shuttle to the airport. The IHOP had good food in the same complex.
review.negativeRemarks: It's cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco Airport North

review.title: Advertised wifi did not work!
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because it was near the airport and had wifi. The wifi was my main concern, if there was wifi I was good. The wifi did not even work!!! It was dreadful slow when it did work, and would disconnect or freeze after a max of 2 minutes of use. I would definitely never stay here again!
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco

review.title: Totally gross.
review.reviewText: Black mold in the tub. Carpet tearing, walls had holes, room smelled dirty, walls paper thin--could hear airplanes like I was right under them. Room was cold. Staff tried to move us to another already occupied room.
review.negativeRemarks: black mold
review.locationRemarks: horrible location

review.title: Stay away or stay awake
review.reviewText:
"You said the hotel has WiFi Internet." "Yes, but it only works in the lobby, not in your room."

"I explicitly requested a non smoking room." "The room is a non smoking room."
"But it smells cigarette. You can come and smell it yourself." "You asked for a non smoking room and the room is a non smoking room."

.

review.title: blah
review.reviewText: gross hotel...........actually motel! Creepy as a woman staying on the ground floor of a motel!
review.negativeRemarks: gross carpet, peeling wallpaper!

review.title: no Internet in the room
review.reviewText: Just so so, almost no Internet in the room, only can have in the small lobby!!

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: The room is very dated. Wallpaper coming off. Carpet lifting, shower was very old and tired looking, tiles looked very dirty because they were so old. Cracks and poor repair work.
review.negativeRemarks: Very tired and old needed a lot of work
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

review.title: Cheap quality NAND overpriced
review.reviewText: Very expensive, smelled like mold/old, wall paper peeling off, tub old n corroded........called front desk for a question n phone was never answered. Just bad completely disappointed!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Noisy

review.title: Not a first choice, but does the job
review.reviewText: Late booking, busy time of year! This Travelodge was as close as we could find to SFO. Waited fifteen minutes to check in, long walk in dark area to room. Clean, satisfactory room. Convenient, on-time shuttle to airport for early departure was very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Long, dark walk to room
review.locationRemarks: Busy, near highway

review.title: Very poor maintenance
review.reviewText: Air conditioner out of service, insects screen was break, the carpe,t down the watch hands, wet, the lamp was burn.
review.positiveRemarks: Tha kindness of Roberto in the front desk

review.title: HORRIBLE!
review.reviewText:
We had 2 rooms. In 1st room, the mattress cover had some stains that looks biological (blood or otherwise) all over it. DISGUSTING! Person sleeping in that bed slept on top of covers and only got a couple of hours of sleep because of the disgust.

The instructions on how to use the phone (how to dial front desk, etc) were completely wrong and there were absolutely no other instructions on how to use it. It took me 20 minutes to contact the front desk.

In 2nd room, phone didn't work, tv remote didn't work, tv would turn on with the power button on the tv, but the control buttons on the tv didn't work. So, tv was unusable.

Continental breakfast - room was HORRIBLY overcrowded. Barely standing room. Only 1 line of food available so al were forced into 1 space and took VERY long. Food selection extremely disappointing. Toasters had setting dials you couldn't decipher. I only discovered that it was set too hot after burning my toast.

Food supply also poor & due to space I had to eat my burnt toast outside on retaining wall where, in attempt to spread jam, flipped plate and lost 2nd piece of toast. All because there was no table for me. In the end, I ate a piece of burnt toast for breakfast and had no interest in going back into the mess to try to get more.

On the night of our arrival, the police showed up as we were checking in to deal with a car break-in. The campus is designed with poor lighting and is spread out enough that it's touch to feel safe.
review.positiveRemarks: It was good to know that the police responded quickly to a call. That helped me feel a LITTLE safer. That's the most positive thing I can think of.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of room, non-working equipment (phone, tv, etc), and horrible breakfast experience.
review.locationRemarks: Unsafe and dirty feeling...

review.title: Not a good choice for the price
review.reviewText: The bed was very uncomfortable, too hard for me...
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms too old
review.locationRemarks: Location is great

review.title: Worst hotel ever
review.reviewText: Way over priced for the extremely poor quality. Broken toilet, mold on bathroom door, stained and dirty carpet, holes in the bedspreads, broken tv... should I go on? One of the worst values I have ever had.
review.negativeRemarks: broken toilet
review.locationRemarks: signs in the hotel parking lot read 'park at your own risk'.

review.title: not bad for 1 or 2 nights stay
