review.reviewText: OK for a one or two night stay. Area for free continental breakfast was too small to acommodate hotel guests. So, needless to say we ate breakfast elsewhere.
review.positiveRemarks: shuttle to and from airport provided
review.negativeRemarks: The one thing that turned me off were the stray cats roaming around the property.
review.locationRemarks: great access right off the highway

review.title: Inexpensive and convenient
review.reviewText: It was better than I thought it would be- I was pleasantly surprised. The reviews I read weren't very good, I'm glad to say my experience was quite pleasant. The room was old but clean, the wi-fi worked very well, and the room was comfortable and quiet. I would recommend it if you want an inexpensive place to stay near SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: Few restaurants available nearby.
review.locationRemarks: Good.

review.title: AWFUL!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was awful. I would say more but I don't have enough space. I would definitely NOT recommened this to ANYONE. It was falling apart.

review.title: less is not more
review.reviewText:
- no Wifi at the guestroom
- you have to finisch your breaksfast right at 9 o'clock
review.locationRemarks: right next to the airport and every noise gets through the door

review.title: Bad hotel experience in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The buildings were worn down and dilapitated. The walls inside my room appeared to be dirty in places, and in need of paint. There were large holes in the baseboards of the bathroom, which looked to be entrances and exits for rodents. The television picture looked like something out of the early 1950's, with a semblance of color. The air conditioning did not work as the dials were broken off and simply put back in place to disguise the fact that the issue had not been attended to, probably for months. The internet did not work,even though my computer indicated that I had a connection. The story varied from the front desk personnel. They said there was a temporary problem with the server. They said there was a problem with the server that could not be resolved. They said too many rooms were accessing the internet at the same time. They said the lobby was the "hot spot" and the rooms couldn't access te internet.
I am quite frankly surprised that eithewr Travelodge or Expedia would affiliate themselves with this
review.positiveRemarks: Some of the staff were polite and tried to be helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: I have said enough.

review.title: A place to avoid
review.reviewText: I don't normally respond to these surveys, but this experience was horrible. The room was not well maintained, stained everywhere, the sheets were thinner than paper, nothing appeared clean, the air conditioner sounded like a freight train, and the hotel is right next to the freeway so the commuter traffic sounds like it is driving through the parking lot. I will never stay in that hotel again!
review.positiveRemarks: The only positive about this hotel is the easy access to SFO
review.negativeRemarks: everything else

review.title: Terrible hotel
review.reviewText: This was the worst hotel I have been in during the past 15 years. Dirty rooms with bad smell. Hotel is near a highway and inside rooms was noisy.

review.title: Nothing to write home about
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for. An old sprawling motel on a busy highway. My only complaint was I booked a non smoking room and hiked all the way to it (I came on the motel's airport shuttle) to find it was a smoking room. I called to ask for a switch, which was arranged, but when I hiked back to the office, the desk clerk hadn't yet bothered to issue a new key so I had to wait while he did so before hiking back to the new room. Small things, but you'd expect a little better service for a business traveler late at night. It costs nothing but apologies and a quick rectification would go a long way.
review.locationRemarks: Busy highway but quiet inside my room

review.title: Great for overnight before early-morning flights
review.reviewText:
My husband and I stay at everything from five star hotels (paid for by business) to economy hotels (paid by ourselves). I don't expect an economy hotel to be 5-star. This hotel was everything we asked for, to spend a night before an early-morning flight. We were given a room just outside the pool, close to the office and got Wi-Fi in our room. We recommend you ask for it specially. It was a good as any economy hotel we've ever stayed at and better than most. No bad smells or thin sheets. The staff was wonderful and printed out our boarding pass for us. We ate dinner at i-HOP, just steps from our room, with its usual food. Of course we left at 4 AM, so didn't try the breakfast.

Only apparent drawback: children said the pool was unheated, but we were using the hotel only for easy access to the airport and glad there was no pool noise!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: great rental-car access to the airport

review.title: Very Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: Very clean, very friendly staff, and recommend to everyone like I said. Enjoyable stay.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Got what I requested

review.title: Not worth staying
review.reviewText: The front desk staff did not accomodate us to switch the 2nd floor room assigned to us even though I mentioned that my companion friend had difficulty with the steps, The air conditioner made a lot of rattling sound that will keep you awake all night. We are glad to check out the next morning, it's not even worth the price we paid for an overnight stay.

review.title: Disgusting!
review.reviewText: Only out of desperation did we stay here after our flight was canceled and it was getting late. Thankfully, our stay was only 10 hours; less would have been better. The place was dull, shabby and dirty and we hope we didn't bring home any unwanted guests/pests. The line-up to check in was busy with only one person at the front desk serving all of the exhausted and stressed people. We were assigned a room in building 7, which is way across their compound. We had to drag our luggage all the way there through a dimly lit parking lot on a cart with wheels going flat. The carpets were old and worn, windows rusty and insecure with dirt along the ledge and the screens half pried open. The bath tub was gross, with the sides coming off, moldy grout and grime in the non-slip surface. No way were we using that. There was a sliding door for the bathroom that barely shut and it didnt even fit the space properly. Hint - don't even think of sleeping with the bedspread touching any part of your body. We were able to grab some cereal, toast and fruit from the breakfast room in the morning - can't go much wrong with that. And, we did manage to hook into their wireless internet. I would sleep at the airport next time if this was the only other choice.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Dark and scary

review.title: Disgusting
review.reviewText: This was the last stop of a two week trip in multiple hotels--all different and more than acceptable until we arrived at this dump. Wall paper peeling, dirty walls, stains on rugs, sheets were so worn there were almost holes in them which made it worse because the mattress pad did not cover the whole bed. The bedspread was old and pilled. The room smelled of mold AND other unknown odors with a combination of cleaning products--opening the windows would not air out the room. The bathroom fan was so clogged with dust, it will probably implode soon. Peeling paint in on walls as well as tile that must have been painted years ago. Had we not arrived late, were tired, had an early flight and had to return a rental car to the airport, we would have left. They did change us to a different room---but the only difference was better sheets. I could not wait to get up-- to get out!
review.negativeRemarks: Filth
review.locationRemarks: Decent

review.title: Dreadful hotel. Would not recommend to anyone
review.reviewText:
dreadful hotel. Rude, inefficient staff. Dilapidated stairs, hallways, old, dirty carpets.
Everything in terrible condition. I would not recommend it to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: Eveything
review.locationRemarks: Noisy

review.title: travelodge SF
review.reviewText:
Staff rude! Room extremely noisy! No WiFi in rooms. and very slow in lobby!
Not worth the money

review.title: Do not stay here
review.reviewText: Worst place I've ever strayed at. Room smelled. Bed was extremely uncomfortable. Stains on the walls.

review.title: Need Renovation
review.reviewText:
the hotel location is Good. But the hotel itself is a bit old. Need renovation. I get the room in the back building, feel spooky because we arrive at night. Some other hotel with better situation nearby. There is IHOP on the premises.
The breakfast is basic.
review.negativeRemarks: The building and surrounding
review.locationRemarks: The Location closed to SF airport

review.title: good place to stay with the family
review.reviewText:
One thing which very much pinched was our flight was delayed for more than two hours BWI.i was booked for 5 nights with airport shuttle and continental breakfast.because of delays for more than two and half hours delay for that reached there only after 1a.m.I couldn't find the hotel shuttle so take another airport shuttle for for I had to pay because the management denied on the ground that they don't have hotel shuttle service after 12.30a.m.
Here my say is once the passenger is booked with transportation to and fro from the hotel hotel must make alternative arrangement for the transportation or the hotel should pay for
the transportation.It was very irritating.Other service was satisfactory.
review.negativeRemarks: taking no care for their booked passenger at the airport.
review.locationRemarks: I like it.

review.title: it was good.
review.reviewText: I did not expect the hotel, but it was good. if i visit the san francisco again, i will be there.

review.title: Outdated bathroom that need a great touch of TLC.
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful and courteous. The rooms are outdated and need some remodeling, because you can smell the plumbing.

review.title: Cheap Hotel Within Three Miles of Airport
review.reviewText: Great price for a hotel within three miles of the airport! Hotel is showing its age with lack of security in the ground-level windows and having insect encouraging openings in molding in bathroom. Coffee maker didn't work. Telephone had unreasonable regulations/rates and internet was advertised, but only available on hotel computers in the lobby.
review.positiveRemarks: My favorite things about this hotel were the price and proximity to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: My least favorite things about this hotel were the lack of security on ground floor windows and falsely advertised internet availability.
review.locationRemarks: The location is convenient to the airport and quiet enough to accommodate sleep.

review.title: Meh..
review.reviewText: Only thing I can say about this place that is cheap and not too far from San Francisco. Though it offered a king size bed it was squeaky and uncomfortable to sleep on. There was a door that separated the shower from the vanity mirror and it was broken and hard to open and close. The staff was friendly enough but make sure you place the don't disturb sign on your door key, they tend to knock twice before entering your suite. Have fun in San Fran and the Bay area.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom
review.locationRemarks: not too far from downtown san fran

review.title: Not as bad as some past reviewers claim
review.reviewText: We read reviews about this hotel after booking it, so after reading about bed bugs, drug addicts and how unsafe it was we were quite worried about staying there, but this all proved unfounded. Fair enough the hotel could do with remodelling and some redecoration but our room was clean and comfortable. Except that is for an arm chair in the room that we all refused to sit in because it looked so worn and greasy. Overall for the price, it was OK and very close to the freeway and the airport. Also due to the massive Travelodge sign outside it was easy to find.
review.positiveRemarks: Pool. Close to airport and freeway. Also price, you get what you pay for. Rooms on the ground which you could park right outside of.
review.negativeRemarks: Decoration. Really noisy bathroom fan
review.locationRemarks: Close to the freeway and the airport. A massive sign outside makes it really easy to find.

review.title: I didn't feel as a Hotel.
review.reviewText: For the money, Yes this hotel is OK. But condition is bad. It looks like ancient building. Can't say as a hotel. Phone, TV and some power outlets didn't work. We could able to use the WIFI only in the front office, not in the room.

review.title: POOR
review.reviewText: The cleaning people left my door wide open !!!!!!!!!!

review.title: Not recommended.
review.reviewText: Very dissappointing. Very run down. Old. Dirty. Air didn't work well. Humid and sticky in room. Pillows were very hard. Not worth the price.

review.title: Problmes with my stay at the Hotel
review.reviewText: I asked for a non smoking room but i recived a smoking room. I was unconfortable my stayed at de hotel.

review.title: It's ok
review.reviewText: A basic hotel easy access to freeway and the SFO airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs remodeling
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport !

review.title: Stay Somewhere else
review.reviewText: This is a really old motel in a state of deferred maintainence. The advertised wireless did not work. The bed was hard as a rock. The room was advertised as a delux suite... I would hate to see the standard room. The best thing about this hotel is that is is located next to an I Hop restaurant and a service station.
review.negativeRemarks: Hard bed, Shabby condition
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect. close to freeway and airport

review.title: Terrible !
review.reviewText: terrible to stay. wifi is out of order all night. terrible breakfast

review.title: Travelodge
review.reviewText: Great old throwback hotel, very close to the airport.

review.title: Not Bad. Ok Rooms.
review.reviewText: Doing construction during our stay. Slightly noisy. Railroad tracks are close by, so you hear the train pass by. It's ok place for a couple of days.

review.title: steer clear of this one!!!
review.reviewText:
The tub/shower was in terrible shape. It looked as if there had been black mold on the floor and painted over with white paint. The soap dish was so grungy that I would not put my soap in it. The wall paper was peeling off the wall and the door would not shut all the way because it was warped at the bottom from apparent moisture.

The carpet that went up the wall to form a baseboard in the main room was torn away in three places.

The drape, when closed, revealed about a third of the room to outsiders!! The peephole had been covered by a Post It note.
review.positiveRemarks: it was easy access to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: the bathroom!!!
review.locationRemarks: easy access to the airport

review.title: AN AWFUL EXPERIENCE
review.reviewText: Lo ud party in adjacent rec. room of motel. Drunk adults there. Kids from party running amok until late. Hotel staff did virtually nothing about it. They finally offered to change our room. We did so only to encounter wet carpet in the new room. Also, coffee maker didn't work.
review.positiveRemarks: We got to leave the next day!

review.title: Close to airport but you'll be disappointed.
review.reviewText: The room was mediocre at best...wallpaper peeling off walls, breakfast not worth getting (go to IHOP), WIFI kept cutting in and out taking me 20 minutes to check-in for my flight. If no rooms are available, it will do but better can be found. It is close to the airport and I guess that is the best thing you can say about it.

review.title: Not Recommended
review.reviewText: A very poor in Comfort and not clean at all.very noisy room near the high way, house keeping sucks.
review.negativeRemarks: Comfort and cleaness.
review.locationRemarks: Good, near the Airport like a lot of hotels around SFO

review.title: Okay for one night only
review.reviewText: The walls were peeling and cracking, the toilet paper holder was broken, no bathtub only an old looking shower. Hotel staff was not helpful at all. I am usually a Days Inn/Discount hotel type person and did not expect a fabulous place, but this did not deserve 3 stars at all. The breakfast was mainly toast and 2 kinds cereal. Was very noisy from nearby highway. Would be okay in a pinch for a night, but not for more than 2.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport

review.title: SFO Travelodge
review.reviewText: Right next to a noisy expressway. Constant 24 hr roar. Asked for a wake-up call but it did not happen, and nearly missed plane. Shuttle to International terminal stops at other hotels and can take nearly 30 mins. Breakfast not available as it began only at 6am, when had to leave for plane. Not recommended.

review.title: Sorry Experience
review.reviewText:
Sold my room to someone else.
Sent me downtown to sister hotel.
Room not of same quality.
had I wanted downtown I woulda booked hotel Downtown
then sister hotel puts me in a room that few hours later the bathroom floor is covered w water. NOT HAPPY.
Managers made no effort compensate me or refund anything.
Poor Service. Poor Managers
review.negativeRemarks: Sold my room to someone else. Not Happy

review.title: Filthy rooms, dangerous area, for a cheap price.
review.reviewText: My room was ground floor with a huge window WITH A BROKEN LOCK, anyone could step right through and this is in a BAD neighborhood. They moved me to a second room, the air conditioner didn't work, the third room had working air conditioning but had stains on the cough that god only knows what caused them, I got tired of changing my room and slept with a chair against the door. The price was cheap but I would try the competition next time.
review.negativeRemarks: filthy and not secure
review.locationRemarks: bad neighborhood

review.title: Awful maintenance and poor at customer service!
review.reviewText: Asked for a hair dryer (a the one in the hotel was broken) did not provide one! They do not answer calls, I must have called at least 20 times from the hotel room. Finally had to walked down to the office and still they did not provide a hari dryer!
review.negativeRemarks: no proper working things in the room,....
review.locationRemarks: Was way too close to the airport and the maintenance was not good.

review.title: The price is right
review.reviewText: This is a convenient, moderately priced motel. I have no complaints. I've stayed there before and will stay there again. Not much of a breakfast but it's included in the price. There is an I-Hop attached if you want a heartier fare. Nothing fancy here, but the price is right.
review.locationRemarks: It's very near the airport and shuttle service is available. Very convenient.

review.title: Surly Clerk
review.reviewText:
Gave the clerk my name and repeated it in German. Clerk took offense and in a surly manner said, "I GOT it the first time." I was trying to be helpful, not offensive. This was the first day of an eighteen day trip. Not a good way to start wondering if things would get better or worse.

Bed spread had a cigarette burn in it and the molding and tile work was primitive.

review.title: Just don't...
review.reviewText: It was the most terrible 14 hours in a hotel to date. The staff was very nice, but the hotel itself was repulsive! Our sheets had blood on them (dried blood but still disgusting), the shower had no drain and all of the paint was chipping off, the ceiling was falling apart, there were 7 fuzzy local stations to watch and the "free wi-fi" did not reach our room. Unless you are okay with any/all of the above based on our experience, I would NOT stay there.
review.positiveRemarks: the front desk lady was nice
review.negativeRemarks: everything else
review.locationRemarks: there was nothing around but an IHOP and no delivery places would deliver.

review.title: very slow internet speed
review.reviewText: very slow internet speed. odd smell of the room. no key for the saftbox.

review.title: Handy, inexpensive, and pleasant
review.reviewText: This very convenient and affordable. It's located within walking distance of restaurants. Offers shuttle services. Free WIFI. Quiet. Not luxurious but a good value. I have stayed here several times.

review.title: Overall Decent
review.reviewText: Good for people looking for a cheap and a decent place. It is not that far from the city also.

review.title: recent stay ok
review.reviewText: its a mid level hotel that fits into your budget, near the airport. Worth for money. Bed and bathroom were clean though they can renovate bathrooms

review.title: Good option!
review.reviewText:
If you need a place to stay near the airport, this is a good option!
Staff is nice and breakfast is good!!
There is a pool, looks clean, I didn't use it!

review.title: Nightmare
review.reviewText: The location is unsafe and people are always screaming. Very noisy. The bathroom was disgusting; mold everywhere! The beds were very uncomfortable and the breakfast was some tea, juice, mini pastries, toast, fruit, and cereal. Breakfast wasn't too bad. I don't recommend this to anyone. Not what it says to be and doesn't look anything like the pictures. Not worth it.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Unsafe, dirty, and noisy.

review.title: Gross, avoid
review.reviewText: Very gross and poor up keep. My gf got a rash from the bed. Just gross! Avoid

review.title: Ok for the cheap price
review.reviewText: Loud (close to freeway) and old but ok for the price.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: Hoyel is nice and staff is very supportive. They are very cooperative. They are giving good information about everything. I hope all hotels like that
review.negativeRemarks: Weared rooms
review.locationRemarks: Sfo airport

review.title: Need better help in the front
review.reviewText:
The front desk people was not helpful in anyway. Did not explain how things work there at the hotal.
For us to be new to their hotal and San Franisco, some one could have been helpful in our question.

They do not remember who stay in what room. Some hotals, I have stay in remember my name or less my room number.
And they are very helpfull in giving direction or a good place to eat out most important is which area of the city to stay away from.

This is what you call customer servicer.
review.negativeRemarks: the parking and front help
review.locationRemarks: good to freeway for a quick get away

review.title: Moldy Hotel
review.reviewText: Room smelled moldy, bad way to start a vacation. The shower/toilet was really smelly. We chose the Travel Lodge for cheap cost but next time we need to stay by the airport we will spend extra money at another hotel.

review.title: Disappointment
review.reviewText: Very poor at front desk. Since it is a tourist center, front desk manager or clerk should have a through knowledge of the tour or at least refer us to proper place. during our stay only the night duty front desk guy had some .nowledge about SA

review.title: Bad
review.reviewText: I want to say only one word for this hotel, that word is bad.

review.title: Bad
review.reviewText: Room in dire need of upgrade. Rugs horribly dirty. Phone did not work at all. Impossible to call front desk. Personnel at front desk could not care less.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Such a nice service at the front desk. Ammenities were really good, everything you could need at the moment. Really recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Ammenities, close to nice places for dinner and even for market which would be costco.
review.negativeRemarks: T.V Cable, not so many channels
review.locationRemarks: Great location, quiet place, even though is close to the freeway.

review.title: Cheap and close to the San Francisco Airport (SFO)
review.reviewText: No refrigerator, parking was a bit tight. Bathroom was quite old. They have complimentary breakfast. IHOP (INTERNATIONAL HOUSE OF PANCAKES" was literally right next door, walking distance. Travelodge was build in 1958. It is one stop light from Costco with gas station. They have a shuttle's service to the airport (SFO), supposedly for free but I did not utilized the "free" shuttle service. I've only stayed one night but mostly would not recommend someone to stay here if they are traveling alone.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Costco with Costco's gas station.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom was quite old and no refrigerator.
review.locationRemarks: One traffic light from Costco. Less than 2 miles from San Francisco Airport (SFO).

review.title: Great if you aren't spending your day in the room.
review.reviewText: The room was nice and clean, but there was no refrigerator for our goods that needed to be refrigerated, and the cable was messed up, as did the internet not work. However, beds were nice and comfy!
review.negativeRemarks: Broken internet/no fridge.
review.locationRemarks: Fairly easy to find

review.title: Good Choice
review.reviewText: For being the cheapest hotel on the list, it was great! Close to the airport, shuttle was prompt and the room was clean and comfortable. Good choice when you are on a budget!

review.title: Nice and simple
review.reviewText: Nice and simple room. Good for the person or persons who are just passing a night or two. Wouldn't recomend to a family or anyone who plans to stay for more than that.

review.title: Good for an overnight stay.
review.reviewText: About what I expected. Old, cheap, quiet, clean. Could use some work in the bathroom, but the price was good. Breakfast was a bit sparse, but there is an attached I-Hop.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Great--next to airport where I needed to be. Free shuttle was nice.

review.title: Business traveler--Disappointed
review.reviewText:
I am a business traveler and typically base my hotel selection on convenience, cost and wireless internet services. This hotel was somewhat convenient, cost was ok for the area, but there wireless internet was rediculous. When customers have to assemble in the hotel lobby to access internet, that is not acceptable. It compromises security and personal space.

This hotel needs to fix its wireless system so that each room can adequately recieve a proper constant signal so that customers do not have to be inconvenienced with no access to the internet. I watched one customer walk around the parking lot looking for a signal to stay connected!

Considering the cost of doing business, my stay was not worth the value as there was loss of proper business engagment capability and lack of personal space in conducting business.

review.title: Good for sleeping then spending the day sightseein
review.reviewText: The staff is very helpful and friendly. I recommend people to use this hotel to save money and spend most of their money sightseeing. There is also a free shuttle to the airport and u can easily catch the 292 bus to downtown for 4$ only. Ps: i recommend u download the "511 transit" app to move around because google maps don't cover buses in that area.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Surrounded by a lot of the diner chains. Can catch 2 buses right from the entrance, or arrive there easily from the 101.

review.title: Just an average place
review.reviewText: A good place to stay if you do not spend too much time at the hotel. We just used the hotel for crashing in the night . Beds were just OK and not in excellent condition.Continental Breakfast was good ! .Booking through Expedia makes check in and checkout easier. No time wasted and no extra charges were applied.
review.locationRemarks: 10-15 mins drive to San Fransico downtown and getting to SFO airport was very easy

review.title: April stay at Flamingo hotel
review.reviewText: It's an older hotel but very clean and the staff very friendly. Would definately stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff being so polite and helpful
review.negativeRemarks: Older hotel and my room was in the back and since I was alone in the night I was a little nervous to go out.
review.locationRemarks: Not hard to find

review.title: A dreadful experience
review.reviewText: Because we had a very late arrival into San Francisco airport (arriving at 11.30pm), we were looking for an airport-friendly hotel to stay for a very brief overnight stay before travellng up to Napa early the next morning. While we booked this hotel knowing that it wasn't a 5-star accommodation, we did expect basic levels of cleanliness and a decent night's sleep. What we got was a dirty room with very poorly cleaned bed linens and a very dirty bathroom. Our room was billed as a "2 queen bed suite", and what we got was 2 queen beds stuffed into a dirty room with barely enough room to walk between the beds and to the sink located right next to the beds. We were so appaled by the accomodations that we decided to pass on their advertised complimentary breakfast buffet and opted to pay for breakfast at a nearby IHOP. I have to say that I will NEVER again book anything with Travelodge or any affiliates as I was so disappointed with this whole experience.

review.title: Travelodge San Francisco Airport North
review.reviewText: The cleanliness was excellent and location of the hotel gave us easy access to any location in the greater San Francisco area. The staff were very helpful and quite cordial. My wife and I will gladly stay at Travelodge in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy Freeway access and close to the Airport.

review.title: Recommended for a stopover between flights.
review.reviewText:
I used this hotel as a one night stopover. For the price, around fifty bucks, u cannot go wrong.
I will definitely use it again in the future.
Staff are pleasant and courteous.
The rooms are clean, if a bit old and careworn, and the beds are comfortable.
Don't listen to the other reviewers who complain about it, if they really want more they should have spent more elsewhere.
There is a shuttle every 30 mins to the airport, and there is an IHOP on site.
review.negativeRemarks: It was a bit old.
review.locationRemarks: It has a pool, and there are restaurants on site and close. It is only 10 mins from the airport.

review.title: Comfortable and well managed
review.reviewText: I found the hotel to be comfortable and well managed. Minor problems were addressed immediately. It is not a luxury hotel, but it is conveniently located near the airport and well maintained. The staff is friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Very few TV channels and limited selections of pay-per-view movies.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport, near on-ramps to all major freeways, easy quick access to downtown San Franciscos

review.title: ehh room
review.reviewText: ants in the room, too much freeway noise. staff is pleasant, but that's about it

review.title: Again only as last resource.
review.reviewText:
Although the room seemed cleaned enough, there was an horrible smell. The Wifi internet was available but only near the reception was strong enough to access it. Several people were there due to that.
Convenient location near the Airport with a shuttle every 30 min.
review.negativeRemarks: Smell on the room and internet access.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to access the Airport.

review.title: Travel to SF
review.reviewText:
Rooms are spread over large irregular area which make you disoriented to the place for a brief period, especially if you are checking in late at night. You have to search for your room.
Parking of your car may be difficult when you come late.
review.negativeRemarks: Very small breakfast room, time for breakfast end at 9:00 am
review.locationRemarks: Although close to the airport, but far from the city

review.title: horried
review.reviewText: Room was out dated and I found q-tips on the bed. The comforter was pulled forward like someone was gonna sleep in it. We got there at 2 am and was to tired to complain also I tried calling the front desk 4 times and no one answered. Totally an inconvenience
review.positiveRemarks: They had a blowdryer and it was off the freeway
review.negativeRemarks: Everything else
review.locationRemarks: Good location. Off freeway

review.title: Shoulda spent a few bucks more for somewhere else
review.reviewText: Very old and run-down place. Our room was filled with cigarette burns in the bedding/furniture, iron burns on the floor, duct tape on the heater and just old, icky everything else!

review.title: Avoid at all costs
review.reviewText: room was far too small, toilet had a flush so weak we were afraid to do "number 2", bed had us both itching all night, was given incorrrect shuttle information, parking, on a scale from 1 to 10 is a ZERO. never, ever again. pay the extra money for a more comfortable place.
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: near the airport

review.title: My experience...
review.reviewText: When I go to a hotel, the only thing I am looking for is a place to stay for lodging. If you are like me and are just looking for a place and don't really mind all the other things, this hotel was perfect. If you are more detailed and picky, I don't know what to say. This hotel did the trick and it was more affordable than a lot of other places. I would recommend the stay.

review.title: worth it
review.reviewText: We arrived early but they found us a room. The room was oldish but we slept and relaxed well. I'd stay again.

review.title: Too terrible to justify the cheap cost
review.reviewText: Really junky place with a strong odor. It's not worth saving money to stay here. Spring for the Holiday Inn Express across the way.

review.title: Bad
review.reviewText: Noise and dirty hotel, no service and old and too large, we need to walk 3 mins from front desk to my room
review.negativeRemarks: Distance from front desk to my room
review.locationRemarks: SFO

review.title: Not a recommendation
review.reviewText: The room smelled awful. We called to get out fan fixed a number of times and no one came. Finally went to the office ourselves to get it. Right next to the freeway so lots of noise. Beds were hard as a rock. They say they have wi/fi, but it only worked sometimes. Nice breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi/Fi worked only sometimes, room smelled awful and beds hard as a rock.
review.locationRemarks: Right next to the freeway.

review.title: Crappy
review.reviewText: This Hotel Sucks point blank. Staff wasn't very helpful when it came to anything, the entire facility needs to bulldozered and rebuilt. The rooms weren't cleaned and every bit of furniture is outdated and worn out just looks terrible...showers look like something out of a prison. Would recommend everyone look at another hotel to stay at.
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: It sucked

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText: bathrooms could do with updating but overall accomodation adequate for 1 night stay.
review.negativeRemarks: highway noise
review.locationRemarks: great for airport connections

review.title: peer review
review.reviewText:
Electrical outlets to connect Laptop are not user friendly located.
provide better/extensive info what to do see in neighborhood

review.title: Cheap and not bad.
review.reviewText: It's a good cheap place if that's what you're looking for. The rooms being spread across several different buildings can get confusing and annoying, especially at night. The shuttle that goes between the hotel and SFO took awhile to arrive.
review.negativeRemarks: The layout of the buildings and the stain on the chair in my room.
review.locationRemarks: It's good for a cheap place near SFO.

review.title: not the best
review.reviewText: we were hoping to come back after surgery and get some rest but there was remodeling going on in the room above us i asked if there was another room to work on they said they already started and had to get it fixed. also there was some mold and rot along the floor in the bathroom the heater didnt work and so for us it was easier to just finish our stay somewhere else

review.title: Not happy
review.reviewText: First time in this hotel and it is last time)))) Not clean at all!!!....

review.title: OK considering the price
review.reviewText: Considering the location and the very cheap price, it was OK. Nothing to write home about, though.

review.title: Good Stay for the price.
review.reviewText: It was a good stay. The Travel Lodge was replacing the mattress, so we were the first to sleep on it. We were mostly out being tourists. The house keeping was great. It is by the freeway, so if you don't mind a little movement while in the room when a big rig passed by, then this place is for you.
review.negativeRemarks: The shaking due to the trucks passing by and the planes overhead.
review.locationRemarks: It was by the airport.

review.title: Reservations problems
review.reviewText: I guess I was one of the lucky ones. They actually had my reservation but most of the people in front of me and behind they did not. They were told they had to call and have a fax sent to them, some people were waiting over 2 hours. Staff didn't seem to care.

review.title: Left Much to be Desired!
review.reviewText: Not even a hook on the wall to hang a jacket! No closet! The light switch in the bathroom stopped woking about 10 PM. No way to get it fixed. The heating system left much to be desired. Either too hot or too cold!
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of amenities.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient for 7:50 AM flight.

review.title: Not again...
review.reviewText: Staff was not friendly at check in. When asked where room was located all I was told was over there with a finger point. Staff had no consideration for time. Who wants to be woken up by a cart and yelling...

review.title: A place to sleep.
review.reviewText: It was a hotel, there were rooms and while "clean" the room was more then a little threadbare and very basic. It served it's purpose and the rate was reasonable. The only reason I wouldn't recommend this place is that I strongly suspect there are other hotels that would offer a better experience for the same cost. In a pinch I would stay here again, if needed.
review.negativeRemarks: Very threadbare and I wasn't a fan of the slider door on the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Fine for the airport

review.title: Not bad for the money
review.reviewText: Great little room for the money, super close to the airport, nice staff, decent room for a low price and easy drive into SFO Airport or you could use their shuttle. Would stay in again if I had to

review.title: Look at rating before you book a room.
review.reviewText:
room was very old. Bathroom condition was old, wall paper coming off. Walls looked dirty.
This was not what I expected Next time I will look at the rating of the hotel before I book.
The room was a non smoking room but you could still smell it.
review.negativeRemarks: how worn the room looked

review.title: Not recommended
review.reviewText: Not as I expected. Breakfast is very dissapointing. Unfortunatley I compared the hotel to Travel lodge uk, same star rating. Generally not happy. TV remote is attached to the tv with a wire, can't sit on bed and browse through channels. The feeling of the room, like a prison.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Ok

review.title: Stay away
review.reviewText:
VERY convenient to SFO - the only good thing. Wireless did NOT ever work despite 2 calls to the front desk. Room was very old and dirty - several of the lamps did not work, the heater thermostat did not work (either on or off).

OK to catch a few hours before an early flight - otherwise, stay away.

review.title: Ok for a night, not bad. Decent.
review.reviewText: It"s not bad for a night. It was ok, decent for the price. There is a IHOP next to the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer Service sucks here, seemed like they didn"t want to do anything. I had to call expedia for my reservation. I was doing their job.
review.locationRemarks: Location is near SFO airport and off 101 freeway.

review.title: No internet in the room
review.reviewText: For one night this property was OK. But, their wireless internet didn't work in the room. It did work in the lobby where the signal strength was much better. None of the staff cared or tried to fix the problem.
review.locationRemarks: Great location if you have an early morning flight out of San Francisco International Airport.

review.title: It's not worth the cost savings!
review.reviewText: worst hotel stay I've ever had. There were ants in my room, along with other dreadful things.

review.title: An airport hotel for rest at a great price
review.reviewText: Quiet for an airport hotel. Great price, rooms fine for the price point.
review.negativeRemarks: A little cold, but understandable
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: WHAT A MISTAKE...to stay here...
review.reviewText: dirty...bed bugs...expedia must remove this hotel form its list....the MANAGEMENT is HORRIBLE...
review.positiveRemarks: STAY AT THE AIRPORT ON A CHAIR is better...
review.negativeRemarks: MANAGEMENT...BED BUGS...
review.locationRemarks: OK

review.title: Not held to high standards!
review.reviewText: Hotel was not what we expected. The room looked dirty and the bed was horribly uncomfortable. The staff was not very friendly. If your looking for cheap cheap place to sleep near the airport then this is for you but its not for comfort that is for sure.
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty
review.locationRemarks: Good for airport bad for downtown.

review.title: Worst Ever
review.reviewText: This hotel was terrible, extremely dirty and had bugs walking around in the room and bathroom. No one would ever take a shower in the shower in this room. I am surprised that Expedia would even list this hotel on their website as a choice. I left and went to another hotel.

review.title: a little dissapointed
review.reviewText:
I have stayed with travelodge in the pass to I was very excited to do it again, the fan in the bathroom didnt work the wall pager patch and messy bathroom, doors you can even open with one hand and the ring around the tub was just horrible discusting. we were upgrate to a better but i travel with a specia need person, i cant be moving thing around all the time.

Continental breakfast was sad, the place has not pix no friendly apmosphere, the lady whom was there at the time was very pleasant try to convinience the its a great place but, i just didnt feel comfortable, eating there.
review.negativeRemarks: continental breakfas the room looks sad
review.locationRemarks: the location was good and convinient, although i got lost 2 finding the place, it a great location.

review.title: OK as a transit point
review.reviewText:
Building is tired, and needs a refurb, tired, but clean. Continental breakfast was poor, so went to the attached IHOP restaurant where we'd had a fab meal the previous evening.
Great, and free, shuttle service to the airport.

review.title: nada
review.reviewText: bath faucets were loose from the wall as was the hair dryer connection. bathtubwas really old,worn w/cracks in wall. the place was "seedy" and worn out. only place where i stayed that was worse was in Belorus [ Russia ]. breakfast was very limited in choices and seating was poor and , limited and tables not cleaned. SHABBY
review.locationRemarks: close to the airport

review.title: Competent
review.reviewText: I stayed there for 5 nights. It is good enough for a short-term staying, quite convenient if you have a car~

review.title: Cheap Stay
review.reviewText: Small room with a big bed, and the bathroom area has almost no privacy from the living/bedroom area. There was a VERY WEAK Wifi signal, which was a big disappointment. There are desktop computers available for use in the lobby, but who wants to do that? An ok breakfast was provided near the lobby, but they could use some food with protein in it. All that was offered was basically a carb-loaded breakfast (bread, cereal, pastries). But it was a cheap motel, so I guess we got what we paid for.
review.negativeRemarks: Very weak WiFi signal.
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport, but a 15-minute drive from downtown San Francisco

review.title: Do yourself a favor and don't stay here
review.reviewText: Very poorly kept hotel. Would definitely not stay here again

review.title: Excelent
review.reviewText: Excelent, the room is big, clean and the parking is in front the room.

review.title: I do not recommend
review.reviewText: As soon as you walk in it smells like mold, beds are squeeky and uncomfortable, bathroom was digusting, wash area was disgusting. There was a inappropriate hair on the towel. The complimentary breakfast consist of cereal and toast, no coffee or juice.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: Sketchy
review.reviewText: Inexpensive but you get what you pay for.. really gross stained mattress, sketchy people hanging around. Super loud neighbors and thin walls = no sleep. Glad it was just for one night. I recommend you bring a sleeping bag or your own blankets. The only good thing was that they have a free shuttle to the airport and double bolted locks on the doors... If you need a cheap hotel for one night at the last minute cause you couldn't get on a flight, this will do. But if any longer than one night, go somewhere else!
review.positiveRemarks: free shuttle to airport, double locks on the door, free wifi
review.negativeRemarks: Most everything, dirty floor, bed, bathroom, loud, no room service
review.locationRemarks: 20 minute shuttle ride to the airport, next to a 24 hour (but really gross) IHOP
review.userLocation: Portland International Airport (PDX), 7000 NE Airport Way, Portland, OR 97218, USA

review.title: Good and fairly, close to airport
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable and pretty quiet, especially considering how close it is to the airport. The one problem I encountered was that I'd booked a non-smoking room, and was initially given a smoking room. When I went back to complain, I was told that the only non-smoking rooms still available were all two queens instead of one king, but at least the change was made without delay.

review.title: not bad to pass the night
review.reviewText: It"is not bad for a place to spend the night for the price we pay.

review.title: Needs Improvement!
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this hotel many times in the past, but I believe it could use some renovation. The carpet in the room was very worn out. Also, I requested a smoking room, but after about 45min of my arrival, I decided to smoke, I noticed there wasn't any ash trays in my room. When I went to the front desk to possibly change rooms, the gentleman at the front desk was very helpful and willing to make a change, but the woman at the front desk was somewhat argumentative and reluctant to make any changes at all. It's really too bad because I don't think I'll ever go back there again!
review.locationRemarks: I would still recommend the same area, just a different hotel. It's because it's in a neighborhood that offers the peace and quiet of the country, not far from the city!

review.title: No one sleeps on those beds!
review.reviewText: They are backed write up against the freeway, so you have the noise of the traffic all night and day. The beds were incredibly stiff. You could feel every metal spring in the mattress. No one in my party sleep well while we were there.

review.title: forgot
review.reviewText: a scary place, really really bad, never go there it feels seedy and dangerous, the old furniture was ripped the bathroom was damaged and smelled bad, the thin sheets were rough and I hope you warn people away from this place, so happy I was alone if my family had been with me we would have left at once and given up the money.

review.title: A one night deal!
review.reviewText: Extremely convenient location right off freeway

review.title: Good hotel value near San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: It's reasonably priced, easy to find from the northbound 101 freeway, clean, comfortable, and surprisingly quiet (for a location so close to a major airport). The hotel staff was very helpful.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText:
We were given a room that was far from the lobby and from the lounge room where the Continental Breakfast was being served from 6 am to 9m daily. We never made it to the Continental beakfast. The room had a strange, smelly odor which never disappeared even after we sprayed the whole palce with Febreeze, The telphone was not working. The room was cold and the heater was not giving any hot air to make the room comfortable.

The room should have been inspected first to make sure that everything in there was working, before giving the roomn to us.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel is so spread out over a large area--building 7 was a lon way away. My room needed an update badly. The TV did not work well-could not access any in-room movies. The telephones did not work and so did not get a wake-up call--someone came to my room at 3:45 AM and banged on my door as the wake-up call! The free breakfast was weak. However, I wa only there to sleep and it was a comparatively inexpensive motel. If my family had been along, I would have very dissatified!

review.title: average hotel
review.reviewText: During breakfast expect people from construction industry together with middle class people...

review.title: Cheap near the Airport.
review.reviewText: So this is a large, cheap hotel very near SFO, with a 24 hour transit service. The room was good, although it was a 200 metre walk from reception. Many of the room back onto the 101 freeway. It's OK as an overnighter for the budget conscious.

review.title: Factory of stay
review.reviewText: It is like a industrial hospitality factory, big and sprawling. Otherwise, gets the job done. But why they charge $50 for guarantee deposit, hard to understand.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown

review.title: Unacceptable
review.reviewText: Dirty and seedy. Didn't stay as the bed linens were soiled. Shouldn't even be listed on Expedia.

review.title: Internet service is awful
review.reviewText:
Hotel is convenient to the airport and the shuttle bus service works fine. I stayed here twice within a week and the first time I was in building 7 where the internet did not work at all. The second night I requested a closer in room, where the internet connected but unfortunately kept losing the connection which made it virtually unusable.
Breakfast is included but not worth going to. Room was spacious and clean

review.title: WiFi... It's not rocket science.
review.reviewText:
I've stayed here before... It's a typical low end motel.

What was different this time was that they put me in a building/room that was *not* near to their WiFi router. And of course, I could not get a stable connection. For heaven's sake Travelodge... If you are going to only use a couple of routers for 7 buildings, USE A HIGH BANDWIDTH router.... Like a dual band N router...instead of the old-junky G machine you are currently saddling your guests with!

review.title: Cheap & Next to SFO
review.reviewText: Gross rooms and kinda sketchy clientele. But its cheap, in an ok area, and next to the airport.

review.title: Not impressed, but it was cheap
review.reviewText: I got what I paid for...

review.title: very poor maintenance
review.reviewText: not up to a motel standard

review.title: A good place to stay for budget travelers.
review.reviewText: For budget travelers (Business or Leisure), it is certainly a good place to stay. Rooms are relatively clean and comfortable. It is also easy to get around from the lodge to places like the airport, Downtown SF, coasts, shoppings, etc. Though the lodge is located next to the high way, I am surprized that the noise is minimal.
review.locationRemarks: Driving along the coast along route one. Love the scenic drive along the coast and enjoying a meal in some of the small towns such as Pacifica, Half Moon Bay, etc.

review.title: Travelodge SFO
review.reviewText: low cost hotel. Unimpressive free breakfast and free WI FI didn't work.
review.locationRemarks: area was ok, ie shuttle bus from SFO

review.title: Fair price, Clean room, Noisy Hwy, No Wifi beyond lobby, Slow internet 0.1Mbps
review.reviewText:
- Staff are ok, they get pay minimum wages, don't expect 5 stars service
- Room kinda old, heavy traffic carpet, old bathroom, very old tv, but clean bed
- You can hear Hwy noise even with all window closed
- No wifi internet beyond lobby, free but not fast (0.1Mbps)
- small narrow parking, easy to get door ding from other cars
- many good restaurants within walking distance
- Free breakfast was ok, cereal - milk - juice
- Hard to find, no big - tall sign, just look for ihop and Chevron gas station

review.title: Can't beat the price
review.reviewText: As a very weary traveler, the front office staff during check in was very courteous, considerate and professional. Wonderful disposition to be welcomed with. Please give him a raise to keep him!
review.locationRemarks: not applicable. Was in transit

review.title: good and cheap
review.reviewText: Great room ..big and comfortable. The internet was weak and lost signal a few times throughout the night.

review.title: Will come back when in San Fransisco
review.reviewText:
For being so close to the airport, I was surprised we were not disturbed by the landing or taking of planes.

We asked for a smoking room & confirmed it at 5p the day we were due in, but when we arrived, they had not saved the room for us & my husband had to smoke outside during the night & in the morning.

We were awakened at 9am by loud pounding and banging right next door to us. Maintenance was repairing a broken window. Check out is at 12n, we had taken in only what we needed for that night & packed it for a quick exit close to noon so we could sleep - we were near the end of a long journey up the California coast. I was also just out of the hosp before the trip began & needed the extra street to drive 11 hrs the next day to home.

Other than those two things, it was a very pleasant place to stay, & my husband loved that a great restaurant & gas was right next door.
review.locationRemarks: This area as the prices are reasonable & accommodations pleasant. More importantly, it's within 10 miles of Chinatown, Japantown (I'm Japanese) the Golden Gate Bridge & the fabulous Piers.
review.userLocation: Las Vegas, NV , originally from Detroit, MI

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: it was cheap, but run down. Most importantly, internet didn't work as the range for the wifi seemed to be almost zero.

review.title: Rooms smell bad.
review.reviewText: The room was big enough but smelled so bad we had to go get a bottle of fabreeze to even survive the night. Very old and shabby. Close to airport and ihop which was nice. No water in the pool and bad service. The office doesn't answer their phone or listen to your requests. Would not recommend this hotel.

review.title: OK for a night
review.reviewText: Needed a place to stay for the night in this location, arrived late and left early. I didn't need any ammenities except a shower and a bed. this filled the bill for the most reasonable price in the area. The whole complex is in need of an update.
review.locationRemarks: This is close to Airport and there are a lot of choices in this area depending your needs.

review.title: After key and Wi Fi problems
review.reviewText:
First of all gave us two key that would not work took addl 30 mins to figure out we knew how to use the keys then made new keys.

next morning wifi quit working for internet just showed local use with all bars lit up tried to tell me that the signal is weak (if signal was weak would not have five bars)

Other that everything was fine.

review.title: Run Down
review.reviewText: The hotel was not well maintained. There was water damage in the bathroom and on the wall in the room next to the beds. It didn't look very clean. It wasn't very easy to find.

review.title: Basic and Affordable Accommodations
review.reviewText: The front desk staff was helpful with bringing my things to my room when I asked them because I was travelling with a baby. The room was clean but a bit rundown, and it didn't have towels in it. However, housekeeping brought them to me promptly after I called the front desk to ask for some.

review.title: Will not choose it again.
review.reviewText: I am not happy as we chose the hotel with 40% discount, then we know the name of the hotel. After we checked in, we noticed this is a very bad choice. They might declare 40% less by using their newly renovated room rate, but put you in other rooms. Once you arrived there, you have no choice but accept what they offered. A very bad experiences. Isulation of the rooms are not good, we heard the noise at 2:00am from big airoplane and feel shakes from that.

review.title: Not as bad as other's say
review.reviewText: Admittedly, this was not the best hotel that I have EVER stayed at. Location was not great, and it wasn't the cleanest area. However it wasn't that bad. Pretty much you are getting what you paid for. CHEAP. The room that i stayed in was at least clean. The breakfast was pretty much cereal and toast, so if you want something else, i would suggest going elsewhere. The nice thing is that the hotel will let you ride the shuttle (that picks you up from SFO) to SFO to catch BART. So at least you aren't paying a ton out of pocket to get to a station.

review.title: Not Good
review.reviewText: Really quite a nasty place. Quite run down and numerous shady characters about. Would not recommend at all.

review.title: The outside of hotel was extremetly dirty. The breakfast bar was also dirty . The matress was hard
review.reviewText: I would never recomend that hotel. I don't consider the fact that prices was lower than other places it does not mean that the hotel should look worse than a cheap hotel in Mexico. I have bad back problems and the matress was very old dirty and smelly that I couldn't sleep well all night long. The breakfast bar offered was dirty and did not had the proper condiments .

review.title: Customer Service was NON EXISTANT!!!!
review.reviewText: We booked a King NON SMOKING room and arrived to find that the "ONLY" room left was a Queen SMOKING room. The person that checked us in basically told us TOO BAD and if we didn't like what was offered we could go sleep in the airport. It was 1am and after travelling 3000 miles, we were exhausted and just wanted to sleep. We found the room to be unclean and the mattress was so lumpy I would have almost preferred the floor at the airport! The exterior of the room/hotel was dingy and there was trash scattered all around. I have stayed at many TRAVELLODGE hotels over the years and I have never had such an awful overall experience. While the hotel is conveniently located, it is NOT worth the money or the rude staff.

review.title: "Practicality at it's Best"
review.reviewText: If you just need a place to STRICTLY crash and get ready for your day, then Travelodge fits the bill, not to mention the FREE* breakfast every morning.

review.title: ok and close, about avearge for price.
review.reviewText: ok and close, about ave for price.

review.title: not good
review.reviewText: no heating controller found , no answer for calling reception and operator

review.title: horrible
review.reviewText: By far the worst hotel i stayed in1!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!... The clerk lady at night is rude and very unhelfull. The room was about half a block away... key didnt work 3 times!!!! Toilet would not flush and didnt want to move me..... dont stay here

review.title: bed bugs
review.reviewText: The airplane noise is not bad. The bed bugs is another story it was uncomfortable and I am hoping I don't get lyme disease.

review.title: Not impressed, but the City is wonderful
review.reviewText: is was ok, for this prize

review.title: Not advisable
review.reviewText:
Many power outlets and lamps did not work, the water drain was nearly blocked. We complained about it but the promised craftsman never showed up (we only stayed for two nights, so probably they didn't care!)

The carpet, the window and the door were rather old and showed heavy signs of use.

We had the door keys (plastic cards) to be programmed twice because we couldn't enter the room at all respectively just with one of the two keys.

review.title: Jan
review.reviewText: The building maintenance of this TraveLodge has not been maintained through the years. From freeway side the exterior has big sections of peeling paint. Minimal interior care/replacement was not done, at least in my room. Took pictures & sent to a friend; bathroom linoleum, grout, very dirty front door (below door knob); string hanging from wobbly light. A few minor replacements would greatly change my perception & therefore comfort in the room. For example, replace the linoleum & coving in the bathroom; while the floor was clean the coving was pulling away from the wall & rusted; replace grout. No soap dish in the shower; plastic dish gone so the small soap couldn't even fit in the holder.

review.title: Rude staff rotten rooms
review.reviewText: Girl at check in was on iPhone and didn't look up as she demanded a credit card and id. Rooms just vile

review.title: nice location yes i will return
review.reviewText: yes gud

review.title: Needs a little work
review.reviewText: The room was clean and the staff was friendly enough, but the property is a bit tired looking. Usually as long as the room is clean and the shower is hot I'm satisfied. Unfortunately the shower had little water pressure. I have more water coming from my kitchen sink sprayer than this shower had.

review.title: Throughback motel from a bygone era.
review.reviewText: The hotel is very old and dated. It is rundown and in serious need of a complete facelift. The complimentary "breakfast" is a joke, consisting of white and wheat bread, a toaster, 2 kinds of dry cereal, coffee, and juice made from concentrate.

review.title: Not clean
review.reviewText: Room was very smelly! Not like smoke- it was like really dirty mattress smell. Disgusting! If we didn't have a flight to catch early the next morning we would not have stayed. I slept in my clothes. It took almost an hour to check in. The shuttle was ok. Also- if you book through Expedia you DO NOT HAVE Park and Fly- even though the sight says "free parking" and "free Airport shuttle" we you get there they charge you per day for parking after the first day.

review.title: Quality / price = very good
review.reviewText: Quality price it is good.

review.title: useful location i
review.reviewText:
nice hotel, really comfortable shuttle service to airport
rich breakfast

review.title: poor
review.reviewText: Not satisfied. Dirty room

review.title: Beware when you stay here!
review.reviewText: Cheap but not nice at all. Noisy guests, dirty, bad television reception. I had a 45 minute wait just to check in. Try elsewhere!

review.title: I will definately search for a better place next time.
review.reviewText:
The room has a smell of nicotine smoke and the ceilings and walls are yellowed from the smokeing. The curtains are yellowed and ragged....washed after touching them.

They advertise in room internet but the internet service was hit and miss. I wanted to take care of business while on the internet and to find things locally to do but the service was too bad...kept getting kicked off. Burn holes in the sheets and bed covers from cigarettes. Nicotine and cigarettes being their number one disgust! They should have offered me a nonsmoking area!!! When advertising that internet service is available ...it should be available to all with a strong signal for all to stay connected!

review.title: Not Good
review.reviewText: The location and service to and from the airport was very convenient but the hotel as such was not good .... we also had beg bugs which freaked us in the morning .... will not go back for sure

review.title: Good bargain
review.reviewText: A bit drab, close to the airport so if you can sleep through the planes taking off - a reasonable price, staff is quick friendly and informative.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: We didn't expect much as this was rated 2 star, but dumpy wasn't what I expected. There were plenty of hotels to chose from in this price range. Chose a Travellodge as they have been ok in the past. We were only staying overnight for a early am flight. The room was only ok. Bathroom was not dirty but ripped walls, broken tiles in floor, sad working faucet, stained. The bed was ok, but pillows had an odor so kind of scared not clean. Choose a different hotel in the area.

review.title: if you like airport and freeway noise
review.reviewText: because i wasn't familiar with san francisco, i booked the family in this hotel. i didn't know that it was so near the freeway and i thought that on the night we were there, planes seemed to be buzzing the building. we hardly got any sleep because of the noise level. when we checked in, person at the counter wasn't warm; like he was just going thru the motion. at check-out, there were 2 filipinos at the counter who were very helpful and were even giving recommendations for food and sights. hotel was old so wasn't expecting much. at least it looked and smelled clean. internet was intermittent.

review.title: Travelodge SFO
review.reviewText:
This hotel was not clean and the room smelled. Very noisy from motorway as well as flights overhead and people walking up and down, as my room was near to pool/reception.
the internet did not work and the reception staff was unwilling to do anything about it. the internet in the lobby also did not work, only discovered after putting in money. refund process long and tedious and will involve (possibly) the company sending me refund cheque some time in the future.
Overall, a very unpleasant experience.

review.title: OLD !
review.reviewText: This hotel is overpriced as is everything in the area. The TV didn`t work when we got there. I told the kids to call the office. The phone in the room didn`t even work. I had to go to the office in person to get some one to fix the phone and TV. Lots of construction guys stay here. NO INTERNET! Even though they advertise free internet you can`t connect.even though you have a signal.

review.title: It is cheap only.
review.reviewText: It is not valued as the price.

review.title: dingy but adaquate
review.reviewText: relatively close to airport but room dingy and depressing . Alright for 1 night but would not want to stay longer

review.title: Nightmare!
review.reviewText: It was the most awful, dirty and disgusting hotel that I have ever stayed in my entire life. The room had a terrible smell (not from smoking) that forced me to have the door open for three hours..and nothing happened, even after all our efforts using clorox, perfume and many other things. The mattresses were a joke, no pads at all, you could feel the coils all the time and the sheets on them...thinner than a leaf and dirty, the carpet floor was another story, dirty, with cigarette burns and smelly.STAY AWAY from this nightmare even if it is the only option that you have and by the way, it wasn't cheap at all if you compare it with other surrounding much more descent hotels.

review.title: Good place to stay when traveling via air
review.reviewText: Hotel is in need of updates and maintenance in the bathroom areas. The continental breakfast offered leaves a lot to be desired. Recommend you visit the IHOP attached to the hotel for breakfast.

review.title: evaluation
review.reviewText: Best I can say is it was a place to sleep.

review.title: Convenient to airport, otherwise not a very nice place to stay.
review.reviewText: Will probably chose another hotel next time. Staff was ok but hotel not that great.

review.title: stay away!
review.reviewText: Stay away from this hotel. The hotel is very old & in very bad condition. The beds are very uncomfortable, and the windows dont close all the way so you hear everything going on outside. There is ice machines at each of the 7 buildings and only 2 of them work. All the washers & dryers in the laundry room were out of order. Had to have room keys reprogrammed multiple times because they would quit working. Every TV channel was fuzzy. I am trying to find something positive to say about this place but there really isnt many. It is conviently located near SFO & the staff was very friendly. Overall this is not a place you want to stay at unless there is no other places available. Seems like they just take your money & dont invest much back into the property. We stayed at other Travelodges on our trip that were well kept & about the same rate. Very disappointed with our 3 night stay at this property!!

review.title: Cockroaches in the room
review.reviewText: There were cockroaches in the room, the toilet was broken, the mattresses were tired. Overall, the room had not been remodeled in 10 years.

review.title: convenient to airport
review.reviewText: The desk personnel were most welcoming and pleasant. The complimentary continental breakfast was adequate. The shuttle service to the airport runs on time.

review.title: Perfect for overnight before or after flight
review.reviewText: This is an average hotel. Nothing special, not a place you want to spend a long vacation, but it is perfect for getting some rest before you leave for a flight.

review.title: Terrible!
review.reviewText: Do yourself a favor, and book at another hotel. The roomed we stayed in smelled like dog feces!!!

review.title: Travel lodge san fran
review.reviewText: Nice easyto find location close to the airport and not too farr from attractions

review.title: Alright for the price
review.reviewText:
Stayed here for one night. Close to the airport and took advantage of the free shuttle (it's on a timetable- and goes to other hotels nearby so keep that in mind when allowing time to get to the airport).
No bed bugs in the room I stayed in (306).
Hotel security a question mark, as it's an open plan.
Breakfast was pastries, cereal, toast with jelly and coffee/tea - ok for free + tip.
Otherwise Dennys is close.
A little problem with calling out on the in-room phone- but was fixed efficienty.
I would reccomend for a cheap short stay or if not spending a lot of time in room.

review.title: Good if you have plane in the morning
review.reviewText:
+ Very close to the airport - you won't miss a plane
- Very close to the airport - good when you like the sound of jets.
+ Rooms and bathrooms are clean.
- Bathrooms urgently need renovation.
- Breakfast (toast, muffin, jam, fruit) ends at 9:00.
- Wi-fi doesn't work in peak hours (morning, evening).
- One coffee portion per double queen room per day.

review.title: past prime
review.reviewText: needs a big update

review.title: SFO Travelodge North
review.reviewText: It is what it is...the cheapest option.

review.title: I'll be back soon
review.reviewText: It was a pretty unique experience

review.title: Unsafe
review.reviewText: Door would not close properly to lock for security. Lots of noise and partying in stairwell until 3:00 in morning. Pretty awful experience.

review.title: Great Free Parking
review.reviewText: All I can say is you get what you pay for... The room was dingy and needed upkeep. It smelled bad and the bed was vary uncomfortable. The parking and shuttle service was the best part of our stay.

review.title: never again
review.reviewText: We checked in probably at about 11 pm, we just wanted to go to bed, we had two rooms, one was right by the parking lot and one was on the opposite side of the building, not convenient, especially to separate us. When we came in to the room by the parking lot we noticed that the bed wasn't made and there was a pile of dirty towels on the sheets! We went back to the front desk and told them and they gave me a key to another room right next to the dirty room. So that means they had no reason to give us rooms on the opposite sides of the building. When we entered the new room at least it had been cleaned since the last guests, but there was a whole in the wall, peeling lanoleum, stained carpet, rust, etc. A big let down since a week ago we paid the same amount to stay at a Days Inn 10 minutes away, it was recently remodled, modern, and very clean, this travelodge probably hadn't been remodled since it was buildt and was filthy. Interesting to note, the people checking in before me were having problems too, Travelodge lost their reservation. At that point I should've had them follow me back to the Days Inn and we all would've slept better.

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: very convenient distance from airport. shuttle service is good. The rooms look older but suitable for transit and overnight stay... I recommend this hotel for travelers in airport transit and catch flight in early hours...

review.title: It's not the Ritz but....
review.reviewText: The room was not updated and beautiful but was clean. The highway noise was mostly eliminated with the doors closed. The IHOP complimentary breakfast was offered but I ran out of time to try it. I would stay again as it is very convenient and priced right.

review.title: not a safe hotel
review.reviewText: The location and free parking is what attracted us to this hotel that was booked with expedia. we stayed two nights there one on each end of the trip. the first night our room was more or less clean but to say the room and linens were in need of much repair is an understatement, holes in the sheets, burn spot from a iron etc. the second night the room we were given was at the back end of the hotel and seemed to have allot of "guests" hanging around outside their rooms. when we got into the room, the beds were made but nothing else in the room was cleaned including someone had not even flushed the toilet. the replacement room was more or less clean but also worn out. burn marks ect as like the first night. we paid close attention the people hanging out and it was clear that this end of the hotel was being used for illegal activities. It was now after midnight so we did stay, and locked ourselves in the room. we were up and on the highway before 5:00 am the next morning without even bothering to shower. the hotel is rated as a two star hotel so we were not expecting much. this hotel should be rated a minus 2 stars.

review.title: Close to Airport
review.reviewText:
I found badbugs on room 722
Close to Airport
Across street Mc Donald's

review.title: Decent stay. No major faults found.
review.reviewText:
I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in the middle of March. You really can't beat the price -especially with Expedia's coupon-, but I had doubts about cleanliness because of the reviews I had read on here. I was actually pleasantly surprised. My boyfriend and I both checked for bed bugs and found nothing. The room was clean, sheets were fine.

Great location. Right next to 101 and 380 freeways. The parking is free which is nice for an airport hotel. Most charge per day for parking. It's about 1/2 hour drive into San Francisco. Their "breakfast" they offer is lacking. Bread, cereal, juice. That's it. There is an employee taking your voucher for the breakfast as you come in. Apparently they've had problems with breakfast crashers.

My only real complaints?

--They charge extra per day for fridge/microwave. It was more than we were willing to pay. Expedia didn't make that clear when booking the hotel.
--Expedia also didn't give me the choice to book a smoking room. That caused some confusion at check in. They do offer smoking rooms....Expedia must be unaware of this.

I know there are previous reviews on here for this hotel that say otherwise, but my experience wasn't bad. I would definitely stay here again if needing to save money.

review.title: Absolutly discusting
review.reviewText: The place was absolutely disgusting. First gave us a key to someone Else's room ,walked in and saw a tv on unmade beds and cans on the table. The went back down to receive another awful room my daughter was afraid in the room and I had to go to the washroom with her.The washrooms were covered in rusty mold and the plumbing needs a major overhauk I wouldn't of stayed and lost my money if it wasn't so late and I had an early flight in the morning. Place was so dirty. F---

review.title: it's worth while to order a room there
review.reviewText: the hotel is well equipped and it has a beautiful scenery judge the price it's much better than other hotels

review.title: Basic amenities
review.reviewText: The stay and fly process was easy and very convient. We were going to be out of the country for about 11 days, and this hotel was one of the few that would let you park your car for up to 14 days without extra charges. The location next to the freeway, and the airport was very noisey. It is too bad they didn't have better sound proofing on the windows and door. The contintental breakfast was the worst (location and food) that I have ever experienced.

review.title: Just so so
review.reviewText: It's ok.

review.title: Terrible bed
review.reviewText:
The price was right, but the room was not. The carpet was stained in a few places and the shower need some bleach, but the real problem with this room was the beds. With out a touch of hyperbole, this was the worst bed I have ever slept on. Springs digging into my back all night. I actually had to get a camping pad out of my car so I could sleep. I was so thankful that I only had paid for two nights.
Please, Travelodge, buy new beds!

review.title: NOISY!
review.reviewText: Being close to the airport is convenient, but you can hear airplanes taking off and landing all day and night. Also, this hotel is just feet from the freeway, highway 101, where you can hear the heavy San Francisco traffic 24/7. The window in our room didn't lock, so we had to take everything with us daily. It's a cheap hotel, but you get what you pay for.

review.title: do not use this hotel
review.reviewText: all the ice macine where broken

review.title: Good stay at a good price
review.reviewText: We stayed there only forr a night and everything was smooth. The front desk was helpful and rooms and amenities were clean. Internet connection was giving a bit of a problem. Be sure to be in time for the complimentary breakfast!

review.title: Safe deal for North SFO hotel
review.reviewText: Needed a room for an overnight. Shuttle is frequent and easy. Front desk people were great. Room was clean, but not spotless. Comfortable. Mc Do across the street. Breakfast available, was acceptable. For the price, the deal was fair!

review.title: Hotel room was cozy
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was perfect. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself could use a little work.

review.title: I'll be back soon!
review.reviewText: I'll be back soon I hope with the same experience

review.title: So-so
review.reviewText: Price was pretty good...
