But hassle w/ room (Expedia booking was different than Hotel reservation) led to me getting what must have been the worst room of this type (far end of complex, under stairs, next to noisy ice/coke machine, noisy heater). Beds were comfortable & bath was reasonably clean. The "continental breakfast" of bad pastry, spotty fruit, toast & stale cereal was not exactly impressive.

review.title: They Don't Care
review.reviewText:
The free transportation from the airport was great. The check-in process was great. But from there it wasn't.

Bottom line, we just needed the room to sleep in for three nights. But there were several issues that were addressed to employees there and nothing was done. When we entered the room, there was a weird smell so we kindly asked if there was any air freshener. They said they would send someone, but no one came. We had to buy our own air freshener for the room. The bathroom sliding door would not close all the way so we kindly asked if someone could take a look at it, but the door never got fixed. We requested for the room to be cleaned and for the towels to be replenished. The room was not made and the towels were not replenished. When we requested for towels, they did not provide enough and stated that was all they had.

The hotel property itself has potential and could be better, but their employees seem to just let it rot. It's a shame really.

review.title: Cheap place to stay
review.reviewText: It is a great hotel if you are in need of a cheap, one night hotel stay that is close to the airport.

review.title: a cheap alternative for travellers to San Francisco
review.reviewText:
breakfast is a bit meager. Motel is located close to 101 highway and consequently it is a bit loud. Due to the budget price there are a lot of
blue collar people. Great: complimentary internet.

review.title: Meh, it was a place to sleep.
review.reviewText: Basic economy motel, fairly clean although somewhat dated. Basic cable TV only. Could use better sound-proofing...noise from highway, airport, and other guests clearly heard in room. Advertised "breakfast" was stale bread for toasting, dry cereal, bruised & 2nds fruit, coffee, and warm juice & milk.

review.title: Will never return!
review.reviewText: Hotel is very dated. While the rooms may seem relatively clean, they appear dirty due to less than spectacular maintenance issues (i.e. peeling wallpaper, really bad caulking in bathroom). Conveniently located near airport and freeways but therefore noisy. Room rate was great but you get what you pay for!

review.title: Will be back
review.reviewText: This year, we stayed at Travelodge Anaheim and Travelodge SFO - North. We have been extremely satisfied with our room accommodations and its locations. The breakfast was very good especially at Anaheim. However, our internet access was very very poor in both locations. We hope that it can be improved.

review.title: Good value for the price
review.reviewText: This is a very cheap hotel close to the airport. The location is convenient and the price is fair for the quality of the service offered. Staff was friendly. Would recommend this hotel for a 1 night stay.

review.title: Would not recommend
review.reviewText:
The hotel is extremely convenient to the airport, but once in your room, it is very disappointing. You get what you pay for at this hotel. The shuttle is convenient - I'll give them that.
I had to walk across a dark parking lot to get to my room.
Once in the room, the carpet was worn and dirty, the shower was aged with peeling grout, the mirrors were cracked, the paint was a marked. I didn't even have a shower curtain, but was so worried about walking back to the office to be asked to be moved I took a shower without one.
I checked the bed carefully before getting in and wore my clothing to bed to ensure I didn't catch anything.
Laying on the pillow was a safety card to how to avoid being robbed. I locked my door and never left the room.
Overall, the worst hotel experience I've had.
I did not get to see how breakfast was as my flight was too early, so maybe that was the redeeming value?

review.title: Uncomfortable
review.reviewText: Felt unsafe at this hotel

review.title: Old, dingy, questionable cleanliness
review.reviewText: the room felt dingy and old. there were stains on the box spring cover. the shower is very old. the door to the toilet/shower area was difficult to close. the mattress felt very old. i was pleased to see that there was a mattress cover to prevent bed bugs. these rooms really need to be renovated.

review.title: Need an hotel by the Airport, Be ready for the worst reception
review.reviewText: The room was OK, but the shuttle for the 5 hotels was packed, we had to miss the first one (every 20 minutes), and when we arrived at the front desk... they could not find our reservation.... Had to call Expedia, and despite Expedia's quick action, took us 45 minutes to get our key... So, from the airport, about 1 hour and a half...

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText:
You get what you pay for, SF is an expensive city and hotels are insane.
Although it was a 20 min drive to downtown SF it was fine.
The conditions of the hotel are not unbearable. Bring your own towels is a recommendation, and the breakfast it's not that great so don't think that giving free breakfast is all that special.

review.title: Don't go.
review.reviewText: See above

review.title: Great for airport travelers
review.reviewText: I stayed here once a year or two ago in a different section (the far left if you are facing the office.....across from the housekeeping) and it was unpleasant that time. That previous time, the room was small, dirty, and noisy, and the staff was not service-oriented. But this time, I was so pleasantly surprised that the person at the counter was courteous and attentive. This time, we were in a room almost directly behind the office and pool on the second floor. It was large, and clean, and quiet. Parking was easy this time. The airport shuttle was mega-convenient. The price was great. I would stay again.

review.title: A Great Deal at the San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: For the money, this was absolutely unbeatable in the entire San Francisco/Peninsula region. Right at the San Francisco Airport (with free shuttle service); also extremely convenient to San Francisco. Even such amenities as iron and ironing board. The room was fully clean, and a continental breakfast was included. Free parking. 24-hour restaurant next door, plus very quick (and hot!) food delivery from other restaurants in the area. Very congenial and knowledgable staff! An interesting and rewarding mix of people staying there: foreigners, upscale-looking Americans, many younger types, minorities that are prevalent in the SF Bay Area. Is it a luxury Hotel? No. But you have to be a real motel snob to think that, for the money, this isn't a great deal a hop away from San Francisco.

review.title: Old, dirty, broken internet, don't stay here
review.reviewText: ice cold pool, no internet, high prices, dirty rooms, mattress have springs sticking out, do not stay here

review.title: Noisy & run-down
review.reviewText: Was flying out of SFO in the early morning so picked this hotel due to cost & location. However, there is a price to pay! Rooms are run down & depressing with very thin walls. The freeway is a stones throw away, with all-night noise, & the worlds loudest ice machine was also just outside the door. It saves a bit of money, but there are better hotel options close by.

review.title: Good hotel, BAD guests!!
review.reviewText: I had read the reviews on Expedia prior to booking this hotel, so I was prepared for the worst when I checked in. However, the check-in went smoothly and I had my room within about 5 minutes. Everything was clean and tidy. However, the neighbors in the room next door were the biggest problem. They were constantly yelling and fighting most of the night, and I kept getting woken up to a man swearing at his girlfriend/wife loudly that he was broke and repeating over and over that he had "no more #^$%& money!!" My sleep was extremely poor here as I kept getting jolted awake every time someone shouted or slammed a door. It sounded like people coming and going most of the night until about 12am. I had no time to pack all my things up and move as I was already exhausted and had to be up very early at 4am the next morning. I recommend a higher star rating hotel if you value your sleep!!

review.title: Good location near SFO airport
review.reviewText: An average motel, too big, but in a good location if you have morning flight from SFO. Very near to the rental car centre.

review.title: NEVER COMING BACK
review.reviewText: I already checking in, and went for my dinner. When we were back, my room was occupied by s.o. I went and asked, the hotel rep told me the room was checked out to other person!!! Then I was given another room up stair, which I later found out that was a smoking room. It was too late to go and complain, I will never stay at this hotel again. The room was so dirty, the bed had tons of dirt when I opened the blanket, I had to redo the bed before I can lie on it. This is the 1st time I saw a hotel bed with LOT OF dirt on it, and dirty smoking smell....terrible night! My 3 years daughter refused to take the shower, because it's so dirty, she kept saying it's yeuzz...

review.title: good price/quality
review.reviewText: The door of the bathroom was broken and the breakfast was not "continental". But the price was very very good!

review.title: Travelodge - SF
review.reviewText:
The carpet stinks and it's enough to keep you up all night. Never stay here unless you have absolutely no place to go. The location is convenient and there's an i-hops close by.

Nearby Howard Johnson offers cleaner rooms -

review.title: A little old and outdated
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine for what we used it for, just an over night stay that was a pit stop to our final destination. If I were to vacation here I'd not advise anyone to use this as their hotel for a long period of stay. Room was okay. Bathroom door didn't shut all the way(sliding door), some rust in shower and the A.C. unit wasn't that effective.

review.title: Happy to get home.
review.reviewText: Someone needs to train the front desk clerks on their job, room was good, but the clerks at front desk seem to be tired of their job. They don't have any good answers for there error, and when they try to correct the problem, that too was wrong.

review.title: A budget hotel
review.reviewText:
Good Stuff: If you're looking for one of the cheaper options near the airport, this is it. You're minutes away and a free shuttle runs every 30 minutes (not necessarily on the half hour, though). Shuttle drivers were very friendly and helpful. The IHOP attached to the hotel was convenient and offers average service. There's also a Houlihan's within walking distance as well as a McD's. At the time they also offered a decent continental breakfast.

Not so good stuff: It's not in the best neighborhood, but the area around the SFO airport isn't that great anyway. This is definitely an older hotel, so furnishings aren't new, but they're clean. No indoor hallways. No elevators, but there are only 2 floors anyway. Buildings are a bit spread out.

Generally, I've stayed in much nicer hotels for a lot less, but the entire area is overpriced. You probably won't like what you'd get for less (if you could find anything for less).

review.title: Great if your getting in late and dont mind dirty hotels!
review.reviewText:
It was gross. I wore my flip flops around the room and in the shower because I couldn't tell if they vacuumed or cleaned the rooms. The blankets had tears and holes on it and the mattresses looked like it was at the end of their sad lives.

But it was right next to the airport and since we got in at midnight it was all we really needed. The price was a bit steep to me but better than what in the city was trying to charge.

One night was enough-didnt look back and next time i will spend a bit of extra money for something cleaner.

review.title: get what you pay for
review.reviewText: It was the cheapest hotel in SF at that time so I guess you get what you pay for

review.title: not impressed with hotek management, needs some help in customer relations
review.reviewText: bad experience..traveling thousands of miles with the airlines i have never run into anything like this. Bad experience.

review.title: Nice stay!
review.reviewText: Perfect for travelers on city tour! 15 min. from downtown SF and 5 min from the airport SFO.

review.title: Travelodge - SFO
review.reviewText: This hotel was very sub-standard. It was uninviting on the exterior. The room was dirty. Iron burns on the carpet. Mold in the bathroom ceiling. The bed mattress was like laying directly on the springs. We had to hold down the toilet handle for at least 60 seconds to get it to flush. There was no internet access in the room. The bath towels were like tissue paper. I had to get more pillows from the front desk as they were so flat, then they would only give us 2 extra. There was a warning in the room to secure all windows and doors, which made us wonder about security. We couldn't wait to leave and go to dinner then come back much later as the room was so disgusting. I would never recommend this place. It is mainly for those staying over for a short time to access the San Francisco International Airport, which is the reason we were there. I know for sure that this is a place to avoid. It does not even warrant a star rating as it is so far below even half a star.

review.title: Tv was Possess it kept turning channels n volume on its own Room 426
review.reviewText: first thing the ice machine was broken so u had to walk to other building. second the tv was possess the channels kept turning on its own and volume room 426. the thing needs bath tub not shower, i was craving a relaxing bubble bath. the continental free breakfast was nice but evry one seem to go crazy in there for free food, very small room. there swimming pool was far away and not convenient place for everyone to enjoy.

review.title: Stay away from this hotel
review.reviewText: I booked the hotel for the last two nights of our US trip. We spent the previous 7 days touring the western US, from San Francisco to Yosemite, Las Vegas, Grand Canyon, and stayed in half a dozen hotels on previous nights. All the hotels we stayed in were very nice with plenty of space and nice facilities. Because of our previous experience, I didn't bother checking the review of Travelodge before I booked it. This turned out to be a huge mistake. After we checked in, we got a room on the ground floor. The first thing we noticed after entered the room was a strong smell of dampness. The room was typical of American motels and spacious enough. The carpet looked dirty. My son was trying to use the bathroom. As soon as he flushed the toilet, it was blocked and the water failed to stop and started flowing everywhere. I immediately called reception. The lady said that the keeper was helping to fix the toilet for another guest. We asked to change the room. The second room didn't look much better and was even worse in smell. I figured now that all the rooms were probably the same. The next morning as I was at the reception, there were two guests complaining to the receptionist, one lady said the shower was leaking, and a man said the toilet was not working. It was quite clear to me at this stage that this was a poorly managed hotel. Having pre-paid at Expedia and there was no cancellation, plus we were leaving, I just accepted the bad luck. if you can,stay away from this hotel.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Ok for someplace to sleep one night but that's it. Could hear outside noice very clear (beside a busy freeway and airport). The staff were very nice and helpful with any questions we had about the city.

review.title: Average Experience
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to the airport and was satisfactory for a two star hotel. No complaints-- the rooms were clean and the breakfast area was kept stocked with fresh food, orderly and clean.

review.title: Poor management
review.reviewText: Hotel staff is not sensitive to Customer's needs, rooms are not ready, transit passengers traveling on int flights book hotel for rest.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: The beds were uncomfortable, and I felt really dirty just being in the room. If you go and you are a swimmer you should request a room near the pool. Ours was about a 1/2 mile away. We had to drive to get the the "continental breakfast" because it was too far to walk in the cold! But I guess for the price you take what you can get.

review.title: Get what ya pay for YIKES
review.reviewText: If your broke and don't care about what you are sleeping on than stay here

review.title: Travelodge SFO North
review.reviewText: The room was big enough, motel seems a bit old though. The neighborhood wasn't much fun, there's a McDonalds and a Denny's nearby. And ofcourse it's really close to the airport. If you like a walk, it's about 12 minutes to the Car rental facility from where you can take the AirTrain to the main terminals.

review.title: Would never go back.
review.reviewText: The shower did not work and was unable to take a shower at night because they would not answer the phone in the office. The beds were so hard you might as well have slept on the floor. We were suppose to stay two nights and left early due to the conditions of the room.

review.title: san fran
review.reviewText:
nothing special hotel.
but served it's purpose

review.title: nothing fancy
review.reviewText: It's an old hotel. Room quality and service were ok considering the cost. Recommend it to anyone looking for good price, nothing fancy really. Had I know they only had 6 or 7 TV channels, I would have gone elsewhere. Other than that, the stay was ok

review.title: I might go back only if I cannot find a better place in the city
review.reviewText: Nothing special

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel Surroundings were not at all good. hotel was not clean. Some of staff were not at all nice

review.title: Will go back later.
review.reviewText: The hotel is located at a convenient place. The breakfast was really good.

review.title: Good hotel if you want to stay near the airport or city for a decent price
review.reviewText: Can't complain much for what you pay for. Was looking for the cheapest hotel in the area so I could drive up to work the following day in the city. I live in San Jose but was attending a party in Daly City and did not want to drive back and forth from the south bay back to SF the next morning. Place was clean but beds weren't that comfortable.

review.title: Average hotel/motel close to the airport
review.reviewText:
The hotel was okey, but not more.
For me it was convenient to stay this close to the airport as I was flying out the following morning.
I would look for other options also close to the airport next time, but if nothing is better then I would stay there again.

Pros: Close to the airport, quick service as for check in and check out

Cons: Rooms not in the best condition slightly noisy and the beds were only average at best.

review.title: A bit run down, but cheap and close to SFO
review.reviewText:
The whole place is a bit run down and scruffy, and clearly has some security problems. You need to be careful.

However, it is cheap and very close to the airport. It's fine for a short night before an early morning flight.

review.title: Could be better
review.reviewText:
Well, since we were staying for 4 nights, I thought whe would have like a microwave and a small refrigerator, you know sometimes you get a botle of wime or beers, and want to keep them cold.
I guess that would be my sugestion

review.title: it's ok as a stop over
review.reviewText: not impressive at all.

review.title: the price + locale + free airport shuttle = absolutely perfect overnight stay for SFO flying
review.reviewText: Facts: Hair dryer in room; no bathtub just a shower; pleasant decor; pleasant and very helpful staff; could not be beat for the money.

review.title: Perfect for SFO flight
review.reviewText: The hotel was inexpensive and efficient. It's very close to the airport. The room was your basic hotel room; it got a little too warm at night and the bed's a bit hard, but really not bad for the price.

review.title: Not a Good Experience Here
review.reviewText: The hotel staff said they didnt have my reservation and asked me if I had reserved a different Travel Lodge. After I presented them a confirmation of that hotel, they went through a pile of reservations to discover that they had my reservation but wasnt entered into their system. No apologies from anyone, no offer to make concessions. Once I checked into my room, I noticed that the there appeared to be loose or poorly repaired wires on the heater, tv and external lighting....all fire hazards!! Radio alarm was also blaring when I entered the room at 315 pm! TV reception was poor. About the only good thing about his place was the OK wireless and the price.

review.title: Sleep in your car; it will be way nicer...
review.reviewText: When I made this reservation it was for 2 queen beds in a non smoking room. We had to check in late that evening and got all checked in and headed down a dark walk way to our room and found one bed. I took the long walk back with our luggage (myself, husband and son) to the lobby to be told that "oh, we didn't have a non smoking 2 bd so we put you in that room". One would think that they would have stated that at check in not just assumed you didn't need two beds! Their service was HORRIBLE and once we did get checked in it would have been more comfortable to lay on the cement outside. The beds were sunk in and hard and it was disgusting to say the least with the cigarette burns in the blankets and ripped sheets. Saving 20 bucks isn't worth it to stay here ever.

review.title: Didn't end well.
review.reviewText: The check-in and stay at the hotel was very satisfactory. On checking out, they demanded that I pay $5.17 for a telephone call I never made. On arriving home, I checked out who the call was to. It was to the overseas customer service line for Expedia. I did not know that my husband booked thru Expedia, so I would have had no reason to call them. I certainly would have used the toll-free US line if I had, or in worst case would have used my cell phone as I would have had no charges using it. What if they had decided to demand $100.00 or even more? When you are checking out and trying to get to a flight, you have no choice but to pay what they demand even if it is fraudulent. I would never stay at this hotel again for this reason.

review.title: Pretty cheap, but would never go back.
review.reviewText: The mattress was old and lumpy. I could feel the coils in the mattress every time I turned. The room smelled very musty. Ugh!

review.title: Better than expected
review.reviewText: It'a a good stay in Travelodge for two nights last month. My boyfriend and I both like the room and the stuff were very kind. If you expect a huge or luxury room, then don't chooes this one.I just paid what I expected and it's better than I expected~~It's clean and warm which gave me some feelings as at home.

review.title: good for the price
review.reviewText: Basic needs met, nothing super fancy, but the continental breakfast was nice to have

review.title: park and fly
review.reviewText: a good overnight hotel that allows long term parking at a reasonable rate and with a shuttle to the airport

review.title: Satisfactory airport hotel with free shuttle
review.reviewText: The check in was efficient. The IHOP next door was very convenient. The free airport shuttle was great. The wireless in our room did not work. Great price, though.

review.title: Recommendation for stopovers at SFO
review.reviewText: People at the reception were welcoming and helpful. The room was ok, in relation to the price very good. It's definitely a recommended place when you just have to stay one night between two flights from SFO.

review.title: Good if you dont want to see the downtown area
review.reviewText: Everything was great. However, the driving to downtown is kind of far and parking is really expensive. So you are better of staying at a hotel near downtown or using public transportation. Also the free breakfast was good, for being free.

review.title: SFO Travel Lodge
review.reviewText: My room at the Travel Lodge a short drive from SFO was a bit worn looking and had not been updated recently, but shuttle service from the airport was good and the staff was efficient and friendly. I'd advise customers to call the hotel from the airport to see when the next bus arrives. The free breakfast was only available until 9 am, but an Int'l Pancakes is right there too. The pool looked inviting but weather was too cold to try it out. Price was the lowest of any motel/hotel near the airport

review.title: Never book at this hotel ever again.
review.reviewText: The room smell so badly that I have to leave the room to sleep in the car. I asked for another room and the hotel said they were full. I don't believe what they said because the parking lot wasn't even half full. I know they hotel was lying and not honest with me. I will never book at this hotel ever again. This was the worst hotel experience in my 50 something years.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: the hotel was about what I expected, it worked for a place to sleep. The room was clean and comfortable and that's what I was looking for.

review.title: not impress. will never go back, even if the price is a deal.
review.reviewText: they said, "if there's anything we can do to make your stay better, please let us know." i asked them if they can ask their shuttle guys to take me down the street real quick to another hotel so i can attend a meeting. they said they weren't able to do that. well, what's the point of saying, "if there's anything we can do..blah blah" then?

review.title: Do not stay here.
review.reviewText:
This place would be ideal if you were traveling through San Francisco and needed a place to stay for one night. DO NOT stay here if you are going to go sight seeing in the city for a week. It is an extreme pain in the behind to commute if you do not have a vehicle.

Our room had no towels and the continental breakfast is a joke.

review.title: oklie, doklie
review.reviewText: good location

review.title: Acceptable
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for, great location, acceptable accommodation. Great advantage - proximity to BART and Caltrain and 101.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: Nice Place . Arrived early 11am and we were able to check in. Great room for the price.

review.title: Good stop-over hotel
review.reviewText: I had a connecting flight ealrly in the morning and therefore stayed only one night. The room was not luxurious, but ok and clean. If you are visiting San Francisco for several days I'd not necessarily recommend it since it's somewhat noisy (airport) and the neighbourhood is not the nicest. For the price paid, I'd recommend it for a short stop-over though.

review.title: If you want cheap...cheap is what you will get
review.reviewText: This was the epitome of CHEAP hotel. Ceiling had multiple cracks and popcorn ceiling. From the inside of our room, it looked like the building was damaged in an earthquake and someone did a very poor job of patching it up. The 1 ice machine that i could find was broken. Bed was a spring frame (imagine a metal frame camping cot) with a mattress thrown on top. The towels were small and very thin. The room screamed CHEAP! Parking was poor. Only thing good about this place is proximity to SFO and IHOP next door. It was cheap for one night layover at SFO and as they say, you get what you pay for. If you want to see what a cheap motel room looks like...this is it. Do yourself a favor and pay the extra money at a nicer hotel down the street.

review.title: cheap and freeway access and near airport
review.reviewText: close to the airport and right off freeway..I wasn't happy with the pillows. The water pressure was terrible. It took awhile to get the heater going.

review.title: Hotel Neghibor
review.reviewText: Hotel is located next to the freeway, it is a little bit noise. Hotel heater is broken, it should repair before rent it out. Wash towel is not enough or none. We tried to get it from front desk, however, front desk does not have any or sent any towels. They asked guest to get them from clean lady. I lived in several Travelodges before. This one was the worst one. I think it is due to hotel owner not Travelodge.

review.title: Overall Average
review.reviewText:
My sister and I stayed at the Travelodge when we went to San Francisco. We wanted a cheap place to stay while we saw the sights and met up with some friends in the city. The hotel itself had the standard amenities of a typical hotel room: bars of soap, towels, kleenex, shampoo + conditioner, coffee + tea and a coffee maker. The room also had an iron and an ironing board, desk, lamps, tv--as I said, it had the standard amenities.

The location was conveniently close to the airport and the freeway which made travel easy. However, the room itself had really uncomfortable beds (firm). We went on a rainy weekend and the heater did work but it took a bit of time to kick in. There were also a lot of sketchy areas in the room where they had tried to patch holes in the wall and cover them up with more wallpaper and tape. It was unsettling. There were also marks in the carpet where a previous guest had dropped the iron in a few places.

Overall my sister was completely dissatisfied with the quality of our room. However, it was the cheapest thing we could find by Daly City. Considering that it was cheap, I'd say we got a good value. Our room was even in the back where not as many people stayed, so I felt like we had enough privacy. The only thing I was truly discontented by was the uncomfortable and firm beds. Aside from that I would stay again.

review.title: Cheap & convenient
review.reviewText: One would assume that anyone choosing a Travelodge by the airport is not expecting a luxury hotel. This motel offers clean, well-tended rooms and an oh-so-convenient location at a bargain price - exactly what we were looking for and exactly what we got.

review.title: Perfect airport hotel
review.reviewText: If you need somewhere great value to get your head down before and after your flight, This is your place, I've stayed here twice and thought it was great value. however, don't expect a porter, mini bar and spa facilities, that's not what this place is all about! It is clean and comfortable though!

review.title: Will Definitely Go Back
review.reviewText: The Travelodge in South San Francisco is nice mid-range hotel for anyone looking for a simply good hotel to stay in. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. I was surprised that there was a coffee pot in the room as well as an ironing board and iron and blow dryer. These were not mentioned as features in the hotel room description. We had a room with two double beds. The only complaint we had was the parking situation. Parking is free, but depending on where your room is, it may be hard for you to find a spot near your room. We were in the 600 section, where there is no parking, but that is how the hotel lot is designed. There is good parking way out in the 700's or in the 300's or 400's which are close the the front of the hotel and the office. This Travelodge also offers a complimentary continental breakfast for all the days of your stay. We stayed two days. This feature was also not mentioned in the hotel description. All in all, we had a very pleasant stay. The hotel staff was very nice. We are definitely going back there next time we are in San Fran.

review.title: Easy freeway access
review.reviewText: Not only was the access from the freeway easy, but being so close to the freeway, the hotel was surprising quiet. I was pleasantly surprised.

review.title: fly away
review.reviewText: Hotel is old, price very reasonable, airport service good, airport parking good

review.title: Just a Place to Lay My Head
review.reviewText: No thrills here, but great price, clean, all I really needed for a brief stay in the area. Actually it was good being near the 101 freeway and airport, as the sounds put me solidly to sleep every night.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: The title says it all. This was basically like staying at a Motel 6. Nothing special about it and its in a really ugly part of South San Francisco about 10-15 miles away from where all the good stuff is. The free shuttle to and from the airport was very much appreciated however and the staff was very friendly.

review.title: convenience is the word
review.reviewText: I don't need much when choosing lodging, just a clean spacious room. That exactly what I received, plus I liked their shuttle service. I forgot my toothpaste, but they provided it for me. Thanks guys!

review.title: somfortable hotel
review.reviewText: very reasonable

review.title: OK for short stay
review.reviewText: Very convenient to airport and airport rental car center. Frequent shuttle to airport. Easy access to Hwys. 101 & 280. Ample parking. Room was basic but in good shape. Soundproofing was very good; I could hardly hear the freeway that runs behind the hotel. The swimming pool was still open and was very clean in late October. Breakfast OK. For the price, you can't beat it in the San Francisco Area. Probably wouldn't recommend it for a longer stay, though.

review.title: Non-Smoking Rooms Not Available
review.reviewText: My main issue with this hotel was the unavailability of a non-smoking room. I booked in advance and they still didn't have any non-smoking rooms. I got the impression that they did not offer non-smoking rooms at all. The condition of the room was adequate for a short single night stay for myself only. However, I would definitely not bring my family and kids.

review.title: YEA, NOT IMPRESSED
review.reviewText: The only positive thing I've got is that I got some rest between flights and didn't have to hang out in the airport for 8 hours. I got no help on the courtesy phones abount when to expect the next shuttle, I had a large heavy suitcase and there was no mention of "no elevator" and that I would have to lug my luggage up the stairs at midnight, plus my carry on bag. My room # was "666", the carpet was yucky n dirty, the curtains barely closed on the large front window, and last of all there is never enough outlets in any hotel room.

review.title: NOT WORTH IT
review.reviewText: We checked out of the hotel and could not even stay there. The staff was rude on check in, and while the outside of hotel looks run down the lobby was clean and tidy so I continued to check in. When I got my room in the back of the hotel, there was a moldy mildew smell. The window was broken and air seeping in, the door would not lock, there was mold growing in several places int he room, the bathtub leaked, the roof leaked, and then there was urine on the bed and when I moved the sheets, I found MOLD! I had to check out, something about this and park at your own risk scared me enough to go somewhere else, there was no way I would stay there, let alone with my son. This was suppossed to only be a quick overnight stay after a hospital visit before we drove home the next morning. Had to go to another hotel.

review.title: Mouse mascot - how fitting
review.reviewText: This place was a dive. The room smelled bad. They make you jump through hoops to get breakfast. (stale bagels)

review.title: One Night Stay
review.reviewText: Stayed for one night in September. Good points: staff very helpful and courteous, quiet at night, IHOP restaurant on premises, free airport shuttle, very affordable - no frills. Bad points: A/C unit very loud, one wall had water damage near floor - frayed wallpaper and mildew smell, sleep sofa crammed into room with king bed.

review.title: Pay more for something else - this stay has soured this chains name for me.
review.reviewText: We were at the very back of the complex. There is only one way in/out. The sign going into the back lot said "park at your own risk". We were going to a concert in SF, so this stay was strictly for convenience. Upon retiring, there were a couple of long brown hairs on the pillows. So I went to get a pillow from the other double bed... those pillows also had hairs on them. The beds did not have fitted sheets, so if you turned while sleeping, the sheet under you would scrunch up and by morning, everything under you was pulled away from the sides, so the mattress itself was exposed. I did not sleep and I was very tired. The bathroom had some kind of small leak on the floor near the baseboard. There was something brown, almost like a little chunk of ground beef in the puddle... very disgusting. I did not complain to the staff because I was with someone and just did not want go there since the main thing of the trip was to go and have a good time/experience. Have to say that while the initial check in experience was good and the staff was pleasant, I will never stay there and would be very reluctant to ever stay at any of their locations - again.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was exactly as described! We were very happy with our room and the staff. Rooms were nice & clean, maybe a bit worn... as expected, but the best value we've ever found in the Bay Area. We'll come back again & recommend it to our friends.

review.title: Basic at best
review.reviewText: This hotel is pretty much in the middle of nowhere and so is only good for one night to be close to the airport. The whole place had a very tired feel, although was generally clean and tidy enough. The man that checked us in seemed to have very little local knowledge and was very reluctant to help us find a number for Domino's Pizza. Our main complaint was upon checking out we asking the desk to call us a taxi and they got us a limo which cost $45 for what should have been a $20 journey.

review.title: Nice for the price
review.reviewText: As a place to stay it was great.

review.title: good for one night near the airport
review.reviewText: We needed a place for one night with shuttle service to SFO for an early flight. Although not much top look at from the outside, the rooms were clean and comfortable. Very close to the interstate so noise could be a factor if you were on that side. Service levels acceptable

review.title: good for the price
review.reviewText: I stayed here few times, it is a good cheap motel near SFO. They are trying hard to improve the place and for the price I have no issues with them, would stay again.

review.title: Was a fair hotel for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine for the price. It is more of a budget hotel and it achieved the goal of a clean nights stay. Being a budget motel the interior is more on the tired side. My one complaint is the free interent did not work from my room and I noticed on other reviews that others have had the same complaint with the office trying to blaim it on each persons computer which is a cop out. They have something wrong with their system.

review.title: You get what u pay for
review.reviewText: The room was okay. Some of the other occupants seemed a little shady. Sounded like there was a party in the room next to me. Booked 2 rooms for one night and they were so far away from each other you had to get in the car to drive from one room to the next. People walking around outside most of the night. Very cheap for san francisco area. Room was clean but a little runned down and beds were not very comfortable. I would probably stay there again if I was short on cash, otherwise I would try somewhere else.

review.title: Not the best bang for your buck
review.reviewText: Sure its cheap in price, but dang you really do get what you pay for. The television was small and although they mentioned they offered able television, they only have like 12 channels displaying images and out of those channels only 6 worked. Kinda like a motel room that you would take a girl after a bar or night out. Dont recommend it, pay an extra 20 bucks and stay somewhere across the street.

review.title: Wouldn't recommend
review.reviewText: No local channels on tv, ice machine not functioning (looked like long term), shabby hotel room. OK, but there are better places with friendlier staff.

review.title: Plan to come back in near future
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay, though it was brief. The room and bed were nice and comforting, and the breakfast was most enjoyable. It's a nice and convenient stay for those on business/pleasure and passing through town.

review.title: terrible! That's it
review.reviewText: I was in emergency but they was not be helpful at all, rather, forced me to check out in 20 minutes without useing any room facility! And when I asked them to call a taxi, they called limousine. I had never had such the worst service. I will never back to the hotel. Also, the restaurant connected to the hotel, was terrible taste and price with the worst service as well.

review.title: will go back next trip
review.reviewText: It is easy access to airport

review.title: Save your money an stay here
review.reviewText: Great price and it was comfortable.

review.title: Poor maintenace motel
review.reviewText: The price is cheap for this motel. However,the second day I had to move to the different room because the ceiling was leaking water in the bathroom.After I move to the new room, the next day, the toilet was overflowed. The motel clerk had to send the plumber guide to fix it. The bathroom sliding door was awful , it 's so hard to pull.

review.title: Well...
review.reviewText: It is a nice price, but not a fancy or fine hotel. They've got the basic breakfast. I did not have cable TV (basic channels). Good things: close to the airport, not that far from SF Downtown and relative good price.

review.title: Cheap, Clean, and Easy
review.reviewText: We just needed two rooms to sleep in before visiting San Francisco for the day. The room was a little worn, but the bed was comfortable and the room was very clean. The location makes it very easy to find.

review.title: Great hotel if you're on a low budget
review.reviewText: I spent 4 nights there as a plan to save some money on a photo trip to Frisco, it's close to the airport, there's a free shuttle that takes you to the BART and back to the hotel. Next to an Ihop (good dinners believe it or not) and close to a gas station. It's far from the action, but you can take the BART train anywhere for around 4 to 8 USD a trip (i also had a car with me so no problem) I had a king bed, TV, iron, good bathroom, a little table..it was almost perfect except for the fact that two light bulbs failed and I was too lazy to report them, still not a big issue.

review.title: Budget hotel, bargain price!
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly. Shuttle bus to the airport was pretty frequent. The internet service is the lobby all 3 computers were suspiciously out of service, not sure what that was all about. The rooms were generic, but were neatly made up. The hotel is showing its age, and needs renovation, but good value for the low price.

review.title: EXTREMELY RUDE STAFF
review.reviewText: When I got to the hotel, I was given a room where a lot of repairs were being done. Consequently, the room smelled like raw sewage. When I asked to be assigned another room, they were rude and at first unwilling to make the change. The night staff is even worse! I had a package that was to be delivered to be and the night staff informed me that it was not his "job" to look for packages that arrive and that my package could be in "housekeeping!" Needless to say, my experience with the staff is enough for me to say that I would not recommend this budget motel to anyone I know!

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Everything was extremely clean, even the caulking behind the toilet was spotless. However the beds where a bit hard.

review.title: Good for overnight for the airport
review.reviewText: The night I stayed there (6/5/09) the place was packed and while it took a while to check in, the front desk person was nice. Because I checked in rather late (around 9:30 PM) I got put in a room that was relatively far (building 7) from the office, and the place is somewhat large. I'm glad it was nice weather, as walking back and forth would not have been good in the rain. Having a car would have been better. The only problem that occurred with my reservation is that I reserved a non-smoking king room, but they didn't have that when I checked in. They gave me a non-smoking room with two doubles instead. The room itself was tidy and clean, and had a all I needed. The room itself, along with the hotel, is not aging well. The carpets were rather worn, the bathtub had rusted through, patched and started to wear through again, and other signs of wear. The place looked tired and is in need of a facelift, and Travelodge should invest in this location to improve upon its site and reputation. Lastly, the shuttle is one that is shared between five other hotels in the area. While that is a good business practice, make sure to give ample time to get to the airport as the first run of the shuttle at 4:05 AM was a bit late. Overall it was fine, and I might stay there again if I need to get an early flight out of SFO, as this was the least expensive place in the area. But, if I wanted something with a bit more creature comforts I would investigate other places.

review.title: Not worth the stay..
review.reviewText: The carpet was very filthy. There were not enough towels. The bed was very squeaky, very old & uncomfortable. I wanted an inexpensive lodging for a one-night stay. Booking at this Travelodge was a wrong decision.

review.title: travel lodge sfo
review.reviewText: THE PLACE WAS NEAT BUT NOT I EXPECTED AS A 2 STAR. THE INTERNET WAS NOT WORKING .OK BREAKFAST !THE PRICE WAS OK ALSO.

review.title: Lovely stay! I will be going back.
review.reviewText: My hotel stay overall was excellent. We had a very pleasant stay. Front desk personnel was very polite and courteous. When I come back to San Francisco I will be staying at the Travelodge San Francisco Airport-North.

review.title: Decent for a cheap hotel
review.reviewText: The room was attended to daily and it was a short (free) shuttle to the Bart airport station. My only complaint is the Internet was working the first day (when the hotel had a sign that they were "fixing" the WiFi), and afterwards it didn't work at all. The staff suggested we use our laptop in the lobby, which was closer to the router. It is a "freeway hotel" (there are a lot in that area), so there may be some traffic noise, but we didn't notice any since we had a room on the far side of the hotel. They offered a room change when we requested our shower drain be unclogged; we declined, and they fixed the drain the same day we requested it. Overall, it's what I would expect for the price: clean, decent staff, etc. Let's be honest, you won't get a mint on your pillow or your suit brushed down, but you won't get bed-bugs after staying here either. This is a clean place to sleep with fairly easy access to the city, period.

review.title: for that price it really worth
review.reviewText: for that price it really worth

review.title: Unimpressed
review.reviewText: There was no Continental breakfast, even though it was advertised. My bed and pillows were dirty...hairs on the pillow and sheets. Will never go back.

review.title: What a DUMP!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Great staff & friendly BUT the hotel is OLD, neglected & runned down!!!!!!!!!! Old wooden windows facing the freeway (US 101), making it noisy!!!!!! Toilet tank was cracked, towel rack fell right off the wall, shower was moldy!!!!!!! WHAT A DUMP!!!!!!!! Maybe worth $5 a night; but we paid much more than that!!!!!!!!!!

review.title: Pay the Extra Cash
review.reviewText: Majority of the reviews were slightly over average, so I decided to try it. We only stayed overnight, but it was the longest night of my life. The bathroom tub had mildew and the water wouldn't stop running (not dripping, running) and the door frame was all rotted out. The carpets had iron stains/burns and it also felt sticky. The pillows were flat and I couldnt open the room window. I would suggest paying the extra money for another hotel!!

review.title: Annoyed
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for and this hotel is no exception, so quality matched the price, which is OK. But the evening desk staff is not helpful with problem, and can be very irritating if not downright insulting. Complaints to the management don't help.

review.title: most convenient for 11-day parking and SFO airport access
review.reviewText: enjoyed being so near to airport and not worrying about finding a park for the car until we returned in 11 days. enjoyed having ihop so near.

review.title: Not too bad!
review.reviewText: Everything was okie , the bed was comfy, the toilet was clean/ THe only thing i may want to highlight is the coffee maker is old and dirty. but overall, is a nice place to stay if u just need a place to rest after a long day sight seeing outside

review.title: Very handy to airport with good shuttle service.
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine had problem with use of computer in foyer which is provided by separate company.

review.title: Just what we needed
review.reviewText: We stayed here when we were switching flights at the SFO airport. The free shuttle made it very convienent for us. It was an afforadable place to sleep.

review.title: It wasn't terrible
review.reviewText: We just picked this place beacuse it was cheap and came with 1 free breakfast cupon from IHOP. The hotel was old and kind of falling appart,and the room was tiny. But the King size bed was comfortable and the sheets were clean. So for a one night stay, my wife and I were satisfied. I say that if you need to stay for 2 or more nights however, pay the extra few bucks for something newer and nicer.

review.title: Beware
review.reviewText: Staff Overworked and less friendly than necessary. lobby not very clean and reception area messy. I was stuck 300 yard walking distance from the lobby in a long line of buildings in the complex. felt very deserted and didn't feel that safe.

review.title: Good alternative for the night
review.reviewText: Just about as close to the airport as you can get. Clean and comfortable room. Great price and super covenient for returning our rental car and get to the airport early.

review.title: a so-so motel
review.reviewText: room has a smell

review.title: Dirty & Not Kept Up
review.reviewText: I will never stay at this hotel again and will NEVER recomend it to anyone EVER! It was dirty, the door jam was broken and glued together poorly, the soap dish in the shower was broken with very sharp jagged edges on it, the sofa had holes in it and the outlet where the cable for the television was run out of the wall was hanging off and exposed. Speaking of the television, not good reception at all and only about 5 channels. Also, the walls were gross! Dirty, stains of I don't even want to know what running down the walls! Very unhappy!

review.title: It's alright for a night
review.reviewText: I was just staying there for a night and driving to Monterey the next. It's fine for what I had to pay.

review.title: Good Value Hotel
review.reviewText: Basic facilities. Fine for the price. IHop proximity was a plus. Staff was helpful.

review.title: No Extras
review.reviewText: This is a CHEAP hotel for that area, so don't expect much. You get what you pay for. We used it the first night, because we didn't get in until about 1 am. Bottom line is it's good for sleeping.

review.title: Reasonable accomodation with free shuttle to airport.
review.reviewText: Hotel is large two storied older complex spread out over huge area. Freeway close by.Resturant next door. Ideal for a night or two.Handy to airport with free shuttle. N.B if you want to visit downtown San Fran. then you would need to get shuttle to/from hotel/airport and use BART train system.

review.title: Very good deal
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Near the airport and main avenues in South SF. Nice pool and personnel.

review.title: very good hotel
review.reviewText: nice!

review.title: Not bad for the price
review.reviewText: We stayed only one night but it was a satisfactory room. The hotel was kind of close to the hotel so we heard Airplanes fly by sometimes at night but it wasn't too bad. It was a cheap room so I expected worse

review.title: Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were unfriendly and very short when I would ask them a question. I went to a different hotel the very next day.

review.title: Good SFO transit choice
review.reviewText: Convenient for stopover between flights. Inexpensive, clean, plain. The late check-in time can be problem for arrivals from the Orient

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: They need to give more towels for bathroom.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel twice. The first time I arrived the staff were great and I got what I had reserved thourgh Expedia(king size bed, non-smoking. The only thing was check in time was at 3pm. My room wasnt ready, the housekeeper was still cleaning, so I had to leave the for an hour, until they were done. The second time, the staff werent really helpful and again they gave me a room that wasnt ready for arrival, and when the staff did switch rooms for me, they gave me what I hadnt even reserved!( I reserved a king size bed, non smoking) and I got double queen smoking and it was not very tidy.

review.title: Basic but handy !
review.reviewText: Basic hotel that isnt flash, but its rates are very competitive. Ideal for those who are happy with a hotel to use as a base from which they can use the free shuttle service to get to and from SFO and BART ( city train system ). Ihop restaurant attached for cheap basic American food. This is very basic, but good value for the money.

review.title: good location,price and service!
review.reviewText: i take leisure in sfo, it's correct choice to stay here, good location to airport and downtown.

review.title: Budget Nostalgia
review.reviewText: A nostalgic older motel. Yeah, it's a little tired and needs updating and renovation, but the location is convenient to the SF Conference Center and SFO. Staff was friendly and helpful. Because the location is inherently noisy (freeway and SFO runway) the lower floor units seem quieter. Was relatively clean and even had an iron for last minute touch up. Wake-up calls were accurate.

review.title: U get what u pay for.
review.reviewText: U get what u pay for, nothing flash, nothing fancy but its near the airport. If u need to stay for teh night and - like me - hate to spend money on hotels its just fine.

review.title: Very cozy and affordable
review.reviewText: The front desk staff was very friendly and allowed me to leave my bag in a secure area while I toured the city and waited for my check in time.

review.title: recomend to others, maybe
review.reviewText: Hotel apearance outside is poor. Inside was decent. Good locationn in relation to airport. Easy to get to and close. front desk service only fair

review.title: Rundown
review.reviewText: The room was cheap, so I shouldn't complain...but the room smelled when we walked in, and it was not well kept...paint chipped, shower stained, not enough towels.

review.title: Great bargain
review.reviewText: Not fancy but clean and close to the city

review.title: Improved
review.reviewText: The service has improved from the previous,example:no staff open the door to enter optionally. In short,good.

review.title: Not impressed at all
review.reviewText: Hotel was not clean at all. Found hair in the bed and hair in and around the sink. I asked for no smoking room and got a smoking room.

review.title: Good for those traveling
review.reviewText: This hotel is very convenient for those who are traveling via the San Francisco International Airport, or even for those just wishing for an easy trip into San Francisco itself. There is a free shuttle that leaves every half hour to/from the airport/BART station and it made our trip to the city a breeze.

review.title: Just OK, but beware of included breakfast package
review.reviewText: It was ok, but nothing to sing about. But I really didn't expect too much since the price was so low. I was not disappointed. But beware, I registered and paid extra for the included breakfast. What they don't tell you is they only provide one breakfast, no matter how many in your room, so my wife and I had to purchase a second meal. That was a jip.

review.title: Scared my car would be stolen
review.reviewText: The hotel is right next to the freeway, and seems a bit seedy, especially since I didn't feel that the lighting around the hotel and where you park your cars, etc. was adequate. The rooms are very outdated and small. The bed was comfortable enough, and the road noise didn't bother me once I turned the room's heater on. And, thankfully, my car was still there in the morning.

review.title: Very inpressed
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised with the cleanliness of the room, even the corners of the bathroom showed no evidence of dirt. Overall a much satisfied stay, I would stay there again.

review.title: would not go back even for less price
review.reviewText: pros: cheap price, nearer to airport / 101 freeway cons: poor service - They don't have printer for customer, their manager asked me to use PC for internet (charge $5.00/hr and same for 1 copy), my reservation was for 1 king bed and they gave me 2 queen beds, room is so small for 2 queen, bathroom is also smaller and no toiletries, for 2 adults they gave me 1 IHOP breakfast voucher, kidding with customers, ice machine didn't work,

review.title: Never, ever again
review.reviewText: Our stay was terrible. We will NEVER stay in another Travelodge again. When we got to our room, it was like an ice box. When we turned on the heater, it blew nothing but cold air. There were no batteries in the TV remote and when we asked to get some we were told we couldn't have any until the maintainence people showed up the next morning, which did us no good as we had a plane to catch at 5 that morning. The knob on the shower faucet barely functioned, leading to a shower either much too cold or much too hot. As if this weren't enough, we were given the wrong information by the hotel staff regarding our return shuttle trip from the airport to the hotel to pick up our car. Consequently, we missed the shuttle and it didn't come again for 45 minutes when it should have been only 20. Overall, this was one of the worst hotel stays we have ever had. This was the first and last time we will ever stay at a Travelodge.

review.title: Good value for such price
review.reviewText: Good price for a short stay.. next to highway, still be able to hear the traffic.. but not that bad.

review.title: not good
review.reviewText: poor service, old facilities, no working ice machine.

review.title: will go back
review.reviewText: was satisified with the hotel and the staff, would go back

review.title: Travellodge
review.reviewText: Not up to standards. Need to be updated. I felt like I was in the dumps.

review.title: Dirty
review.reviewText: This hotel is horrible and we should have stayed somewhere else. The only benifet to this hotel was the park and fly. We've done a lot of traveling and stayed at a few travel lodges over the years and this one was by far the worst.

review.title: Not a great hotel, but OK for the price
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because it was least expensive one I could find. Its an OK hotel if you just want to stay for the night. The room was clean.But the bathroom was very dingy. The exterior of the hotel looks very bad and cheap looking. I would not go here again. But its OK if you just want to sleep for the night.

review.title: Would not return here.
review.reviewText: This hotel really needs a makeover. The front desk staff was very fast to check us in. No complaints there. The shuttle to the airport was on time. The airplane noise was terrible. We couldn't fall asleep until the planes stopped taking off (11:00 PM). I would not stay here again. I'd spend a few extra dollars and find someplace newer and further from the take off and landing zone.

review.title: reasonably priced
review.reviewText: Close to airport, small room but clean and reasonably priced.

review.title: need to improve
review.reviewText: There are many ways for improvement,for example:the service personnels and managers did open the door at random harassment of guests several times a day,and the room cleanliness ,etc. strong suggest:install some microwaves ,refrigerators and cooking utensils in some rooms,then this type of room can be raise prices appropriately,respect the different needs of guests .

review.title: Nightmare!
review.reviewText: Whatever you do, do NOT stay here!! We forfeited the money and went to another hotel. The room smelled terribly, was completely run down; dirty carpets, pile of garbage outside our door. People hanging around the guest pool drinking, and a note on the bed warning us to be sure our door was dead bolted and all valuables removed from the vehicle. Not to mention the noise from the highway and general disrepair of this hotel. Travelodge needs to address this because it does nothing to encourage people to stay at their hotels. We sure won't.

review.title: Too cheap
review.reviewText: Courteous front-desk staff and a good housekeeping crew couldn't make up for everpresent freeway noise and decrepit facilities. The outdoor motel buildings are only yards away from a busy freeway. To make matters worse, our door was missing half its weatherstripping, which allowed cold air and noise to pour into our room all night. Speaking of not sleeping, I cut myself on a bedspring poking up through the mattress and sheet!

review.title: You will be sorry you paid for this!!
review.reviewText: Staff very unfreindly, unhelpfull and generally rude. Rooms have an awfull damp smell, live bare wires and sockets hanging from walls, dirty shower complete with black mould, dirty sheets complete with bugs, air-con unit did not work and smells awfull when switched on, carpets are alive, and front door would not lock! Oh yeah, if you want a good nights sleep, go sleep at the airport. You may have more luck! If only I could rate it -5...

review.title: Hotel in desparate need of upgrade
review.reviewText: As a part of the Wyndham chain, this hotel is in serious need of an upgrade. I used to stay here a lot but the last 2 times have me changing my mind. The rooms have a funny smell. I was there just two weeks ago and the shower was clogged, the room didn't get cleaned till after five. About 2 months ago I got some sort of bug bite, when I returned home my skin was full of red itchy bumps. I know for sure unless I am really desperate I won't stay here anymore.

review.title: Will not return...
review.reviewText: I called the hotel repeatedly - 8 to 10 - times - for an airport pickup to no avail. I finally "hitched" a ride with another hotel van service. The hotel lobby and surrounding grounds are in desperate need of attention. I felt I was in a third-rate hotel; however, the room wasn't too bad. And the rate was cheap.

review.title: Cheap hotel near SFO
review.reviewText: You can get to and from SFO with buss early 30 min. Hotel is nice for the prize.

review.title: Only 3 star
review.reviewText: Park and Fly was attractive and Expedia gave a good one night stay price.

review.title: Unfriendly staff
review.reviewText: Aside from the unfriendly staff, the surrounding area doesn't give you a safe vibe. I had reserved a one king size bed room and got a 2 queen room because they had no king bed rooms. To top it off, the room didn't smell too good and the bathtub wasn't all that clean.

review.title: It's a fair deal in this category
review.reviewText: A middle range 2 stars room, but never forget that it's not rated 5 stars. So is the daily fee. Remember that the full breakfast included is for 1 person.

review.title: Good for the value
review.reviewText: This hotel is good for the value although it's very old and run down. The towel rack is broken, the bedframe brokedown, and the toilet runs all night.

review.title: Very run-down and noisy
review.reviewText: This hotel is in need of a major remodel. The staff was nice, but the condition of the property is very poor. Even though one would expect some airport noise at a hotel that's near the airport, it was extremely noisy at this hotel. We had two rooms. Both were terrible. One toilet wouldn't flush. When we called the front desk we were told there was no one around to fix it.

review.title: location suitable for easy access to airport SFO
review.reviewText: Clean affordable, noisy. with staff that with one notable exception were quite unhelpful.

review.title: Never will go back to the travelodge
review.reviewText: I had a terrible experience. When wanted to check in and no rooms available front desk said I unless you want to sleep on dirty sheets we can check you in now. They have way to much going on at the hotel Conference room where they were having a party with very loud music till midnight and drunk people walking all around. This was a awful getaway for me and my finacee and I was way to tired to take care of the business I went to take care of in the first place.

review.title: Hotel OK, but very noisy
review.reviewText: I was pleased with the cleanliness of the room and tea/coffee machine. Bed was good so were the pillows.There was only one thing, the location of the hotel. It is just in between a highway and SAn Francisco BLvd. and planes taking off above your head. You can not escape the noise until very late hours even when using ear plugs.If you do not have problem with it, it is good place for 1 night. Otherwise choose something else.

review.title: Do yourself a favor and don't stay here
review.reviewText: Let's see where do I start. The property was in dire need of maintenance, potholes in the parking lot, building needs painting, second floor walklway has wood slats that are broken and I wouldn't trust. Now for the room, multiple stains on the carpet along with iron burns, walls had multiple marks, bathroom was tiny and only had a sliding door to close it off from the room. At the corner of the bathroom door was a nasty topping of cheese pizza that had dried and left for us to eat. Overall a real disappointment. Finally Expedia advertised that this room also offered free IHOP breakfast for guests. Upon check-in we did not receive any coupon or instructions regarding the breakfast. Next morning we went to the front desk where we were informed that only one person could eat for free and then it was only 3 small items like acontinental breakfast - DO NOT STAY HERE YOU WILL BE SORRY.

review.title: Perfect for Airport stop-over
review.reviewText: Great free shuttle to and from SFO Airport running every 30 minutes. The IHOP onsite is open 24 hours serving good reasonable priced food. Given 3 for comfort of room as our's was a little cramped with a king-size bed and sofa, but overall this is a great hotel for an airport stop-over and it even provides free Wi-Fi and a pool.

review.title: good price to stay in SF
review.reviewText: Nothing to complain, free parking, cheap, of course the room is relatively clean. Good value.

review.title: NO GOOD
review.reviewText: TERRIBLE..VERY DIRTY ROOM, SHOWER DON 'T WORK SERVICE INESISTENT, BREAKFAST NOT INCLUDED FOR ALL GUESTS. TERRIBLE. DIRTY AND NOISY. NON RECOMMENDED THIS HOTEL.

review.title: it a nice place away from big city
review.reviewText: the atendant at front desk was very unfriendly but other than that everything was good

review.title: ok for short stay
review.reviewText: older but cost effective

review.title: Not pleased
review.reviewText: By the 101, the hotel was very noisy but that's OK. What was not was the service, which I did not find friendly. I had to ask several times to get the advertised continental breakfast and could only get one voucher per room.

review.title: Not bad for the price and location
review.reviewText: The hotel was old, and it looked and smelled liked it. However the location was not bad it was a short drive into downtown, and since we only went to the hotel to sleep it was not too unbearable.

review.title: Stay away!
review.reviewText: If you want cheap and dirty, this is your motel! We reserved a roll away bed for 3 nights and only got it for one night. The bed spreads were dirty . . . stained. The location of the motel didn't seem safe. Don't recommend it.

review.title: Not worth it!!
review.reviewText: When we asked for a non-smoking room, we should have told them that we didn't want it to smell like cat urine either! We tried to save money by staying in a hotel near the airport instead of downtown San Francisco. The hotel had outdated lighting fixtures and only half of them worked, the room had a foul smell to it, and the mattresses were more like box springs. We were a family of four and could not get the towels and washclothes to equal the same number. We left messages with housekeeping and when we called the front desk, they would not help us. We even walked around to find a housekeeper and she told us on two seperate occasions that she didn't have any to give us. Therefore, we spent 4 days sharing towels. It was not a good experience at all and we should have just paid the additional price to stay in the City.

review.title: Not worth it if you like Cleanliness
review.reviewText: It was cheap but not worth it. There were nasty spiders on the curtains. I stayed for two nights and after killing a couple spiders the first night, there were more in the same spot the next night. After that, I was weary of even laying in bed or going in the bathroom. It was inexpensive but definitely not worth it...even if it's just overnight.

review.title: You get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: The bed lacked a fitted sheet. The WiFi was not dependable; it lasted 5 to 10 minutes every couple of hours. TV stations were fuzzy. 3 out of 4 bedroom light bulbs were burnt out. Although the male attendants at the front counter were indifferent to me (American), they appeared very rude to international travelers.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Dirty, nonsmoking room smells like smoke with cigarette burns and tables are dirty with sticky mess on top and I had to clean it myself. Toilet wont flush right away and has to hold the flusher to work. carpet smells and needs replacement.

review.title: Good location but that's about it
review.reviewText: Good location near San Francisco Airport & only 8-10 min. drive to downtown San Fran. Nearby restaurant next door with ok service. BUT rooms were old and needed a good cleaning, one bed was awful & felt like we were sleeping on the box spring. Asked to get changed and they said they would put a pad on it, but did not. Room had a weird odor. Nothing fancy.

review.title: If your short on cash...
review.reviewText: This is the place to stay. The maid service is pushy and does not respect the "Privacy Please" sign. There is not enough around if your sick or had a late night and would like something to eat. This includes the supossed 24 hour IHOP that was closed by 10pm. The air in the rooms is humid and opening the window or turning on the air does very little to help. The staff is not very knowledgable of the area and do little to help if you are lost or need directions. I will definately not be staying there again.

review.title: OK FOR OVERNIGHT
review.reviewText: OK FOR OVERNIGHT STAY CLOSE TO SF AIRPORT ONLY

review.title: Good hotel for the price.
review.reviewText: The Travelodge provided an inexpensive, basic overnight stay for me while away on business. It is a great value for San Francisco and its proximity to SFO can't be beat. If I have to stay over in San Francisco, I will most definitely stay here again.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Inexpensive location near the airport with ample long-term parking. But not an attractive hotel with great service.

review.title: Scary
review.reviewText: The hotel was not acceptable in any way. We ended up finding another hotel.

review.title: Saving Money
review.reviewText: For the price, this motel-style accommodation was very good. Don't expect it to be in a class with its higher-priced neighbors on S. Airport but it does offer clean rooms, convenient to SFO and easy access to highways 101, 280 and 380. Having an IHOP next door is also very convenient and the airport and Tanforan, a major shopping center are both less than two miles away. The room was clean and the amenities, though meager, were well-maintained. Parking can be a bit of a problem if you arrive late, but on the plus side, the large lot, although quite a trek from my room, was patrolled by a night watchman. The building my room was in was tucked behind another building. This offered a bit of quiet seclusion but at the sacrifice the element of visibility as a safety factor. Checkout was quick and easy and, unless I take my wife along, I will stay there again.

review.title: Hotel in need of building maintenance
review.reviewText: The rug had iron burns on it in about 4 places. The beds were very hard to sleep on. But for the amount we paid and the closeness to the airport made up for any of these things.

review.title: Just over-night
review.reviewText: OK for overnight.

review.title: Best for the buck
review.reviewText: Hotel is really good if you just want a place to stay for a few days. The room is clean and the customer service is nice. There's also a free shuttle that takes you to SFO airport. That saves you money if you want to go to downtown SF. Just take BART from the airport and it'll take you downtown so you don't have to pay for parking. The only thing I didn't like about was the bathroom door wouldn't lock so there's no privacy if you're with someone else. It's an old sliding door so it basically covers the bathroom. Overall, it's a nice stay.

review.title: Dissappointed
review.reviewText: The hotel was not very well taken care of, it stands out like a sore thumb since it's surrounded by nicer hotels. The bed was the most uncomfortable I've ever had to sleep in before. Will never go back.

review.title: Good if you are on a budget
review.reviewText: If you are on a budget this is an excellent option... Always clean and has good service

review.title: travelodge
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a very poor condition.

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine. Slightly cheeky though that you just get 1 breakfast voucher. Wifi worked properly and wasn't really any aircraft noise. Location is a few minutes drive from the airport terminals.

review.title: Its just a place to crash.
review.reviewText: We must admit that it was a good place to catch some shut eye, but not for a long-term stay. The room was pretty run down, and the mattresses need some padding.

review.title: dirty
review.reviewText: The rug floor was very dirty. The maid does not clean around the corners. The rug is old, and the carpet has not been shampooed for years.

review.title: Double charged for the same movie title in less than 24 hours
review.reviewText: This is the first time I write a review about a hotel and the reason is I was ripped of. I ordered a movie while in my room, the instructions says you can continue to watch this movie for the next 24 hours, just hit the play button when you want to continue watching the movie. I watched part of the movie, stepped out of my room to get a dinner came back ready to watch the rest of it. I started the movie from the begininig and watch it until the end. When I checked out I notice double charge for the movie, I explained to the front desk person that it is the same movie I watched in less than 24 hours, he said it does not matter I still have to pay for two movies! I told him they should disclose this in the instruction instead of saying you could watch the movie for the next 24 hours; he said I could take it up to the management. I check in at 6PM and checked out the next morning at 10 Am, paid $24 to watch National Treasure.

review.title: Cheap
review.reviewText: This is a place for sleeping only so don't expect a whole lot.

review.title: Simple, basic motel
review.reviewText: Stayed here 3 nights while visiting San Francisco. There's nothing spectacular but it has everything you need. It's cheap, clean and has regular shuttles to and from the airport. The rooms were clean and decent sized. I'd stay there again in the future.

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable room, large shower. Shuttle to airport was very effecient. Will use again when I need transportation to and from SFO.

review.title: cheap, but you get what you paid for
review.reviewText: Our room was loud. We could hear traffic all night on 101, as well as noise from the airport. The IHOP breakfast coupon isn't really worth it since its only good for one person(even though we booked 2 queen beds) and its only good on three select breakfast choices.

review.title: Needs Maintenance, but still a value
review.reviewText: The bathroom need cleaning and some repairs. When I checked the person before me was complaining of black mold in her bathroom. Very busy and very reasonable for San Francisco.

review.title: would not recommend
review.reviewText: sheets thin as were the pillows. room had a musty smell and needs a really good cleaning. Price is right for 2 queen bed room but

review.title: convenient to SFO
review.reviewText: If you need a cheap overnight near SFO, this hotel is one to consider. Although they don't provide breakfast, an IHOP adjoins the hotel, so food is easy to get.

review.title: Just one night stay with Park and Fly
review.reviewText: I stayed just one night with Park and Fly. It was good for save money. I think if they have continental breakfast, I will stay again.

review.title: CHEAP NOT JUST THE PRICE
review.reviewText: The lobby & exterior were fine.The service (in person) was turse where as over the phone I was treated with courtesy. The shower was filthy and falling apart as was the carpeting in the room. Even the t.v. had horrible reception. Maybe if you only had to stay for an couple of hours sleep I would say go for it.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice except I tripped in the carpet between the room and the tile in the bathroom. It seemed as it if was not finished.

review.title: Good bargin
review.reviewText: Convenient to airport and restaurants

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: It's close to the airport, close to the BART station, reasonably priced, clean and comfortable. The room was excellent value for my money, in fact, I am staying there again this weekend. So "Yes", I would definitely recommend it to fellow travelers.

review.title: Need improvement in many areas in this Airport Travelodge
