review.reviewText: Hotel staff is friendly but the room was very badly maintained. It's not clean & it's very disusting to even using it. The bed linens are not clean & the mattress need replacement. Hotel offered "Full Breakfast" but cannot accomodate 2 adults & 1 child. It's supposed to include in the reservation. Overall, this hotel is very disappointing, very noisy location by the Freeway.

review.title: A bit run-down but worth it
review.reviewText: The Travelodge SFO North is a bit run down but has the following advantages: The price for the park and fly package was cheaper than the cost of parking my car at the airport. The shuttle service is excellent as it goes every half hour, and the free breakfast was at the IHOP next door. While I was a little nervous as a lone woman walking through the parking lot to get to my room at night, it was worth it.

review.title: Good place to stay while waiting for a flight.
review.reviewText: Hotel is old but clean. There is an IHOP there and a McDonald's down the road a short distance. The hotel is in the city of South San Francisco but is called Travelodge North since it is north of the airport. I thought there were 2 Travelodges but was set straight by the shuttle driver. There aren't a lot of channels on the TV but it was comfortable and a reasonably priced place to stay between flights.

review.title: just a place to sleep
review.reviewText: Hotel shuttle from and to the airport was very fast and very nice. The hotel can be a nice alternative if you are on a budget and just looking for a place to sleep. For that, it offers comfortable beds and ok rooms. If you need more than just a place to sleep, then you should consider other hotels.

review.title: Cheap & Convenient
review.reviewText: Hotel Review: There is nothing special about this hotel other than it is extremely cheap and convenient for traveling in and out of SFO. We paid a low price, got a room for the night with a reasonably comfortable bed, clean - albeit old and musty - but then we got 14 days free parking and a ride to/from the airport for less than we paid for the room. What beats that? The shuttle runs every 20 minutes starting at about 4 am to midnight and doesn't require a reservation for the shuttle. I'll do it again.

review.title: you get what you paid
review.reviewText: Comfortable. I wouldn't trust the coffee maker too much. Never seems to be enough cream or sugar for two. Bathtub could be a lot cleaner and heater didn't keep the room warmer. Wifi is o.k but slow.

review.title: Very convenient motel close to airport
review.reviewText: Stayed for one night before my flight back that left early on the next morning. Friendly check-in, large room in good and clean condition, hotel very conveniently located just a few minutes drive from the airport and the rental car return building.

review.title: Get what you paid for
review.reviewText: If you are thinking of staying at this hotel for the amenities don't expect a whole lot. Coffee maker didn't make good coffee and we suspected that they never cleaned it. Not much closet space for luggage and the heater didn't do much to warm the room. Wifi was very slow, I think everyone was on it. And lots of noise from outside, you can hear people right outside your door and they are trying to whisper. Overall, it is o.k. if you plan to sleep on the car ride.

review.title: It was cheap but you get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Room decor needed updating. Window was boarded up with plywood.

review.title: Stay no more than 1 day
review.reviewText: If you are just staying overnight and just need it for sleep then it is alll right.

review.title: You get what you pay for-- it's cheap and basic, no more.
review.reviewText: This is a fine motel if you want a simple and cheap place to sleep. Don't expect more than the minimum-- but if you're OK with that, you'll be happy.

review.title: Good buy for bachelor.
review.reviewText: Looks much better inside than out, in my opinion. Very accomadating staff.Excellent location in refence to San Francisco. Decent restaurants nearby. Would definetely stay there again.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Rooms were far from the office and looked like it was were they put undesirables. The advertised WIFI internet did not work in room.

review.title: Not bad if you stay for 1 or 2 nights
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel for one night because we were transfering flight the next day. It was OK. I booked it because of the free airport shuttle and the i-hop next to it, but be careful that there are 2 travelodges close to the airport. This one is in south SF.

review.title: Served it's purpose
review.reviewText: Even though the hotel is older, I enjoyed my stay. Room was clean and comfortable. Only there for hot showers and sleep. Rest of my time was for sightseeing. Glad there was a shuttle service. I don't drive when I visit San Fransisco. I'd go back again.

review.title: hotel is ok
review.reviewText: This hotel was not the best.For what we used it for it was fine.IT was not dirty,but it wasent real clean.We was only there long enough to sleep and get cleaned up.IT is really old hotel.The wall paper was peeling in places and it was just really old.They whole places needs to be re done. I also didnt really feel safe.I wasnet affraid of being harmed,but there was a lot of "Thug" types hanging around.Made me wonder if my rental car was going to get broken into or damaged.They did have an all night security guard that patrolled the parking lot and I think that prevented stuff like that from happening. The IHOP next door wasent very good.For the quality of service and food we got,it was very expensive.

review.title: Needs updating
review.reviewText: The hotel was not a bad place to stay but it needs updating. Wallpaper was peeling off walls, furniture was old and not very clean. The heater had to stay on all night because it was barely blowing any warm air. For the price, it was not that bad of a place to stay though. It was pretty quiet, is next door to Ihop and is close to the airport.

review.title: would never go back to this hotel
review.reviewText: I did not feel safe in the hotel. I did not stay my last night, I left. People were knocking on my door at 2 and 3 am, people were yelling and being rude throughout the day. I did not feel like I could leave my room at night.

review.title: Acceptable hotel
review.reviewText: If you just look for a place to stay with competitive price, then this maybe your choice. However, if you are picky, maybe not. Room cleanliness is good, otherwise no frid or microwave.

review.title: Travelodge - San Fransisco - NORTH
review.reviewText: Our first encounter with a travelodge employee was when we were picked up at the airport. The driver was rude and snippy to say the least. When we arrived at our room there was a strange musty odor that in due time we found out was due to a leaking toilet. When we called to report the toilet problem, we were told that we would have to wait until three days later for it to be repaired.

review.title: Not too impressed.
review.reviewText: We bought a full breakfast with the room, but found out we got only one breakfast per room, not per person, so I would recommend not getting that option. The room was dingy, but comfortable enough. No tub. Very generic. Good service to the airport and inexpensive.

review.title: convenient location
review.reviewText: very close to airport,shuttle access to and from airport .IHOP next door open 24 hours.

review.title: love free WiFi!
review.reviewText: good place - very busy

review.title: Great for Low Budget Stay
review.reviewText: This hotel exceeded my expectations. The room was clean and well maintained. It had everything: TV, video games, a free safe for valuable belongings, laundry facilities, an iron and ironing board in suite, alarm clock, nice furniture. The only downside was my particular building (out of about 7) was next to a feeway so I could always hear motorcycles and trucks whizzing by. Also, it got a bit cold around 6:00 am but nothing a sweater couldn't cure.

review.title: Not Bad for the price
review.reviewText: Not the best hotel, but with the free shuttle, breakfast and price, it's worth it.

review.title: Comfort at a fair price
review.reviewText: Unfortnately we got food poisoning the night before and we were not able to enjoy our trip to San Francisco, Ca. However, the room was comfortable and clean which made our stay pleasant. The hotel shuttle drivers were very courteous an informative. We would use this hotel again in our next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: It was a cheap deal but not worth the problems...
review.reviewText: The shower was broken and reception found it difficult to help us but eventually did. It did not feel safe. When we were switching rooms in a dark parking lot area, every person in the hotel found it necessary to step outside and stare. Long term guests maybe?

review.title: Nice hotel but not convenient location for longer stay
review.reviewText: We have reserved this hotel because of easy access from higway because we were afraid to drive in downtown, it was our first visit to America. During our visit of four days we had a problem to reach out center of San Francisco without car.There is no direct fast metro line near hotel only bus but that drive is too long. You should take first free shuttle to airport SF and then a Muni line - which is train to downtown Powell station cca. 25 min drive. For further exploring then you have a metro network for which you need another ticket. In one word very complicated and expensive.

review.title: Ok, Good deal on Fly packag
review.reviewText: The hotel front desk is not very friendly or helpful. If there is a problem with noise in another unit you are not going to get any help. Lighting is poor outside. The units are old and do not look clean. It is a good price for the stay one night and fly. You can leave your car for seven days with that package.

review.title: For the price...not bad
review.reviewText: WE had a problem with our iron and they said they had no more. The housecleaning lady came an hour early before check out and tried to say she still needed to clean the room. There were alot of little things that need improvement. The restraunt onsite was horrible, horrible service and not enough employees.

review.title: happy
review.reviewText: I am always happy in this hotel

review.title: Handicap friendly and clean
review.reviewText: Having been in other handicap friendly facilities before, this hotel was definitely very nice in this respect. Rails everywhere, a clean room, and semi-decent cable. My only complaint was with the terribly intermittent internet service. Other than that, everything was wonderful.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: The room has everything for my convinience that was nice. However, the bathroom and carpet look dirty that gave me unsutisfaction

review.title: Scary
review.reviewText: This hotel was "seedy". All guests who rode the shuttle to and from the hotel had similar comments about it being the worst hotel on their trip. There was a window broken out of car in parking lot during the day time.

review.title: ok, but old and room was cluttered w/furniture.
review.reviewText: old hotel, but convenient to airport. Worked for what we needed.

review.title: Good buy for the buck, 24 free hour shuttle to SFO is very helpful
review.reviewText: 24 hour shuttle service was very cool, leaving every 20 min or so to SFO and where you can hop on the BART. Hotel condition was slightly run down a bit, but how much can you expect for this price. TV stations were limited, a nice little refrigerator would be nice if they had them. WIFI access was superb, excellent connection. Hotel grounds was kinda sprawled out if walking. But no complaints from me for this hotel, it was a great price, great location, and I would recommend someone on a lower budget to stay at this hotel but it's nothing fancy.

review.title: Pay the extra money and stay somewhere nice.
review.reviewText: The rooms was supposed to be smoke free but it smelled od old smoke. The beds were the worst I have ever slept on. The springs were poking into us all night. On the positive side, it is close enought to the freeway and downtown. Pay the liittle extra and stay somewhere nice.

review.title: great stay except for the wireless internet was always down.
review.reviewText: great stay except for the wireless internet was always down.

review.title: Travel Lodge NOT what you expect.
review.reviewText: The location was good, near the airport. We did NOT get the room reserved, a King bed; we got 2 queens. The mattress must be as old as the hotel, the springs were 1/8 inch below the material. Terrible beds. My feet were off the end of the bed all night.

review.title: Checking In
review.reviewText: Room was clean and comfortable. I really liked the sofa they put in the room instead of one of those cheesy chairs. The coffee maker didn't make good coffee, we suspect it wasn't cleaned very well. The shower head had no pressure and you had to wait to flush the toilet since the water level was so low. Other than that it was nice. TV channels were a little bit better but you go more news channels than anything else. Oh, and the room cleaners come by early so don't expect that you can stay to the last minute in your room because they will be waiting right outside of your room. They know if you are there or not. Other than that the a/c heater works well, bed is comfy, and water is always hot.

review.title: Not good for the area and money
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, there were many things out of place with this hotel, first security. Literally the rooms are facing hightway 101 or facing right into the street where anyone can come and knock in your door or get hit by a car from the speeding hightway. The shower was very dirty, curtains had black spots from mold growing. Carpet was very dusty, i walked with only socks for 5 minutes and the bottom was black from all the dirt! the bed was ok can't complain about that but the sheets had stains, of all colors. There are better hotels in the area for the same price or a little bit higher. I stayed in the area in a couple of other occasion and all the previous hotels beat this one by far. The only reason i stayed was because all other hotels had no vacancy which should have been a clue to me.

review.title: it's clean
review.reviewText: about 10 min to SF downtown

review.title: musty rooms; unhelpful staff
review.reviewText: basic accommodation but not up to the standard of other travelodges I have stayed in

review.title: Clean rooms and very nice staff.
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful at checkin. Hotel was clean.

review.title: Middle-of-the-road airport hptel.
review.reviewText: It was certainly adequate. Frequent shuttle bus service to and from the airport was certainly a plus. Airport was just a few minutes away. Down-side, not much to choose from for restaurant selection nearby. If you are looking for an inexpensive hotel with frequent transportation to SFO, this is a good place.

review.title: SFO's Closest Hotel
review.reviewText: It's closest airport,2 miles and has free shuttle bus from airport to hotel,fast check in room and clean room.

review.title: Hotel OK for Purpose of Stay
review.reviewText: One of the lamp sockets was loose from stem, one of the electrical outlets didn't work, and the commode wasn't exactly flush with the floor - it rocked slightly. Also, for a city the size of San Francisco, the TV channel selection could have been more diverse. Other than those minor things, the hotel was quite adequate for my stay. The rooms were clean, the staff courteous and helpful. The hotel was conveniently located to the places that I needed go during my trip. Also, having IHOP next door was a great help.

review.title: Does the job.
review.reviewText: I needed to stay couple of days in San Francisco and this hotel did the job. The rooms were clean and it was one of less expensive hotels in the area. You can get a free shuttle from the airport, which is a plus. Nothing fancy.

review.title: Reasonable price hotel
review.reviewText: Reasonable price based on the quality of hotel

review.title: okay
review.reviewText: This hotel is okay to stay for a night or two (as we did) if you're just looking for a place to crash. It's also very near the San Francisco airport.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The room was very clean, and my stay was comfortable. However, the blow dryer didn't work. I didn't mention this until checkout, they may have been able to exchange it while I was there. Very pleasant staff.

review.title: Nice Swimming Pool
review.reviewText: There are pleasant views of hills in San Francisco and a nice swimming pool. There is a 24 hour restaurant next door (House of Pancakes). Its a 10 minute easy drive to downtown along route 101 - easily commutable. I found it the cheapest travelodge around, but thet try hard to upgrade your room if you let them.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: Reasonable price. It is old, but not bad.

review.title: A gem from the 60th
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean and comfortable with large showers. Architecturally, it is a classic building from the sixties. The shuttle worked fine, although it only goes around every 40 minutes

review.title: VERY Noisy hotel right on the highway, Not impressed
review.reviewText: Booked 2 nights here prior to flying home from SFO. After 30 minutes, became apparent room was too noisy. The hotel backs directly onto the highway (approx 20 feet from back wall of room). Room was also smokey (for a non smoking room) and beds were very old and soft. Bathroom door did not close. Informed front desk room was unacceptable, but no other rooms available at 6pm..... refused to cancel 2nd night (required by expedia) until manager could approve. Tried in vain to contact manager several times... staff would not call her on cell phone. Eventually, left the next morning, paid for the 2nd night anyways but stayed at a much nicer hotel very close by for a few dollars more. Confirmed my opinion of not staying at this chain again without having prior knowledge of the property.

review.title: Not impressed at all.
review.reviewText: I understand that you essentially get what you pay for -- when you pay a low rate per night for a hotel room, my expectations aren't high. But, the conditions of this hotel were even below my non-expectations. Mostly, this is in reference to the service people. I found them to be rude, and with a complete lack of compassion. Stay anywhere else in this area but here.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: we spent 3 nights in this hotel and although the staff was very friendly the beds must be from the 1950's you felt every spring it was awful!! also the door had obviously been kicked in previously and the door jamb was just patched back together sure didnt make you feel secure we didnt leave anything in the room when we were not there....would not stay at this hotel again!!!

review.title: Our Vegas Trip
review.reviewText: Very nice place and close to the airport. Breakfast was great. and everything was close.

review.title: Worst Hotel I've ever stay at
review.reviewText: As a business traveller who travels often, this is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The service was appauling, there was no manager on duty that I could talk to for issues that were disturbing about the structure, and the room was not clean. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. There are many other hotels in this vicinity that you can choose from.......dont choose this one!

review.title: Good for Price and Location
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel often when coming to San Francisco. The bus service to down town San Francisco is very conventient. Bus No. 292 stops directly across the street going into town and stops directly in front of the hotel on the return. Hotel is not fancy, but I am never in the room much except in the evening. For the price and location, it an excellent deal.

review.title: Good, basic place to stay near airport
review.reviewText: This complex apparently was built as a big convention center complex. Only a portion of the (500?)rooms are now being used (maybe a hundred ?). There are restaurants nearby and it worked well for a no-frills place to stay.

review.title: Bad Experience
review.reviewText: Hotel was in bad shape, in need of paint and repair. Mattresses were old and uncomfortable

review.title: Not high end but good deal for a good price.
review.reviewText: Decent hotel, basic and good enough for sleeping. Safe. Good deal for the price. I would use it again.

review.title: Near Everything
review.reviewText: This hotel has basic services but is central location to the airport, mall, and a decent nightspot (across the street).

review.title: Good value for price
review.reviewText: We had a very short stopover for one night and were pleased witht the motel. It was clean, affordable and provided all the comforts we needed for our short stay. Also conveniently located to airport with free shuttle. We would stay again.

review.title: looks like i was in iraque
review.reviewText: unconfortable,unpleasant,honestly i was so frustrated that i don-t have to words to express. desolated area (industrial), rooms were trashy, small, full of mold , never go back , price expensive, even if it was offered for free would refuse .

review.title: You get what you pay for...Not impressed!
review.reviewText: Very old and no comfort...just a marginal place to sleep.

review.title: good place
review.reviewText: nice staff and free wifi!

review.title: too far away to lobby
review.reviewText: build #7 is too far away from lobby. A/C noise is big. outside traffic noise is big

review.title: Honest Opinion
review.reviewText: The room was worth the price that we paid for it. We received exactly what we anticipated and we were pleased.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The heating system was not well maintained. I suffered from respiratory allergy.

review.title: The Worst
review.reviewText: I was handicap walking with a cane, flew from Michigan and was given a room outside, the farthest building from the office that I had to walk to and it was on the 2nd floor with all my luggage. Very scary at 2:00 AM Front desk could give me NO help and of course this was after the shuttle bus left which was not even theirs. We waited at the airport for over 1 hour when this other shuttle company gave us a ride to the hotel. It was not a hotel it was a motel rundown with no service. The bathroom door was painted open, could not pull it out of the wall.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Appeared run down. Needs updated.

review.title: you get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Rooms are outdated, tv remote didn't work, other guests nearby partied and played their music loud, no help from the front desk for the remote and for the noisy neighbors. Extremely bad experience, will never go to this hotel again, and will think twice before going to another Travelodge.

review.title: Don't stay here... ever!
review.reviewText: Loudest, most ghetto hotel I've ever stayed at. People are living in this hotel as evidenced by the constant yelling, deteriorating facade, and generally uncomfortable feeling when walking through it. Very inconveniently located in the middle of nowhere (around $30 for a cab ride to anywhere.) Next time we will stay downtown, no matter how much more it costs.

review.title: More like a one-star hotel!
review.reviewText: We were not happy with our 2-night stay here. Noise kept us awake into the early morning. Cigarette smoke was drifting into our no-smoking room from an adjoining room. Bathroom door was a slider which was difficult to operate. We certainly won't do this one again! On the positive side: Nearby IHOP restaurant was OK. Airport was nearby. You get what you pay for!!!

review.title: The price is right.
review.reviewText: Needs maintenance, but for the price it is good. Beds are old but the rooms were clean.

review.title: Travel Lodge
review.reviewText: A good place to stay and enjoy the hospitality of the excellent staff at the desk.

review.title: quality meets the price
review.reviewText: This hotel is good, if you want to stay for cheap money close to the Airport. Clean enough, comfortable enough, but surely not a place where you want to spend more than a few days. The aiport shuttle service was very convienent and for me one of the reasons to pick this hotel(besides the low rates).

review.title: Best hotel for its value!
review.reviewText: Expected a low quality room but was surprised, for its rate its the best room if your on a tight budget. Will definately go back.

review.title: Noisy airport hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently located near San Francisco airport, next to off-airport car rental places. It provides basic, affordable accomodations. It is literally next to Highway 101, and hard to get any sleep from the traffic noise. Even though the room was supposed to be non-smoking, it had a strong smell of residue smoke and whatever chemicals they used to clean it and cover it up. Despite its convenient location and price, I would not stay there again.

review.title: Good for Park N' Fly
review.reviewText: This is a very average facility with basic rooms. Nothing special. The price was right and it offered long term parking for one night's stay, so it fit our need nicely.

review.title: Affordable, great location!
review.reviewText: This Travelodge is 12 miles from downtown S.F., but it is worth the stay and the price is great. A lot of the hotels and motels in the city charge a parking fee. The Travelodge does not. The rooms are clean, the service is good , plus there is an IHop restaurant on the premises. I will definitely stay there again. It has easy freeway access, plus a city bus service into town.

review.title: An OK Place
review.reviewText: Nothing fancy, but they had a really good Italian delivery. Easy access to freeway.

review.title: Good for a few nights
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfect for a few nights. It's very close to the airport and the interstate. The good stuff in San Francisco is just 30 minutes away.

review.title: Easy way to go
review.reviewText: This was perfect for our weekend goals (see the city, see 49er game). 1 block freeway access to 101 or 280, making it doubly easy to enter San Francisco. Also, we loved that it was a few blocks from airport car rental; we flew in, then got our car, and checked in, both within 30 minutes of landing. Checing out just as easy. Being in the city most of each day, the room suited our basic need for sleep. Showers could be better. Decent overall.

review.title: Practicle Location
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was excellent. Half the staff were great and the other jus OK. Will definately stay there again because of the convenience of the locatio

review.title: Adequate for the Price
review.reviewText: The hotel was convenient to the place where I had to meet. The price was good for the quality. I did have to track down housekeeping to get a few minor items that should have been left in the room (replace soap and wash cloth) - no big deal. The restaurant next to hotel was nice - good food - open 24 hrs., except Sunday night.

review.title: OK for quick stay
review.reviewText: I basically used this hotel as a stop-over returning to the airport early the next morning. Shuttle service was worth it. Restaurant closes on Sunday eve at 10 PM and reopens at 6 AM on Monday morning. Some people had trouble getting breakfast in time for their shuttle. Just be aware of this. Hotel sits next to freeway--be prepared for the loud traffic noise.

review.title: Won't go back.
review.reviewText: A/C unit was broke. The shower head holder was broke. There was a coffeemaker in the room but no coffee nor creamer, albeit they are available at the front desk. Extra beddings are not available after 5 p.m. because housekeeping was closed.

review.title: Hated it
review.reviewText: It took 30 minutes to check in, the non-smoking room smelled quite strongly of smoke, and the numerous warnings about safety made me feel anything but safe.

review.title: Good Bargain
review.reviewText: This Travel Lodge is older and not well cared for. But the price was great and free airport transportation was a plus.

review.title: Good for a night.
review.reviewText: It's ok for a night before traveling. I would not vacation there.

review.title: Good value for the money.
review.reviewText: Very easy access to San Francisco downtown by way of Bus 292 right outside the motel. Price 2 USD. Duration: Less than an hour. Motel OK. Nice and competent staff.

review.title: Affordable place to stay relatively close to SF downtown
review.reviewText: We spent only two nights in this hotel and we chose it with the purpose to spend only the nights there, since we spent both days with discovering the city. It is next to the Highway 101 which gives you an easy access to the downtown. The hotel room was clean and just fulfilled the requirement of a clean bed and bathroom. There is no breakfast at the hotel, but there is an IHOP next to it. Since it is close to the airport, sometimes you can hear planes, but honestly I remember hearing planes only while I was awake.

review.title: Nice and convenient
review.reviewText: Very convenient traffic service to airport and downtown. Reasonable price. Clean and good service.

review.title: Poor, even for a budget hotel.
review.reviewText: I don't know how this place even got two stars on it's review. All the buildings looked like reconditioned school rooms, and were not clean. The airport shuttle was not reliable at all, and coffee/soap/shampoo was not restocked. The cable TV was even fuzzy!

review.title: Won't stay there next time.
review.reviewText: The room was dirty (at least looked dirty). Could use a lot of update. But it's cheap and free parking.

review.title: bad experience
review.reviewText: First we were placed in a smoking room. Then we moved to a room that the lock was broken. There was mold on the bathroom ceiling and we didn't feel safe in the room.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and tidy, however the overall condition of the property looked to cater to questionable character-types. This property is runned-down and motel-looking. It serves a purpose if one is looking just for a place to sleep. It was not what I expected.

review.title: I might be back at this hotel next year.
review.reviewText: This is m,y second time at thid hotel. The was the least expensive hotel, I found online for the San Francisco area.

review.title: O K
review.reviewText: noize area

review.title: Good Deal
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay near the airport. Freeway close and near downtown San Franciso. I will stay there again.

review.title: OK to stay.
review.reviewText: Room was clean enough to sleep. Not extra-clean, but clean. 2 qween size beds were very helpful to stay 1 room with 2 kids. TV was big enough and channel selection was OK. You can have additional fun with pay-movies if you want.

review.title: Very well located
review.reviewText: It is a practical option for someone who is not familiar with the city and need to be close to the airport. The facilities to drop the rented car where superb.

review.title: sorry , its already been paid
review.reviewText: its hard to be satisfied when you arrive this area surrounded by better looking hotels and find out that you are staying at the ugliest one. I mean oldest not good looking, I have stayed in much better places paying the same rate I did on this one. I believe this one needs an architectural remodeling, the lobby needs to be renewed, the rooms we stayed had a smell. you really feel like staying in a cheap hotel and having to deal with it since you book it through the internet. you feel guilty for being a cheap guy, your fellow travelers will blame you and play jokes on you because it was your choice. Im never using travelodge again.

review.title: Livable
review.reviewText: It wasn't horrible but it definetly wasn't what I expected the picture looks much better than the actual hotel BTW this is definetly a MOTEL but on the plus side it is close to the airport and very close to fast food resturants and not to far from San Francisco attrations

review.title: Good service, noisy neighbors
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately the room next to us was housing 6-7 people who hung out a lot and woke up at 6:30 am...very loudly. Ask for a room on the second floor, not ground level.

review.title: Avoid this hotel!
review.reviewText: Noisy, smelly, dirty--the description on the hotel's web site does not admit to any of these conditions, but this is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. There are nicer hotels with comparable prices within a block or two of this one which provide equal airport access and much nicer conditions. I know because I walked around checking them out during my stay at this one, in hopes of checking into something different (but they were all booked).

review.title: very happy
review.reviewText: very happy with this travelodge hotel, would definitely use again if i went back to san fransisco, i would be happy to recommend it to anybody i knew was visiting that state, also very helpful and friendly staff.

review.title: Good value for the money
review.reviewText: Easy access to downtown San Francisco or the peninsula and the airport. Nothing fancy but the rates are reasonable and good value for the money. Share shuttle with other hotels which can be time consuming but it's complimentary. Staff are helpful and friendly. We've stayed there twice and have been satisfied both times.

review.title: Cheap and easy.
review.reviewText: The staff was great! The rest of the hotel wasn't as impressive, but the rooms were clean.

review.title: Ya get what ya pay for.
review.reviewText: It was a good place to stay for a inexpensive price. I only stayed one night, so I have no complaints.

review.title: You can do better for your money
review.reviewText: We choose this hotel because it was near to the San Francisco Airport. The price was really good considering the free parking opportunity and the free breakfast. First surprise was, the free breakfast was actually a complimentary one for ONE person a day (worth approx. 6 Dollar) and hesitantly given to us upon asking. Second surprise was the room or better to say the way it smelled. Considering the Hotel is standing since the 60's the smell is probably coming from the very old (and loud) a/c system and/or mildew (Carpet, Walls...). The cleanliness was lacking too, the carpet was very dirty, there were stains and i wouldn't recommend to walk barefoot. A small tv was provided however the reception was despite cabel service rather foggy. We would definitely recommend to book another hotel, since there are plenty of other opportunities around.

review.title: Great for the price
review.reviewText: If you are looking for an economical place to stay while visiting the San Francisco area, you can't beat the price. Close access to freeway. Not a luxury hotel, but the staff was extremely friendly and helpful with answering questions regarding visiting the area. Room was clean. No complaints.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located near the airport(SFO), Highway 101, IHOP, and the South San Francisco Conference Center. It was also clean and the staff were quite helpful with directions and replacement of forgotten items - toothpaste.

review.title: It fullfilled its function.
review.reviewText: We stayed here because it was close to SFO and provided free shuttle service and parking. The staff was kind, but this was a travel motel.

review.title: Nothing fancy, low cost and clean.
review.reviewText: The room size is OK. But the whole hotel is very very close to highway 101 and you can hear the highway noise at night. Overall, I am satisfied with this hotel, nothing to complain and nothing to feel very good about also.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: We needed a place to stay for one night, and picked this one because we rented a car for the next day, and they had a complimentary shuttle to and from the airport. The room was clean but bed was a little hard for our taste. The fan in the bathroom was loud. The pool was nice, this is where we spent most of our time. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Yes I would stay there again. We also didn't hear the planes that were mentioned, in fact the traffic on the highway was louder.

review.title: 24-hour eatery
review.reviewText: For travellers from the Fast East and facing jet lag, having a 24-hour IHOP next door is a big plus. We were up and hungry at 3am.

review.title: NIce stay
review.reviewText: Convenient. Close to the airport.

review.title: OK for inexpensive hotel
review.reviewText: This is a decent airport hotel, for the price, with a convenient shuttle to the airport. The room was clean enough, the sheets and towels smelled clean, there was a coffee pot in the room. Even though the hotel is next to the freeway and right near the airport, it was fairly quiet inside the room. It certainly is not a destination hotel but it is functional if you need a place to stay for a night or two right near the airport.

review.title: good deal
review.reviewText: The room was clean and relativly spacious. However they really need to put in more sockets in the room and get wirless! Otherwise for the money..i thought it was a good deal!

review.title: Nice room.
review.reviewText: Large room; fairly basic room amenities, but clean and comfortable.

review.title: not impressed, too old
review.reviewText: This hotel is in need of a major renovation, new carpet, new paint, new exterior look.

review.title: Trip to the Zoo
review.reviewText: Although it was an older hotel, it was nice to be able to park right next to my room. It was near the freeway, but you could hear airplanes and cars all night. The room was clean, and if you only plan on staying there for a little, it is a great buy. You can't get a better deal that close to SF.

review.title: lot's of inoperable things
review.reviewText: 3 lamps didn't work. Heater did NOT work. Thank god my wife and I only slept there and didn't hang out. Plenty of better choices out there. Although the service was great, and the staff friendly - I didn't have the time to bring these issues up w/ the management.

review.title: Simple, clean, and cheap.
review.reviewText: This is the perfect simple clean motel to just chill or to relax by a pool on a hot day or need to be near the airport. The grounds and room are clean. The pool is nicely heated. Friendly front desk staff. IHOP just steps away.

review.title: Could have Done Worse
review.reviewText: We have stayed at better hotels from the same chain. The location was very convenient including having an eating place right beside it. Breakfast was included for one person on the price of the room. A microwave and refrigerator would have added to the comfort but were not included.

review.title: Good room for a fair rate
review.reviewText: This hotel is nothing fancy, but the bed was pretty comfortable. I was a bit disappointed that my room with a king bed did not have a bath tub, just a shower.

review.title: A Roof Over Your Head
review.reviewText: A place to sleep at a reasonable price (for the Bay Area), nothing more. Easy access to Hwy 101 & 280. Some highway noise. Also planes fly right over even late into the night. But can't complain for the price...

review.title: Just a place to stay
review.reviewText: Stay there but don't expect you will get any service. Poor receptionist.

review.title: close to the airport
review.reviewText: OK for a one night stay

review.title: It does the job
review.reviewText: This is a very standard hotel, don't expect the highest quality, its a clean hotel, cleaning service is really very good. The front office staff is there pretty much to check you in and out and answer yes or no questions, they're either not very well informed or they don't feel like answering questions. They have a fast internet connection at the lobby but you have to pay to use it, as well as the internet hotspot also at the lobby. Overall this hotel does what is intended for, to be used for a stay after a long day at downtown san francisco, not much else unless you want to use the pool, which I believe is heated. The shuttle service is decent, even though it services about 4 other hotels, so you have to schedule yourself right in order to get to the airport on time.

review.title: Reasonable, for a couple of nights but no more
review.reviewText: Just about OK for the money. Only one free (and very small) breakfast per room. 20 minute drive to San Francisco Town. Reception staff were a mixture, some friendly, some couldn't be bothered

review.title: Suitable for budget travellers
review.reviewText: good location.

review.title: If you need a place to sleep
review.reviewText: I went to San Francisco to see the city. Not to stay in my hotel room. The price of the hotel room was equal to quality of the mattress I slept on. But the room was clean and the staff is friendly. If all you need is a place to sleep, then this hotel is perfectly fine.

review.title: Good for what you spend
review.reviewText: This was my fourth or fifth time. I think this hotel is good for the money u spend.

review.title: would use again
review.reviewText: very good location as it is only about a mile or two from the airport.Located just of highway 101 which is used to get to most popular locations.Hotel itself is nothing fancy but room was clean and when I go on vacation I just need the hotel for sleep and a shower. For the price was well worth it.

review.title: A quiet room
review.reviewText: My wife and I were pleasantly surprised at how quiet our room was -- since the hotel is located near the SF airport and adjacent to a major freeway! Our evening flight into SF was delayed, so we were very late checking in, and consequently found ourselves needing to sleep in later in the morning. We slept undisturbed...

review.title: Highly recommend
review.reviewText: This hotel is not fancy, but provides you with what you are looking for in an inexpensive hotel with comfort. Check-in was fast, rooms clean, IHOP next door is convenient, free transportation to airport, and most of all the price if you book through Expedia. Enjoyed the free coffee maker, hair dryer, iron, and the toiletries.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: It's nice to find Hotels that gives you the confort and quality of the Big Names Hotels for such a great Price...... I'm really looking forward to my next trip. And to top it off, we even got breakfast at Ihop... who said it couldn't get better....

review.title: Good, inexpensive airport hotel
review.reviewText: *This hotel is what I expect from a travelodge. *In-room hair dryer and coffee-maker **No lock on the sliding bathroom door

review.title: Clean Basic Hotel
review.reviewText: Travelodge was convenient to the airport. The room was very basic, but very clean.

review.title: This is a cheap, old hotel near the airport.
review.reviewText: It has a shuttle to the airport BART station every 30 minutes, it has a good pool, it is attached to an IHOP with one (not per person, it is per room only)free breakfast per day (1 of 3 choices only). It also has extremely hard and uncomfortable beds, mold in the bathroom, noisy rooms and a general aura of decay. You will get a cheap, old hotel near the airport. That may be what you want.

review.title: Look Somewhere Else
review.reviewText: I was attracted by the low rates and "free breakfast". Only one breakfast was included for a room of 4 adults, and was from a very limited menu, drink not included. Value was about $6.00 The room was clean, but in need of maintenence (loose tile, peeling paint and mold around the sink and tub). Try somewhere else.

review.title: Airport Tavelodge
review.reviewText: Rooms were not as quiet as I would have liked after all day travel, but were clean. Establishment is not new and could use some new beds and pillows. Check-in was quick and easy, having booked online. Would not like to have to make reservations by phone. Shuttle to airport was very convenient, coming every half hour. It was only a few minutes to the airport. 24-hour IHOP next door made it nice.

review.title: not clean
review.reviewText: the carpet not very clean, the bathroom floor not clean,shower area with mold

review.title: Affordable
review.reviewText: Was okay place to stay for the money. Wasn't comfortable with location after dark

review.title: Nice overnite stay close to airport
review.reviewText: I traveled to see a relative and had a very early flight the next day. I stayed at the Travelodge. It was very nice, clean, swimming pool clean. Shuttle to airport. Great price for a great convenience.

review.title: convenient, functional near the airport
review.reviewText: Okay if you want a no frills hotel. Ihop convenient but note that breakfast is only for 1 guedst. The shutlles are helpful.

review.title: Not great, but will do for a real short stay
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a economical place to stay for a short while and don't expect to spend a lot of time at the hotel, then this is place is definitely a good candidate! Otherwise, if you are thinking of a long stay or are holidaying with your family, then this is not the place for you.

review.title: room clearner(maid) was not good!!
review.reviewText: One of them left a dirty floorcloth on my bed, and another one came to clean my room in early morning even I hadn't check out! She made big knock, and woke me up. I will not use the hotel anymore.

review.title: Decent for the price
review.reviewText: Having gone with the cheapest and closest hotel to the airport for one night after a late night flight I found my room to be more than adaquate. However, there was no help offered with my heavy case and I had to go up a slippery flight of outside stairs in the rain. Also see below.

review.title: Early Check-In was a plus
review.reviewText: Allowed early check-in when called early that morning so that was convenient. There was a problem with satellite TV, bad signal, but was not there for the TV so no big deal. But very surprised about the early check in because didn't feel like waiting till 3pm to check in when have other things to do. Why all hotel have such a late check in time anyway? Because some hotels are very strict on Check-In time. If room is available they should allow the guest to check in. It is already paid for by day. 3pm to 12pm is not 24hours. So shouldn't it be the latest to check-in be at least 12pm not 3pm? Hate these late check-in time. Make traveling inconvenient. When you arrive, should be allow to check-in whenever if room is available.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised due to the fact that the room rate was so reasonable. Although this Traveloge is an older one, it was clean, accessible and convenient to SFO.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: I am used to staying at higher end hotels like the Marriott. Because this was a low budget trip, I purchased an Expedia package and got an incredible deal on airfare, hotel, rental car and parking at my home airport. I was a little concerned that the Travelodge might be a problem. It wasn't. It was clean, well maintained and great access to the highway. Having an IHOP on the property was a plus.

review.title: I love travel
review.reviewText: I'm satisfied with Travelodge hotel and I stayed very close to the city. And I wanna go back to San Francisco and stay in the same hotel, because we had comfort and the hotel was not expensive.

review.title: Average Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is about 15 minutes away from Downtown San Francisco. The rates are great! There is an IHOP restaurant right next door. Easy freeway access, which is a plus. The only thing I probably did not like was that the ventilation in the room does not seem to work. The rooms are rather stuffy. If you are looking for a clean bed and shower, then this is the place.

review.title: Great value - nice central location
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly, knowledable and accomodating

review.title: Ya get what you pay for
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and clean. Of the three staff I had interactions with, only one was very friendly but they all got the job done. It's really wonderful to have the 24 hour IHOP attached to the hotel! Very convenient.

review.title: Don't unless you have too!
review.reviewText: It seemed that is was party city all night.  Convenient to the airport but people walking by your room whopping all night is a bit much.

review.title: This is the place
review.reviewText: We were so impressed by the receptionist on duty that day, also the condition of the room was perfect . It met every need of ours, it was very clean and spacious, The location was not hard to find and not too far from the city. The rate was quite cheap comparing to others for it's best quality. The I-Pod restaurant was also great.

review.title: You get what you pay for...
review.reviewText: but for the condition of our room we should have paid even less.  You can obviously tell this is an older hotel. The room was pretty small but what I expected, but the bathroom was even smaller.  The tub looked like is was cracked in the center. The maintenance guys came by to caulk the bathroom, but couldn't even do that because we were already there.  If we needed an extra blanket, pillow we had to go to the front desk. Of course, they only had 1 pillow for the 3 of us. Parking was not very good either.
